      12              : //  This file is an amalgamation of multiple different files.
      13              : //  You probably shouldn't edit it directly.

      15              : #ifndef CATCH_AMALGAMATED_HPP_INCLUDED
      16              : #define CATCH_AMALGAMATED_HPP_INCLUDED
      17              : 
      18              : 
      19              : /** \file
      20              :  * This is a convenience header for Catch2. It includes **all** of Catch2 headers.
      21              :  *
      22              :  * Generally the Catch2 users should use specific includes they need,
      23              :  * but this header can be used instead for ease-of-experimentation, or
      24              :  * just plain convenience, at the cost of (significantly) increased
      25              :  * compilation times.
      26              :  *
      27              :  * When a new header is added to either the top level folder, or to the
      28              :  * corresponding internal subfolder, it should be added here. Headers
      29              :  * added to the various subparts (e.g. matchers, generators, etc...),
      30              :  * should go their respective catch-all headers.
      31              :  */
      32              : 
      33              : #ifndef CATCH_ALL_HPP_INCLUDED
      34              : #define CATCH_ALL_HPP_INCLUDED
      35              : 
      36              : 
      37              : 
      38              : /** \file
      39              :  * This is a convenience header for Catch2's benchmarking. It includes
      40              :  * **all** of Catch2 headers related to benchmarking.
      41              :  *
      42              :  * Generally the Catch2 users should use specific includes they need,
      43              :  * but this header can be used instead for ease-of-experimentation, or
      44              :  * just plain convenience, at the cost of (significantly) increased
      45              :  * compilation times.
      46              :  *
      47              :  * When a new header is added to either the `benchmark` folder, or to
      48              :  * the corresponding internal (detail) subfolder, it should be added here.
      49              :  */
      50              : 
      51              : #ifndef CATCH_BENCHMARK_ALL_HPP_INCLUDED
      52              : #define CATCH_BENCHMARK_ALL_HPP_INCLUDED
      53              : 
      54              : 
      55              : 
      56              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
      57              : 
      58              : #ifndef CATCH_BENCHMARK_HPP_INCLUDED
      59              : #define CATCH_BENCHMARK_HPP_INCLUDED
      60              : 
      61              : 
      62              : 
      63              : #ifndef CATCH_COMPILER_CAPABILITIES_HPP_INCLUDED
      64              : #define CATCH_COMPILER_CAPABILITIES_HPP_INCLUDED
      65              : 
      66              : // Detect a number of compiler features - by compiler
      67              : // The following features are defined:
      68              : //
      69              : // CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH : is Windows SEH supported?
      70              : // CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS : are POSIX signals supported?
      71              : // CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS : Are exceptions enabled?
      72              : // ****************
      73              : // Note to maintainers: if new toggles are added please document them
      74              : // in configuration.md, too
      75              : // ****************
      76              : 
      77              : // In general each macro has a _NO_<feature name> form
      78              : // (e.g. CATCH_CONFIG_NO_POSIX_SIGNALS) which disables the feature.
      79              : // Many features, at point of detection, define an _INTERNAL_ macro, so they
      80              : // can be combined, en-mass, with the _NO_ forms later.
      81              : 
      82              : 
      83              : 
      84              : #ifndef CATCH_PLATFORM_HPP_INCLUDED
      85              : #define CATCH_PLATFORM_HPP_INCLUDED
      86              : 
      87              : // See e.g.:
      88              : // https://opensource.apple.com/source/CarbonHeaders/CarbonHeaders-18.1/TargetConditionals.h.auto.html
      89              : #ifdef __APPLE__
      90              : #  ifndef __has_extension
      91              : #    define __has_extension(x) 0
      92              : #  endif
      93              : #  include <TargetConditionals.h>
      94              : #  if (defined(TARGET_OS_OSX) && TARGET_OS_OSX == 1) || \
      95              :       (defined(TARGET_OS_MAC) && TARGET_OS_MAC == 1)
      96              : #    define CATCH_PLATFORM_MAC
      97              : #  elif (defined(TARGET_OS_IPHONE) && TARGET_OS_IPHONE == 1)
      98              : #    define CATCH_PLATFORM_IPHONE
      99              : #  endif
     100              : 
     101              : #elif defined(linux) || defined(__linux) || defined(__linux__)
     102              : #  define CATCH_PLATFORM_LINUX
     103              : 
     104              : #elif defined(__QNX__)
     105              : #  define CATCH_PLATFORM_QNX
     106              : 
     107              : #elif defined(WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__)
     108              : #  define CATCH_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
     109              : 
     110              : #  if defined( WINAPI_FAMILY ) && ( WINAPI_FAMILY == WINAPI_FAMILY_APP )
     111              : #      define CATCH_PLATFORM_WINDOWS_UWP
     112              : #  endif
     113              : 
     114              : #elif defined(__ORBIS__) || defined(__PROSPERO__)
     115              : #  define CATCH_PLATFORM_PLAYSTATION
     116              : 
     117              : #endif
     118              : 
     119              : #endif // CATCH_PLATFORM_HPP_INCLUDED
     120              : 
     121              : #ifdef __cplusplus
     122              : 
     123              : #  if (__cplusplus >= 201703L) || (defined(_MSVC_LANG) && _MSVC_LANG >= 201703L)
     124              : #    define CATCH_CPP17_OR_GREATER
     125              : #  endif
     126              : 
     127              : #  if (__cplusplus >= 202002L) || (defined(_MSVC_LANG) && _MSVC_LANG >= 202002L)
     128              : #    define CATCH_CPP20_OR_GREATER
     129              : #  endif
     130              : 
     131              : #endif
     132              : 
     133              : // Only GCC compiler should be used in this block, so other compilers trying to
     134              : // mask themselves as GCC should be ignored.
     135              : #if defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__clang__) && !defined(__ICC) && !defined(__CUDACC__) && !defined(__LCC__) && !defined(__NVCOMPILER)
     136              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION _Pragma( "GCC diagnostic push" )
     137              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION  _Pragma( "GCC diagnostic pop" )
     138              : 
     139              : // This only works on GCC 9+. so we have to also add a global suppression of Wparentheses
     140              : // for older versions of GCC.
     141              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_PARENTHESES_WARNINGS \
     142              :          _Pragma( "GCC diagnostic ignored \"-Wparentheses\"" )
     143              : 
     144              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_RESULT \
     145              :          _Pragma( "GCC diagnostic ignored \"-Wunused-result\"" )
     146              : 
     147              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS \
     148              :          _Pragma( "GCC diagnostic ignored \"-Wunused-variable\"" )
     149              : 
     150              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_USELESS_CAST_WARNINGS \
     151              :          _Pragma( "GCC diagnostic ignored \"-Wuseless-cast\"" )
     152              : 
     153              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_SHADOW_WARNINGS \
     154              :          _Pragma( "GCC diagnostic ignored \"-Wshadow\"" )
     155              : 
     156              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_USE_BUILTIN_CONSTANT_P
     157              : 
     158              : #endif
     159              : 
     160              : #if defined(__NVCOMPILER)
     161              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION _Pragma( "diag push" )
     162              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION  _Pragma( "diag pop" )
     163              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS _Pragma( "diag_suppress declared_but_not_referenced" )
     164              : #endif
     165              : 
     166              : #if defined(__CUDACC__) && !defined(__clang__)
     167              : #  ifdef __NVCC_DIAG_PRAGMA_SUPPORT__
     168              : // New pragmas introduced in CUDA 11.5+
     169              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION _Pragma( "nv_diagnostic push" )
     170              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION  _Pragma( "nv_diagnostic pop" )
     171              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS _Pragma( "nv_diag_suppress 177" )
     172              : #  else
     173              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS _Pragma( "diag_suppress 177" )
     174              : #  endif
     175              : #endif
     176              : 
     177              : // clang-cl defines _MSC_VER as well as __clang__, which could cause the
     178              : // start/stop internal suppression macros to be double defined.
     179              : #if defined(__clang__) && !defined(_MSC_VER)
     180              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_USE_BUILTIN_CONSTANT_P
     181              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION _Pragma( "clang diagnostic push" )
     182              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION  _Pragma( "clang diagnostic pop" )
     183              : #endif // __clang__ && !_MSC_VER
     184              : 
     185              : #if defined(__clang__)
     186              : 
     187              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS \
     188              :          _Pragma( "clang diagnostic ignored \"-Wexit-time-destructors\"" ) \
     189              :          _Pragma( "clang diagnostic ignored \"-Wglobal-constructors\"")
     190              : 
     191              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_PARENTHESES_WARNINGS \
     192              :          _Pragma( "clang diagnostic ignored \"-Wparentheses\"" )
     193              : 
     194              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS \
     195              :          _Pragma( "clang diagnostic ignored \"-Wunused-variable\"" )
     196              : 
     197              : #    if (__clang_major__ >= 20)
     198              : #        define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_ZERO_VARIADIC_WARNINGS \
     199              :              _Pragma( "clang diagnostic ignored \"-Wvariadic-macro-arguments-omitted\"" )
     200              : #    elif (__clang_major__ == 19)
     201              : #        define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_ZERO_VARIADIC_WARNINGS \
     202              :                  _Pragma( "clang diagnostic ignored \"-Wc++20-extensions\"" )
     203              : #    else
     204              : #        define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_ZERO_VARIADIC_WARNINGS
     205              :              _Pragma( "clang diagnostic ignored \"-Wgnu-zero-variadic-macro-arguments\"" )
     206              : #    endif
     207              : 
     208              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_WARNINGS \
     209              :          _Pragma( "clang diagnostic ignored \"-Wunused-template\"" )
     210              : 
     211              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_COMMA_WARNINGS \
     212              :         _Pragma( "clang diagnostic ignored \"-Wcomma\"" )
     213              : 
     214              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_SHADOW_WARNINGS \
     215              :         _Pragma( "clang diagnostic ignored \"-Wshadow\"" )
     216              : 
     217              : #endif // __clang__
     218              : 
     219              : // As of this writing, IBM XL's implementation of __builtin_constant_p has a bug
     220              : // which results in calls to destructors being emitted for each temporary,
     221              : // without a matching initialization. In practice, this can result in something
     222              : // like `std::string::~string` being called on an uninitialized value.
     223              : //
     224              : // For example, this code will likely segfault under IBM XL:
     225              : // ```
     226              : // REQUIRE(std::string("12") + "34" == "1234")
     227              : // ```
     228              : //
     229              : // Similarly, NVHPC's implementation of `__builtin_constant_p` has a bug which
     230              : // results in calls to the immediately evaluated lambda expressions to be
     231              : // reported as unevaluated lambdas.
     232              : // https://developer.nvidia.com/nvidia_bug/3321845.
     233              : //
     234              : // Therefore, `CATCH_INTERNAL_IGNORE_BUT_WARN` is not implemented.
     235              : #if defined( __ibmxl__ ) || defined( __CUDACC__ ) || defined( __NVCOMPILER )
     236              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_USE_BUILTIN_CONSTANT_P
     237              : #endif
     238              : 
     239              : 
     240              : 
     241              : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
     242              : // We know some environments not to support full POSIX signals
     243              : #if defined( CATCH_PLATFORM_WINDOWS ) ||                                       \
     244              :     defined( CATCH_PLATFORM_PLAYSTATION ) ||                                   \
     245              :     defined( __CYGWIN__ ) ||                                                   \
     246              :     defined( __QNX__ ) ||                                                      \
     247              :     defined( __EMSCRIPTEN__ ) ||                                               \
     248              :     defined( __DJGPP__ ) ||                                                    \
     249              :     defined( __OS400__ )
     250              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_POSIX_SIGNALS
     251              : #else
     252              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS
     253              : #endif
     254              : 
     255              : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
     256              : // Assume that some platforms do not support getenv.
     257              : #if defined( CATCH_PLATFORM_WINDOWS_UWP ) ||                                   \
     258              :     defined( CATCH_PLATFORM_PLAYSTATION ) ||                                   \
     259              :     defined( _GAMING_XBOX )
     260              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_GETENV
     261              : #else
     262              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_GETENV
     263              : #endif
     264              : 
     265              : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
     266              : // Android somehow still does not support std::to_string
     267              : #if defined(__ANDROID__)
     268              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_CPP11_TO_STRING
     269              : #endif
     270              : 
     271              : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
     272              : // Not all Windows environments support SEH properly
     273              : #if defined(__MINGW32__)
     274              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_WINDOWS_SEH
     275              : #endif
     276              : 
     277              : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
     278              : // PS4
     279              : #if defined(__ORBIS__)
     280              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_NEW_CAPTURE
     281              : #endif
     282              : 
     283              : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
     284              : // Cygwin
     285              : #ifdef __CYGWIN__
     286              : 
     287              : // Required for some versions of Cygwin to declare gettimeofday
     288              : // see: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/36901803/gettimeofday-not-declared-in-this-scope-cygwin
     289              : #   define _BSD_SOURCE
     290              : // some versions of cygwin (most) do not support std::to_string. Use the libstd check.
     291              : // https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc-4.8.2/libstdc++/api/a01053_source.html line 2812-2813
     292              : # if !((__cplusplus >= 201103L) && defined(_GLIBCXX_USE_C99) \
     293              :            && !defined(_GLIBCXX_HAVE_BROKEN_VSWPRINTF))
     294              : 
     295              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_CPP11_TO_STRING
     296              : 
     297              : # endif
     298              : #endif // __CYGWIN__
     299              : 
     300              : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
     301              : // Visual C++
     302              : #if defined(_MSC_VER)
     303              : 
     304              : // We want to defer to nvcc-specific warning suppression if we are compiled
     305              : // with nvcc masquerading for MSVC.
     306              : #    if !defined( __CUDACC__ )
     307              : #        define CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
     308              :             __pragma( warning( push ) )
     309              : #        define CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
     310              :             __pragma( warning( pop ) )
     311              : #    endif
     312              : 
     313              : // Universal Windows platform does not support SEH
     314              : #  if !defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_WINDOWS_UWP)
     315              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH
     316              : #  endif
     317              : 
     318              : // Only some Windows platform families support the console
     319              : #  if defined(WINAPI_FAMILY_PARTITION)
     320              : #    if !WINAPI_FAMILY_PARTITION(WINAPI_PARTITION_APP | WINAPI_PARTITION_SYSTEM)
     321              : #      define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_COLOUR_WIN32
     322              : #    endif
     323              : #  endif
     324              : 
     325              : // MSVC traditional preprocessor needs some workaround for __VA_ARGS__
     326              : // _MSVC_TRADITIONAL == 0 means new conformant preprocessor
     327              : // _MSVC_TRADITIONAL == 1 means old traditional non-conformant preprocessor
     328              : #  if !defined(__clang__) // Handle Clang masquerading for msvc
     329              : #    if !defined(_MSVC_TRADITIONAL) || (defined(_MSVC_TRADITIONAL) && _MSVC_TRADITIONAL)
     330              : #      define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_TRADITIONAL_MSVC_PREPROCESSOR
     331              : #    endif // MSVC_TRADITIONAL
     332              : #  endif // __clang__
     333              : 
     334              : #endif // _MSC_VER
     335              : 
     336              : #if defined(_REENTRANT) || defined(_MSC_VER)
     337              : // Enable async processing, as -pthread is specified or no additional linking is required
     338              : # define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_USE_ASYNC
     339              : #endif // _MSC_VER
     340              : 
     341              : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
     342              : // Check if we are compiled with -fno-exceptions or equivalent
     343              : #if defined(__EXCEPTIONS) || defined(__cpp_exceptions) || defined(_CPPUNWIND)
     344              : #  define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_EXCEPTIONS_ENABLED
     345              : #endif
     346              : 
     347              : 
     348              : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
     349              : // Embarcadero C++Build
     350              : #if defined(__BORLANDC__)
     351              :     #define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_POLYFILL_ISNAN
     352              : #endif
     353              : 
     354              : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
     355              : 
     356              : // RTX is a special version of Windows that is real time.
     357              : // This means that it is detected as Windows, but does not provide
     358              : // the same set of capabilities as real Windows does.
     359              : #if defined(UNDER_RTSS) || defined(RTX64_BUILD)
     360              :     #define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_WINDOWS_SEH
     361              :     #define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_ASYNC
     362              :     #define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_COLOUR_WIN32
     363              : #endif
     364              : 
     365              : #if !defined(_GLIBCXX_USE_C99_MATH_TR1)
     366              : #define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_GLOBAL_NEXTAFTER
     367              : #endif
     368              : 
     369              : // Various stdlib support checks that require __has_include
     370              : #if defined(__has_include)
     371              :   // Check if string_view is available and usable
     372              :   #if __has_include(<string_view>) && defined(CATCH_CPP17_OR_GREATER)
     373              :   #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP17_STRING_VIEW
     374              :   #endif
     375              : 
     376              :   // Check if optional is available and usable
     377              :   #  if __has_include(<optional>) && defined(CATCH_CPP17_OR_GREATER)
     378              :   #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP17_OPTIONAL
     379              :   #  endif // __has_include(<optional>) && defined(CATCH_CPP17_OR_GREATER)
     380              : 
     381              :   // Check if byte is available and usable
     382              :   #  if __has_include(<cstddef>) && defined(CATCH_CPP17_OR_GREATER)
     383              :   #    include <cstddef>
     384              :   #    if defined(__cpp_lib_byte) && (__cpp_lib_byte > 0)
     385              :   #      define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP17_BYTE
     386              :   #    endif
     387              :   #  endif // __has_include(<cstddef>) && defined(CATCH_CPP17_OR_GREATER)
     388              : 
     389              :   // Check if variant is available and usable
     390              :   #  if __has_include(<variant>) && defined(CATCH_CPP17_OR_GREATER)
     391              :   #    if defined(__clang__) && (__clang_major__ < 8)
     392              :          // work around clang bug with libstdc++ https://bugs.llvm.org/show_bug.cgi?id=31852
     393              :          // fix should be in clang 8, workaround in libstdc++ 8.2
     394              :   #      include <ciso646>
     395              :   #      if defined(__GLIBCXX__) && defined(_GLIBCXX_RELEASE) && (_GLIBCXX_RELEASE < 9)
     396              :   #        define CATCH_CONFIG_NO_CPP17_VARIANT
     397              :   #      else
     398              :   #        define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP17_VARIANT
     399              :   #      endif // defined(__GLIBCXX__) && defined(_GLIBCXX_RELEASE) && (_GLIBCXX_RELEASE < 9)
     400              :   #    else
     401              :   #      define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP17_VARIANT
     402              :   #    endif // defined(__clang__) && (__clang_major__ < 8)
     403              :   #  endif // __has_include(<variant>) && defined(CATCH_CPP17_OR_GREATER)
     404              : #endif // defined(__has_include)
     405              : 
     406              : 
     407              : #if defined(CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_NO_WINDOWS_SEH) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH) && !defined(CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_WINDOWS_SEH)
     408              : #   define CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH
     409              : #endif
     410              : // This is set by default, because we assume that unix compilers are posix-signal-compatible by default.
     411              : #if defined(CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS) && !defined(CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_POSIX_SIGNALS) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_NO_POSIX_SIGNALS) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS)
     412              : #   define CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS
     413              : #endif
     414              : 
     415              : #if defined(CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_GETENV) && !defined(CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_GETENV) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_NO_GETENV) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_GETENV)
     416              : #   define CATCH_CONFIG_GETENV
     417              : #endif
     418              : 
     419              : #if !defined(CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_CPP11_TO_STRING) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_NO_CPP11_TO_STRING) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_CPP11_TO_STRING)
     420              : #    define CATCH_CONFIG_CPP11_TO_STRING
     421              : #endif
     422              : 
     423              : #if defined(CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP17_OPTIONAL) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_NO_CPP17_OPTIONAL) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_CPP17_OPTIONAL)
     424              : #  define CATCH_CONFIG_CPP17_OPTIONAL
     425              : #endif
     426              : 
     427              : #if defined(CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP17_STRING_VIEW) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_NO_CPP17_STRING_VIEW) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_CPP17_STRING_VIEW)
     428              : #  define CATCH_CONFIG_CPP17_STRING_VIEW
     429              : #endif
     430              : 
     431              : #if defined(CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP17_VARIANT) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_NO_CPP17_VARIANT) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_CPP17_VARIANT)
     432              : #  define CATCH_CONFIG_CPP17_VARIANT
     433              : #endif
     434              : 
     435              : #if defined(CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP17_BYTE) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_NO_CPP17_BYTE) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_CPP17_BYTE)
     436              : #  define CATCH_CONFIG_CPP17_BYTE
     437              : #endif
     438              : 
     439              : 
     440              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL_REDIRECT)
     441              : #  define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NEW_CAPTURE
     442              : #endif
     443              : 
     444              : #if defined(CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NEW_CAPTURE) && !defined(CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_NO_NEW_CAPTURE) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_NO_NEW_CAPTURE) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_NEW_CAPTURE)
     445              : #  define CATCH_CONFIG_NEW_CAPTURE
     446              : #endif
     447              : 
     448              : #if !defined( CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_EXCEPTIONS_ENABLED ) && \
     449              :     !defined( CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS ) &&          \
     450              :     !defined( CATCH_CONFIG_NO_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS )

     466              : 
     467              : // The goal of this macro is to avoid evaluation of the arguments, but
     468              : // still have the compiler warn on problems inside...

     478              :                                                      hicpp-vararg) */
     479              : #else
     480              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_IGNORE_BUT_WARN( ... )
     481              : #endif

     650              : 
     651              : /** \file
     652              :  * Wrapper for the CONFIG configuration option
     653              :  *
     654              :  * When generating internal unique names, there are two options. Either
     655              :  * we mix in the current line number, or mix in an incrementing number.
     656              :  * We prefer the latter, using `__COUNTER__`, but users might want to
     657              :  * use the former.
     658              :  */
     659              : 
     660              : #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_COUNTER_HPP_INCLUDED
     661              : #define CATCH_CONFIG_COUNTER_HPP_INCLUDED
     662              : 
     663              : 
     664              : #if ( !defined(__JETBRAINS_IDE__) || __JETBRAINS_IDE__ >= 20170300L )
     665              :     #define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_COUNTER
     666              : #endif
     667              : 
     668              : #if defined( CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_COUNTER ) && \
     669              :     !defined( CATCH_CONFIG_NO_COUNTER ) && \
     670              :     !defined( CATCH_CONFIG_COUNTER )
     671              : #    define CATCH_CONFIG_COUNTER
     672              : #endif
     673              : 
     674              : 
     675              : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_COUNTER_HPP_INCLUDED
     676              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME_LINE2( name, line ) name##line
     677              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME_LINE( name, line ) INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME_LINE2( name, line )
     678              : #ifdef CATCH_CONFIG_COUNTER
     679              : #  define INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( name ) INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME_LINE( name, __COUNTER__ )
     680              : #else
     681              : #  define INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( name ) INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME_LINE( name, __LINE__ )
     682              : #endif
     683              :

     704              : namespace Catch {
     705              : 
     706              :     /// A non-owning string class (similar to the forthcoming std::string_view)
     707              :     /// Note that, because a StringRef may be a substring of another string,
     708              :     /// it may not be null terminated.
     709              :     class StringRef {
     710              :     public:
     711              :         using size_type = std::size_t;
     712              :         using const_iterator = const char*;
     713              : 
     714              :         static constexpr size_type npos{ static_cast<size_type>( -1 ) };
     715              : 
     716              :     private:
     717              :         static constexpr char const* const s_empty = "";
     718              : 
     719              :         char const* m_start = s_empty;
     720              :         size_type m_size = 0;
     721              : 
     722              :     public: // construction
     723            0 :         constexpr StringRef() noexcept = default;
     724              : 
     725              :         StringRef( char const* rawChars ) noexcept;
     726              : 
     727            0 :         constexpr StringRef( char const* rawChars, size_type size ) noexcept
     728            0 :         :   m_start( rawChars ),
     729            0 :             m_size( size )
     730            0 :         {}
     731              : 
     732          822 :         StringRef( std::string const& stdString ) noexcept
     733          822 :         :   m_start( stdString.c_str() ),
     734          822 :             m_size( stdString.size() )
     735          822 :         {}
     736              : 
     737          451 :         explicit operator std::string() const {
     738          902 :             return std::string(m_start, m_size);
     739              :         }
     740              : 
     741              :     public: // operators
     742         1438 :         auto operator == ( StringRef other ) const noexcept -> bool {
     743         1438 :             return m_size == other.m_size
     744         1438 :                 && (std::memcmp( m_start, other.m_start, m_size ) == 0);
     745              :         }
     746              :         auto operator != (StringRef other) const noexcept -> bool {
     747              :             return !(*this == other);
     748              :         }
     749              : 
     750         5725 :         constexpr auto operator[] ( size_type index ) const noexcept -> char {
     751         5725 :             assert(index < m_size);
     752         5725 :             return m_start[index];
     753              :         }
     754              : 
     755              :         bool operator<(StringRef rhs) const noexcept;
     756              : 
     757              :     public: // named queries
     758          590 :         constexpr auto empty() const noexcept -> bool {
     759          590 :             return m_size == 0;
     760              :         }
     761         2624 :         constexpr auto size() const noexcept -> size_type {
     762         2624 :             return m_size;
     763              :         }
     764              : 
     765              :         // Returns a substring of [start, start + length).
     766              :         // If start + length > size(), then the substring is [start, size()).
     767              :         // If start > size(), then the substring is empty.
     768          544 :         constexpr StringRef substr(size_type start, size_type length) const noexcept {
     769          544 :             if (start < m_size) {
     770          544 :                 const auto shortened_size = m_size - start;
     771          544 :                 return StringRef(m_start + start, (shortened_size < length) ? shortened_size : length);
     772              :             } else {
     773            0 :                 return StringRef();
     774              :             }
     775              :         }
     776              : 
     777              :         // Returns the current start pointer. May not be null-terminated.
     778          120 :         constexpr char const* data() const noexcept {
     779          120 :             return m_start;
     780              :         }
     781              : 
     782          324 :         constexpr const_iterator begin() const { return m_start; }
     783          324 :         constexpr const_iterator end() const { return m_start + m_size; }
     784              : 
     785              : 
     786              :         friend std::string& operator += (std::string& lhs, StringRef rhs);
     787              :         friend std::ostream& operator << (std::ostream& os, StringRef str);
     788              :         friend std::string operator+(StringRef lhs, StringRef rhs);
     789              : 
     790              :         /**
     791              :          * Provides a three-way comparison with rhs
     792              :          *
     793              :          * Returns negative number if lhs < rhs, 0 if lhs == rhs, and a positive
     794              :          * number if lhs > rhs
     795              :          */
     796              :         int compare( StringRef rhs ) const;
     797              :     };
     798              : 
     799              : 
     800            0 :     constexpr auto operator ""_sr( char const* rawChars, std::size_t size ) noexcept -> StringRef {

     802              :     }
     803              : } // namespace Catch

     805              : constexpr auto operator ""_catch_sr( char const* rawChars, std::size_t size ) noexcept -> Catch::StringRef {

     816              : 
     817              :     // ResultWas::OfType enum
     818              :     struct ResultWas { enum OfType {
     819              :         Unknown = -1,
     820              :         Ok = 0,
     821              :         Info = 1,
     822              :         Warning = 2,
     823              :         // TODO: Should explicit skip be considered "not OK" (cf. isOk)? I.e., should it have the failure bit?
     824              :         ExplicitSkip = 4,
     825              : 
     826              :         FailureBit = 0x10,
     827              : 
     828              :         ExpressionFailed = FailureBit | 1,
     829              :         ExplicitFailure = FailureBit | 2,
     830              : 
     831              :         Exception = 0x100 | FailureBit,
     832              : 
     833              :         ThrewException = Exception | 1,
     834              :         DidntThrowException = Exception | 2,
     835              : 
     836              :         FatalErrorCondition = 0x200 | FailureBit
     837              : 
     838              :     }; };
     839              : 
     840           30 :     constexpr bool isOk( ResultWas::OfType resultType ) {
     841           30 :         return ( resultType & ResultWas::FailureBit ) == 0;
     842              :     }
     843              :     constexpr bool isJustInfo( int flags ) { return flags == ResultWas::Info; }
     844              : 
     845              : 
     846              :     // ResultDisposition::Flags enum
     847              :     struct ResultDisposition { enum Flags {
     848              :         Normal = 0x01,
     849              : 
     850              :         ContinueOnFailure = 0x02,   // Failures fail test, but execution continues
     851              :         FalseTest = 0x04,           // Prefix expression with !
     852              :         SuppressFail = 0x08         // Failures are reported but do not fail the test
     853              :     }; };
     854              : 
     855              :     constexpr ResultDisposition::Flags operator|( ResultDisposition::Flags lhs,
     856              :                                         ResultDisposition::Flags rhs ) {
     857              :         return static_cast<ResultDisposition::Flags>( static_cast<int>( lhs ) |
     858              :                                                       static_cast<int>( rhs ) );
     859              :     }
     860              : 
     861          615 :     constexpr bool isFalseTest( int flags ) {
     862          615 :         return ( flags & ResultDisposition::FalseTest ) != 0;
     863              :     }
     864            0 :     constexpr bool shouldSuppressFailure( int flags ) {
     865            0 :         return ( flags & ResultDisposition::SuppressFail ) != 0;
     866              :     }
     867              : 
     868              : } // end namespace Catch

     872              : 
     873              : #ifndef CATCH_UNIQUE_PTR_HPP_INCLUDED

     875              : 
     876              : #include <cassert>
     877              : #include <type_traits>
     878              : 
     879              : 
     880              : namespace Catch {
     881              : namespace Detail {
     882              :     /**
     883              :      * A reimplementation of `std::unique_ptr` for improved compilation performance
     884              :      *
     885              :      * Does not support arrays nor custom deleters.
     886              :      */
     887              :     template <typename T>
     888              :     class unique_ptr {
     889              :         T* m_ptr;
     890              :     public:
     891           11 :         constexpr unique_ptr(std::nullptr_t = nullptr):
     892           11 :             m_ptr{}
     893           11 :         {}
     894          560 :         explicit constexpr unique_ptr(T* ptr):
     895          560 :             m_ptr(ptr)
     896          560 :         {}
     897              : 
     898              :         template <typename U, typename = std::enable_if_t<std::is_base_of<T, U>::value>>
     899          311 :         unique_ptr(unique_ptr<U>&& from):
     900          311 :             m_ptr(from.release())
     901          311 :         {}
     902              : 
     903              :         template <typename U, typename = std::enable_if_t<std::is_base_of<T, U>::value>>
     904          127 :         unique_ptr& operator=(unique_ptr<U>&& from) {
     905          127 :             reset(from.release());
     906              : 
     907          127 :             return *this;
     908              :         }
     909              : 
     910              :         unique_ptr(unique_ptr const&) = delete;
     911              :         unique_ptr& operator=(unique_ptr const&) = delete;
     912              : 
     913          984 :         unique_ptr(unique_ptr&& rhs) noexcept:
     914          984 :             m_ptr(rhs.m_ptr) {
     915          984 :             rhs.m_ptr = nullptr;
     916          984 :         }
     917            1 :         unique_ptr& operator=(unique_ptr&& rhs) noexcept {
     918            1 :             reset(rhs.release());
     919              : 
     920            1 :             return *this;
     921              :         }
     922              : 
     923         1385 :         ~unique_ptr() {
     924         1385 :             delete m_ptr;
     925         1385 :         }
     926              : 
     927          433 :         T& operator*() {
     928          433 :             assert(m_ptr);
     929          433 :             return *m_ptr;
     930              :         }
     931            0 :         T const& operator*() const {
     932            0 :             assert(m_ptr);
     933            0 :             return *m_ptr;
     934              :         }
     935         2172 :         T* operator->() noexcept {
     936         2172 :             assert(m_ptr);
     937         2172 :             return m_ptr;
     938              :         }
     939          998 :         T const* operator->() const noexcept {
     940          998 :             assert(m_ptr);
     941          998 :             return m_ptr;
     942              :         }
     943              : 
     944          976 :         T* get() { return m_ptr; }
     945            0 :         T const* get() const { return m_ptr; }
     946              : 
     947          129 :         void reset(T* ptr = nullptr) {
     948          129 :             delete m_ptr;
     949          129 :             m_ptr = ptr;
     950          129 :         }
     951              : 
     952          439 :         T* release() {
     953          439 :             auto temp = m_ptr;
     954          439 :             m_ptr = nullptr;
     955          439 :             return temp;
     956              :         }
     957              : 
     958            3 :         explicit operator bool() const {
     959            3 :             return m_ptr != nullptr;
     960              :         }
     961              : 
     962              :         friend void swap(unique_ptr& lhs, unique_ptr& rhs) {
     963              :             auto temp = lhs.m_ptr;
     964              :             lhs.m_ptr = rhs.m_ptr;
     965              :             rhs.m_ptr = temp;
     966              :         }
     967              :     };
     968              : 
     969              :     //! Specialization to cause compile-time error for arrays
     970              :     template <typename T>
     971              :     class unique_ptr<T[]>;
     972              : 
     973              :     template <typename T, typename... Args>
     974          560 :     unique_ptr<T> make_unique(Args&&... args) {
     975          560 :         return unique_ptr<T>(new T(CATCH_FORWARD(args)...));
     976              :     }
     977              : 
     978              : 
     979              : } // end namespace Detail
     980              : } // end namespace Catch
     981              : 
     982              : #endif // CATCH_UNIQUE_PTR_HPP_INCLUDED
     983              : 
     984              : 
     985              : #ifndef CATCH_BENCHMARK_STATS_FWD_HPP_INCLUDED
     986              : #define CATCH_BENCHMARK_STATS_FWD_HPP_INCLUDED
     987              : 
     988              : 
     989              : 
     990              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
     991              : 
     992              : #ifndef CATCH_CLOCK_HPP_INCLUDED
     993              : #define CATCH_CLOCK_HPP_INCLUDED
     994              : 
     995              : #include <chrono>
     996              : 
     997              : namespace Catch {
     998              :     namespace Benchmark {
     999              :         using IDuration = std::chrono::nanoseconds;
    1000              :         using FDuration = std::chrono::duration<double, std::nano>;
    1001              : 
    1002              :         template <typename Clock>
    1003              :         using TimePoint = typename Clock::time_point;
    1004              : 
    1005              :         using default_clock = std::chrono::steady_clock;
    1006              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    1007              : } // namespace Catch
    1008              : 
    1009              : #endif // CATCH_CLOCK_HPP_INCLUDED
    1010              : 
    1011              : namespace Catch {
    1012              : 
    1013              :     // We cannot forward declare the type with default template argument
    1014              :     // multiple times, so it is split out into a separate header so that
    1015              :     // we can prevent multiple declarations in dependees
    1016              :     template <typename Duration = Benchmark::FDuration>
    1017              :     struct BenchmarkStats;
    1018              : 
    1019              : } // end namespace Catch
    1020              : 
    1021              : #endif // CATCH_BENCHMARK_STATS_FWD_HPP_INCLUDED

    1023              : namespace Catch {
    1024              :

    1045              : 
    1046              :     class IResultCapture {
    1047              :     public:
    1048              :         virtual ~IResultCapture();
    1049              : 
    1050              :         virtual void notifyAssertionStarted( AssertionInfo const& info ) = 0;
    1051              :         virtual bool sectionStarted( StringRef sectionName,
    1052              :                                      SourceLineInfo const& sectionLineInfo,
    1053              :                                      Counts& assertions ) = 0;
    1054              :         virtual void sectionEnded( SectionEndInfo&& endInfo ) = 0;
    1055              :         virtual void sectionEndedEarly( SectionEndInfo&& endInfo ) = 0;
    1056              :

    1058              :         acquireGeneratorTracker( StringRef generatorName,
    1059              :                                  SourceLineInfo const& lineInfo ) = 0;

    1061              :         createGeneratorTracker( StringRef generatorName,
    1062              :                                 SourceLineInfo lineInfo,
    1063              :                                 Generators::GeneratorBasePtr&& generator ) = 0;
    1064              : 
    1065              :         virtual void benchmarkPreparing( StringRef name ) = 0;
    1066              :         virtual void benchmarkStarting( BenchmarkInfo const& info ) = 0;
    1067              :         virtual void benchmarkEnded( BenchmarkStats<> const& stats ) = 0;
    1068              :         virtual void benchmarkFailed( StringRef error ) = 0;
    1069              : 
    1070              :         static void pushScopedMessage( MessageInfo&& message );
    1071              :         static void popScopedMessage( unsigned int messageId );
    1072              :         static void emplaceUnscopedMessage( MessageBuilder&& builder );
    1073              : 
    1074              :         virtual void handleFatalErrorCondition( StringRef message ) = 0;
    1075              :

    1077              :                 (   AssertionInfo const& info,
    1078              :                     ITransientExpression const& expr,
    1079              :                     AssertionReaction& reaction ) = 0;

    1081              :                 (   AssertionInfo const& info,
    1082              :                     ResultWas::OfType resultType,
    1083              :                     std::string&& message,
    1084              :                     AssertionReaction& reaction ) = 0;

    1086              :                 (   AssertionInfo const& info,
    1087              :                     AssertionReaction& reaction ) = 0;
    1088              :         virtual void handleUnexpectedInflightException
    1089              :                 (   AssertionInfo const& info,
    1090              :                     std::string&& message,
    1091              :                     AssertionReaction& reaction ) = 0;
    1092              :         virtual void handleIncomplete
    1093              :                 (   AssertionInfo const& info ) = 0;
    1094              :         virtual void handleNonExpr
    1095              :                 (   AssertionInfo const &info,
    1096              :                     ResultWas::OfType resultType,
    1097              :                     AssertionReaction &reaction ) = 0;
    1098              : 
    1099              : 
    1100              :         virtual bool lastAssertionPassed() = 0;
    1101              : 
    1102              :         // Deprecated, do not use:
    1103              :         virtual std::string getCurrentTestName() const = 0;
    1104              :         virtual const AssertionResult* getLastResult() const = 0;
    1105              :         virtual void exceptionEarlyReported() = 0;
    1106              :     };
    1107              : 
    1108              :     namespace Detail {
    1109              :         [[noreturn]]
    1110              :         void missingCaptureInstance();
    1111              :     }
    1112          995 :     inline IResultCapture& getResultCapture() {
    1113          995 :         if (auto* capture = getCurrentContext().getResultCapture()) {
    1114          995 :             return *capture;
    1115              :         } else {
    1116            0 :             Detail::missingCaptureInstance();
    1117              :         }
    1118              :     }

    1130              : #ifndef CATCH_NONCOPYABLE_HPP_INCLUDED
    1131              : #define CATCH_NONCOPYABLE_HPP_INCLUDED
    1132              : 
    1133              : namespace Catch {
    1134              :     namespace Detail {
    1135              : 
    1136              :         //! Deriving classes become noncopyable and nonmovable
    1137              :         class NonCopyable {
    1138              :         public:
    1139              :             NonCopyable( NonCopyable const& ) = delete;
    1140              :             NonCopyable( NonCopyable&& ) = delete;
    1141              :             NonCopyable& operator=( NonCopyable const& ) = delete;
    1142              :             NonCopyable& operator=( NonCopyable&& ) = delete;
    1143              : 
    1144              :         protected:
    1145              :             NonCopyable() noexcept = default;
    1146              :         };
    1147              : 
    1148              :     } // namespace Detail
    1149              : } // namespace Catch
    1150              : 
    1151              : #endif // CATCH_NONCOPYABLE_HPP_INCLUDED

    1163              :     };

    1166              :         Nothing = 0x00,

    1168              :         NoAssertions = 0x01,
    1169              :         //! A command line test spec matched no test cases
    1170              :         UnmatchedTestSpec = 0x02,
    1171              :     }; };

    1184              :         //! Let Catch2 pick implementation based on platform detection
    1185              :         PlatformDefault,

    1187              :         ANSI,
    1188              :         //! Use Win32 console colour API
    1189              :         Win32,
    1190              :         //! Don't use any colour

    1192              :     };

    1194              :         Never,

    1300              : 
    1301              : #ifndef CATCH_BENCHMARK_STATS_HPP_INCLUDED
    1302              : #define CATCH_BENCHMARK_STATS_HPP_INCLUDED
    1303              : 
    1304              : 
    1305              : 
    1306              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
    1307              : 
    1308              : #ifndef CATCH_ESTIMATE_HPP_INCLUDED
    1309              : #define CATCH_ESTIMATE_HPP_INCLUDED
    1310              : 
    1311              : namespace Catch {
    1312              :     namespace Benchmark {
    1313              :         template <typename Type>
    1314              :         struct Estimate {
    1315              :             Type point;
    1316              :             Type lower_bound;
    1317              :             Type upper_bound;
    1318              :             double confidence_interval;
    1319              :         };
    1320              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    1321              : } // namespace Catch
    1322              : 
    1323              : #endif // CATCH_ESTIMATE_HPP_INCLUDED
    1324              : 
    1325              : 
    1326              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
    1327              : 
    1328              : #ifndef CATCH_OUTLIER_CLASSIFICATION_HPP_INCLUDED
    1329              : #define CATCH_OUTLIER_CLASSIFICATION_HPP_INCLUDED
    1330              : 
    1331              : namespace Catch {
    1332              :     namespace Benchmark {
    1333              :         struct OutlierClassification {
    1334              :             int samples_seen = 0;
    1335              :             int low_severe = 0;     // more than 3 times IQR below Q1
    1336              :             int low_mild = 0;       // 1.5 to 3 times IQR below Q1
    1337              :             int high_mild = 0;      // 1.5 to 3 times IQR above Q3
    1338              :             int high_severe = 0;    // more than 3 times IQR above Q3
    1339              : 
    1340              :             constexpr int total() const {
    1341              :                 return low_severe + low_mild + high_mild + high_severe;
    1342              :             }
    1343              :         };
    1344              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    1345              : } // namespace Catch
    1346              : 
    1347              : #endif // CATCH_OUTLIERS_CLASSIFICATION_HPP_INCLUDED
    1348              : // The fwd decl & default specialization needs to be seen by VS2017 before
    1349              : // BenchmarkStats itself, or VS2017 will report compilation error.
    1350              : 
    1351              : #include <string>
    1352              : #include <vector>
    1353              : 
    1354              : namespace Catch {
    1355              : 
    1356              :     struct BenchmarkInfo {
    1357              :         std::string name;
    1358              :         double estimatedDuration;
    1359              :         int iterations;
    1360              :         unsigned int samples;
    1361              :         unsigned int resamples;
    1362              :         double clockResolution;
    1363              :         double clockCost;
    1364              :     };
    1365              : 
    1366              :     // We need to keep template parameter for backwards compatibility,
    1367              :     // but we also do not want to use the template paraneter.
    1368              :     template <class Dummy>
    1369              :     struct BenchmarkStats {
    1370              :         BenchmarkInfo info;
    1371              : 
    1372              :         std::vector<Benchmark::FDuration> samples;
    1373              :         Benchmark::Estimate<Benchmark::FDuration> mean;
    1374              :         Benchmark::Estimate<Benchmark::FDuration> standardDeviation;
    1375              :         Benchmark::OutlierClassification outliers;
    1376              :         double outlierVariance;
    1377              :     };
    1378              : 
    1379              : 
    1380              : } // end namespace Catch
    1381              : 
    1382              : #endif // CATCH_BENCHMARK_STATS_HPP_INCLUDED
    1383              : 
    1384              : 
    1385              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
    1386              : 
    1387              : #ifndef CATCH_ENVIRONMENT_HPP_INCLUDED
    1388              : #define CATCH_ENVIRONMENT_HPP_INCLUDED
    1389              : 
    1390              : 
    1391              : namespace Catch {
    1392              :     namespace Benchmark {
    1393              :         struct EnvironmentEstimate {
    1394              :             FDuration mean;
    1395              :             OutlierClassification outliers;
    1396              :         };

    1398              :             EnvironmentEstimate clock_resolution;
    1399              :             EnvironmentEstimate clock_cost;
