    1415              : 
    1416              : #ifndef CATCH_BENCHMARK_FUNCTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    1417              : #define CATCH_BENCHMARK_FUNCTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    1418              : 
    1419              : 
    1420              : 
    1421              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
    1422              : 
    1423              : #ifndef CATCH_CHRONOMETER_HPP_INCLUDED
    1424              : #define CATCH_CHRONOMETER_HPP_INCLUDED
    1425              : 
    1426              : 
    1427              : 
    1428              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
    1429              : 
    1430              : #ifndef CATCH_OPTIMIZER_HPP_INCLUDED
    1431              : #define CATCH_OPTIMIZER_HPP_INCLUDED
    1432              : 
    1433              : #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__)
    1434              : #   include <atomic> // atomic_thread_fence
    1435              : #endif
    1436              : 
    1437              : 
    1438              : #include <type_traits>
    1439              : 
    1440              : namespace Catch {
    1441              :     namespace Benchmark {
    1442              : #if defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__clang__)
    1443              :         template <typename T>
    1444              :         inline void keep_memory(T* p) {
    1445              :             asm volatile("" : : "g"(p) : "memory");
    1446              :         }
    1447            0 :         inline void keep_memory() {
    1448            0 :             asm volatile("" : : : "memory");
    1449            0 :         }
    1450              : 
    1451              :         namespace Detail {
    1452            0 :             inline void optimizer_barrier() { keep_memory(); }
    1453              :         } // namespace Detail
    1454              : #elif defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__)
    1455              : 
    1456              : #if defined(_MSVC_VER)
    1457              : #pragma optimize("", off)
    1458              : #elif defined(__IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__)
    1459              : // For IAR the pragma only affects the following function
    1460              : #pragma optimize=disable
    1461              : #endif
    1462              :         template <typename T>
    1463              :         inline void keep_memory(T* p) {
    1464              :             // thanks @milleniumbug
    1465              :             *reinterpret_cast<char volatile*>(p) = *reinterpret_cast<char const volatile*>(p);
    1466              :         }
    1467              :         // TODO equivalent keep_memory()
    1468              : #if defined(_MSVC_VER)
    1469              : #pragma optimize("", on)
    1470              : #endif
    1471              : 
    1472              :         namespace Detail {
    1473              :             inline void optimizer_barrier() {
    1474              :                 std::atomic_thread_fence(std::memory_order_seq_cst);
    1475              :             }
    1476              :         } // namespace Detail
    1477              : 
    1478              : #endif
    1479              : 
    1480              :         template <typename T>
    1481              :         inline void deoptimize_value(T&& x) {
    1482              :             keep_memory(&x);
    1483              :         }
    1484              : 
    1485              :         template <typename Fn, typename... Args>
    1486              :         inline auto invoke_deoptimized(Fn&& fn, Args&&... args) -> std::enable_if_t<!std::is_same<void, decltype(fn(args...))>::value> {
    1487              :             deoptimize_value(CATCH_FORWARD(fn) (CATCH_FORWARD(args)...));
    1488              :         }
    1489              : 
    1490              :         template <typename Fn, typename... Args>
    1491            0 :         inline auto invoke_deoptimized(Fn&& fn, Args&&... args) -> std::enable_if_t<std::is_same<void, decltype(fn(args...))>::value> {
    1492            0 :             CATCH_FORWARD((fn)) (CATCH_FORWARD(args)...);
    1493            0 :         }
    1494              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    1495              : } // namespace Catch
    1496              : 
    1497              : #endif // CATCH_OPTIMIZER_HPP_INCLUDED
    1498              : 
    1499              : 
    1500              : #ifndef CATCH_META_HPP_INCLUDED
    1501              : #define CATCH_META_HPP_INCLUDED
    1502              : 
    1503              : #include <type_traits>
    1504              : 
    1505              : namespace Catch {
    1506              :     template <typename>
    1507              :     struct true_given : std::true_type {};
    1508              : 
    1509              :     struct is_callable_tester {
    1510              :         template <typename Fun, typename... Args>
    1511              :         static true_given<decltype(std::declval<Fun>()(std::declval<Args>()...))> test(int);
    1512              :         template <typename...>
    1513              :         static std::false_type test(...);
    1514              :     };
    1515              : 
    1516              :     template <typename T>
    1517              :     struct is_callable;
    1518              : 
    1519              :     template <typename Fun, typename... Args>
    1520              :     struct is_callable<Fun(Args...)> : decltype(is_callable_tester::test<Fun, Args...>(0)) {};
    1521              : 
    1522              : 
    1523              : #if defined(__cpp_lib_is_invocable) && __cpp_lib_is_invocable >= 201703
    1524              :     // std::result_of is deprecated in C++17 and removed in C++20. Hence, it is
    1525              :     // replaced with std::invoke_result here.
    1526              :     template <typename Func, typename... U>
    1527              :     using FunctionReturnType = std::remove_reference_t<std::remove_cv_t<std::invoke_result_t<Func, U...>>>;
    1528              : #else
    1529              :     template <typename Func, typename... U>
    1530              :     using FunctionReturnType = std::remove_reference_t<std::remove_cv_t<std::result_of_t<Func(U...)>>>;
    1531              : #endif
    1532              : 
    1533              : } // namespace Catch
    1534              : 
    1535              : namespace mpl_{
    1536              :     struct na;
    1537              : }
    1538              : 
    1539              : #endif // CATCH_META_HPP_INCLUDED
    1540              : 
    1541              : namespace Catch {
    1542              :     namespace Benchmark {
    1543              :         namespace Detail {
    1544              :             struct ChronometerConcept {
    1545              :                 virtual void start() = 0;
    1546              :                 virtual void finish() = 0;
    1547              :                 virtual ~ChronometerConcept(); // = default;
    1548              : 
    1549              :                 ChronometerConcept() = default;
    1550              :                 ChronometerConcept(ChronometerConcept const&) = default;
    1551              :                 ChronometerConcept& operator=(ChronometerConcept const&) = default;
    1552              :             };
    1553              :             template <typename Clock>
    1554              :             struct ChronometerModel final : public ChronometerConcept {
    1555              :                 void start() override { started = Clock::now(); }
    1556              :                 void finish() override { finished = Clock::now(); }
    1557              : 
    1558              :                 IDuration elapsed() const {
    1559              :                     return std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::nanoseconds>(
    1560              :                         finished - started );
    1561              :                 }
    1562              : 
    1563              :                 TimePoint<Clock> started;
    1564              :                 TimePoint<Clock> finished;
    1565              :             };
    1566              :         } // namespace Detail
    1567              : 
    1568              :         struct Chronometer {
    1569              :         public:
    1570              :             template <typename Fun>
    1571            0 :             void measure(Fun&& fun) { measure(CATCH_FORWARD(fun), is_callable<Fun(int)>()); }
    1572              : 
    1573              :             int runs() const { return repeats; }
    1574              : 
    1575              :             Chronometer(Detail::ChronometerConcept& meter, int repeats_)
    1576              :                 : impl(&meter)
    1577              :                 , repeats(repeats_) {}
    1578              : 
    1579              :         private:
    1580              :             template <typename Fun>
    1581            0 :             void measure(Fun&& fun, std::false_type) {
    1582            0 :                 measure([&fun](int) { return fun(); }, std::true_type());
    1583            0 :             }
    1584              : 
    1585              :             template <typename Fun>
    1586            0 :             void measure(Fun&& fun, std::true_type) {
    1587            0 :                 Detail::optimizer_barrier();
    1588            0 :                 impl->start();
    1589            0 :                 for (int i = 0; i < repeats; ++i) invoke_deoptimized(fun, i);
    1590            0 :                 impl->finish();
    1591            0 :                 Detail::optimizer_barrier();
    1592            0 :             }
    1593              : 
    1594              :             Detail::ChronometerConcept* impl;
    1595              :             int repeats;
    1596              :         };
    1597              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    1598              : } // namespace Catch
    1599              : 
    1600              : #endif // CATCH_CHRONOMETER_HPP_INCLUDED
    1601              : 
    1602              : #include <type_traits>
    1603              : 
    1604              : namespace Catch {
    1605              :     namespace Benchmark {
    1606              :         namespace Detail {
    1607              :             template <typename T, typename U>
    1608              :             static constexpr bool is_related_v = std::is_same<std::decay_t<T>, std::decay_t<U>>::value;
    1609              : 
    1610              :             /// We need to reinvent std::function because every piece of code that might add overhead
    1611              :             /// in a measurement context needs to have consistent performance characteristics so that we
    1612              :             /// can account for it in the measurement.
    1613              :             /// Implementations of std::function with optimizations that aren't always applicable, like
    1614              :             /// small buffer optimizations, are not uncommon.
    1615              :             /// This is effectively an implementation of std::function without any such optimizations;
    1616              :             /// it may be slow, but it is consistently slow.
    1617              :             struct BenchmarkFunction {
    1618              :             private:
    1619              :                 struct callable {
    1620              :                     virtual void call(Chronometer meter) const = 0;
    1621              :                     virtual ~callable(); // = default;
    1622              : 
    1623            0 :                     callable() = default;
    1624              :                     callable(callable&&) = default;
    1625              :                     callable& operator=(callable&&) = default;
    1626              :                 };
    1627              :                 template <typename Fun>
    1628              :                 struct model : public callable {
    1629            0 :                     model(Fun&& fun_) : fun(CATCH_MOVE(fun_)) {}
    1630              :                     model(Fun const& fun_) : fun(fun_) {}
    1631              : 
    1632            0 :                     void call(Chronometer meter) const override {
    1633            0 :                         call(meter, is_callable<Fun(Chronometer)>());
    1634            0 :                     }
    1635              :                     void call(Chronometer meter, std::true_type) const {
    1636              :                         fun(meter);
    1637              :                     }
    1638            0 :                     void call(Chronometer meter, std::false_type) const {
    1639            0 :                         meter.measure(fun);
    1640            0 :                     }
    1641              : 
    1642              :                     Fun fun;
    1643              :                 };
    1644              : 
    1645              :             public:
    1646              :                 BenchmarkFunction();
    1647              : 
    1648              :                 template <typename Fun,
    1649              :                     std::enable_if_t<!is_related_v<Fun, BenchmarkFunction>, int> = 0>
    1650              :                     BenchmarkFunction(Fun&& fun)
    1651              :                     : f(new model<std::decay_t<Fun>>(CATCH_FORWARD(fun))) {}
    1652              : 
    1653              :                 BenchmarkFunction( BenchmarkFunction&& that ) noexcept:
    1654              :                     f( CATCH_MOVE( that.f ) ) {}
    1655              : 
    1656              :                 BenchmarkFunction&
    1657              :                 operator=( BenchmarkFunction&& that ) noexcept {
    1658              :                     f = CATCH_MOVE( that.f );
    1659              :                     return *this;
    1660              :                 }
    1661              : 
    1662              :                 void operator()(Chronometer meter) const { f->call(meter); }
    1663              : 
    1664              :             private:
    1665              :                 Catch::Detail::unique_ptr<callable> f;
    1666              :             };
    1667              :         } // namespace Detail
    1668              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    1669              : } // namespace Catch
    1670              : 
    1671              : #endif // CATCH_BENCHMARK_FUNCTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    1672              : 
    1673              : 
    1674              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
    1675              : 
    1676              : #ifndef CATCH_REPEAT_HPP_INCLUDED
    1677              : #define CATCH_REPEAT_HPP_INCLUDED
    1678              : 
    1679              : #include <type_traits>
    1680              : 
    1681              : namespace Catch {
    1682              :     namespace Benchmark {
    1683              :         namespace Detail {
    1684              :             template <typename Fun>
    1685              :             struct repeater {
    1686              :                 void operator()(int k) const {
    1687              :                     for (int i = 0; i < k; ++i) {
    1688              :                         fun();
    1689              :                     }
    1690              :                 }
    1691              :                 Fun fun;
    1692              :             };
    1693              :             template <typename Fun>
    1694              :             repeater<std::decay_t<Fun>> repeat(Fun&& fun) {
    1695              :                 return { CATCH_FORWARD(fun) };
    1696              :             }
    1697              :         } // namespace Detail
    1698              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    1699              : } // namespace Catch
    1700              : 
    1701              : #endif // CATCH_REPEAT_HPP_INCLUDED
    1702              : 
    1703              : 
    1704              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
    1705              : 
    1706              : #ifndef CATCH_RUN_FOR_AT_LEAST_HPP_INCLUDED
    1707              : #define CATCH_RUN_FOR_AT_LEAST_HPP_INCLUDED
    1708              : 
    1709              : 
    1710              : 
    1711              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
    1712              : 
    1713              : #ifndef CATCH_MEASURE_HPP_INCLUDED
    1714              : #define CATCH_MEASURE_HPP_INCLUDED
    1715              : 
    1716              : 
    1717              : 
    1718              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
    1719              : 
    1720              : #ifndef CATCH_COMPLETE_INVOKE_HPP_INCLUDED
    1721              : #define CATCH_COMPLETE_INVOKE_HPP_INCLUDED
    1722              : 
    1723              : 
    1724              : namespace Catch {
    1725              :     namespace Benchmark {
    1726              :         namespace Detail {
    1727              :             template <typename T>
    1728              :             struct CompleteType { using type = T; };
    1729              :             template <>
    1730              :             struct CompleteType<void> { struct type {}; };
    1731              : 
    1732              :             template <typename T>
    1733              :             using CompleteType_t = typename CompleteType<T>::type;
    1734              : 
    1735              :             template <typename Result>
    1736              :             struct CompleteInvoker {
    1737              :                 template <typename Fun, typename... Args>
    1738              :                 static Result invoke(Fun&& fun, Args&&... args) {
    1739              :                     return CATCH_FORWARD(fun)(CATCH_FORWARD(args)...);
    1740              :                 }
    1741              :             };
    1742              :             template <>
    1743              :             struct CompleteInvoker<void> {
    1744              :                 template <typename Fun, typename... Args>
    1745              :                 static CompleteType_t<void> invoke(Fun&& fun, Args&&... args) {
    1746              :                     CATCH_FORWARD(fun)(CATCH_FORWARD(args)...);
    1747              :                     return {};
    1748              :                 }
    1749              :             };
    1750              : 
    1751              :             // invoke and not return void :(
    1752              :             template <typename Fun, typename... Args>
    1753              :             CompleteType_t<FunctionReturnType<Fun, Args...>> complete_invoke(Fun&& fun, Args&&... args) {
    1754              :                 return CompleteInvoker<FunctionReturnType<Fun, Args...>>::invoke(CATCH_FORWARD(fun), CATCH_FORWARD(args)...);
    1755              :             }
    1756              : 
    1757              :         } // namespace Detail
    1758              : 
    1759              :         template <typename Fun>
    1760              :         Detail::CompleteType_t<FunctionReturnType<Fun>> user_code(Fun&& fun) {
    1761              :             return Detail::complete_invoke(CATCH_FORWARD(fun));
    1762              :         }
    1763              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    1764              : } // namespace Catch
    1765              : 
    1766              : #endif // CATCH_COMPLETE_INVOKE_HPP_INCLUDED
    1767              : 
    1768              : 
    1769              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
    1770              : 
    1771              : #ifndef CATCH_TIMING_HPP_INCLUDED
    1772              : #define CATCH_TIMING_HPP_INCLUDED
    1773              : 
    1774              : 
    1775              : namespace Catch {
    1776              :     namespace Benchmark {
    1777              :         template <typename Result>
    1778              :         struct Timing {
    1779              :             IDuration elapsed;
    1780              :             Result result;
    1781              :             int iterations;
    1782              :         };
    1783              :         template <typename Func, typename... Args>
    1784              :         using TimingOf = Timing<Detail::CompleteType_t<FunctionReturnType<Func, Args...>>>;
    1785              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    1786              : } // namespace Catch
    1787              : 
    1788              : #endif // CATCH_TIMING_HPP_INCLUDED
    1789              : 
    1790              : namespace Catch {
    1791              :     namespace Benchmark {
    1792              :         namespace Detail {
    1793              :             template <typename Clock, typename Fun, typename... Args>
    1794              :             TimingOf<Fun, Args...> measure(Fun&& fun, Args&&... args) {
    1795              :                 auto start = Clock::now();
    1796              :                 auto&& r = Detail::complete_invoke(CATCH_FORWARD(fun), CATCH_FORWARD(args)...);
    1797              :                 auto end = Clock::now();
    1798              :                 auto delta = end - start;
    1799              :                 return { delta, CATCH_FORWARD(r), 1 };
    1800              :             }
    1801              :         } // namespace Detail
    1802              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    1803              : } // namespace Catch
    1804              : 
    1805              : #endif // CATCH_MEASURE_HPP_INCLUDED
    1806              : 
    1807              : #include <type_traits>
    1808              : 
    1809              : namespace Catch {
    1810              :     namespace Benchmark {
    1811              :         namespace Detail {
    1812              :             template <typename Clock, typename Fun>
    1813              :             TimingOf<Fun, int> measure_one(Fun&& fun, int iters, std::false_type) {
    1814              :                 return Detail::measure<Clock>(fun, iters);
    1815              :             }
    1816              :             template <typename Clock, typename Fun>
    1817              :             TimingOf<Fun, Chronometer> measure_one(Fun&& fun, int iters, std::true_type) {
    1818              :                 Detail::ChronometerModel<Clock> meter;
    1819              :                 auto&& result = Detail::complete_invoke(fun, Chronometer(meter, iters));
    1820              : 
    1821              :                 return { meter.elapsed(), CATCH_MOVE(result), iters };
    1822              :             }
    1823              : 
    1824              :             template <typename Clock, typename Fun>
    1825              :             using run_for_at_least_argument_t = std::conditional_t<is_callable<Fun(Chronometer)>::value, Chronometer, int>;
    1826              : 
    1827              : 
    1828              :             [[noreturn]]
    1829              :             void throw_optimized_away_error();
    1830              : 
    1831              :             template <typename Clock, typename Fun>
    1832              :             TimingOf<Fun, run_for_at_least_argument_t<Clock, Fun>>
    1833              :                 run_for_at_least(IDuration how_long,
    1834              :                                  const int initial_iterations,
    1835              :                                  Fun&& fun) {
    1836              :                 auto iters = initial_iterations;
    1837              :                 while (iters < (1 << 30)) {
    1838              :                     auto&& Timing = measure_one<Clock>(fun, iters, is_callable<Fun(Chronometer)>());
    1839              : 
    1840              :                     if (Timing.elapsed >= how_long) {
    1841              :                         return { Timing.elapsed, CATCH_MOVE(Timing.result), iters };
    1842              :                     }
    1843              :                     iters *= 2;
    1844              :                 }
    1845              :                 throw_optimized_away_error();
    1846              :             }
    1847              :         } // namespace Detail
    1848              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    1849              : } // namespace Catch
    1850              : 
    1851              : #endif // CATCH_RUN_FOR_AT_LEAST_HPP_INCLUDED
    1852              : 
    1853              : #include <vector>
    1854              : 
    1855              : namespace Catch {
    1856              :     namespace Benchmark {
    1857              :         struct ExecutionPlan {
    1858              :             int iterations_per_sample;
    1859              :             FDuration estimated_duration;
    1860              :             Detail::BenchmarkFunction benchmark;
    1861              :             FDuration warmup_time;
    1862              :             int warmup_iterations;
    1863              : 
    1864              :             template <typename Clock>
    1865              :             std::vector<FDuration> run(const IConfig &cfg, Environment env) const {
    1866              :                 // warmup a bit
    1867              :                 Detail::run_for_at_least<Clock>(
    1868              :                     std::chrono::duration_cast<IDuration>( warmup_time ),
    1869              :                     warmup_iterations,
    1870              :                     Detail::repeat( []() { return Clock::now(); } )
    1871              :                 );
    1872              : 
    1873              :                 std::vector<FDuration> times;
    1874              :                 const auto num_samples = cfg.benchmarkSamples();
    1875              :                 times.reserve( num_samples );
    1876              :                 for ( size_t i = 0; i < num_samples; ++i ) {
    1877              :                     Detail::ChronometerModel<Clock> model;
    1878              :                     this->benchmark( Chronometer( model, iterations_per_sample ) );
    1879              :                     auto sample_time = model.elapsed() - env.clock_cost.mean;
    1880              :                     if ( sample_time < FDuration::zero() ) {
    1881              :                         sample_time = FDuration::zero();
    1882              :                     }
    1883              :                     times.push_back(sample_time / iterations_per_sample);
    1884              :                 }
    1885              :                 return times;
    1886              :             }
    1887              :         };
    1888              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    1889              : } // namespace Catch
    1890              : 
    1891              : #endif // CATCH_EXECUTION_PLAN_HPP_INCLUDED
    1892              : 
    1893              : 
    1894              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
    1895              : 
    1896              : #ifndef CATCH_ESTIMATE_CLOCK_HPP_INCLUDED
    1897              : #define CATCH_ESTIMATE_CLOCK_HPP_INCLUDED
    1898              : 
    1899              : 
    1900              : 
    1901              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
    1902              : 
    1903              : #ifndef CATCH_STATS_HPP_INCLUDED
    1904              : #define CATCH_STATS_HPP_INCLUDED
    1905              : 
    1906              : 
    1907              : #include <vector>
    1908              : 
    1909              : namespace Catch {
    1910              :     namespace Benchmark {
    1911              :         namespace Detail {
    1912              :             using sample = std::vector<double>;
    1913              : 
    1914              :             double weighted_average_quantile( int k,
    1915              :                                               int q,
    1916              :                                               double* first,
    1917              :                                               double* last );
    1918              : 
    1919              :             OutlierClassification
    1920              :             classify_outliers( double const* first, double const* last );
    1921              : 
    1922              :             double mean( double const* first, double const* last );
    1923              : 
    1924              :             double normal_cdf( double x );
    1925              : 
    1926              :             double erfc_inv(double x);
    1927              : 
    1928              :             double normal_quantile(double p);
    1929              : 
    1930              :             Estimate<double>
    1931              :             bootstrap( double confidence_level,
    1932              :                        double* first,
    1933              :                        double* last,
    1934              :                        sample const& resample,
    1935              :                        double ( *estimator )( double const*, double const* ) );
    1936              : 
    1937              :             struct bootstrap_analysis {
    1938              :                 Estimate<double> mean;
    1939              :                 Estimate<double> standard_deviation;
    1940              :                 double outlier_variance;
    1941              :             };
    1942              : 
    1943              :             bootstrap_analysis analyse_samples(double confidence_level,
    1944              :                                                unsigned int n_resamples,
    1945              :                                                double* first,
    1946              :                                                double* last);
    1947              :         } // namespace Detail
    1948              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    1949              : } // namespace Catch
    1950              : 
    1951              : #endif // CATCH_STATS_HPP_INCLUDED
    1952              : 
    1953              : #include <algorithm>
    1954              : #include <vector>
    1955              : #include <cmath>
    1956              : 
    1957              : namespace Catch {
    1958              :     namespace Benchmark {
    1959              :         namespace Detail {
    1960              :             template <typename Clock>
    1961              :             std::vector<double> resolution(int k) {
    1962              :                 const size_t points = static_cast<size_t>( k + 1 );
    1963              :                 // To avoid overhead from the branch inside vector::push_back,
    1964              :                 // we allocate them all and then overwrite.
    1965              :                 std::vector<TimePoint<Clock>> times(points);
    1966              :                 for ( auto& time : times ) {
    1967              :                     time = Clock::now();
    1968              :                 }
    1969              : 
    1970              :                 std::vector<double> deltas;
    1971              :                 deltas.reserve(static_cast<size_t>(k));
    1972              :                 for ( size_t idx = 1; idx < points; ++idx ) {
    1973              :                     deltas.push_back( static_cast<double>(
    1974              :                         ( times[idx] - times[idx - 1] ).count() ) );
    1975              :                 }
    1976              : 
    1977              :                 return deltas;
    1978              :             }
    1979              : 
    1980              :             constexpr auto warmup_iterations = 10000;
    1981              :             constexpr auto warmup_time = std::chrono::milliseconds(100);
    1982              :             constexpr auto minimum_ticks = 1000;
    1983              :             constexpr auto warmup_seed = 10000;
    1984              :             constexpr auto clock_resolution_estimation_time = std::chrono::milliseconds(500);
    1985              :             constexpr auto clock_cost_estimation_time_limit = std::chrono::seconds(1);
    1986              :             constexpr auto clock_cost_estimation_tick_limit = 100000;
    1987              :             constexpr auto clock_cost_estimation_time = std::chrono::milliseconds(10);
    1988              :             constexpr auto clock_cost_estimation_iterations = 10000;
    1989              : 
    1990              :             template <typename Clock>
    1991              :             int warmup() {
    1992              :                 return run_for_at_least<Clock>(warmup_time, warmup_seed, &resolution<Clock>)
    1993              :                     .iterations;
    1994              :             }
    1995              :             template <typename Clock>
    1996              :             EnvironmentEstimate estimate_clock_resolution(int iterations) {
    1997              :                 auto r = run_for_at_least<Clock>(clock_resolution_estimation_time, iterations, &resolution<Clock>)
    1998              :                     .result;
    1999              :                 return {
    2000              :                     FDuration(mean(r.data(), r.data() + r.size())),
    2001              :                     classify_outliers(r.data(), r.data() + r.size()),
    2002              :                 };
    2003              :             }
    2004              :             template <typename Clock>
    2005              :             EnvironmentEstimate estimate_clock_cost(FDuration resolution) {
    2006              :                 auto time_limit = (std::min)(
    2007              :                     resolution * clock_cost_estimation_tick_limit,
    2008              :                     FDuration(clock_cost_estimation_time_limit));
    2009              :                 auto time_clock = [](int k) {
    2010              :                     return Detail::measure<Clock>([k] {
    2011              :                         for (int i = 0; i < k; ++i) {
    2012              :                             volatile auto ignored = Clock::now();
    2013              :                             (void)ignored;
    2014              :                         }
    2015              :                     }).elapsed;
    2016              :                 };
    2017              :                 time_clock(1);
    2018              :                 int iters = clock_cost_estimation_iterations;
    2019              :                 auto&& r = run_for_at_least<Clock>(clock_cost_estimation_time, iters, time_clock);
    2020              :                 std::vector<double> times;
    2021              :                 int nsamples = static_cast<int>(std::ceil(time_limit / r.elapsed));
    2022              :                 times.reserve(static_cast<size_t>(nsamples));
    2023              :                 for ( int s = 0; s < nsamples; ++s ) {
    2024              :                     times.push_back( static_cast<double>(
    2025              :                         ( time_clock( r.iterations ) / r.iterations )
    2026              :                             .count() ) );
    2027              :                 }
    2028              :                 return {
    2029              :                     FDuration(mean(times.data(), times.data() + times.size())),
    2030              :                     classify_outliers(times.data(), times.data() + times.size()),
    2031              :                 };
    2032              :             }
    2033              : 
    2034              :             template <typename Clock>
    2035              :             Environment measure_environment() {
    2036              : #if defined(__clang__)
    2037              : #    pragma clang diagnostic push
    2038              : #    pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wexit-time-destructors"
    2039              : #endif
    2040              :                 static Catch::Detail::unique_ptr<Environment> env;
    2041              : #if defined(__clang__)
    2042              : #    pragma clang diagnostic pop
    2043              : #endif
    2044              :                 if (env) {
    2045              :                     return *env;
    2046              :                 }
    2047              : 
    2048              :                 auto iters = Detail::warmup<Clock>();
    2049              :                 auto resolution = Detail::estimate_clock_resolution<Clock>(iters);
    2050              :                 auto cost = Detail::estimate_clock_cost<Clock>(resolution.mean);
    2051              : 
    2052              :                 env = Catch::Detail::make_unique<Environment>( Environment{resolution, cost} );
    2053              :                 return *env;
    2054              :             }
    2055              :         } // namespace Detail
    2056              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    2057              : } // namespace Catch
    2058              : 
    2059              : #endif // CATCH_ESTIMATE_CLOCK_HPP_INCLUDED
    2060              : 
    2061              : 
    2062              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
    2063              : 
    2064              : #ifndef CATCH_ANALYSE_HPP_INCLUDED
    2065              : #define CATCH_ANALYSE_HPP_INCLUDED
    2066              : 
    2067              : 
    2068              : 
    2069              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
    2070              : 
    2071              : #ifndef CATCH_SAMPLE_ANALYSIS_HPP_INCLUDED
    2072              : #define CATCH_SAMPLE_ANALYSIS_HPP_INCLUDED
    2073              : 
    2074              : 
    2075              : #include <vector>
    2076              : 
    2077              : namespace Catch {
    2078              :     namespace Benchmark {
    2079              :         struct SampleAnalysis {
    2080              :             std::vector<FDuration> samples;
    2081              :             Estimate<FDuration> mean;
    2082              :             Estimate<FDuration> standard_deviation;
    2083              :             OutlierClassification outliers;
    2084              :             double outlier_variance;
    2085              :         };
    2086              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    2087              : } // namespace Catch
    2088              : 
    2089              : #endif // CATCH_SAMPLE_ANALYSIS_HPP_INCLUDED
    2090              : 
    2091              : 
    2092              : namespace Catch {
    2093              :     class IConfig;
    2094              : 
    2095              :     namespace Benchmark {
    2096              :         namespace Detail {
    2097              :             SampleAnalysis analyse(const IConfig &cfg, FDuration* first, FDuration* last);
    2098              :         } // namespace Detail
    2099              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    2100              : } // namespace Catch
    2101              : 
    2102              : #endif // CATCH_ANALYSE_HPP_INCLUDED
    2103              : 
    2104              : #include <algorithm>
    2105              : #include <chrono>
    2106              : #include <exception>
    2107              : #include <string>
    2108              : #include <cmath>
    2109              : 
    2110              : namespace Catch {
    2111              :     namespace Benchmark {
    2112              :         struct Benchmark {
    2113              :             Benchmark(std::string&& benchmarkName)
    2114              :                 : name(CATCH_MOVE(benchmarkName)) {}
    2115              : 
    2116              :             template <class FUN>
    2117              :             Benchmark(std::string&& benchmarkName , FUN &&func)
    2118              :                 : fun(CATCH_MOVE(func)), name(CATCH_MOVE(benchmarkName)) {}
    2119              : 
    2120              :             template <typename Clock>
    2121              :             ExecutionPlan prepare(const IConfig &cfg, Environment env) {
    2122              :                 auto min_time = env.clock_resolution.mean * Detail::minimum_ticks;
    2123              :                 auto run_time = std::max(min_time, std::chrono::duration_cast<decltype(min_time)>(cfg.benchmarkWarmupTime()));
    2124              :                 auto&& test = Detail::run_for_at_least<Clock>(std::chrono::duration_cast<IDuration>(run_time), 1, fun);
    2125              :                 int new_iters = static_cast<int>(std::ceil(min_time * test.iterations / test.elapsed));
    2126              :                 return { new_iters, test.elapsed / test.iterations * new_iters * cfg.benchmarkSamples(), CATCH_MOVE(fun), std::chrono::duration_cast<FDuration>(cfg.benchmarkWarmupTime()), Detail::warmup_iterations };
    2127              :             }
    2128              : 
    2129              :             template <typename Clock = default_clock>
    2130              :             void run() {
    2131              :                 static_assert( Clock::is_steady,
    2132              :                                "Benchmarking clock should be steady" );
    2133              :                 auto const* cfg = getCurrentContext().getConfig();
    2134              : 
    2135              :                 auto env = Detail::measure_environment<Clock>();
    2136              : 
    2137              :                 getResultCapture().benchmarkPreparing(name);
    2138              :                 CATCH_TRY{
    2139              :                     auto plan = user_code([&] {
    2140              :                         return prepare<Clock>(*cfg, env);
    2141              :                     });
    2142              : 
    2143              :                     BenchmarkInfo info {
    2144              :                         CATCH_MOVE(name),
    2145              :                         plan.estimated_duration.count(),
    2146              :                         plan.iterations_per_sample,
    2147              :                         cfg->benchmarkSamples(),
    2148              :                         cfg->benchmarkResamples(),
    2149              :                         env.clock_resolution.mean.count(),
    2150              :                         env.clock_cost.mean.count()
    2151              :                     };
    2152              : 
    2153              :                     getResultCapture().benchmarkStarting(info);
    2154              : 
    2155              :                     auto samples = user_code([&] {
    2156              :                         return plan.template run<Clock>(*cfg, env);
    2157              :                     });
    2158              : 
    2159              :                     auto analysis = Detail::analyse(*cfg, samples.data(), samples.data() + samples.size());
    2160              :                     BenchmarkStats<> stats{ CATCH_MOVE(info), CATCH_MOVE(analysis.samples), analysis.mean, analysis.standard_deviation, analysis.outliers, analysis.outlier_variance };
    2161              :                     getResultCapture().benchmarkEnded(stats);
    2162              :                 } CATCH_CATCH_ALL {
    2163              :                     getResultCapture().benchmarkFailed(translateActiveException());
    2164              :                     // We let the exception go further up so that the
    2165              :                     // test case is marked as failed.
    2166              :                     std::rethrow_exception(std::current_exception());
    2167              :                 }
    2168              :             }
    2169              : 
    2170              :             // sets lambda to be used in fun *and* executes benchmark!
    2171              :             template <typename Fun, std::enable_if_t<!Detail::is_related_v<Fun, Benchmark>, int> = 0>
    2172              :                 Benchmark & operator=(Fun func) {
    2173              :                 auto const* cfg = getCurrentContext().getConfig();
    2174              :                 if (!cfg->skipBenchmarks()) {
    2175              :                     fun = Detail::BenchmarkFunction(func);
    2176              :                     run();
    2177              :                 }
    2178              :                 return *this;
    2179              :             }
    2180              : 
    2181              :             explicit operator bool() {
    2182              :                 return true;
    2183              :             }
    2184              : 
    2185              :         private:
    2186              :             Detail::BenchmarkFunction fun;
    2187              :             std::string name;
    2188              :         };
    2189              :     }
    2190              : } // namespace Catch
    2191              : 
    2192              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_GET_1_ARG(arg1, arg2, ...) arg1
    2193              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_GET_2_ARG(arg1, arg2, ...) arg2
    2194              : 
    2195              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_BENCHMARK(BenchmarkName, name, benchmarkIndex)\
    2196              :     if( Catch::Benchmark::Benchmark BenchmarkName{name} ) \
    2197              :         BenchmarkName = [&](int benchmarkIndex)
    2198              : 
    2199              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_BENCHMARK_ADVANCED(BenchmarkName, name)\
    2200              :     if( Catch::Benchmark::Benchmark BenchmarkName{name} ) \
    2201              :         BenchmarkName = [&]
    2202              : 
    2203              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_ALL)
    2204              : 
    2205              : #define CATCH_BENCHMARK(...) \
    2206              :     INTERNAL_CATCH_BENCHMARK(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME(CATCH2_INTERNAL_BENCHMARK_), INTERNAL_CATCH_GET_1_ARG(__VA_ARGS__,,), INTERNAL_CATCH_GET_2_ARG(__VA_ARGS__,,))
    2207              : #define CATCH_BENCHMARK_ADVANCED(name) \
    2208              :     INTERNAL_CATCH_BENCHMARK_ADVANCED(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME(CATCH2_INTERNAL_BENCHMARK_), name)
    2209              : 
    2210              : #else
    2211              : 
    2212              : #define BENCHMARK(...) \
    2213              :     INTERNAL_CATCH_BENCHMARK(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME(CATCH2_INTERNAL_BENCHMARK_), INTERNAL_CATCH_GET_1_ARG(__VA_ARGS__,,), INTERNAL_CATCH_GET_2_ARG(__VA_ARGS__,,))
    2214              : #define BENCHMARK_ADVANCED(name) \
    2215              :     INTERNAL_CATCH_BENCHMARK_ADVANCED(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME(CATCH2_INTERNAL_BENCHMARK_), name)
    2216              : 
    2217              : #endif
    2218              : 
    2219              : #endif // CATCH_BENCHMARK_HPP_INCLUDED
    2220              : 
    2221              : 
    2222              : // Adapted from donated nonius code.
    2223              : 
    2224              : #ifndef CATCH_CONSTRUCTOR_HPP_INCLUDED
    2225              : #define CATCH_CONSTRUCTOR_HPP_INCLUDED
    2226              : 
    2227              : 
    2228              : #include <type_traits>
    2229              : 
    2230              : namespace Catch {
    2231              :     namespace Benchmark {
    2232              :         namespace Detail {
    2233              :             template <typename T, bool Destruct>
    2234              :             struct ObjectStorage
    2235              :             {
    2236              :                 ObjectStorage() = default;
    2237              : 
    2238              :                 ObjectStorage(const ObjectStorage& other)
    2239              :                 {
    2240              :                     new(&data) T(other.stored_object());
    2241              :                 }
    2242              : 
    2243              :                 ObjectStorage(ObjectStorage&& other)
    2244              :                 {
    2245              :                     new(data) T(CATCH_MOVE(other.stored_object()));
    2246              :                 }
    2247              : 
    2248              :                 ~ObjectStorage() { destruct_on_exit<T>(); }
    2249              : 
    2250              :                 template <typename... Args>
    2251              :                 void construct(Args&&... args)
    2252              :                 {
    2253              :                     new (data) T(CATCH_FORWARD(args)...);
    2254              :                 }
    2255              : 
    2256              :                 template <bool AllowManualDestruction = !Destruct>
    2257              :                 std::enable_if_t<AllowManualDestruction> destruct()
    2258              :                 {
    2259              :                     stored_object().~T();
    2260              :                 }
    2261              : 
    2262              :             private:
    2263              :                 // If this is a constructor benchmark, destruct the underlying object
    2264              :                 template <typename U>
    2265              :                 void destruct_on_exit(std::enable_if_t<Destruct, U>* = nullptr) { destruct<true>(); }
    2266              :                 // Otherwise, don't
    2267              :                 template <typename U>
    2268              :                 void destruct_on_exit(std::enable_if_t<!Destruct, U>* = nullptr) { }
    2269              : 
    2270              : #if defined( __GNUC__ ) && __GNUC__ <= 6
    2271              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic push
    2272              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wstrict-aliasing"
    2273              : #endif
    2274              :                 T& stored_object() { return *reinterpret_cast<T*>( data ); }
    2275              : 
    2276              :                 T const& stored_object() const {
    2277              :                     return *reinterpret_cast<T const*>( data );
    2278              :                 }
    2279              : #if defined( __GNUC__ ) && __GNUC__ <= 6
    2280              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic pop
    2281              : #endif
    2282              : 
    2283              :                 alignas( T ) unsigned char data[sizeof( T )]{};
    2284              :             };
    2285              :         } // namespace Detail
    2286              : 
    2287              :         template <typename T>
    2288              :         using storage_for = Detail::ObjectStorage<T, true>;
    2289              : 
    2290              :         template <typename T>
    2291              :         using destructable_object = Detail::ObjectStorage<T, false>;
    2292              :     } // namespace Benchmark
    2293              : } // namespace Catch
    2294              : 
    2295              : #endif // CATCH_CONSTRUCTOR_HPP_INCLUDED
    2296              : 
    2297              : #endif // CATCH_BENCHMARK_ALL_HPP_INCLUDED
    2298              : 
    2299              : 
    2300              : #ifndef CATCH_APPROX_HPP_INCLUDED
    2301              : #define CATCH_APPROX_HPP_INCLUDED
