    3897              : 
    3898              : 
    3899              : 
    3900              : /** \file
    3901              :  * Wrapper for the CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_MESSAGES configuration option
    3902              :  *
    3903              :  * CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_ALL can be used to avoid clashes with other macros
    3904              :  * by prepending CATCH_. This may not be desirable if the only clashes are with
    3905              :  * logger macros such as INFO and WARN. In this cases
    3906              :  * CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_MESSAGES can be used to only prefix a small subset
    3907              :  * of relevant macros.
    3908              :  *
    3909              :  */
    3910              : 
    3911              : #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_MESSAGES_HPP_INCLUDED
    3912              : #define CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_MESSAGES_HPP_INCLUDED
    3913              : 
    3914              : 
    3915              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_ALL) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_MESSAGES)
    3916              :     #define CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_MESSAGES
    3917              : #endif
    3918              : 
    3919              : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_MESSAGES_HPP_INCLUDED
    3920              : 
    3921              : 
    3922              : #ifndef CATCH_STREAM_END_STOP_HPP_INCLUDED
    3923              : #define CATCH_STREAM_END_STOP_HPP_INCLUDED
    3924              : 
    3925              : 
    3926              : namespace Catch {
    3927              : 
    3928              :     // Use this in variadic streaming macros to allow
    3929              :     //    << +StreamEndStop
    3930              :     // as well as
    3931              :     //    << stuff +StreamEndStop
    3932              :     struct StreamEndStop {
    3933              :         constexpr StringRef operator+() const { return StringRef(); }
    3934              : 
    3935              :         template <typename T>
    3936              :         constexpr friend T const& operator+( T const& value, StreamEndStop ) {
    3937              :             return value;
    3938              :         }
    3939              :     };
    3940              : 
    3941              : } // namespace Catch
    3942              : 
    3943              : #endif // CATCH_STREAM_END_STOP_HPP_INCLUDED
    3944              : 
    3945              : 
    3946              : #ifndef CATCH_MESSAGE_INFO_HPP_INCLUDED
    3947              : #define CATCH_MESSAGE_INFO_HPP_INCLUDED
    3948              : 
    3949              : 
    3950              : 
    3951              : #ifndef CATCH_DEPRECATION_MACRO_HPP_INCLUDED
    3952              : #define CATCH_DEPRECATION_MACRO_HPP_INCLUDED
    3953              : 
    3954              : 
    3955              : #if !defined( CATCH_CONFIG_NO_DEPRECATION_ANNOTATIONS )
    3956              : #    define DEPRECATED( msg ) [[deprecated( msg )]]
    3957              : #else
    3958              : #    define DEPRECATED( msg )
    3959              : #endif
    3960              : 
    3961              : #endif // CATCH_DEPRECATION_MACRO_HPP_INCLUDED
    3962              : 
    3963              : #include <string>
    3964              : 
    3965              : namespace Catch {
    3966              : 
    3967              :     struct MessageInfo {
    3968              :         MessageInfo(    StringRef _macroName,
    3969              :                         SourceLineInfo const& _lineInfo,
    3970              :                         ResultWas::OfType _type );
    3971              : 
    3972              :         StringRef macroName;
    3973              :         std::string message;
    3974              :         SourceLineInfo lineInfo;
    3975              :         ResultWas::OfType type;
    3976              :         // The "ID" of the message, used to know when to remove it from reporter context.
    3977              :         unsigned int sequence;
    3978              : 
    3979              :         DEPRECATED( "Explicitly use the 'sequence' member instead" )
    3980              :         bool operator == (MessageInfo const& other) const {
    3981              :             return sequence == other.sequence;
    3982              :         }
    3983              :         DEPRECATED( "Explicitly use the 'sequence' member instead" )
    3984              :         bool operator < (MessageInfo const& other) const {
    3985              :             return sequence < other.sequence;
    3986              :         }
    3987              :     private:
    3988              :         static thread_local unsigned int globalCount;
    3989              :     };
    3990              : 
    3991              : } // end namespace Catch
    3992              : 
    3993              : #endif // CATCH_MESSAGE_INFO_HPP_INCLUDED
    3994              : 
    3995              : #include <string>
    3996              : #include <vector>
    3997              : 
    3998              : namespace Catch {
    3999              : 
    4000              :     struct SourceLineInfo;
    4001              :     class IResultCapture;
    4002              : 
    4003              :     struct MessageStream {
    4004              : 
    4005              :         template<typename T>
    4006              :         MessageStream& operator << ( T const& value ) {
    4007              :             m_stream << value;
    4008              :             return *this;
    4009              :         }
    4010              : 
    4011              :         ReusableStringStream m_stream;
    4012              :     };
    4013              : 
    4014              :     struct MessageBuilder : MessageStream {
    4015            0 :         MessageBuilder( StringRef macroName,
    4016              :                         SourceLineInfo const& lineInfo,
    4017            0 :                         ResultWas::OfType type ):
    4018            0 :             m_info(macroName, lineInfo, type) {}
    4019              : 
    4020              :         template<typename T>
    4021              :         MessageBuilder&& operator << ( T const& value ) && {
    4022              :             m_stream << value;
    4023              :             return CATCH_MOVE(*this);
    4024              :         }
    4025              : 
    4026              :         MessageInfo m_info;
    4027              :     };
    4028              : 
    4029              :     class ScopedMessage {
    4030              :     public:
    4031              :         explicit ScopedMessage( MessageBuilder&& builder );
    4032              :         ScopedMessage( ScopedMessage& duplicate ) = delete;
    4033              :         ScopedMessage( ScopedMessage&& old ) noexcept;
    4034              :         ~ScopedMessage();
    4035              : 
    4036              :         unsigned int m_messageId;
    4037              :         bool m_moved = false;
    4038              :     };
    4039              : 
    4040              :     class Capturer {
    4041              :         std::vector<MessageInfo> m_messages;
    4042              :         size_t m_captured = 0;
    4043              :     public:
    4044              :         Capturer( StringRef macroName, SourceLineInfo const& lineInfo, ResultWas::OfType resultType, StringRef names );
    4045              : 
    4046              :         Capturer(Capturer const&) = delete;
    4047              :         Capturer& operator=(Capturer const&) = delete;
    4048              : 
    4049              :         ~Capturer();
    4050              : 
    4051              :         void captureValue( size_t index, std::string const& value );
    4052              : 
    4053              :         template<typename T>
    4054              :         void captureValues( size_t index, T const& value ) {
    4055              :             captureValue( index, Catch::Detail::stringify( value ) );
    4056              :         }
    4057              : 
    4058              :         template<typename T, typename... Ts>
    4059              :         void captureValues( size_t index, T const& value, Ts const&... values ) {
    4060              :             captureValue( index, Catch::Detail::stringify(value) );
    4061              :             captureValues( index+1, values... );
    4062              :         }
    4063              :     };
    4064              : 
    4065              : } // end namespace Catch
    4066              : 
    4067              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    4068              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( macroName, messageType, resultDisposition, ... ) \
    4069              :     do { \
    4070              :         Catch::AssertionHandler catchAssertionHandler( macroName##_catch_sr, CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, Catch::StringRef(), resultDisposition ); \
    4071              :         catchAssertionHandler.handleMessage( messageType, ( Catch::MessageStream() << __VA_ARGS__ + ::Catch::StreamEndStop() ).m_stream.str() ); \
    4072              :         catchAssertionHandler.complete(); \
    4073              :     } while( false )
    4074              : 
    4075              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    4076              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_CAPTURE( varName, macroName, ... ) \
    4077              :     Catch::Capturer varName( macroName##_catch_sr,        \
    4078              :                              CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO,     \
    4079              :                              Catch::ResultWas::Info,      \
    4080              :                              #__VA_ARGS__##_catch_sr );   \
    4081              :     varName.captureValues( 0, __VA_ARGS__ )
    4082              : 
    4083              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    4084              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_INFO( macroName, log ) \
    4085              :     const Catch::ScopedMessage INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( scopedMessage )( Catch::MessageBuilder( macroName##_catch_sr, CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, Catch::ResultWas::Info ) << log )
    4086              : 
    4087              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    4088              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_UNSCOPED_INFO( macroName, log ) \
    4089              :     Catch::IResultCapture::emplaceUnscopedMessage( Catch::MessageBuilder( macroName##_catch_sr, CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, Catch::ResultWas::Info ) << log )
    4090              : 
    4091              : 
    4092              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_MESSAGES) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
    4093              : 
    4094              :   #define CATCH_INFO( msg ) INTERNAL_CATCH_INFO( "CATCH_INFO", msg )
    4095              :   #define CATCH_UNSCOPED_INFO( msg ) INTERNAL_CATCH_UNSCOPED_INFO( "CATCH_UNSCOPED_INFO", msg )
    4096              :   #define CATCH_WARN( msg ) INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( "CATCH_WARN", Catch::ResultWas::Warning, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, msg )
    4097              :   #define CATCH_CAPTURE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_CAPTURE( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME(capturer), "CATCH_CAPTURE", __VA_ARGS__ )
    4098              : 
    4099              : #elif defined(CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_MESSAGES) && defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
    4100              : 
    4101              :   #define CATCH_INFO( msg )          (void)(0)
    4102              :   #define CATCH_UNSCOPED_INFO( msg ) (void)(0)
    4103              :   #define CATCH_WARN( msg )          (void)(0)
    4104              :   #define CATCH_CAPTURE( ... )       (void)(0)
    4105              : 
    4106              : #elif !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_MESSAGES) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
    4107              : 
    4108              :   #define INFO( msg ) INTERNAL_CATCH_INFO( "INFO", msg )
    4109              :   #define UNSCOPED_INFO( msg ) INTERNAL_CATCH_UNSCOPED_INFO( "UNSCOPED_INFO", msg )
    4110              :   #define WARN( msg ) INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( "WARN", Catch::ResultWas::Warning, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, msg )
    4111              :   #define CAPTURE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_CAPTURE( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME(capturer), "CAPTURE", __VA_ARGS__ )
    4112              : 
    4113              : #elif !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_MESSAGES) && defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
    4114              : 
    4115              :   #define INFO( msg )          (void)(0)
    4116              :   #define UNSCOPED_INFO( msg ) (void)(0)
    4117              :   #define WARN( msg )          (void)(0)
    4118              :   #define CAPTURE( ... )       (void)(0)
    4119              : 
    4120              : #endif // end of user facing macro declarations
    4121              : 
    4122              :

    4139              : 
    4140              :     struct Counts {
    4141              :         Counts operator - ( Counts const& other ) const;
    4142              :         Counts& operator += ( Counts const& other );
    4143              : 
    4144              :         std::uint64_t total() const;
    4145              :         bool allPassed() const;
    4146              :         bool allOk() const;
    4147              : 
    4148              :         std::uint64_t passed = 0;
    4149              :         std::uint64_t failed = 0;
    4150              :         std::uint64_t failedButOk = 0;
    4151              :         std::uint64_t skipped = 0;
    4152              :     };
    4153              :

    4155              :

    4157              :         Totals& operator += ( Totals const& other );
    4158              : 
    4159              :         Totals delta( Totals const& prevTotals ) const;
    4160              :

    4170              : namespace Catch {
    4171              : 
    4172              :     struct SectionInfo {
    4173              :         // The last argument is ignored, so that people can write
    4174              :         // SECTION("ShortName", "Proper description that is long") and
    4175              :         // still use the `-c` flag comfortably.
    4176          518 :         SectionInfo( SourceLineInfo const& _lineInfo, std::string _name,
    4177          518 :                     const char* const = nullptr ):
    4178          518 :             name(CATCH_MOVE(_name)),
    4179          518 :             lineInfo(_lineInfo)
    4180          518 :             {}
    4181              : 
    4182              :         std::string name;
    4183              :         SourceLineInfo lineInfo;
    4184              :     };
    4185              : 
    4186              :     struct SectionEndInfo {
    4187              :         SectionInfo sectionInfo;
    4188              :         Counts prevAssertions;
    4189              :         double durationInSeconds;
    4190              :     };

    4239              : 
    4240              : namespace Catch {
    4241              :     namespace Clara {
    4242              : 
    4243              :         class Args;
    4244              :         class Parser;
    4245              : 
    4246              :         // enum of result types from a parse
    4247              :         enum class ParseResultType {
    4248              :             Matched,
    4249              :             NoMatch,
    4250              :             ShortCircuitAll,
    4251              :             ShortCircuitSame
    4252              :         };
    4253              : 
    4254              :         struct accept_many_t {};
    4255              :         constexpr accept_many_t accept_many {};
    4256              : 
    4257              :         namespace Detail {
    4258              :             struct fake_arg {
    4259              :                 template <typename T>
    4260              :                 operator T();
    4261              :             };
    4262              : 
    4263              :             template <typename F, typename = void>
    4264              :             static constexpr bool is_unary_function_v = false;
    4265              : 
    4266              :             template <typename F>
    4267              :             static constexpr bool is_unary_function_v<
    4268              :                 F,
    4269              :                 Catch::Detail::void_t<decltype( std::declval<F>()(
    4270              :                     fake_arg() ) )>> = true;
    4271              : 
    4272              :             // Traits for extracting arg and return type of lambdas (for single
    4273              :             // argument lambdas)
    4274              :             template <typename L>
    4275              :             struct UnaryLambdaTraits
    4276              :                 : UnaryLambdaTraits<decltype( &L::operator() )> {};
    4277              : 
    4278              :             template <typename ClassT, typename ReturnT, typename... Args>
    4279              :             struct UnaryLambdaTraits<ReturnT ( ClassT::* )( Args... ) const> {
    4280              :                 static const bool isValid = false;
    4281              :             };
    4282              : 
    4283              :             template <typename ClassT, typename ReturnT, typename ArgT>
    4284              :             struct UnaryLambdaTraits<ReturnT ( ClassT::* )( ArgT ) const> {
    4285              :                 static const bool isValid = true;
    4286              :                 using ArgType = std::remove_const_t<std::remove_reference_t<ArgT>>;
    4287              :                 using ReturnType = ReturnT;
    4288              :             };
    4289              : 
    4290              :             class TokenStream;
    4291              : 
    4292              :             // Wraps a token coming from a token stream. These may not directly
    4293              :             // correspond to strings as a single string may encode an option +
    4294              :             // its argument if the : or = form is used
    4295              :             enum class TokenType { Option, Argument };
    4296              :             struct Token {
    4297              :                 TokenType type;
    4298              :                 StringRef token;
    4299              :             };
    4300              : 
    4301              :             // Abstracts iterators into args as a stream of tokens, with option
    4302              :             // arguments uniformly handled
    4303              :             class TokenStream {
    4304              :                 using Iterator = std::vector<StringRef>::const_iterator;
    4305              :                 Iterator it;
    4306              :                 Iterator itEnd;
    4307              :                 std::vector<Token> m_tokenBuffer;
    4308              :                 void loadBuffer();
    4309              : 
    4310              :             public:
    4311              :                 explicit TokenStream( Args const& args );
    4312              :                 TokenStream( Iterator it, Iterator itEnd );
    4313              : 
    4314            1 :                 explicit operator bool() const {
    4315            1 :                     return !m_tokenBuffer.empty() || it != itEnd;
    4316              :                 }
    4317              : 
    4318              :                 size_t count() const {
    4319              :                     return m_tokenBuffer.size() + ( itEnd - it );
    4320              :                 }
    4321              : 
    4322            0 :                 Token operator*() const {
    4323            0 :                     assert( !m_tokenBuffer.empty() );
    4324            0 :                     return m_tokenBuffer.front();
    4325              :                 }
    4326              : 
    4327            0 :                 Token const* operator->() const {
    4328            0 :                     assert( !m_tokenBuffer.empty() );
    4329            0 :                     return &m_tokenBuffer.front();
    4330              :                 }
    4331              : 
    4332              :                 TokenStream& operator++();
    4333              :             };
    4334              : 
    4335              :             //! Denotes type of a parsing result
    4336              :             enum class ResultType {
    4337              :                 Ok,          ///< No errors
    4338              :                 LogicError,  ///< Error in user-specified arguments for
    4339              :                              ///< construction
    4340              :                 RuntimeError ///< Error in parsing inputs
    4341              :             };
    4342              : 
    4343              :             class ResultBase {
    4344              :             protected:
    4345            2 :                 ResultBase( ResultType type ): m_type( type ) {}
    4346              :                 virtual ~ResultBase(); // = default;
    4347              : 
    4348              : 
    4349            1 :                 ResultBase(ResultBase const&) = default;
    4350            0 :                 ResultBase& operator=(ResultBase const&) = default;
    4351            0 :                 ResultBase(ResultBase&&) = default;
    4352              :                 ResultBase& operator=(ResultBase&&) = default;
    4353              : 
    4354              :                 virtual void enforceOk() const = 0;
    4355              : 
    4356              :                 ResultType m_type;
    4357              :             };
    4358              : 
    4359              :             template <typename T>
    4360              :             class ResultValueBase : public ResultBase {
    4361              :             public:
    4362            1 :                 T const& value() const& {
    4363            1 :                     enforceOk();
    4364            1 :                     return m_value;
    4365              :                 }
    4366            0 :                 T&& value() && {
    4367            0 :                     enforceOk();

    4369              :                 }
    4370              : 
    4371              :             protected:
    4372            0 :                 ResultValueBase( ResultType type ): ResultBase( type ) {}
    4373              :

    4376            0 :                     if ( m_type == ResultType::Ok )
    4377            0 :                         new ( &m_value ) T( other.m_value );
    4378            0 :                 }
    4379            1 :                 ResultValueBase( ResultValueBase&& other ):

    4381            1 :                     if ( m_type == ResultType::Ok )
    4382            1 :                         new ( &m_value ) T( CATCH_MOVE(other.m_value) );
    4383            1 :                 }
    4384              : 
    4385              : 
    4386              :                 ResultValueBase( ResultType, T const& value ):
    4387              :                     ResultBase( ResultType::Ok ) {
    4388              :                     new ( &m_value ) T( value );
    4389              :                 }
    4390            2 :                 ResultValueBase( ResultType, T&& value ):
    4391            2 :                     ResultBase( ResultType::Ok ) {
    4392            2 :                     new ( &m_value ) T( CATCH_MOVE(value) );
    4393            2 :                 }
    4394              : 
    4395              :                 ResultValueBase& operator=( ResultValueBase const& other ) {
    4396              :                     if ( m_type == ResultType::Ok )
    4397              :                         m_value.~T();
    4398              :                     ResultBase::operator=( other );
    4399              :                     if ( m_type == ResultType::Ok )
    4400              :                         new ( &m_value ) T( other.m_value );
    4401              :                     return *this;
    4402              :                 }
    4403            0 :                 ResultValueBase& operator=( ResultValueBase&& other ) {
    4404            0 :                     if ( m_type == ResultType::Ok ) m_value.~T();
    4405            0 :                     ResultBase::operator=( other );
    4406            0 :                     if ( m_type == ResultType::Ok )
    4407            0 :                         new ( &m_value ) T( CATCH_MOVE(other.m_value) );

    4409              :                 }
    4410              : 
    4411              :

    4413            3 :                     if ( m_type == ResultType::Ok )
    4414            3 :                         m_value.~T();

    4416              : 
    4417              :                 union {
    4418              :                     T m_value;
    4419              :                 };
    4420              :             };

    4422              :             template <> class ResultValueBase<void> : public ResultBase {
    4423              :             protected:

    4426              : 
    4427              :             template <typename T = void>
    4428              :             class BasicResult : public ResultValueBase<T> {
    4429              :             public:
    4430              :                 template <typename U>
    4431            0 :                 explicit BasicResult( BasicResult<U> const& other ):
    4432              :                     ResultValueBase<T>( other.type() ),
    4433            0 :                     m_errorMessage( other.errorMessage() ) {
    4434            0 :                     assert( type() != ResultType::Ok );
    4435            0 :                 }
    4436              : 
    4437              :                 template <typename U>
    4438            2 :                 static auto ok( U&& value ) -> BasicResult {
    4439            2 :                     return { ResultType::Ok, CATCH_FORWARD(value) };
    4440              :                 }
    4441            0 :                 static auto ok() -> BasicResult { return { ResultType::Ok }; }
    4442            0 :                 static auto logicError( std::string&& message )
    4443              :                     -> BasicResult {
    4444            0 :                     return { ResultType::LogicError, CATCH_MOVE(message) };
    4445              :                 }
    4446            0 :                 static auto runtimeError( std::string&& message )
    4447              :                     -> BasicResult {
    4448            0 :                     return { ResultType::RuntimeError, CATCH_MOVE(message) };
    4449              :                 }
    4450              : 
    4451            1 :                 explicit operator bool() const {
    4452            1 :                     return m_type == ResultType::Ok;
    4453              :                 }
    4454            0 :                 auto type() const -> ResultType { return m_type; }
    4455            0 :                 auto errorMessage() const -> std::string const& {
    4456            0 :                     return m_errorMessage;
    4457              :                 }
    4458              : 
    4459              :             protected:
    4460            1 :                 void enforceOk() const override {
    4461              : 
    4462              :                     // Errors shouldn't reach this point, but if they do
    4463              :                     // the actual error message will be in m_errorMessage
    4464            1 :                     assert( m_type != ResultType::LogicError );
    4465            1 :                     assert( m_type != ResultType::RuntimeError );
    4466            1 :                     if ( m_type != ResultType::Ok )
    4467            0 :                         std::abort();
    4468            1 :                 }
    4469              : 
    4470              :                 std::string
    4471              :                     m_errorMessage; // Only populated if resultType is an error
    4472              : 
    4473            0 :                 BasicResult( ResultType type,
    4474              :                              std::string&& message ):
    4475            0 :                     ResultValueBase<T>( type ), m_errorMessage( CATCH_MOVE(message) ) {
    4476            0 :                     assert( m_type != ResultType::Ok );
    4477            0 :                 }
    4478              : 
    4479              :                 using ResultValueBase<T>::ResultValueBase;
    4480              :                 using ResultBase::m_type;
    4481              :             };
    4482              : 
    4483              :             class ParseState {
    4484              :             public:
    4485              :                 ParseState( ParseResultType type,
    4486              :                             TokenStream remainingTokens );

    4488            0 :                 ParseResultType type() const { return m_type; }

    4500              : 
    4501              :             using Result = BasicResult<void>;
    4502              :             using ParserResult = BasicResult<ParseResultType>;
    4503              :             using InternalParseResult = BasicResult<ParseState>;
    4504              : 
    4505              :             struct HelpColumns {
    4506              :                 std::string left;

    4509              : 
    4510              :             template <typename T>
    4511            0 :             ParserResult convertInto( std::string const& source, T& target ) {
    4512            0 :                 std::stringstream ss( source );
    4513            0 :                 ss >> target;
    4514            0 :                 if ( ss.fail() ) {
    4515              :                     return ParserResult::runtimeError(
    4516              :                         "Unable to convert '" + source +
    4517            0 :                         "' to destination type" );
    4518              :                 } else {
    4519            0 :                     return ParserResult::ok( ParseResultType::Matched );
    4520              :                 }
    4521            0 :             }
    4522              :             ParserResult convertInto( std::string const& source,
    4523              :                                       std::string& target );
    4524              :             ParserResult convertInto( std::string const& source, bool& target );
    4525              : 
    4526              : #ifdef CLARA_CONFIG_OPTIONAL_TYPE
    4527              :             template <typename T>
    4528              :             auto convertInto( std::string const& source,
    4529              :                               CLARA_CONFIG_OPTIONAL_TYPE<T>& target )
    4530              :                 -> ParserResult {
    4531              :                 T temp;
    4532              :                 auto result = convertInto( source, temp );
    4533              :                 if ( result )
    4534              :                     target = CATCH_MOVE( temp );
    4535              :                 return result;
    4536              :             }
    4537              : #endif // CLARA_CONFIG_OPTIONAL_TYPE
    4538              : 
    4539              :             struct BoundRef : Catch::Detail::NonCopyable {
    4540           38 :                 virtual ~BoundRef() = default;
    4541              :                 virtual bool isContainer() const;
    4542              :                 virtual bool isFlag() const;
    4543              :             };
    4544              :             struct BoundValueRefBase : BoundRef {
    4545              :                 virtual auto setValue( std::string const& arg )
    4546              :                     -> ParserResult = 0;
    4547              :             };
    4548              :             struct BoundFlagRefBase : BoundRef {
    4549              :                 virtual auto setFlag( bool flag ) -> ParserResult = 0;
    4550              :                 bool isFlag() const override;
    4551              :             };
    4552              : 
    4553              :             template <typename T> struct BoundValueRef : BoundValueRefBase {
    4554              :                 T& m_ref;

    4556            9 :                 explicit BoundValueRef( T& ref ): m_ref( ref ) {}

    4589              :             template <typename ReturnType> struct LambdaInvoker {
    4590              :                 static_assert(
    4591              :                     std::is_same<ReturnType, ParserResult>::value,
    4592              :                     "Lambda must return void or clara::ParserResult" );
    4593              : 
    4594              :                 template <typename L, typename ArgType>
    4595            0 :                 static auto invoke( L const& lambda, ArgType const& arg )
    4596              :                     -> ParserResult {
    4597            0 :                     return lambda( arg );
    4598              :                 }
    4599              :             };
    4600              : 
    4601              :             template <> struct LambdaInvoker<void> {
    4602              :                 template <typename L, typename ArgType>
    4603            0 :                 static auto invoke( L const& lambda, ArgType const& arg )
    4604              :                     -> ParserResult {
    4605            0 :                     lambda( arg );
    4606            0 :                     return ParserResult::ok( ParseResultType::Matched );
    4607              :                 }
    4608              :             };
    4609              : 
    4610              :             template <typename ArgType, typename L>
    4611            0 :             auto invokeLambda( L const& lambda, std::string const& arg )
    4612              :                 -> ParserResult {
    4613            0 :                 ArgType temp{};

    4615            0 :                 return !result ? result
    4616              :                                : LambdaInvoker<typename UnaryLambdaTraits<
    4617            0 :                                      L>::ReturnType>::invoke( lambda, temp );
    4618            0 :             }
    4619              : 
    4620              :             template <typename L> struct BoundLambda : BoundValueRefBase {
    4621              :                 L m_lambda;
    4622              : 
    4623              :                 static_assert(
    4624              :                     UnaryLambdaTraits<L>::isValid,
    4625              :                     "Supplied lambda must take exactly one argument" );
    4626           12 :                 explicit BoundLambda( L const& lambda ): m_lambda( lambda ) {}
    4627              : 
    4628            0 :                 auto setValue( std::string const& arg )

    4630              :                     return invokeLambda<typename UnaryLambdaTraits<L>::ArgType>(
    4631            0 :                         m_lambda, arg );
    4632              :                 }
    4633              :             };

    4635              :             template <typename L> struct BoundManyLambda : BoundLambda<L> {

    4637            0 :                 bool isContainer() const override { return true; }

    4813              :         // Specifies the name of the executable
    4814              :         class ExeName : public Detail::ComposableParserImpl<ExeName> {
    4815              :             std::shared_ptr<std::string> m_name;
    4816              :             std::shared_ptr<Detail::BoundValueRefBase> m_ref;
    4817              : 
    4818              :         public:
    4819              :             ExeName();

    4821              : 
    4822              :             template <typename LambdaT>
    4823              :             explicit ExeName(LambdaT const& lambda) : ExeName() {
    4824              :                 m_ref = std::make_shared<Detail::BoundLambda<LambdaT>>(lambda);
    4825              :             }
    4826              : 
    4827              :             // The exe name is not parsed out of the normal tokens, but is
    4828              :             // handled specially

    4830              :                 parse(std::string const&,
    4831              :                       Detail::TokenStream tokens) const override;
    4832              : 
    4833            0 :             std::string const& name() const { return *m_name; }
    4834              :             Detail::ParserResult set(std::string const& newName);
    4835              :         };
    4836              : 
    4837              : 
    4838              :         // A Combined parser
    4839              :         class Parser : Detail::ParserBase {
    4840              :             mutable ExeName m_exeName;
    4841              :             std::vector<Opt> m_options;
    4842              :             std::vector<Arg> m_args;
    4843              : 
    4844              :         public:
    4845              : 
    4846            1 :             auto operator|=(ExeName const& exeName) -> Parser& {
    4847            1 :                 m_exeName = exeName;
    4848            1 :                 return *this;
    4849              :             }
    4850              : 
    4851            1 :             auto operator|=(Arg const& arg) -> Parser& {
    4852            1 :                 m_args.push_back(arg);
    4853            1 :                 return *this;
    4854              :             }
    4855              : 
    4856            1 :             friend Parser& operator|=( Parser& p, Opt const& opt ) {
    4857            1 :                 p.m_options.push_back( opt );
    4858            1 :                 return p;
    4859              :             }
    4860           35 :             friend Parser& operator|=( Parser& p, Opt&& opt ) {
    4861           35 :                 p.m_options.push_back( CATCH_MOVE(opt) );
    4862           35 :                 return p;
    4863              :             }
    4864              : 
    4865              :             Parser& operator|=(Parser const& other);
    4866              : 
    4867              :             template <typename T>
    4868              :             friend Parser operator|( Parser const& p, T&& rhs ) {
    4869              :                 Parser temp( p );
    4870              :                 temp |= rhs;
    4871              :                 return temp;
    4872              :             }
    4873              : 
    4874              :             template <typename T>
    4875           38 :             friend Parser operator|( Parser&& p, T&& rhs ) {
    4876           38 :                 p |= CATCH_FORWARD(rhs);
    4877           38 :                 return CATCH_MOVE(p);
    4878              :             }
    4879              : 
    4880              :             std::vector<Detail::HelpColumns> getHelpColumns() const;
    4881              : 
    4882              :             void writeToStream(std::ostream& os) const;
    4883              : 
    4884            0 :             friend auto operator<<(std::ostream& os, Parser const& parser)
    4885              :                 -> std::ostream& {
    4886            0 :                 parser.writeToStream(os);
    4887            0 :                 return os;
    4888              :             }
    4889              : 
    4890              :             Detail::Result validate() const override;
    4891              : 
    4892              :             using ParserBase::parse;
    4893              :             Detail::InternalParseResult
    4894              :                 parse(std::string const& exeName,
    4895              :                       Detail::TokenStream tokens) const override;
    4896              :         };
    4897              : 
    4898              :         /**
    4899              :          * Wrapper over argc + argv, assumes that the inputs outlive it
    4900              :          */
    4901              :         class Args {
    4902              :             friend Detail::TokenStream;
    4903              :             StringRef m_exeName;
    4904              :             std::vector<StringRef> m_args;
    4905              : 
    4906              :         public:
    4907              :             Args(int argc, char const* const* argv);
    4908              :             // Helper constructor for testing
    4909              :             Args(std::initializer_list<StringRef> args);
    4910              : 
    4911            1 :             StringRef exeName() const { return m_exeName; }
    4912              :         };
    4913              : 
    4914              : 
    4915              :         // Convenience wrapper for option parser that specifies the help option
    4916              :         struct Help : Opt {
    4917              :             Help(bool& showHelpFlag);
    4918              :         };
    4919              : 
    4920              :         // Result type for parser operation
    4921              :         using Detail::ParserResult;
    4922              : 
    4923              :         namespace Detail {
    4924              :             template <typename DerivedT>
    4925              :             template <typename T>
    4926              :             Parser
    4927            1 :                 ComposableParserImpl<DerivedT>::operator|(T const& other) const {
    4928            1 :                 return Parser() | static_cast<DerivedT const&>(*this) | other;
    4929              :             }
    4930              :         }
    4931              : 
    4932              :     } // namespace Clara
    4933              : } // namespace Catch
    4934              : 
    4935              : #if defined( __clang__ )
    4936              : #    pragma clang diagnostic pop
    4937              : #endif
    4938              : 
    4939              : #if defined( __GNUC__ )
    4940              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic pop
    4941              : #endif
    4942              : 
    4943              : #endif // CATCH_CLARA_HPP_INCLUDED
    4944              : 
    4945              : namespace Catch {
    4946              :

    4950              : 
    4951              : } // end namespace Catch
    4952              : 
    4953              : #endif // CATCH_COMMANDLINE_HPP_INCLUDED
    4954              : 
    4955              : namespace Catch {
    4956              :

    4960              :     constexpr int UnmatchedTestSpecExitCode = 3;

    4964              :

    4970              :

    4980              : 
    4981              :         template<typename CharT>
    4982            1 :         int run(int argc, CharT const * const argv[]) {
    4983            1 :             if (m_startupExceptions)
    4984            0 :                 return 1;
    4985            1 :             int returnCode = applyCommandLine(argc, argv);
    4986            1 :             if (returnCode == 0)
    4987            1 :                 returnCode = run();
    4988            1 :             return returnCode;
    4989              :         }
    4990              : 
    4991              :         int run();
    4992              : 
    4993              :         Clara::Parser const& cli() const;
    4994              :         void cli( Clara::Parser const& newParser );
    4995              :         ConfigData& configData();
    4996              :         Config& config();
    4997              :     private:
    4998              :         int runInternal();
    4999              : 
    5000              :         Clara::Parser m_cli;

    5003              :         bool m_startupExceptions = false;
    5004              :     };
    5005              : 
    5006              : } // end namespace Catch
    5007              : 
    5008              : #endif // CATCH_SESSION_HPP_INCLUDED
    5009              : 
    5010              : 
    5011              : #ifndef CATCH_TAG_ALIAS_HPP_INCLUDED
    5012              : #define CATCH_TAG_ALIAS_HPP_INCLUDED

    5018              :

    5020            0 :         TagAlias(std::string const& _tag, SourceLineInfo _lineInfo):

    5022            0 :             lineInfo(_lineInfo)
    5023            0 :         {}

    5042              :     };

    5045              : 
    5046              : #define CATCH_REGISTER_TAG_ALIAS( alias, spec ) \
    5047              :     CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    5048              :     CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS \
    5049              :     namespace{ const Catch::RegistrarForTagAliases INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( AutoRegisterTagAlias )( alias, spec, CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO ); } \
    5050              :     CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION
    5051              : 
    5052              : #endif // CATCH_TAG_ALIAS_AUTOREGISTRAR_HPP_INCLUDED
    5053              : 
    5054              : 
    5055              : #ifndef CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_MACROS_HPP_INCLUDED
    5056              : #define CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_MACROS_HPP_INCLUDED
    5057              : 
    5058              : // We need this suppression to leak, because it took until GCC 10
    5059              : // for the front end to handle local suppression via _Pragma properly
    5060              : // inside templates (so `TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE` and co).
    5061              : // **THIS IS DIFFERENT FOR STANDARD TESTS, WHERE GCC 9 IS SUFFICIENT**
    5062              : #if defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__clang__) && !defined(__ICC) && __GNUC__ < 10
    5063              : #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wparentheses"
    5064              : #endif
    5065              : 
    5066              : 
    5067              : 
    5068              :

    5070              : #define CATCH_TEST_MACROS_HPP_INCLUDED
    5071              : 
    5072              :

    5076              : 
    5077              : 
    5078              : 
    5079              : #ifndef CATCH_ASSERTION_HANDLER_HPP_INCLUDED
    5080              : #define CATCH_ASSERTION_HANDLER_HPP_INCLUDED
    5081              : 
    5082              : 
    5083              : 
    5084              : #ifndef CATCH_DECOMPOSER_HPP_INCLUDED
    5085              : #define CATCH_DECOMPOSER_HPP_INCLUDED
    5086              : 
    5087              : 
    5088              : 
    5089              : #ifndef CATCH_COMPARE_TRAITS_HPP_INCLUDED
    5090              : #define CATCH_COMPARE_TRAITS_HPP_INCLUDED
    5091              : 
    5092              : 
    5093              : #include <type_traits>
    5094              : 
    5095              : namespace Catch {
    5096              :     namespace Detail {
    5097              : 
    5098              : #if defined( __GNUC__ ) && !defined( __clang__ )
    5099              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic push
    5100              :     // GCC likes to complain about comparing bool with 0, in the decltype()
    5101              :     // that defines the comparable traits below.
    5102              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wbool-compare"
    5103              :     // "ordered comparison of pointer with integer zero" same as above,
    5104              :     // but it does not have a separate warning flag to suppress
    5105              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wextra"
    5106              :     // Did you know that comparing floats with `0` directly
    5107              :     // is super-duper dangerous in unevaluated context?
    5108              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal"
    5109              : #endif
    5110              : 
    5111              : #if defined( __clang__ )
    5112              : #    pragma clang diagnostic push
    5113              :     // Did you know that comparing floats with `0` directly
    5114              :     // is super-duper dangerous in unevaluated context?
    5115              : #    pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal"
    5116              : #endif
    5117              : 
    5118              : #define CATCH_DEFINE_COMPARABLE_TRAIT( id, op )                               \
    5119              :     template <typename, typename, typename = void>                            \
    5120              :     struct is_##id##_comparable : std::false_type {};                         \
    5121              :     template <typename T, typename U>                                         \
    5122              :     struct is_##id##_comparable<                                              \
    5123              :         T,                                                                    \
    5124              :         U,                                                                    \
    5125              :         void_t<decltype( std::declval<T>() op std::declval<U>() )>>           \
    5126              :         : std::true_type {};                                                  \
    5127              :     template <typename, typename = void>                                      \
    5128              :     struct is_##id##_0_comparable : std::false_type {};                       \
    5129              :     template <typename T>                                                     \
    5130              :     struct is_##id##_0_comparable<T,                                          \
    5131              :                                   void_t<decltype( std::declval<T>() op 0 )>> \
    5132              :         : std::true_type {};
    5133              : 
    5134              :         // We need all 6 pre-spaceship comparison ops: <, <=, >, >=, ==, !=
    5135              :         CATCH_DEFINE_COMPARABLE_TRAIT( lt, < )
    5136              :         CATCH_DEFINE_COMPARABLE_TRAIT( le, <= )
    5137              :         CATCH_DEFINE_COMPARABLE_TRAIT( gt, > )
    5138              :         CATCH_DEFINE_COMPARABLE_TRAIT( ge, >= )
    5139              :         CATCH_DEFINE_COMPARABLE_TRAIT( eq, == )
    5140              :         CATCH_DEFINE_COMPARABLE_TRAIT( ne, != )
    5141              : 
    5142              : #undef CATCH_DEFINE_COMPARABLE_TRAIT
    5143              : 
    5144              : #if defined( __GNUC__ ) && !defined( __clang__ )
    5145              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic pop
    5146              : #endif
    5147              : #if defined( __clang__ )
    5148              : #    pragma clang diagnostic pop
    5149              : #endif
    5150              : 
    5151              : 
    5152              :     } // namespace Detail
    5153              : } // namespace Catch
    5154              : 
    5155              : #endif // CATCH_COMPARE_TRAITS_HPP_INCLUDED
    5156              : 
    5157              : 
    5158              : #ifndef CATCH_LOGICAL_TRAITS_HPP_INCLUDED
    5159              : #define CATCH_LOGICAL_TRAITS_HPP_INCLUDED
    5160              : 
    5161              : #include <type_traits>
    5162              : 
    5163              : namespace Catch {
    5164              : namespace Detail {
    5165              : 
    5166              : #if defined( __cpp_lib_logical_traits ) && __cpp_lib_logical_traits >= 201510
    5167              : 
    5168              :     using std::conjunction;
    5169              :     using std::disjunction;
    5170              :     using std::negation;
    5171              : 
    5172              : #else
    5173              : 
    5174              :     template <class...> struct conjunction : std::true_type {};
    5175              :     template <class B1> struct conjunction<B1> : B1 {};
    5176              :     template <class B1, class... Bn>
    5177              :     struct conjunction<B1, Bn...>
    5178              :         : std::conditional_t<bool( B1::value ), conjunction<Bn...>, B1> {};
    5179              : 
    5180              :     template <class...> struct disjunction : std::false_type {};
    5181              :     template <class B1> struct disjunction<B1> : B1 {};
    5182              :     template <class B1, class... Bn>
    5183              :     struct disjunction<B1, Bn...>
    5184              :         : std::conditional_t<bool( B1::value ), B1, disjunction<Bn...>> {};
    5185              : 
    5186              :     template <class B>
    5187              :     struct negation : std::integral_constant<bool, !bool(B::value)> {};
    5188              : 
    5189              : #endif
    5190              : 
    5191              : } // namespace Detail
    5192              : } // namespace Catch
    5193              : 
    5194              : #endif // CATCH_LOGICAL_TRAITS_HPP_INCLUDED
    5195              : 
    5196              : #include <type_traits>
    5197              : #include <iosfwd>
    5198              : 
    5199              : /** \file
    5200              :  * Why does decomposing look the way it does:
    5201              :  *
    5202              :  * Conceptually, decomposing is simple. We change `REQUIRE( a == b )` into
    5203              :  * `Decomposer{} <= a == b`, so that `Decomposer{} <= a` is evaluated first,
    5204              :  * and our custom operator is used for `a == b`, because `a` is transformed
    5205              :  * into `ExprLhs<T&>` and then into `BinaryExpr<T&, U&>`.
    5206              :  *
    5207              :  * In practice, decomposing ends up a mess, because we have to support
    5208              :  * various fun things.
    5209              :  *
    5210              :  * 1) Types that are only comparable with literal 0, and they do this by
    5211              :  *    comparing against a magic type with pointer constructor and deleted
    5212              :  *    other constructors. Example: `REQUIRE((a <=> b) == 0)` in libstdc++
    5213              :  *
    5214              :  * 2) Types that are only comparable with literal 0, and they do this by
    5215              :  *    comparing against a magic type with consteval integer constructor.
    5216              :  *    Example: `REQUIRE((a <=> b) == 0)` in current MSVC STL.
    5217              :  *
    5218              :  * 3) Types that have no linkage, and so we cannot form a reference to
    5219              :  *    them. Example: some implementations of traits.
    5220              :  *
    5221              :  * 4) Starting with C++20, when the compiler sees `a == b`, it also uses
    5222              :  *    `b == a` when constructing the overload set. For us this means that
    5223              :  *    when the compiler handles `ExprLhs<T> == b`, it also tries to resolve
    5224              :  *    the overload set for `b == ExprLhs<T>`.
    5225              :  *
    5226              :  * To accommodate these use cases, decomposer ended up rather complex.
    5227              :  *
    5228              :  * 1) These types are handled by adding SFINAE overloads to our comparison
    5229              :  *    operators, checking whether `T == U` are comparable with the given
    5230              :  *    operator, and if not, whether T (or U) are comparable with literal 0.
    5231              :  *    If yes, the overload compares T (or U) with 0 literal inline in the
    5232              :  *    definition.
    5233              :  *
    5234              :  *    Note that for extra correctness, we check  that the other type is
    5235              :  *    either an `int` (literal 0 is captured as `int` by templates), or
    5236              :  *    a `long` (some platforms use 0L for `NULL` and we want to support
    5237              :  *    that for pointer comparisons).
    5238              :  *
    5239              :  * 2) For these types, `is_foo_comparable<T, int>` is true, but letting
    5240              :  *    them fall into the overload that actually does `T == int` causes
    5241              :  *    compilation error. Handling them requires that the decomposition
    5242              :  *    is `constexpr`, so that P2564R3 applies and the `consteval` from
    5243              :  *    their accompanying magic type is propagated through the `constexpr`
    5244              :  *    call stack.
    5245              :  *
    5246              :  *    However this is not enough to handle these types automatically,
    5247              :  *    because our default is to capture types by reference, to avoid
    5248              :  *    runtime copies. While these references cannot become dangling,
    5249              :  *    they outlive the constexpr context and thus the default capture
    5250              :  *    path cannot be actually constexpr.
    5251              :  *
    5252              :  *    The solution is to capture these types by value, by explicitly
    5253              :  *    specializing `Catch::capture_by_value` for them. Catch2 provides
    5254              :  *    specialization for `std::foo_ordering`s, but users can specialize
    5255              :  *    the trait for their own types as well.
    5256              :  *
    5257              :  * 3) If a type has no linkage, we also cannot capture it by reference.
    5258              :  *    The solution is once again to capture them by value. We handle
    5259              :  *    the common cases by using `std::is_arithmetic` and `std::is_enum`
    5260              :  *    as the default for `Catch::capture_by_value`, but that is only a
    5261              :  *    some-effort heuristic. These combine to capture all possible bitfield
    5262              :  *    bases, and also some trait-like types. As with 2), users can
    5263              :  *    specialize `capture_by_value` for their own types as needed.
    5264              :  *
    5265              :  * 4) To support C++20 and make the SFINAE on our decomposing operators
    5266              :  *    work, the SFINAE has to happen in return type, rather than in
    5267              :  *    a template type. This is due to our use of logical type traits
    5268              :  *    (`conjunction`/`disjunction`/`negation`), that we use to workaround
    5269              :  *    an issue in older (9-) versions of GCC. I still blame C++20 for
    5270              :  *    this, because without the comparison order switching, the logical
    5271              :  *    traits could still be used in template type.
    5272              :  *
    5273              :  * There are also other side concerns, e.g. supporting both `REQUIRE(a)`
    5274              :  * and `REQUIRE(a == b)`, or making `REQUIRE_THAT(a, IsEqual(b))` slot
    5275              :  * nicely into the same expression handling logic, but these are rather
    5276              :  * straightforward and add only a bit of complexity (e.g. common base
    5277              :  * class for decomposed expressions).
    5278              :  */
    5279              : 
    5280              : #ifdef _MSC_VER
    5281              : #pragma warning(push)
    5282              : #pragma warning(disable:4389) // '==' : signed/unsigned mismatch
    5283              : #pragma warning(disable:4018) // more "signed/unsigned mismatch"
    5284              : #pragma warning(disable:4312) // Converting int to T* using reinterpret_cast (issue on x64 platform)
    5285              : #pragma warning(disable:4180) // qualifier applied to function type has no meaning
    5286              : #pragma warning(disable:4800) // Forcing result to true or false
    5287              : #endif
    5288              : 
    5289              : #ifdef __clang__
    5290              : #  pragma clang diagnostic push
    5291              : #  pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wsign-compare"
    5292              : #  pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wnon-virtual-dtor"
    5293              : #elif defined __GNUC__
    5294              : #  pragma GCC diagnostic push
    5295              : #  pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wsign-compare"
    5296              : #  pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wnon-virtual-dtor"
    5297              : #endif
    5298              : 
    5299              : #if defined(CATCH_CPP20_OR_GREATER) && __has_include(<compare>)
    5300              : #  include <compare>
    5301              : #    if defined( __cpp_lib_three_way_comparison ) && \
    5302              :             __cpp_lib_three_way_comparison >= 201907L
    5303              : #      define CATCH_CONFIG_CPP20_COMPARE_OVERLOADS
    5304              : #    endif
    5305              : #endif
    5306              : 
    5307              : namespace Catch {
    5308              : 
    5309              :     namespace Detail {
    5310              :         // This was added in C++20, but we require only C++14 for now.
    5311              :         template <typename T>
    5312              :         using RemoveCVRef_t = std::remove_cv_t<std::remove_reference_t<T>>;
    5313              :     }
    5314              : 
    5315              :     // Note: This is about as much as we can currently reasonably support.
    5316              :     //       In an ideal world, we could capture by value small trivially
    5317              :     //       copyable types, but the actual `std::is_trivially_copyable`
    5318              :     //       trait is a huge mess with standard-violating results on
    5319              :     //       GCC and Clang, which are unlikely to be fixed soon due to ABI
    5320              :     //       concerns.
    5321              :     //       `std::is_scalar` also causes issues due to the `is_pointer`
    5322              :     //       component, which causes ambiguity issues with (references-to)
    5323              :     //       function pointer. If those are resolved, we still need to
    5324              :     //       disambiguate the overload set for arrays, through explicit
    5325              :     //       overload for references to sized arrays.
    5326              :     template <typename T>
    5327              :     struct capture_by_value
    5328              :         : std::integral_constant<bool,
    5329              :                                  std::is_arithmetic<T>::value ||
    5330              :                                      std::is_enum<T>::value> {};
    5331              : 
    5332              : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_CPP20_COMPARE_OVERLOADS )
    5333              :     template <>
    5334              :     struct capture_by_value<std::strong_ordering> : std::true_type {};
    5335              :     template <>
    5336              :     struct capture_by_value<std::weak_ordering> : std::true_type {};
    5337              :     template <>
    5338              :     struct capture_by_value<std::partial_ordering> : std::true_type {};
    5339              : #endif
    5340              : 
    5341              :     template <typename T>
    5342              :     struct always_false : std::false_type {};
    5343              : 
    5344              :     class ITransientExpression {
    5345              :         bool m_isBinaryExpression;
    5346              :         bool m_result;
    5347              : 
    5348              :     protected:
    5349              :         ~ITransientExpression() = default;
    5350              : 
    5351              :     public:
    5352            0 :         constexpr auto isBinaryExpression() const -> bool { return m_isBinaryExpression; }
    5353          615 :         constexpr auto getResult() const -> bool { return m_result; }
    5354              :         //! This function **has** to be overridden by the derived class.
    5355              :         virtual void streamReconstructedExpression( std::ostream& os ) const;
    5356              : 
    5357            0 :         constexpr ITransientExpression( bool isBinaryExpression, bool result )
    5358            0 :         :   m_isBinaryExpression( isBinaryExpression ),
    5359            0 :             m_result( result )
    5360            0 :         {}
    5361              : 
    5362              :         constexpr ITransientExpression( ITransientExpression const& ) = default;
    5363              :         constexpr ITransientExpression& operator=( ITransientExpression const& ) = default;
    5364              : 
    5365            0 :         friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, ITransientExpression const& expr) {
    5366            0 :             expr.streamReconstructedExpression(out);
    5367            0 :             return out;
    5368              :         }
    5369              :     };
    5370              : 
    5371              :     void formatReconstructedExpression( std::ostream &os, std::string const& lhs, StringRef op, std::string const& rhs );
    5372              : 
    5373              :     template<typename LhsT, typename RhsT>
    5374              :     class BinaryExpr  : public ITransientExpression {
    5375              :         LhsT m_lhs;
    5376              :         StringRef m_op;
    5377              :         RhsT m_rhs;
    5378              : 
    5379              :         void streamReconstructedExpression( std::ostream &os ) const override {
    5380              :             formatReconstructedExpression
    5381              :                     ( os, Catch::Detail::stringify( m_lhs ), m_op, Catch::Detail::stringify( m_rhs ) );
    5382              :         }
    5383              : 
    5384              :     public:
    5385              :         constexpr BinaryExpr( bool comparisonResult, LhsT lhs, StringRef op, RhsT rhs )
    5386              :         :   ITransientExpression{ true, comparisonResult },
    5387              :             m_lhs( lhs ),
    5388              :             m_op( op ),
    5389              :             m_rhs( rhs )
    5390              :         {}
    5391              : 
    5392              :         template<typename T>
    5393              :         auto operator && ( T ) const -> BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT const&> const {
    5394              :             static_assert(always_false<T>::value,
    5395              :             "chained comparisons are not supported inside assertions, "
    5396              :             "wrap the expression inside parentheses, or decompose it");
    5397              :         }
    5398              : 
    5399              :         template<typename T>
    5400              :         auto operator || ( T ) const -> BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT const&> const {
    5401              :             static_assert(always_false<T>::value,
    5402              :             "chained comparisons are not supported inside assertions, "
    5403              :             "wrap the expression inside parentheses, or decompose it");
    5404              :         }
    5405              : 
    5406              :         template<typename T>
    5407              :         auto operator == ( T ) const -> BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT const&> const {
    5408              :             static_assert(always_false<T>::value,
    5409              :             "chained comparisons are not supported inside assertions, "
    5410              :             "wrap the expression inside parentheses, or decompose it");
    5411              :         }
    5412              : 
    5413              :         template<typename T>
    5414              :         auto operator != ( T ) const -> BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT const&> const {
    5415              :             static_assert(always_false<T>::value,
    5416              :             "chained comparisons are not supported inside assertions, "
    5417              :             "wrap the expression inside parentheses, or decompose it");
    5418              :         }
    5419              : 
    5420              :         template<typename T>
    5421              :         auto operator > ( T ) const -> BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT const&> const {
    5422              :             static_assert(always_false<T>::value,
    5423              :             "chained comparisons are not supported inside assertions, "
    5424              :             "wrap the expression inside parentheses, or decompose it");
    5425              :         }
    5426              : 
    5427              :         template<typename T>
    5428              :         auto operator < ( T ) const -> BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT const&> const {
    5429              :             static_assert(always_false<T>::value,
    5430              :             "chained comparisons are not supported inside assertions, "
    5431              :             "wrap the expression inside parentheses, or decompose it");
    5432              :         }
    5433              : 
    5434              :         template<typename T>
    5435              :         auto operator >= ( T ) const -> BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT const&> const {
    5436              :             static_assert(always_false<T>::value,
    5437              :             "chained comparisons are not supported inside assertions, "
    5438              :             "wrap the expression inside parentheses, or decompose it");
    5439              :         }
    5440              : 
    5441              :         template<typename T>
    5442              :         auto operator <= ( T ) const -> BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT const&> const {
    5443              :             static_assert(always_false<T>::value,
    5444              :             "chained comparisons are not supported inside assertions, "
    5445              :             "wrap the expression inside parentheses, or decompose it");
    5446              :         }
    5447              :     };
    5448              : 
    5449              :     template<typename LhsT>
    5450              :     class UnaryExpr : public ITransientExpression {
    5451              :         LhsT m_lhs;
    5452              : 
    5453              :         void streamReconstructedExpression( std::ostream &os ) const override {
    5454              :             os << Catch::Detail::stringify( m_lhs );
    5455              :         }
    5456              : 
    5457              :     public:
    5458              :         explicit constexpr UnaryExpr( LhsT lhs )
    5459              :         :   ITransientExpression{ false, static_cast<bool>(lhs) },
    5460              :             m_lhs( lhs )
    5461              :         {}
    5462              :     };
    5463              : 
    5464              : 
    5465              :     template<typename LhsT>
    5466              :     class ExprLhs {
    5467              :         LhsT m_lhs;
    5468              :     public:
    5469              :         explicit constexpr ExprLhs( LhsT lhs ) : m_lhs( lhs ) {}
    5470              : 
    5471              : #define CATCH_INTERNAL_DEFINE_EXPRESSION_EQUALITY_OPERATOR( id, op )           \
    5472              :     template <typename RhsT>                                                   \
    5473              :     constexpr friend auto operator op( ExprLhs&& lhs, RhsT&& rhs )             \
    5474              :         -> std::enable_if_t<                                                   \
    5475              :             Detail::conjunction<Detail::is_##id##_comparable<LhsT, RhsT>,      \
    5476              :                                 Detail::negation<capture_by_value<             \
    5477              :                                     Detail::RemoveCVRef_t<RhsT>>>>::value,     \
    5478              :             BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT const&>> {                                   \
    5479              :         return {                                                               \
    5480              :             static_cast<bool>( lhs.m_lhs op rhs ), lhs.m_lhs, #op##_sr, rhs }; \
    5481              :     }                                                                          \
    5482              :     template <typename RhsT>                                                   \
    5483              :     constexpr friend auto operator op( ExprLhs&& lhs, RhsT rhs )               \
    5484              :         -> std::enable_if_t<                                                   \
    5485              :             Detail::conjunction<Detail::is_##id##_comparable<LhsT, RhsT>,      \
    5486              :                                 capture_by_value<RhsT>>::value,                \
    5487              :             BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT>> {                                          \
    5488              :         return {                                                               \
    5489              :             static_cast<bool>( lhs.m_lhs op rhs ), lhs.m_lhs, #op##_sr, rhs }; \
    5490              :     }                                                                          \
    5491              :     template <typename RhsT>                                                   \
    5492              :     constexpr friend auto operator op( ExprLhs&& lhs, RhsT rhs )               \
    5493              :         -> std::enable_if_t<                                                   \
    5494              :             Detail::conjunction<                                               \
    5495              :                 Detail::negation<Detail::is_##id##_comparable<LhsT, RhsT>>,    \
    5496              :                 Detail::is_eq_0_comparable<LhsT>,                              \
    5497              :               /* We allow long because we want `ptr op NULL` to be accepted */ \
    5498              :                 Detail::disjunction<std::is_same<RhsT, int>,                   \
    5499              :                                     std::is_same<RhsT, long>>>::value,         \
    5500              :             BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT>> {                                          \
    5501              :         if ( rhs != 0 ) { throw_test_failure_exception(); }                    \
    5502              :         return {                                                               \
    5503              :             static_cast<bool>( lhs.m_lhs op 0 ), lhs.m_lhs, #op##_sr, rhs };   \
    5504              :     }                                                                          \
    5505              :     template <typename RhsT>                                                   \
    5506              :     constexpr friend auto operator op( ExprLhs&& lhs, RhsT rhs )               \
    5507              :         -> std::enable_if_t<                                                   \
    5508              :             Detail::conjunction<                                               \
    5509              :                 Detail::negation<Detail::is_##id##_comparable<LhsT, RhsT>>,    \
    5510              :                 Detail::is_eq_0_comparable<RhsT>,                              \
    5511              :               /* We allow long because we want `ptr op NULL` to be accepted */ \
    5512              :                 Detail::disjunction<std::is_same<LhsT, int>,                   \
    5513              :                                     std::is_same<LhsT, long>>>::value,         \
    5514              :             BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT>> {                                          \
    5515              :         if ( lhs.m_lhs != 0 ) { throw_test_failure_exception(); }              \
    5516              :         return { static_cast<bool>( 0 op rhs ), lhs.m_lhs, #op##_sr, rhs };    \
    5517              :     }
    5518              : 
    5519              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_DEFINE_EXPRESSION_EQUALITY_OPERATOR( eq, == )
    5520              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_DEFINE_EXPRESSION_EQUALITY_OPERATOR( ne, != )
    5521              : 
    5522              :     #undef CATCH_INTERNAL_DEFINE_EXPRESSION_EQUALITY_OPERATOR
    5523              : 
    5524              : 
    5525              : #define CATCH_INTERNAL_DEFINE_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON_OPERATOR( id, op )         \
    5526              :     template <typename RhsT>                                                   \
    5527              :     constexpr friend auto operator op( ExprLhs&& lhs, RhsT&& rhs )             \
    5528              :         -> std::enable_if_t<                                                   \
    5529              :             Detail::conjunction<Detail::is_##id##_comparable<LhsT, RhsT>,      \
    5530              :                                 Detail::negation<capture_by_value<             \
    5531              :                                     Detail::RemoveCVRef_t<RhsT>>>>::value,     \
    5532              :             BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT const&>> {                                   \
    5533              :         return {                                                               \
    5534              :             static_cast<bool>( lhs.m_lhs op rhs ), lhs.m_lhs, #op##_sr, rhs }; \
    5535              :     }                                                                          \
    5536              :     template <typename RhsT>                                                   \
    5537              :     constexpr friend auto operator op( ExprLhs&& lhs, RhsT rhs )               \
    5538              :         -> std::enable_if_t<                                                   \
    5539              :             Detail::conjunction<Detail::is_##id##_comparable<LhsT, RhsT>,      \
    5540              :                                 capture_by_value<RhsT>>::value,                \
    5541              :             BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT>> {                                          \
    5542              :         return {                                                               \
    5543              :             static_cast<bool>( lhs.m_lhs op rhs ), lhs.m_lhs, #op##_sr, rhs }; \
    5544              :     }                                                                          \
    5545              :     template <typename RhsT>                                                   \
    5546              :     constexpr friend auto operator op( ExprLhs&& lhs, RhsT rhs )               \
    5547              :         -> std::enable_if_t<                                                   \
    5548              :             Detail::conjunction<                                               \
