    5549              :                 Detail::negation<Detail::is_##id##_comparable<LhsT, RhsT>>,    \
    5550              :                 Detail::is_##id##_0_comparable<LhsT>,                          \
    5551              :                 std::is_same<RhsT, int>>::value,                               \
    5552              :             BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT>> {                                          \
    5553              :         if ( rhs != 0 ) { throw_test_failure_exception(); }                    \
    5554              :         return {                                                               \
    5555              :             static_cast<bool>( lhs.m_lhs op 0 ), lhs.m_lhs, #op##_sr, rhs };   \
    5556              :     }                                                                          \
    5557              :     template <typename RhsT>                                                   \
    5558              :     constexpr friend auto operator op( ExprLhs&& lhs, RhsT rhs )               \
    5559              :         -> std::enable_if_t<                                                   \
    5560              :             Detail::conjunction<                                               \
    5561              :                 Detail::negation<Detail::is_##id##_comparable<LhsT, RhsT>>,    \
    5562              :                 Detail::is_##id##_0_comparable<RhsT>,                          \
    5563              :                 std::is_same<LhsT, int>>::value,                               \
    5564              :             BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT>> {                                          \
    5565              :         if ( lhs.m_lhs != 0 ) { throw_test_failure_exception(); }              \
    5566              :         return { static_cast<bool>( 0 op rhs ), lhs.m_lhs, #op##_sr, rhs };    \
    5567              :     }
    5568              : 
    5569              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_DEFINE_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON_OPERATOR( lt, < )
    5570              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_DEFINE_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON_OPERATOR( le, <= )
    5571              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_DEFINE_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON_OPERATOR( gt, > )
    5572              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_DEFINE_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON_OPERATOR( ge, >= )
    5573              : 
    5574              :     #undef CATCH_INTERNAL_DEFINE_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON_OPERATOR
    5575              : 
    5576              : 
    5577              : #define CATCH_INTERNAL_DEFINE_EXPRESSION_OPERATOR( op )                        \
    5578              :     template <typename RhsT>                                                   \
    5579              :     constexpr friend auto operator op( ExprLhs&& lhs, RhsT&& rhs )             \
    5580              :         -> std::enable_if_t<                                                   \
    5581              :             !capture_by_value<Detail::RemoveCVRef_t<RhsT>>::value,             \
    5582              :             BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT const&>> {                                   \
    5583              :         return {                                                               \
    5584              :             static_cast<bool>( lhs.m_lhs op rhs ), lhs.m_lhs, #op##_sr, rhs }; \
    5585              :     }                                                                          \
    5586              :     template <typename RhsT>                                                   \
    5587              :     constexpr friend auto operator op( ExprLhs&& lhs, RhsT rhs )               \
    5588              :         -> std::enable_if_t<capture_by_value<RhsT>::value,                     \
    5589              :                             BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT>> {                          \
    5590              :         return {                                                               \
    5591              :             static_cast<bool>( lhs.m_lhs op rhs ), lhs.m_lhs, #op##_sr, rhs }; \
    5592              :     }
    5593              : 
    5594              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_DEFINE_EXPRESSION_OPERATOR(|)
    5595              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_DEFINE_EXPRESSION_OPERATOR(&)
    5596              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_DEFINE_EXPRESSION_OPERATOR(^)
    5597              : 
    5598              :     #undef CATCH_INTERNAL_DEFINE_EXPRESSION_OPERATOR
    5599              : 
    5600              :         template<typename RhsT>
    5601              :         friend auto operator && ( ExprLhs &&, RhsT && ) -> BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT const&> {
    5602              :             static_assert(always_false<RhsT>::value,
    5603              :             "operator&& is not supported inside assertions, "
    5604              :             "wrap the expression inside parentheses, or decompose it");
    5605              :         }
    5606              : 
    5607              :         template<typename RhsT>
    5608              :         friend auto operator || ( ExprLhs &&, RhsT && ) -> BinaryExpr<LhsT, RhsT const&> {
    5609              :             static_assert(always_false<RhsT>::value,
    5610              :             "operator|| is not supported inside assertions, "
    5611              :             "wrap the expression inside parentheses, or decompose it");
    5612              :         }
    5613              : 
    5614              :         constexpr auto makeUnaryExpr() const -> UnaryExpr<LhsT> {
    5615              :             return UnaryExpr<LhsT>{ m_lhs };
    5616              :         }
    5617              :     };
    5618              : 
    5619              :     struct Decomposer {
    5620              :         template <typename T,
    5621              :                   std::enable_if_t<!capture_by_value<Detail::RemoveCVRef_t<T>>::value,
    5622              :                       int> = 0>
    5623              :         constexpr friend auto operator <= ( Decomposer &&, T && lhs ) -> ExprLhs<T const&> {
    5624              :             return ExprLhs<const T&>{ lhs };
    5625              :         }
    5626              : 
    5627              :         template <typename T,
    5628              :                   std::enable_if_t<capture_by_value<T>::value, int> = 0>
    5629              :         constexpr friend auto operator <= ( Decomposer &&, T value ) -> ExprLhs<T> {
    5630              :             return ExprLhs<T>{ value };
    5631              :         }
    5632              :     };
    5633              : 
    5634              : } // end namespace Catch
    5635              : 
    5636              : #ifdef _MSC_VER
    5637              : #pragma warning(pop)
    5638              : #endif
    5639              : #ifdef __clang__
    5640              : #  pragma clang diagnostic pop
    5641              : #elif defined __GNUC__
    5642              : #  pragma GCC diagnostic pop
    5643              : #endif
    5644              : 
    5645              : #endif // CATCH_DECOMPOSER_HPP_INCLUDED
    5646              : 
    5647              : #include <string>
    5648              : 
    5649              : namespace Catch {
    5650              : 
    5651              :     struct AssertionReaction {
    5652              :         bool shouldDebugBreak = false;
    5653              :         bool shouldThrow = false;
    5654              :         bool shouldSkip = false;
    5655              :     };
    5656              : 
    5657              :     class AssertionHandler {
    5658              :         AssertionInfo m_assertionInfo;
    5659              :         AssertionReaction m_reaction;
    5660              :         bool m_completed = false;
    5661              :         IResultCapture& m_resultCapture;
    5662              : 
    5663              :     public:
    5664              :         AssertionHandler
    5665              :             (   StringRef macroName,
    5666              :                 SourceLineInfo const& lineInfo,
    5667              :                 StringRef capturedExpression,
    5668              :                 ResultDisposition::Flags resultDisposition );
    5669              :         ~AssertionHandler() {
    5670              :             if ( !m_completed ) {
    5671              :                 m_resultCapture.handleIncomplete( m_assertionInfo );
    5672              :             }
    5673              :         }
    5674              : 
    5675              : 
    5676              :         template<typename T>
    5677              :         constexpr void handleExpr( ExprLhs<T> const& expr ) {
    5678              :             handleExpr( expr.makeUnaryExpr() );
    5679              :         }
    5680              :         void handleExpr( ITransientExpression const& expr );
    5681              : 
    5682              :         void handleMessage(ResultWas::OfType resultType, std::string&& message);
    5683              : 
    5684              :         void handleExceptionThrownAsExpected();
    5685              :         void handleUnexpectedExceptionNotThrown();
    5686              :         void handleExceptionNotThrownAsExpected();
    5687              :         void handleThrowingCallSkipped();
    5688              :         void handleUnexpectedInflightException();
    5689              : 
    5690              :         void complete();
    5691              : 
    5692              :         // query
    5693              :         auto allowThrows() const -> bool;
    5694              :     };
    5695              : 
    5696              :     void handleExceptionMatchExpr( AssertionHandler& handler, std::string const& str );
    5697              : 
    5698              : } // namespace Catch
    5699              : 
    5700              : #endif // CATCH_ASSERTION_HANDLER_HPP_INCLUDED
    5701              : 
    5702              : 
    5703              : #ifndef CATCH_PREPROCESSOR_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY_HPP_INCLUDED
    5704              : #define CATCH_PREPROCESSOR_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY_HPP_INCLUDED
    5705              : 
    5706              : 
    5707              : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_STRINGIFICATION)
    5708              :   #define CATCH_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY(...) #__VA_ARGS__##_catch_sr
    5709              : #else
    5710              :   #define CATCH_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY(...) "Disabled by CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_STRINGIFICATION"_catch_sr
    5711              : #endif
    5712              : 
    5713              : #endif // CATCH_PREPROCESSOR_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY_HPP_INCLUDED
    5714              : 
    5715              : // We need this suppression to leak, because it took until GCC 10
    5716              : // for the front end to handle local suppression via _Pragma properly
    5717              : #if defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__clang__) && !defined(__ICC) && __GNUC__ <= 9
    5718              :   #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wparentheses"
    5719              : #endif
    5720              : 
    5721              : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
    5722              : 
    5723              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_FAST_COMPILE) || defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
    5724              : 
    5725              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    5726              : // Another way to speed-up compilation is to omit local try-catch for REQUIRE*
    5727              : // macros.
    5728              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TRY
    5729              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_CATCH( capturer )
    5730              : 
    5731              : #else // CATCH_CONFIG_FAST_COMPILE
    5732              : 
    5733              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TRY try
    5734              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_CATCH( handler ) catch(...) { (handler).handleUnexpectedInflightException(); }
    5735              : 
    5736              : #endif
    5737              : 
    5738              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    5739              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( macroName, resultDisposition, ... ) \
    5740              :     do { /* NOLINT(bugprone-infinite-loop) */ \
    5741              :         /* The expression should not be evaluated, but warnings should hopefully be checked */ \
    5742              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_IGNORE_BUT_WARN(__VA_ARGS__); \
    5743              :         Catch::AssertionHandler catchAssertionHandler( macroName##_catch_sr, CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, CATCH_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY(__VA_ARGS__), resultDisposition ); \
    5744              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_TRY { \
    5745              :             CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    5746              :             CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_PARENTHESES_WARNINGS \
    5747              :             catchAssertionHandler.handleExpr( Catch::Decomposer() <= __VA_ARGS__ ); /* NOLINT(bugprone-chained-comparison) */ \
    5748              :             CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    5749              :         } INTERNAL_CATCH_CATCH( catchAssertionHandler ) \
    5750              :         catchAssertionHandler.complete(); \
    5751              :     } while( (void)0, (false) && static_cast<const bool&>( !!(__VA_ARGS__) ) ) // the expression here is never evaluated at runtime but it forces the compiler to give it a look
    5752              :     // The double negation silences MSVC's C4800 warning, the static_cast forces short-circuit evaluation if the type has overloaded &&.
    5753              : 
    5754              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    5755              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_IF( macroName, resultDisposition, ... ) \
    5756              :     INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( macroName, resultDisposition, __VA_ARGS__ ); \
    5757              :     if( Catch::getResultCapture().lastAssertionPassed() )
    5758              : 
    5759              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    5760              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_ELSE( macroName, resultDisposition, ... ) \
    5761              :     INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( macroName, resultDisposition, __VA_ARGS__ ); \
    5762              :     if( !Catch::getResultCapture().lastAssertionPassed() )
    5763              : 
    5764              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    5765              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_NO_THROW( macroName, resultDisposition, ... ) \
    5766              :     do { \
    5767              :         Catch::AssertionHandler catchAssertionHandler( macroName##_catch_sr, CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, CATCH_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY(__VA_ARGS__), resultDisposition ); \
    5768              :         try { \
    5769              :             CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    5770              :             CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_USELESS_CAST_WARNINGS \
    5771              :             static_cast<void>(__VA_ARGS__); \
    5772              :             CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    5773              :             catchAssertionHandler.handleExceptionNotThrownAsExpected(); \
    5774              :         } \
    5775              :         catch( ... ) { \
    5776              :             catchAssertionHandler.handleUnexpectedInflightException(); \
    5777              :         } \
    5778              :         catchAssertionHandler.complete(); \
    5779              :     } while( false )
    5780              : 
    5781              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    5782              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS( macroName, resultDisposition, ... ) \
    5783              :     do { \
    5784              :         Catch::AssertionHandler catchAssertionHandler( macroName##_catch_sr, CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, CATCH_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY(__VA_ARGS__), resultDisposition); \
    5785              :         if( catchAssertionHandler.allowThrows() ) \
    5786              :             try { \
    5787              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    5788              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_RESULT \
    5789              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_USELESS_CAST_WARNINGS \
    5790              :                 static_cast<void>(__VA_ARGS__); \
    5791              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    5792              :                 catchAssertionHandler.handleUnexpectedExceptionNotThrown(); \
    5793              :             } \
    5794              :             catch( ... ) { \
    5795              :                 catchAssertionHandler.handleExceptionThrownAsExpected(); \
    5796              :             } \
    5797              :         else \
    5798              :             catchAssertionHandler.handleThrowingCallSkipped(); \
    5799              :         catchAssertionHandler.complete(); \
    5800              :     } while( false )
    5801              : 
    5802              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    5803              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_AS( macroName, exceptionType, resultDisposition, expr ) \
    5804              :     do { \
    5805              :         Catch::AssertionHandler catchAssertionHandler( macroName##_catch_sr, CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, CATCH_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY(expr) ", " CATCH_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY(exceptionType), resultDisposition ); \
    5806              :         if( catchAssertionHandler.allowThrows() ) \
    5807              :             try { \
    5808              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    5809              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_RESULT \
    5810              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_USELESS_CAST_WARNINGS \
    5811              :                 static_cast<void>(expr); \
    5812              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    5813              :                 catchAssertionHandler.handleUnexpectedExceptionNotThrown(); \
    5814              :             } \
    5815              :             catch( exceptionType const& ) { \
    5816              :                 catchAssertionHandler.handleExceptionThrownAsExpected(); \
    5817              :             } \
    5818              :             catch( ... ) { \
    5819              :                 catchAssertionHandler.handleUnexpectedInflightException(); \
    5820              :             } \
    5821              :         else \
    5822              :             catchAssertionHandler.handleThrowingCallSkipped(); \
    5823              :         catchAssertionHandler.complete(); \
    5824              :     } while( false )
    5825              : 
    5826              : 
    5827              : 
    5828              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    5829              : // Although this is matcher-based, it can be used with just a string
    5830              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_STR_MATCHES( macroName, resultDisposition, matcher, ... ) \
    5831              :     do { \
    5832              :         Catch::AssertionHandler catchAssertionHandler( macroName##_catch_sr, CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, CATCH_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY(__VA_ARGS__) ", " CATCH_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY(matcher), resultDisposition ); \
    5833              :         if( catchAssertionHandler.allowThrows() ) \
    5834              :             try { \
    5835              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    5836              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_RESULT \
    5837              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_USELESS_CAST_WARNINGS \
    5838              :                 static_cast<void>(__VA_ARGS__); \
    5839              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    5840              :                 catchAssertionHandler.handleUnexpectedExceptionNotThrown(); \
    5841              :             } \
    5842              :             catch( ... ) { \
    5843              :                 Catch::handleExceptionMatchExpr( catchAssertionHandler, matcher ); \
    5844              :             } \
    5845              :         else \
    5846              :             catchAssertionHandler.handleThrowingCallSkipped(); \
    5847              :         catchAssertionHandler.complete(); \
    5848              :     } while( false )
    5849              : 
    5850              : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE
    5851              : 
    5852              : #endif // CATCH_TEST_MACRO_IMPL_HPP_INCLUDED
    5853              : 
    5854              : 
    5855              : #ifndef CATCH_SECTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    5856              : #define CATCH_SECTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    5857              : 
    5858              : 
    5859              : 
    5860              : 
    5861              : /** \file
    5862              :  * Wrapper for the STATIC_ANALYSIS_SUPPORT configuration option
    5863              :  *
    5864              :  * Some of Catch2's macros can be defined differently to work better with
    5865              :  * static analysis tools, like clang-tidy or coverity.
    5866              :  * Currently the main use case is to show that `SECTION`s are executed
    5867              :  * exclusively, and not all in one run of a `TEST_CASE`.
    5868              :  */
    5869              : 
    5870              : #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_STATIC_ANALYSIS_SUPPORT_HPP_INCLUDED
    5871              : #define CATCH_CONFIG_STATIC_ANALYSIS_SUPPORT_HPP_INCLUDED
    5872              : 
    5873              : 
    5874              : #if defined(__clang_analyzer__) || defined(__COVERITY__)
    5875              :     #define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_STATIC_ANALYSIS_SUPPORT
    5876              : #endif
    5877              : 
    5878              : #if defined( CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_STATIC_ANALYSIS_SUPPORT ) && \
    5879              :     !defined( CATCH_CONFIG_NO_EXPERIMENTAL_STATIC_ANALYSIS_SUPPORT ) && \
    5880              :     !defined( CATCH_CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL_STATIC_ANALYSIS_SUPPORT )
    5881              : #    define CATCH_CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL_STATIC_ANALYSIS_SUPPORT
    5882              : #endif
    5883              : 
    5884              : 
    5885              : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_STATIC_ANALYSIS_SUPPORT_HPP_INCLUDED
    5886              : 
    5887              : 
    5888              : #ifndef CATCH_TIMER_HPP_INCLUDED
    5889              : #define CATCH_TIMER_HPP_INCLUDED
    5890              : 
    5891              : #include <cstdint>
    5892              : 
    5893              : namespace Catch {
    5894              : 
    5895              :     class Timer {
    5896              :         uint64_t m_nanoseconds = 0;
    5897              :     public:
    5898              :         void start();
    5899              :         auto getElapsedNanoseconds() const -> uint64_t;
    5900              :         auto getElapsedMicroseconds() const -> uint64_t;
    5901              :         auto getElapsedMilliseconds() const -> unsigned int;
    5902              :         auto getElapsedSeconds() const -> double;
    5903              :     };
    5904              : 
    5905              : } // namespace Catch
    5906              : 
    5907              : #endif // CATCH_TIMER_HPP_INCLUDED
    5908              : 
    5909              : namespace Catch {
    5910              : 
    5911              :     class Section : Detail::NonCopyable {
    5912              :     public:
    5913              :         Section( SectionInfo&& info );
    5914              :         Section( SourceLineInfo const& _lineInfo,
    5915              :                  StringRef _name,
    5916              :                  const char* const = nullptr );
    5917              :         ~Section();
    5918              : 
    5919              :         // This indicates whether the section should be executed or not
    5920              :         explicit operator bool() const;
    5921              : 
    5922              :     private:
    5923              :         SectionInfo m_info;
    5924              : 
    5925              :         Counts m_assertions;
    5926              :         bool m_sectionIncluded;
    5927              :         Timer m_timer;
    5928              :     };
    5929              : 
    5930              : } // end namespace Catch
    5931              : 
    5932              : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL_STATIC_ANALYSIS_SUPPORT)
    5933              : #    define INTERNAL_CATCH_SECTION( ... )                                 \
    5934              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION                         \
    5935              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS                  \
    5936              :         if ( Catch::Section const& INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME(            \
    5937              :                  catch_internal_Section ) =                               \
    5938              :                  Catch::Section( CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, __VA_ARGS__ ) ) \
    5939              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION
    5940              : 
    5941              : #    define INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( ... )                     \
    5942              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION                     \
    5943              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS              \
    5944              :         if ( Catch::Section const& INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME(        \
    5945              :                  catch_internal_Section ) =                           \
    5946              :                  Catch::SectionInfo(                                  \
    5947              :                      CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO,                         \
    5948              :                      ( Catch::ReusableStringStream() << __VA_ARGS__ ) \
    5949              :                          .str() ) )                                   \
    5950              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION
    5951              : 
    5952              : #else
    5953              : 
    5954              : // These section definitions imply that at most one section at one level
    5955              : // will be entered (because only one section's __LINE__ can be equal to
    5956              : // the dummy `catchInternalSectionHint` variable from `TEST_CASE`).
    5957              : 
    5958              : namespace Catch {
    5959              :     namespace Detail {
    5960              :         // Intentionally without linkage, as it should only be used as a dummy
    5961              :         // symbol for static analysis.
    5962              :         // The arguments are used as a dummy for checking warnings in the passed
    5963              :         // expressions.
    5964              :         int GetNewSectionHint( StringRef, const char* const = nullptr );
    5965              :     } // namespace Detail
    5966              : } // namespace Catch
    5967              : 
    5968              : 
    5969              : #    define INTERNAL_CATCH_SECTION( ... )                                   \
    5970              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION                           \
    5971              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS                    \
    5972              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_SHADOW_WARNINGS                             \
    5973              :         if ( [[maybe_unused]] const int catchInternalPreviousSectionHint =  \
    5974              :                  catchInternalSectionHint,                                  \
    5975              :              catchInternalSectionHint =                                     \
    5976              :                  Catch::Detail::GetNewSectionHint(__VA_ARGS__);             \
    5977              :              catchInternalPreviousSectionHint == __LINE__ )                 \
    5978              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION
    5979              : 
    5980              : #    define INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( ... )                           \
    5981              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION                           \
    5982              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS                    \
    5983              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_SHADOW_WARNINGS                             \
    5984              :         if ( [[maybe_unused]] const int catchInternalPreviousSectionHint =  \
    5985              :                  catchInternalSectionHint,                                  \
    5986              :              catchInternalSectionHint = Catch::Detail::GetNewSectionHint(   \
    5987              :                 ( Catch::ReusableStringStream() << __VA_ARGS__ ).str());    \
    5988              :              catchInternalPreviousSectionHint == __LINE__ )                 \
    5989              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION
    5990              : 
    5991              : #endif
    5992              : 
    5993              : 
    5994              : #endif // CATCH_SECTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    5995              : 
    5996              : 
    5997              : #ifndef CATCH_TEST_REGISTRY_HPP_INCLUDED
    5998              : #define CATCH_TEST_REGISTRY_HPP_INCLUDED
    5999              : 
    6000              : 
    6001              : 
    6002              : #ifndef CATCH_INTERFACES_TEST_INVOKER_HPP_INCLUDED
    6003              : #define CATCH_INTERFACES_TEST_INVOKER_HPP_INCLUDED
    6004              : 
    6005              : namespace Catch {
    6006              : 
    6007              :     class ITestInvoker {
    6008              :     public:
    6009              :         virtual void prepareTestCase();
    6010              :         virtual void tearDownTestCase();
    6011              :         virtual void invoke() const = 0;
    6012              :         virtual ~ITestInvoker(); // = default
    6013              :     };
    6014              : 
    6015              : } // namespace Catch
    6016              : 
    6017              : #endif // CATCH_INTERFACES_TEST_INVOKER_HPP_INCLUDED
    6018              : 
    6019              : 
    6020              : #ifndef CATCH_PREPROCESSOR_REMOVE_PARENS_HPP_INCLUDED
    6021              : #define CATCH_PREPROCESSOR_REMOVE_PARENS_HPP_INCLUDED
    6022              : 
    6023              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND1( param ) INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND2( param )
    6024              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND2( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_NO##__VA_ARGS__
    6025              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_DEF( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_DEF __VA_ARGS__
    6026              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_NOINTERNAL_CATCH_DEF
    6027              : 
    6028              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS( ... ) \
    6029              :     INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND1( INTERNAL_CATCH_DEF __VA_ARGS__ )
    6030              : 
    6031              : #endif // CATCH_PREPROCESSOR_REMOVE_PARENS_HPP_INCLUDED
    6032              : 
    6033              : // GCC 5 and older do not properly handle disabling unused-variable warning
    6034              : // with a _Pragma. This means that we have to leak the suppression to the
    6035              : // user code as well :-(
    6036              : #if defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__clang__) && __GNUC__ <= 5
    6037              : #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wunused-variable"
    6038              : #endif
    6039              : 
    6040              : 
    6041              : 
    6042              : namespace Catch {
    6043              : 
    6044              : template<typename C>
    6045              : class TestInvokerAsMethod : public ITestInvoker {
    6046              :     void (C::*m_testAsMethod)();
    6047              : public:
    6048              :     constexpr TestInvokerAsMethod( void ( C::*testAsMethod )() ) noexcept:
    6049              :         m_testAsMethod( testAsMethod ) {}
    6050              : 
    6051              :     void invoke() const override {
    6052              :         C obj;
    6053              :         (obj.*m_testAsMethod)();
    6054              :     }
    6055              : };
    6056              : 
    6057              : Detail::unique_ptr<ITestInvoker> makeTestInvoker( void(*testAsFunction)() );
    6058              : 
    6059              : template<typename C>
    6060              : Detail::unique_ptr<ITestInvoker> makeTestInvoker( void (C::*testAsMethod)() ) {
    6061              :     return Detail::make_unique<TestInvokerAsMethod<C>>( testAsMethod );
    6062              : }
    6063              : 
    6064              : template <typename C>
    6065              : class TestInvokerFixture : public ITestInvoker {
    6066              :     void ( C::*m_testAsMethod )() const;
    6067              :     Detail::unique_ptr<C> m_fixture = nullptr;
    6068              : 
    6069              : public:
    6070              :     constexpr TestInvokerFixture( void ( C::*testAsMethod )() const ) noexcept:
    6071              :         m_testAsMethod( testAsMethod ) {}
    6072              : 
    6073              :     void prepareTestCase() override {
    6074              :         m_fixture = Detail::make_unique<C>();
    6075              :     }
    6076              : 
    6077              :     void tearDownTestCase() override {
    6078              :         m_fixture.reset();
    6079              :     }
    6080              : 
    6081              :     void invoke() const override {
    6082              :         auto* f = m_fixture.get();
    6083              :         ( f->*m_testAsMethod )();
    6084              :     }
    6085              : };
    6086              : 
    6087              : template<typename C>
    6088              : Detail::unique_ptr<ITestInvoker> makeTestInvokerFixture( void ( C::*testAsMethod )() const ) {
    6089              :     return Detail::make_unique<TestInvokerFixture<C>>( testAsMethod );
    6090              : }
    6091              : 
    6092              : struct NameAndTags {
    6093              :     constexpr NameAndTags( StringRef name_ = StringRef(),
    6094              :                            StringRef tags_ = StringRef() ) noexcept:
    6095              :         name( name_ ), tags( tags_ ) {}
    6096              :     StringRef name;
    6097              :     StringRef tags;
    6098              : };
    6099              : 
    6100              : struct AutoReg : Detail::NonCopyable {
    6101              :     AutoReg( Detail::unique_ptr<ITestInvoker> invoker, SourceLineInfo const& lineInfo, StringRef classOrMethod, NameAndTags const& nameAndTags ) noexcept;
    6102              : };
    6103              : 
    6104              : } // end namespace Catch
    6105              : 
    6106              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
    6107              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE_NO_REGISTRATION( TestName, ... ) \
    6108              :         static inline void TestName()
    6109              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE_METHOD_NO_REGISTRATION( TestName, ClassName, ... ) \
    6110              :         namespace{                        \
    6111              :             struct TestName : INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(ClassName) { \
    6112              :                 void test();              \
    6113              :             };                            \
    6114              :         }                                 \
    6115              :         void TestName::test()
    6116              : #endif
    6117              : 
    6118              : 
    6119              : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL_STATIC_ANALYSIS_SUPPORT)
    6120              : 
    6121              :     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    6122              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE2( TestName, ... ) \
    6123              :         static void TestName(); \
    6124              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    6125              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS \
    6126              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS \
    6127              :         namespace{ const Catch::AutoReg INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( autoRegistrar )( Catch::makeTestInvoker( &TestName ), CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, Catch::StringRef(), Catch::NameAndTags{ __VA_ARGS__ } ); } /* NOLINT */ \
    6128              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    6129              :         static void TestName()
    6130              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE( ... ) \
    6131              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEST_ ), __VA_ARGS__ )
    6132              : 
    6133              : #else  // ^^ !CATCH_CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL_STATIC_ANALYSIS_SUPPORT | vv CATCH_CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL_STATIC_ANALYSIS_SUPPORT
    6134              : 
    6135              : 
    6136              : // Dummy registrator for the dumy test case macros
    6137              : namespace Catch {
    6138              :     namespace Detail {
    6139              :         struct DummyUse {
    6140              :             DummyUse( void ( * )( int ), Catch::NameAndTags const& );
    6141              :         };
    6142              :     } // namespace Detail
    6143              : } // namespace Catch
    6144              : 
    6145              : // Note that both the presence of the argument and its exact name are
    6146              : // necessary for the section support.
    6147              : 
    6148              : // We provide a shadowed variable so that a `SECTION` inside non-`TEST_CASE`
    6149              : // tests can compile. The redefined `TEST_CASE` shadows this with param.
    6150              : static int catchInternalSectionHint = 0;
    6151              : 
    6152              : #    define INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE2( fname, ... )                         \
    6153              :         static void fname( int );                                          \
    6154              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION                          \
    6155              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS                           \
    6156              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS                   \
    6157              :         static const Catch::Detail::DummyUse INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME(   \
    6158              :             dummyUser )( &(fname), Catch::NameAndTags{ __VA_ARGS__ } );    \
    6159              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_SHADOW_WARNINGS                            \
    6160              :         static void fname( [[maybe_unused]] int catchInternalSectionHint ) \
    6161              :             CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION
    6162              : #    define INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE( ... ) \
    6163              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( dummyFunction ), __VA_ARGS__ )
    6164              : 
    6165              : 
    6166              : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL_STATIC_ANALYSIS_SUPPORT
    6167              : 
    6168              :     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    6169              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_CASE_METHOD2( TestName, ClassName, ... )\
    6170              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    6171              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS \
    6172              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS \
    6173              :         namespace{ \
    6174              :             struct TestName : INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(ClassName) { \
    6175              :                 void test(); \
    6176              :             }; \
    6177              :             const Catch::AutoReg INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( autoRegistrar )( \
    6178              :             Catch::makeTestInvoker( &TestName::test ),                    \
    6179              :             CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO,                                      \
    6180              :             #ClassName##_catch_sr,                                        \
    6181              :             Catch::NameAndTags{ __VA_ARGS__ } ); /* NOLINT */ \
    6182              :         } \
    6183              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    6184              :         void TestName::test()
    6185              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_CASE_METHOD( ClassName, ... ) \
    6186              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_CASE_METHOD2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEST_ ), ClassName, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6187              : 
    6188              :     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    6189              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_CASE_PERSISTENT_FIXTURE2( TestName, ClassName, ... )      \
    6190              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION                             \
    6191              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS                              \
    6192              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS                      \
    6193              :         namespace {                                                           \
    6194              :             struct TestName : INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS( ClassName ) {     \
    6195              :                 void test() const;                                            \
    6196              :             };                                                                \
    6197              :             const Catch::AutoReg INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( autoRegistrar )( \
    6198              :                 Catch::makeTestInvokerFixture( &TestName::test ),                    \
    6199              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO,                                      \
    6200              :                 #ClassName##_catch_sr,                                        \
    6201              :                 Catch::NameAndTags{ __VA_ARGS__ } ); /* NOLINT */             \
    6202              :         }                                                                     \
    6203              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION                              \
    6204              :         void TestName::test() const
    6205              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_CASE_PERSISTENT_FIXTURE( ClassName, ... )    \
    6206              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_CASE_PERSISTENT_FIXTURE2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEST_ ), ClassName, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6207              : 
    6208              : 
    6209              :     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    6210              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_METHOD_AS_TEST_CASE( QualifiedMethod, ... ) \
    6211              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    6212              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS \
    6213              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS \
    6214              :         namespace {                                                           \
    6215              :         const Catch::AutoReg INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( autoRegistrar )( \
    6216              :             Catch::makeTestInvoker( &QualifiedMethod ),                   \
    6217              :             CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO,                                      \
    6218              :             "&" #QualifiedMethod##_catch_sr,                              \
    6219              :             Catch::NameAndTags{ __VA_ARGS__ } );                          \
    6220              :     } /* NOLINT */ \
    6221              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION
    6222              : 
    6223              : 
    6224              :     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    6225              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_REGISTER_TESTCASE( Function, ... ) \
    6226              :         do { \
    6227              :             CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    6228              :             CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS \
    6229              :             CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS \
    6230              :             Catch::AutoReg INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( autoRegistrar )( Catch::makeTestInvoker( Function ), CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, Catch::StringRef(), Catch::NameAndTags{ __VA_ARGS__ } ); /* NOLINT */ \
    6231              :             CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    6232              :         } while(false)
    6233              : 
    6234              : 
    6235              : #endif // CATCH_TEST_REGISTRY_HPP_INCLUDED
    6236              : 
    6237              : 
    6238              : #ifndef CATCH_UNREACHABLE_HPP_INCLUDED
    6239              : #define CATCH_UNREACHABLE_HPP_INCLUDED
    6240              : 
    6241              : /**\file
    6242              :  * Polyfill `std::unreachable`
    6243              :  *
    6244              :  * We need something like `std::unreachable` to tell the compiler that
    6245              :  * some macros, e.g. `FAIL` or `SKIP`, do not continue execution in normal
    6246              :  * manner, and should handle it as such, e.g. not warn if there is no return
    6247              :  * from non-void function after a `FAIL` or `SKIP`.
    6248              :  */
    6249              : 
    6250              : #include <exception>
    6251              : 
    6252              : #if defined( __cpp_lib_unreachable ) && __cpp_lib_unreachable > 202202L
    6253              : #    include <utility>
    6254              : namespace Catch {
    6255              :     namespace Detail {
    6256              :         using Unreachable = std::unreachable;
    6257              :     }
    6258              : } // namespace Catch
    6259              : 
    6260              : #else // vv If we do not have std::unreachable, we implement something similar
    6261              : 
    6262              : namespace Catch {
    6263              :     namespace Detail {
    6264              : 
    6265              :         [[noreturn]]
    6266            0 :         inline void Unreachable() noexcept {
    6267              : #    if defined( NDEBUG )
    6268              : #        if defined( _MSC_VER ) && !defined( __clang__ )
    6269              :             __assume( false );
    6270              : #        elif defined( __GNUC__ )
    6271              :             __builtin_unreachable();
    6272              : #        else // vv platform without known optimization hint
    6273              :             std::terminate();
    6274              : #        endif
    6275              : #    else  // ^^ NDEBUG
    6276              :             // For non-release builds, we prefer termination on bug over UB
    6277            0 :             std::terminate();
    6278              : #    endif //
    6279              :         }
    6280              : 
    6281              :     } // namespace Detail
    6282              : } // end namespace Catch
    6283              : 
    6284              : #endif
    6285              : 
    6286              : #endif // CATCH_UNREACHABLE_HPP_INCLUDED
    6287              : 
    6288              : 
    6289              : // All of our user-facing macros support configuration toggle, that
    6290              : // forces them to be defined prefixed with CATCH_. We also like to
    6291              : // support another toggle that can minimize (disable) their implementation.
    6292              : // Given this, we have 4 different configuration options below
    6293              : 
    6294              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_ALL) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
    6295              : 
    6296              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "CATCH_REQUIRE", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6297              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE_FALSE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "CATCH_REQUIRE_FALSE", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal | Catch::ResultDisposition::FalseTest, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6298              : 
    6299              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS( "CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6300              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS( expr, exceptionType ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_AS( "CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS", exceptionType, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, expr )
    6301              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE_NOTHROW( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_NO_THROW( "CATCH_REQUIRE_NOTHROW", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6302              : 
    6303              :   #define CATCH_CHECK( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "CATCH_CHECK", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6304              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_FALSE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "CATCH_CHECK_FALSE", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure | Catch::ResultDisposition::FalseTest, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6305              :   #define CATCH_CHECKED_IF( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_IF( "CATCH_CHECKED_IF", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure | Catch::ResultDisposition::SuppressFail, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6306              :   #define CATCH_CHECKED_ELSE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_ELSE( "CATCH_CHECKED_ELSE", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure | Catch::ResultDisposition::SuppressFail, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6307              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_NOFAIL( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "CATCH_CHECK_NOFAIL", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure | Catch::ResultDisposition::SuppressFail, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6308              : 
    6309              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_THROWS( ... )  INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS( "CATCH_CHECK_THROWS", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6310              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_THROWS_AS( expr, exceptionType ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_AS( "CATCH_CHECK_THROWS_AS", exceptionType, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, expr )
    6311              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_NOTHROW( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_NO_THROW( "CATCH_CHECK_NOTHROW", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6312              : 
    6313              :   #define CATCH_TEST_CASE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE( __VA_ARGS__ )
    6314              :   #define CATCH_TEST_CASE_METHOD( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_CASE_METHOD( className, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6315              :   #define CATCH_METHOD_AS_TEST_CASE( method, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_METHOD_AS_TEST_CASE( method, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6316              :   #define CATCH_TEST_CASE_PERSISTENT_FIXTURE( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_CASE_PERSISTENT_FIXTURE( className, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6317              :   #define CATCH_REGISTER_TEST_CASE( Function, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_REGISTER_TESTCASE( Function, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6318              :   #define CATCH_SECTION( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_SECTION( __VA_ARGS__ )
    6319              :   #define CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( __VA_ARGS__ )
    6320              :   #define CATCH_FAIL( ... ) do { \
    6321              :            INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG("CATCH_FAIL", Catch::ResultWas::ExplicitFailure, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__ );  \
    6322              :            Catch::Detail::Unreachable(); \
    6323              :          } while ( false )
    6324              :   #define CATCH_FAIL_CHECK( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( "CATCH_FAIL_CHECK", Catch::ResultWas::ExplicitFailure, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6325              :   #define CATCH_SUCCEED( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( "CATCH_SUCCEED", Catch::ResultWas::Ok, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6326              :   #define CATCH_SKIP( ... ) do { \
    6327              :            INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( "CATCH_SKIP", Catch::ResultWas::ExplicitSkip, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__ ); \
    6328              :            Catch::Detail::Unreachable(); \
    6329              :          } while (false)
    6330              : 
    6331              : 
    6332              :   #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_RUNTIME_STATIC_REQUIRE)
    6333              :     #define CATCH_STATIC_REQUIRE( ... )       static_assert(   __VA_ARGS__ ,      #__VA_ARGS__ );     CATCH_SUCCEED( #__VA_ARGS__ )
    6334              :     #define CATCH_STATIC_REQUIRE_FALSE( ... ) static_assert( !(__VA_ARGS__), "!(" #__VA_ARGS__ ")" ); CATCH_SUCCEED( #__VA_ARGS__ )
    6335              :     #define CATCH_STATIC_CHECK( ... )       static_assert(   __VA_ARGS__ ,      #__VA_ARGS__ );     CATCH_SUCCEED( #__VA_ARGS__ )
    6336              :     #define CATCH_STATIC_CHECK_FALSE( ... ) static_assert( !(__VA_ARGS__), "!(" #__VA_ARGS__ ")" ); CATCH_SUCCEED( #__VA_ARGS__ )
    6337              :   #else
    6338              :     #define CATCH_STATIC_REQUIRE( ... )       CATCH_REQUIRE( __VA_ARGS__ )
    6339              :     #define CATCH_STATIC_REQUIRE_FALSE( ... ) CATCH_REQUIRE_FALSE( __VA_ARGS__ )
    6340              :     #define CATCH_STATIC_CHECK( ... )       CATCH_CHECK( __VA_ARGS__ )
    6341              :     #define CATCH_STATIC_CHECK_FALSE( ... ) CATCH_CHECK_FALSE( __VA_ARGS__ )
    6342              :   #endif
    6343              : 
    6344              : 
    6345              :   // "BDD-style" convenience wrappers
    6346              :   #define CATCH_SCENARIO( ... ) CATCH_TEST_CASE( "Scenario: " __VA_ARGS__ )
    6347              :   #define CATCH_SCENARIO_METHOD( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_CASE_METHOD( className, "Scenario: " __VA_ARGS__ )
    6348              :   #define CATCH_GIVEN( desc )     INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( "    Given: " << desc )
    6349              :   #define CATCH_AND_GIVEN( desc ) INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( "And given: " << desc )
    6350              :   #define CATCH_WHEN( desc )      INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( "     When: " << desc )
    6351              :   #define CATCH_AND_WHEN( desc )  INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( " And when: " << desc )
    6352              :   #define CATCH_THEN( desc )      INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( "     Then: " << desc )
    6353              :   #define CATCH_AND_THEN( desc )  INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( "      And: " << desc )
    6354              : 
    6355              : #elif defined(CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_ALL) && defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE) // ^^ prefixed, implemented | vv prefixed, disabled
    6356              : 
    6357              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE( ... )        (void)(0)
    6358              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE_FALSE( ... )  (void)(0)
    6359              : 
    6360              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS( ... ) (void)(0)
    6361              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS( expr, exceptionType ) (void)(0)
    6362              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE_NOTHROW( ... ) (void)(0)
    6363              : 
    6364              :   #define CATCH_CHECK( ... )         (void)(0)
    6365              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_FALSE( ... )   (void)(0)
    6366              :   #define CATCH_CHECKED_IF( ... )    if (__VA_ARGS__)
    6367              :   #define CATCH_CHECKED_ELSE( ... )  if (!(__VA_ARGS__))
    6368              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_NOFAIL( ... )  (void)(0)
    6369              : 
    6370              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_THROWS( ... )  (void)(0)
    6371              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_THROWS_AS( expr, exceptionType ) (void)(0)
    6372              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_NOTHROW( ... ) (void)(0)
    6373              : 
    6374              :   #define CATCH_TEST_CASE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE_NO_REGISTRATION(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEST_ ))
    6375              :   #define CATCH_TEST_CASE_METHOD( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE_NO_REGISTRATION(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEST_ ))
    6376              :   #define CATCH_METHOD_AS_TEST_CASE( method, ... )
    6377              :   #define CATCH_TEST_CASE_PERSISTENT_FIXTURE( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE_NO_REGISTRATION(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEST_ ))
    6378              :   #define CATCH_REGISTER_TEST_CASE( Function, ... ) (void)(0)
    6379              :   #define CATCH_SECTION( ... )
    6380              :   #define CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( ... )
    6381              :   #define CATCH_FAIL( ... ) (void)(0)
    6382              :   #define CATCH_FAIL_CHECK( ... ) (void)(0)
    6383              :   #define CATCH_SUCCEED( ... ) (void)(0)
    6384              :   #define CATCH_SKIP( ... ) (void)(0)
    6385              : 
    6386              :   #define CATCH_STATIC_REQUIRE( ... )       (void)(0)
    6387              :   #define CATCH_STATIC_REQUIRE_FALSE( ... ) (void)(0)
    6388              :   #define CATCH_STATIC_CHECK( ... )       (void)(0)
    6389              :   #define CATCH_STATIC_CHECK_FALSE( ... ) (void)(0)
    6390              : 
    6391              :   // "BDD-style" convenience wrappers
    6392              :   #define CATCH_SCENARIO( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE_NO_REGISTRATION(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEST_ ))
    6393              :   #define CATCH_SCENARIO_METHOD( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE_METHOD_NO_REGISTRATION(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEST_ ), className )
    6394              :   #define CATCH_GIVEN( desc )
    6395              :   #define CATCH_AND_GIVEN( desc )
    6396              :   #define CATCH_WHEN( desc )
    6397              :   #define CATCH_AND_WHEN( desc )
    6398              :   #define CATCH_THEN( desc )
    6399              :   #define CATCH_AND_THEN( desc )
    6400              : 
    6401              : #elif !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_ALL) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE) // ^^ prefixed, disabled | vv unprefixed, implemented
    6402              : 
    6403              :   #define REQUIRE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "REQUIRE", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__  )
    6404              :   #define REQUIRE_FALSE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "REQUIRE_FALSE", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal | Catch::ResultDisposition::FalseTest, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6405              : 
    6406              :   #define REQUIRE_THROWS( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS( "REQUIRE_THROWS", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6407              :   #define REQUIRE_THROWS_AS( expr, exceptionType ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_AS( "REQUIRE_THROWS_AS", exceptionType, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, expr )
    6408              :   #define REQUIRE_NOTHROW( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_NO_THROW( "REQUIRE_NOTHROW", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6409              : 
    6410              :   #define CHECK( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "CHECK", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6411              :   #define CHECK_FALSE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "CHECK_FALSE", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure | Catch::ResultDisposition::FalseTest, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6412              :   #define CHECKED_IF( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_IF( "CHECKED_IF", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure | Catch::ResultDisposition::SuppressFail, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6413              :   #define CHECKED_ELSE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_ELSE( "CHECKED_ELSE", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure | Catch::ResultDisposition::SuppressFail, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6414              :   #define CHECK_NOFAIL( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "CHECK_NOFAIL", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure | Catch::ResultDisposition::SuppressFail, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6415              : 
    6416              :   #define CHECK_THROWS( ... )  INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS( "CHECK_THROWS", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6417              :   #define CHECK_THROWS_AS( expr, exceptionType ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_AS( "CHECK_THROWS_AS", exceptionType, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, expr )
    6418              :   #define CHECK_NOTHROW( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_NO_THROW( "CHECK_NOTHROW", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6419              : 
    6420              :   #define TEST_CASE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE( __VA_ARGS__ )
    6421              :   #define TEST_CASE_METHOD( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_CASE_METHOD( className, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6422              :   #define METHOD_AS_TEST_CASE( method, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_METHOD_AS_TEST_CASE( method, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6423              :   #define TEST_CASE_PERSISTENT_FIXTURE( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_CASE_PERSISTENT_FIXTURE( className, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6424              :   #define REGISTER_TEST_CASE( Function, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_REGISTER_TESTCASE( Function, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6425              :   #define SECTION( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_SECTION( __VA_ARGS__ )
    6426              :   #define DYNAMIC_SECTION( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( __VA_ARGS__ )
    6427              :   #define FAIL( ... ) do { \
    6428              :            INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( "FAIL", Catch::ResultWas::ExplicitFailure, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__ ); \
    6429              :            Catch::Detail::Unreachable(); \
    6430              :          } while (false)
    6431              :   #define FAIL_CHECK( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( "FAIL_CHECK", Catch::ResultWas::ExplicitFailure, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6432              :   #define SUCCEED( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( "SUCCEED", Catch::ResultWas::Ok, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6433              :   #define SKIP( ... ) do { \
    6434              :            INTERNAL_CATCH_MSG( "SKIP", Catch::ResultWas::ExplicitSkip, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__ ); \
    6435              :            Catch::Detail::Unreachable(); \
    6436              :          } while (false)
    6437              : 
    6438              : 
    6439              :   #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_RUNTIME_STATIC_REQUIRE)
    6440              :     #define STATIC_REQUIRE( ... )       static_assert(   __VA_ARGS__,  #__VA_ARGS__ ); SUCCEED( #__VA_ARGS__ )
    6441              :     #define STATIC_REQUIRE_FALSE( ... ) static_assert( !(__VA_ARGS__), "!(" #__VA_ARGS__ ")" ); SUCCEED( "!(" #__VA_ARGS__ ")" )
    6442              :     #define STATIC_CHECK( ... )       static_assert(   __VA_ARGS__,  #__VA_ARGS__ ); SUCCEED( #__VA_ARGS__ )
    6443              :     #define STATIC_CHECK_FALSE( ... ) static_assert( !(__VA_ARGS__), "!(" #__VA_ARGS__ ")" ); SUCCEED( "!(" #__VA_ARGS__ ")" )
    6444              :   #else
    6445              :     #define STATIC_REQUIRE( ... )       REQUIRE( __VA_ARGS__ )
    6446              :     #define STATIC_REQUIRE_FALSE( ... ) REQUIRE_FALSE( __VA_ARGS__ )
    6447              :     #define STATIC_CHECK( ... )       CHECK( __VA_ARGS__ )
    6448              :     #define STATIC_CHECK_FALSE( ... ) CHECK_FALSE( __VA_ARGS__ )
    6449              :   #endif
    6450              : 
    6451              :   // "BDD-style" convenience wrappers
    6452              :   #define SCENARIO( ... ) TEST_CASE( "Scenario: " __VA_ARGS__ )
    6453              :   #define SCENARIO_METHOD( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_CASE_METHOD( className, "Scenario: " __VA_ARGS__ )
    6454              :   #define GIVEN( desc )     INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( "    Given: " << desc )
    6455              :   #define AND_GIVEN( desc ) INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( "And given: " << desc )
    6456              :   #define WHEN( desc )      INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( "     When: " << desc )
    6457              :   #define AND_WHEN( desc )  INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( " And when: " << desc )
    6458              :   #define THEN( desc )      INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( "     Then: " << desc )
    6459              :   #define AND_THEN( desc )  INTERNAL_CATCH_DYNAMIC_SECTION( "      And: " << desc )
    6460              : 
    6461              : #elif !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_ALL) && defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE) // ^^ unprefixed, implemented | vv unprefixed, disabled
    6462              : 
    6463              :   #define REQUIRE( ... )       (void)(0)
    6464              :   #define REQUIRE_FALSE( ... ) (void)(0)
    6465              : 
    6466              :   #define REQUIRE_THROWS( ... ) (void)(0)
    6467              :   #define REQUIRE_THROWS_AS( expr, exceptionType ) (void)(0)
    6468              :   #define REQUIRE_NOTHROW( ... ) (void)(0)
    6469              : 
    6470              :   #define CHECK( ... ) (void)(0)
    6471              :   #define CHECK_FALSE( ... ) (void)(0)
    6472              :   #define CHECKED_IF( ... ) if (__VA_ARGS__)
    6473              :   #define CHECKED_ELSE( ... ) if (!(__VA_ARGS__))
    6474              :   #define CHECK_NOFAIL( ... ) (void)(0)
    6475              : 
    6476              :   #define CHECK_THROWS( ... )  (void)(0)
    6477              :   #define CHECK_THROWS_AS( expr, exceptionType ) (void)(0)
    6478              :   #define CHECK_NOTHROW( ... ) (void)(0)
    6479              : 
    6480              :   #define TEST_CASE( ... )  INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE_NO_REGISTRATION(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEST_ ), __VA_ARGS__)
    6481              :   #define TEST_CASE_METHOD( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE_NO_REGISTRATION(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEST_ ))
    6482              :   #define METHOD_AS_TEST_CASE( method, ... )
    6483              :   #define TEST_CASE_PERSISTENT_FIXTURE( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE_NO_REGISTRATION(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEST_ ), __VA_ARGS__)
    6484              :   #define REGISTER_TEST_CASE( Function, ... ) (void)(0)
    6485              :   #define SECTION( ... )
    6486              :   #define DYNAMIC_SECTION( ... )
    6487              :   #define FAIL( ... ) (void)(0)
    6488              :   #define FAIL_CHECK( ... ) (void)(0)
    6489              :   #define SUCCEED( ... ) (void)(0)
    6490              :   #define SKIP( ... ) (void)(0)
    6491              : 
    6492              :   #define STATIC_REQUIRE( ... )       (void)(0)
    6493              :   #define STATIC_REQUIRE_FALSE( ... ) (void)(0)
    6494              :   #define STATIC_CHECK( ... )       (void)(0)
    6495              :   #define STATIC_CHECK_FALSE( ... ) (void)(0)
    6496              : 
    6497              :   // "BDD-style" convenience wrappers
    6498              :   #define SCENARIO( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE_NO_REGISTRATION(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEST_ ) )
    6499              :   #define SCENARIO_METHOD( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TESTCASE_METHOD_NO_REGISTRATION(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEST_ ), className )
    6500              : 
    6501              :   #define GIVEN( desc )
    6502              :   #define AND_GIVEN( desc )
    6503              :   #define WHEN( desc )
    6504              :   #define AND_WHEN( desc )
    6505              :   #define THEN( desc )
    6506              :   #define AND_THEN( desc )
    6507              : 
    6508              : #endif // ^^ unprefixed, disabled
    6509              : 
    6510              : // end of user facing macros
    6511              : 
    6512              : #endif // CATCH_TEST_MACROS_HPP_INCLUDED
    6513              : 
    6514              : 
    6515              : #ifndef CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_REGISTRY_HPP_INCLUDED
    6516              : #define CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_REGISTRY_HPP_INCLUDED
    6517              : 
    6518              : 
    6519              : 
    6520              : #ifndef CATCH_PREPROCESSOR_HPP_INCLUDED
    6521              : #define CATCH_PREPROCESSOR_HPP_INCLUDED
    6522              : 
    6523              : 
    6524              : #if defined(__GNUC__)
    6525              : // We need to silence "empty __VA_ARGS__ warning", and using just _Pragma does not work
    6526              : #pragma GCC system_header
    6527              : #endif
    6528              : 
    6529              : 
    6530              : namespace Catch {
    6531              :     namespace Detail {
    6532              :         template <int N>
    6533              :         struct priority_tag : priority_tag<N - 1> {};
    6534              :         template <>
    6535              :         struct priority_tag<0> {};
    6536              :     }
    6537              : }
    6538              : 
    6539              : #define CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL0(...) __VA_ARGS__
    6540              : #define CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL1(...) CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL0(CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL0(CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL0(__VA_ARGS__)))
    6541              : #define CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL2(...) CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL1(CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL1(CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL1(__VA_ARGS__)))
    6542              : #define CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL3(...) CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL2(CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL2(CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL2(__VA_ARGS__)))
    6543              : #define CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL4(...) CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL3(CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL3(CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL3(__VA_ARGS__)))
    6544              : #define CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL5(...) CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL4(CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL4(CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL4(__VA_ARGS__)))
    6545              : 
    6546              : #ifdef CATCH_CONFIG_TRADITIONAL_MSVC_PREPROCESSOR
    6547              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS(...) __VA_ARGS__
    6548              : // MSVC needs more evaluations
    6549              : #define CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL6(...) CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL5(CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL5(CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL5(__VA_ARGS__)))
    6550              : #define CATCH_RECURSE(...)  CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL6(CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL6(__VA_ARGS__))
    6551              : #else
    6552              : #define CATCH_RECURSE(...)  CATCH_RECURSION_LEVEL5(__VA_ARGS__)
    6553              : #endif
    6554              : 
    6555              : #define CATCH_REC_END(...)
    6556              : #define CATCH_REC_OUT
    6557              : 
    6558              : #define CATCH_EMPTY()
    6559              : #define CATCH_DEFER(id) id CATCH_EMPTY()
    6560              : 
    6561              : #define CATCH_REC_GET_END2() 0, CATCH_REC_END
    6562              : #define CATCH_REC_GET_END1(...) CATCH_REC_GET_END2
    6563              : #define CATCH_REC_GET_END(...) CATCH_REC_GET_END1
    6564              : #define CATCH_REC_NEXT0(test, next, ...) next CATCH_REC_OUT
    6565              : #define CATCH_REC_NEXT1(test, next) CATCH_DEFER ( CATCH_REC_NEXT0 ) ( test, next, 0)
    6566              : #define CATCH_REC_NEXT(test, next)  CATCH_REC_NEXT1(CATCH_REC_GET_END test, next)
    6567              : 
    6568              : #define CATCH_REC_LIST0(f, x, peek, ...) , f(x) CATCH_DEFER ( CATCH_REC_NEXT(peek, CATCH_REC_LIST1) ) ( f, peek, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6569              : #define CATCH_REC_LIST1(f, x, peek, ...) , f(x) CATCH_DEFER ( CATCH_REC_NEXT(peek, CATCH_REC_LIST0) ) ( f, peek, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6570              : #define CATCH_REC_LIST2(f, x, peek, ...)   f(x) CATCH_DEFER ( CATCH_REC_NEXT(peek, CATCH_REC_LIST1) ) ( f, peek, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6571              : 
    6572              : #define CATCH_REC_LIST0_UD(f, userdata, x, peek, ...) , f(userdata, x) CATCH_DEFER ( CATCH_REC_NEXT(peek, CATCH_REC_LIST1_UD) ) ( f, userdata, peek, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6573              : #define CATCH_REC_LIST1_UD(f, userdata, x, peek, ...) , f(userdata, x) CATCH_DEFER ( CATCH_REC_NEXT(peek, CATCH_REC_LIST0_UD) ) ( f, userdata, peek, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6574              : #define CATCH_REC_LIST2_UD(f, userdata, x, peek, ...)   f(userdata, x) CATCH_DEFER ( CATCH_REC_NEXT(peek, CATCH_REC_LIST1_UD) ) ( f, userdata, peek, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6575              : 
    6576              : // Applies the function macro `f` to each of the remaining parameters, inserts commas between the results,
    6577              : // and passes userdata as the first parameter to each invocation,
    6578              : // e.g. CATCH_REC_LIST_UD(f, x, a, b, c) evaluates to f(x, a), f(x, b), f(x, c)
    6579              : #define CATCH_REC_LIST_UD(f, userdata, ...) CATCH_RECURSE(CATCH_REC_LIST2_UD(f, userdata, __VA_ARGS__, ()()(), ()()(), ()()(), 0))
    6580              : 
    6581              : #define CATCH_REC_LIST(f, ...) CATCH_RECURSE(CATCH_REC_LIST2(f, __VA_ARGS__, ()()(), ()()(), ()()(), 0))
    6582              :

    6622              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TYPE_GEN\
    6623              :     template<typename...> struct TypeList {};\
    6624              :     template<typename... Ts>\
    6625              :     constexpr auto get_wrapper(Catch::Detail::priority_tag<1>) noexcept -> TypeList<Ts...> { return {}; }\
    6626              :     template<template<typename...> class...> struct TemplateTypeList{};\
    6627              :     template<template<typename...> class...Cs>\
    6628              :     constexpr auto get_wrapper(Catch::Detail::priority_tag<1>) noexcept -> TemplateTypeList<Cs...> { return {}; }\
    6629              :     template<typename...>\
    6630              :     struct append;\
    6631              :     template<typename...>\
    6632              :     struct rewrap;\
    6633              :     template<template<typename...> class, typename...>\
    6634              :     struct create;\
    6635              :     template<template<typename...> class, typename>\
    6636              :     struct convert;\
    6637              :     \
    6638              :     template<typename T> \
    6639              :     struct append<T> { using type = T; };\
    6640              :     template< template<typename...> class L1, typename...E1, template<typename...> class L2, typename...E2, typename...Rest>\
    6641              :     struct append<L1<E1...>, L2<E2...>, Rest...> { using type = typename append<L1<E1...,E2...>, Rest...>::type; };\
    6642              :     template< template<typename...> class L1, typename...E1, typename...Rest>\
    6643              :     struct append<L1<E1...>, TypeList<mpl_::na>, Rest...> { using type = L1<E1...>; };\
    6644              :     \
    6645              :     template< template<typename...> class Container, template<typename...> class List, typename...elems>\
    6646              :     struct rewrap<TemplateTypeList<Container>, List<elems...>> { using type = TypeList<Container<elems...>>; };\
    6647              :     template< template<typename...> class Container, template<typename...> class List, class...Elems, typename...Elements>\
    6648              :     struct rewrap<TemplateTypeList<Container>, List<Elems...>, Elements...> { using type = typename append<TypeList<Container<Elems...>>, typename rewrap<TemplateTypeList<Container>, Elements...>::type>::type; };\
    6649              :     \
    6650              :     template<template <typename...> class Final, template< typename...> class...Containers, typename...Types>\
    6651              :     struct create<Final, TemplateTypeList<Containers...>, TypeList<Types...>> { using type = typename append<Final<>, typename rewrap<TemplateTypeList<Containers>, Types...>::type...>::type; };\
    6652              :     template<template <typename...> class Final, template <typename...> class List, typename...Ts>\
    6653              :     struct convert<Final, List<Ts...>> { using type = typename append<Final<>,TypeList<Ts>...>::type; };
    6654              : 
    6655              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_1(signature, ...)\
    6656              :     template<INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(signature)> struct Nttp{};\
    6657              :     template<INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(signature)>\
    6658              :     constexpr auto get_wrapper(Catch::Detail::priority_tag<0>) noexcept -> Nttp<__VA_ARGS__> { return {}; } \

    6662              :     \

    6747              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_0(signature)
    6748              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_GEN(...) INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS(INTERNAL_CATCH_VA_NARGS_IMPL(__VA_ARGS__, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_1, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_1, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_1, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_1, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_1, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_1, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_1, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_1, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_1,INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_1, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_0)( __VA_ARGS__))
    6749              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST_METHOD(TestName, ...) INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS(INTERNAL_CATCH_VA_NARGS_IMPL( "dummy", __VA_ARGS__, INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X,INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X,INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X,INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST_METHOD1, INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST_METHOD0)(TestName, __VA_ARGS__))
    6750              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_METHOD(TestName, ClassName, ...) INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS(INTERNAL_CATCH_VA_NARGS_IMPL( "dummy", __VA_ARGS__, INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X,INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X,INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X,INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_METHOD_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_METHOD1, INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_METHOD0)(TestName, ClassName, __VA_ARGS__))
    6751              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_REG_METHOD_GEN(TestName, ...)     6752              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_REG_GEN(TestFunc, ...) INTERNAL_CATCH_TYPES_REGISTER(TestFunc) INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS(INTERNAL_CATCH_VA_NARGS_IMPL( "dummy", __VA_ARGS__, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_REGISTER, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_REGISTER, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_REGISTER, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_REGISTER, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_REGISTER, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_REGISTER, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_REGISTER, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_REGISTER, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_REGISTER, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_REGISTER0, INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_REGISTER0)(TestFunc, __VA_ARGS__))
    6753              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST(TestName, ...)
