    6754              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST(TestName, ...) INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS(INTERNAL_CATCH_VA_NARGS_IMPL( "dummy", __VA_ARGS__, INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_X,INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST_X,INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_X,INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_X, INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST1, INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST0)(TestName, __VA_ARGS__))
    6755              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS_GEN(...) INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS(INTERNAL_CATCH_VA_NARGS_IMPL(__VA_ARGS__, INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS_11_ARG,INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS_10_ARG,INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS_9_ARG,INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS_8_ARG,INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS_7_ARG,INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS_6_ARG,INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS_5_ARG,INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS_4_ARG,INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS_3_ARG,INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS_2_ARG,INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS_1_ARG)(__VA_ARGS__))
    6756              : #endif
    6757              : 
    6758              : #endif // CATCH_PREPROCESSOR_HPP_INCLUDED
    6759              : 
    6760              : 
    6761              : // GCC 5 and older do not properly handle disabling unused-variable warning
    6762              : // with a _Pragma. This means that we have to leak the suppression to the
    6763              : // user code as well :-(
    6764              : #if defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__clang__) && __GNUC__ <= 5
    6765              : #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wunused-variable"
    6766              : #endif
    6767              : 
    6768              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
    6769              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_NO_REGISTRATION_2( TestName, TestFunc, Name, Tags, Signature, ... )  \
    6770              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST(TestFunc, INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(Signature))
    6771              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_METHOD_NO_REGISTRATION_2( TestNameClass, TestName, ClassName, Name, Tags, Signature, ... )    \
    6772              :         namespace{                                                                                  \
    6773              :             namespace INTERNAL_CATCH_MAKE_NAMESPACE(TestName) {                                      \
    6774              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_METHOD(TestName, ClassName, INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(Signature));\
    6775              :         }                                                                                           \
    6776              :         }                                                                                           \
    6777              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST_METHOD(TestName, INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(Signature))
    6778              : 
    6779              :     #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_TRADITIONAL_MSVC_PREPROCESSOR
    6780              :         #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_NO_REGISTRATION(Name, Tags, ...) \
    6781              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_NO_REGISTRATION_2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), Name, Tags, typename TestType, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6782              :     #else
    6783              :         #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_NO_REGISTRATION(Name, Tags, ...) \
    6784              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS( INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_NO_REGISTRATION_2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), Name, Tags, typename TestType, __VA_ARGS__ ) )
    6785              :     #endif
    6786              : 
    6787              :     #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_TRADITIONAL_MSVC_PREPROCESSOR
    6788              :         #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_SIG_NO_REGISTRATION(Name, Tags, Signature, ...) \
    6789              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_NO_REGISTRATION_2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), Name, Tags, Signature, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6790              :     #else
    6791              :         #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_SIG_NO_REGISTRATION(Name, Tags, Signature, ...) \
    6792              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS( INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_NO_REGISTRATION_2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), Name, Tags, Signature, __VA_ARGS__ ) )
    6793              :     #endif
    6794              : 
    6795              :     #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_TRADITIONAL_MSVC_PREPROCESSOR

    6798              :     #else

    6801              :     #endif
    6802              : 
    6803              :     #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_TRADITIONAL_MSVC_PREPROCESSOR

    6809              :     #endif

    6811              : 
    6812              : 
    6813              :     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    6814              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_2(TestName, TestFunc, Name, Tags, Signature, ... )\
    6815              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    6816              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS \
    6817              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_ZERO_VARIADIC_WARNINGS \
    6818              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_WARNINGS \
    6819              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS \
    6820              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_COMMA_WARNINGS \
    6821              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST(TestFunc, INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(Signature));\
    6822              :         namespace {\
    6823              :         namespace INTERNAL_CATCH_MAKE_NAMESPACE(TestName){\
    6824              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_TYPE_GEN\
    6825              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_GEN(INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(Signature))\
    6826              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_REG_GEN(TestFunc,INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(Signature))\
    6827              :             template<typename...Types> \
    6828              :             struct TestName{\
    6829              :                 TestName(){\
    6830              :                     size_t index = 0;                                    \
    6831              :                     constexpr char const* tmpl_types[] = {CATCH_REC_LIST(INTERNAL_CATCH_STRINGIZE_WITHOUT_PARENS, __VA_ARGS__)}; /* NOLINT(cppcoreguidelines-avoid-c-arrays,modernize-avoid-c-arrays,hicpp-avoid-c-arrays) */\
    6832              :                     using expander = size_t[]; /* NOLINT(cppcoreguidelines-avoid-c-arrays,modernize-avoid-c-arrays,hicpp-avoid-c-arrays) */\
    6833              :                     (void)expander{(reg_test(Types{}, Catch::NameAndTags{ Name " - " + std::string(tmpl_types[index]), Tags } ), index++)... };/* NOLINT */ \
    6834              :                 }\
    6835              :             };\
    6836              :             static const int INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( globalRegistrar ) = [](){\
    6837              :             TestName<INTERNAL_CATCH_MAKE_TYPE_LISTS_FROM_TYPES(__VA_ARGS__)>();\
    6838              :             return 0;\
    6839              :         }();\
    6840              :         }\
    6841              :         }\
    6842              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    6843              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST(TestFunc,INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(Signature))
    6844              : 
    6845              : #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_TRADITIONAL_MSVC_PREPROCESSOR
    6846              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE(Name, Tags, ...) \
    6847              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), Name, Tags, typename TestType, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6848              : #else
    6849              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE(Name, Tags, ...) \
    6850              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS( INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), Name, Tags, typename TestType, __VA_ARGS__ ) )
    6851              : #endif
    6852              : 
    6853              : #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_TRADITIONAL_MSVC_PREPROCESSOR
    6854              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_SIG(Name, Tags, Signature, ...) \
    6855              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), Name, Tags, Signature, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6856              : #else
    6857              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_SIG(Name, Tags, Signature, ...) \
    6858              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS( INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), Name, Tags, Signature, __VA_ARGS__ ) )
    6859              : #endif
    6860              : 
    6861              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_PRODUCT_TEST_CASE2(TestName, TestFuncName, Name, Tags, Signature, TmplTypes, TypesList) \
    6862              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION                      \
    6863              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS                      \
    6864              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_ZERO_VARIADIC_WARNINGS                \
    6865              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_WARNINGS       \
    6866              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS \
    6867              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_COMMA_WARNINGS \
    6868              :         template<typename TestType> static void TestFuncName();       \
    6869              :         namespace {\
    6870              :         namespace INTERNAL_CATCH_MAKE_NAMESPACE(TestName) {                                     \
    6871              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_TYPE_GEN                                                  \
    6872              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_GEN(INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(Signature))         \
    6873              :             template<typename... Types>                               \
    6874              :             struct TestName {                                         \
    6875              :                 void reg_tests() {                                          \
    6876              :                     size_t index = 0;                                    \
    6877              :                     using expander = size_t[];                           \
    6878              :                     constexpr char const* tmpl_types[] = {CATCH_REC_LIST(INTERNAL_CATCH_STRINGIZE_WITHOUT_PARENS, INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(TmplTypes))};\
    6879              :                     constexpr char const* types_list[] = {CATCH_REC_LIST(INTERNAL_CATCH_STRINGIZE_WITHOUT_PARENS, INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(TypesList))};\
    6880              :                     constexpr auto num_types = sizeof(types_list) / sizeof(types_list[0]);\
    6881              :                     (void)expander{(Catch::AutoReg( Catch::makeTestInvoker( &TestFuncName<Types> ), CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, Catch::StringRef(), Catch::NameAndTags{ Name " - " + std::string(tmpl_types[index / num_types]) + '<' + types_list[index % num_types] + '>', Tags } ), index++)... };/* NOLINT */\
    6882              :                 }                                                     \
    6883              :             };                                                        \
    6884              :             static const int INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( globalRegistrar ) = [](){ \
    6885              :                 using TestInit = typename create<TestName, decltype(get_wrapper<INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(TmplTypes)>(Catch::Detail::priority_tag<1>{})), TypeList<INTERNAL_CATCH_MAKE_TYPE_LISTS_FROM_TYPES(INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(TypesList))>>::type; \
    6886              :                 TestInit t;                                           \
    6887              :                 t.reg_tests();                                        \
    6888              :                 return 0;                                             \
    6889              :             }();                                                      \
    6890              :         }                                                             \
    6891              :         }                                                             \
    6892              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION                       \
    6893              :         template<typename TestType>                                   \
    6894              :         static void TestFuncName()
    6895              : 
    6896              : #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_TRADITIONAL_MSVC_PREPROCESSOR
    6897              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_PRODUCT_TEST_CASE(Name, Tags, ...)\
    6898              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_PRODUCT_TEST_CASE2(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), Name, Tags, typename T,__VA_ARGS__)
    6899              : #else
    6900              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_PRODUCT_TEST_CASE(Name, Tags, ...)\
    6901              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS( INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_PRODUCT_TEST_CASE2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), Name, Tags, typename T, __VA_ARGS__ ) )
    6902              : #endif
    6903              : 
    6904              : #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_TRADITIONAL_MSVC_PREPROCESSOR
    6905              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_PRODUCT_TEST_CASE_SIG(Name, Tags, Signature, ...)\
    6906              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_PRODUCT_TEST_CASE2(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), Name, Tags, Signature, __VA_ARGS__)
    6907              : #else
    6908              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_PRODUCT_TEST_CASE_SIG(Name, Tags, Signature, ...)\
    6909              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS( INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_PRODUCT_TEST_CASE2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), Name, Tags, Signature, __VA_ARGS__ ) )
    6910              : #endif
    6911              : 
    6912              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_LIST_TEST_CASE_2(TestName, TestFunc, Name, Tags, TmplList)\
    6913              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    6914              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS \
    6915              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_WARNINGS \
    6916              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS \
    6917              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_COMMA_WARNINGS \
    6918              :         template<typename TestType> static void TestFunc();       \
    6919              :         namespace {\
    6920              :         namespace INTERNAL_CATCH_MAKE_NAMESPACE(TestName){\
    6921              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_TYPE_GEN\
    6922              :         template<typename... Types>                               \
    6923              :         struct TestName {                                         \
    6924              :             void reg_tests() {                                          \
    6925              :                 size_t index = 0;                                    \
    6926              :                 using expander = size_t[];                           \
    6927              :                 (void)expander{(Catch::AutoReg( Catch::makeTestInvoker( &TestFunc<Types> ), CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, Catch::StringRef(), Catch::NameAndTags{ Name " - " INTERNAL_CATCH_STRINGIZE(TmplList) " - " + std::to_string(index), Tags } ), index++)... };/* NOLINT */\
    6928              :             }                                                     \
    6929              :         };\
    6930              :         static const int INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( globalRegistrar ) = [](){ \
    6931              :                 using TestInit = typename convert<TestName, TmplList>::type; \
    6932              :                 TestInit t;                                           \
    6933              :                 t.reg_tests();                                        \
    6934              :                 return 0;                                             \
    6935              :             }();                                                      \
    6936              :         }}\
    6937              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION                       \
    6938              :         template<typename TestType>                                   \
    6939              :         static void TestFunc()
    6940              : 
    6941              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_LIST_TEST_CASE(Name, Tags, TmplList) \
    6942              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_LIST_TEST_CASE_2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), Name, Tags, TmplList )
    6943              : 
    6944              : 
    6945              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_METHOD_2( TestNameClass, TestName, ClassName, Name, Tags, Signature, ... ) \
    6946              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    6947              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS \
    6948              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_ZERO_VARIADIC_WARNINGS \
    6949              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_WARNINGS \
    6950              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS \
    6951              :         namespace {\
    6952              :         namespace INTERNAL_CATCH_MAKE_NAMESPACE(TestName){ \
    6953              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_TYPE_GEN\
    6954              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_GEN(INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(Signature))\
    6955              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_DECLARE_SIG_TEST_METHOD(TestName, ClassName, INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(Signature));\
    6956              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_REG_METHOD_GEN(TestName, INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(Signature))\
    6957              :             template<typename...Types> \
    6958              :             struct TestNameClass{\
    6959              :                 TestNameClass(){\
    6960              :                     size_t index = 0;                                    \
    6961              :                     constexpr char const* tmpl_types[] = {CATCH_REC_LIST(INTERNAL_CATCH_STRINGIZE_WITHOUT_PARENS, __VA_ARGS__)};\
    6962              :                     using expander = size_t[];\
    6963              :                     (void)expander{(reg_test(Types{}, #ClassName, Catch::NameAndTags{ Name " - " + std::string(tmpl_types[index]), Tags } ), index++)... };/* NOLINT */ \
    6964              :                 }\
    6965              :             };\
    6966              :             static const int INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( globalRegistrar ) = [](){\
    6967              :                 TestNameClass<INTERNAL_CATCH_MAKE_TYPE_LISTS_FROM_TYPES(__VA_ARGS__)>();\
    6968              :                 return 0;\
    6969              :         }();\
    6970              :         }\
    6971              :         }\
    6972              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    6973              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_DEFINE_SIG_TEST_METHOD(TestName, INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(Signature))
    6974              : 
    6975              : #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_TRADITIONAL_MSVC_PREPROCESSOR
    6976              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_METHOD( ClassName, Name, Tags,... ) \
    6977              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_METHOD_2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_CLASS_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ) , ClassName, Name, Tags, typename T, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6978              : #else
    6979              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_METHOD( ClassName, Name, Tags,... ) \
    6980              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS( INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_METHOD_2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_CLASS_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ) , ClassName, Name, Tags, typename T, __VA_ARGS__ ) )
    6981              : #endif
    6982              : 
    6983              : #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_TRADITIONAL_MSVC_PREPROCESSOR
    6984              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_METHOD_SIG( ClassName, Name, Tags, Signature, ... ) \
    6985              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_METHOD_2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_CLASS_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ) , ClassName, Name, Tags, Signature, __VA_ARGS__ )
    6986              : #else
    6987              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_METHOD_SIG( ClassName, Name, Tags, Signature, ... ) \
    6988              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS( INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_METHOD_2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_CLASS_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ) , ClassName, Name, Tags, Signature, __VA_ARGS__ ) )
    6989              : #endif
    6990              : 
    6991              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_PRODUCT_TEST_CASE_METHOD_2(TestNameClass, TestName, ClassName, Name, Tags, Signature, TmplTypes, TypesList)\
    6992              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    6993              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS \
    6994              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_ZERO_VARIADIC_WARNINGS \
    6995              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_WARNINGS \
    6996              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS \
    6997              :         template<typename TestType> \
    6998              :             struct TestName : INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(ClassName <TestType>) { \
    6999              :                 void test();\
    7000              :             };\
    7001              :         namespace {\
    7002              :         namespace INTERNAL_CATCH_MAKE_NAMESPACE(TestNameClass) {\
    7003              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_TYPE_GEN                  \
    7004              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_NTTP_GEN(INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(Signature))\
    7005              :             template<typename...Types>\
    7006              :             struct TestNameClass{\
    7007              :                 void reg_tests(){\
    7008              :                     std::size_t index = 0;\
    7009              :                     using expander = std::size_t[];\
    7010              :                     constexpr char const* tmpl_types[] = {CATCH_REC_LIST(INTERNAL_CATCH_STRINGIZE_WITHOUT_PARENS, INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(TmplTypes))};\
    7011              :                     constexpr char const* types_list[] = {CATCH_REC_LIST(INTERNAL_CATCH_STRINGIZE_WITHOUT_PARENS, INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(TypesList))};\
    7012              :                     constexpr auto num_types = sizeof(types_list) / sizeof(types_list[0]);\
    7013              :                     (void)expander{(Catch::AutoReg( Catch::makeTestInvoker( &TestName<Types>::test ), CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, #ClassName, Catch::NameAndTags{ Name " - " + std::string(tmpl_types[index / num_types]) + '<' + types_list[index % num_types] + '>', Tags } ), index++)... };/* NOLINT */ \
    7014              :                 }\
    7015              :             };\
    7016              :             static const int INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( globalRegistrar ) = [](){\
    7017              :                 using TestInit = typename create<TestNameClass, decltype(get_wrapper<INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(TmplTypes)>(Catch::Detail::priority_tag<1>{})), TypeList<INTERNAL_CATCH_MAKE_TYPE_LISTS_FROM_TYPES(INTERNAL_CATCH_REMOVE_PARENS(TypesList))>>::type;\
    7018              :                 TestInit t;\
    7019              :                 t.reg_tests();\
    7020              :                 return 0;\
    7021              :             }(); \
    7022              :         }\
    7023              :         }\
    7024              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    7025              :         template<typename TestType> \
    7026              :         void TestName<TestType>::test()
    7027              : 
    7028              : #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_TRADITIONAL_MSVC_PREPROCESSOR
    7029              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_PRODUCT_TEST_CASE_METHOD( ClassName, Name, Tags, ... )\
    7030              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_PRODUCT_TEST_CASE_METHOD_2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( CATCH2_INTERNAL_TEMPLATE_TEST_ ), ClassName, Name, Tags, typename T, __VA_ARGS__ )
    7031              : #else
    7032              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_PRODUCT_TEST_CASE_METHOD( ClassName, Name, Tags, ... )\

    7034              : #endif
    7035              :

    7039              : #else

    7046              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS \
    7047              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_WARNINGS \
    7048              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_UNUSED_VARIABLE_WARNINGS \
    7049              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_COMMA_WARNINGS \

    7052              :             void test();\
    7053              :         };\
    7054              :         namespace {\
    7055              :         namespace INTERNAL_CATCH_MAKE_NAMESPACE(TestName){ \
    7056              :             INTERNAL_CATCH_TYPE_GEN\
    7057              :             template<typename...Types>\
    7058              :             struct TestNameClass{\
    7059              :                 void reg_tests(){\
    7060              :                     size_t index = 0;\
    7061              :                     using expander = size_t[];\
    7062              :                     (void)expander{(Catch::AutoReg( Catch::makeTestInvoker( &TestName<Types>::test ), CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, #ClassName##_catch_sr, Catch::NameAndTags{ Name " - " INTERNAL_CATCH_STRINGIZE(TmplList) " - " + std::to_string(index), Tags } ), index++)... };/* NOLINT */ \
    7063              :                 }\
    7064              :             };\

    7066              :                 using TestInit = typename convert<TestNameClass, TmplList>::type;\
    7067              :                 TestInit t;\
    7068              :                 t.reg_tests();\
    7069              :                 return 0;\
    7070              :             }(); \
    7071              :         }}\
    7072              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \

    7078              : 
    7079              :

    7168              :     #define TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_METHOD_SIG( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_EXPAND_VARGS( INTERNAL_CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE_METHOD_SIG_NO_REGISTRATION(className, __VA_ARGS__ ) )
    7169              :   #endif
    7170              : 
    7171              :   // When disabled, these can be shared between proper preprocessor and MSVC preprocessor
    7172              :   #define TEMPLATE_PRODUCT_TEST_CASE( ... ) TEMPLATE_TEST_CASE( __VA_ARGS__ )

    7180              :

    7182              : #endif // CATCH_TEMPLATE_TEST_MACROS_HPP_INCLUDED
    7183              : 
    7184              : 
    7185              : #ifndef CATCH_TEST_CASE_INFO_HPP_INCLUDED
    7186              : #define CATCH_TEST_CASE_INFO_HPP_INCLUDED
    7187              : 
    7188              : 
    7189              : 
    7190              : #include <cstdint>
    7191              : #include <string>
    7192              : #include <vector>
    7193              : 
    7194              : #ifdef __clang__
    7195              : #pragma clang diagnostic push
    7196              : #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wpadded"
    7197              : #endif
    7198              : 
    7199              : namespace Catch {
    7200              : 
    7201              :     /**
    7202              :      * A **view** of a tag string that provides case insensitive comparisons
    7203              :      *
    7204              :      * Note that in Catch2 internals, the square brackets around tags are
    7205              :      * not a part of tag's representation, so e.g. "[cool-tag]" is represented
    7206              :      * as "cool-tag" internally.
    7207              :      */
    7208              :     struct Tag {
    7209          118 :         constexpr Tag(StringRef original_):
    7210          118 :             original(original_)
    7211          118 :         {}
    7212              :         StringRef original;
    7213              : 
    7214              :         friend bool operator< ( Tag const& lhs, Tag const& rhs );
    7215              :         friend bool operator==( Tag const& lhs, Tag const& rhs );
    7216              :     };
    7217              : 
    7218              :     class ITestInvoker;
    7219              :     struct NameAndTags;
    7220              : 
    7221              :     enum class TestCaseProperties : uint8_t {
    7222              :         None = 0,
    7223              :         IsHidden = 1 << 1,
    7224              :         ShouldFail = 1 << 2,
    7225              :         MayFail = 1 << 3,
    7226              :         Throws = 1 << 4,
    7227              :         NonPortable = 1 << 5,
    7228              :         Benchmark = 1 << 6
    7229              :     };
    7230              : 
    7231              :     /**
    7232              :      * Various metadata about the test case.
    7233              :      *
    7234              :      * A test case is uniquely identified by its (class)name and tags
    7235              :      * combination, with source location being ignored, and other properties
    7236              :      * being determined from tags.
    7237              :      *
    7238              :      * Tags are kept sorted.
    7239              :      */
    7240              :     struct TestCaseInfo : Detail::NonCopyable {
    7241              : 
    7242              :         TestCaseInfo(StringRef _className,
    7243              :                      NameAndTags const& _nameAndTags,
    7244              :                      SourceLineInfo const& _lineInfo);
    7245              : 
    7246              :         bool isHidden() const;
    7247              :         bool throws() const;
    7248              :         bool okToFail() const;
    7249              :         bool expectedToFail() const;
    7250              : 
    7251              :         // Adds the tag(s) with test's filename (for the -# flag)
    7252              :         void addFilenameTag();
    7253              : 
    7254              :         //! Orders by name, classname and tags
    7255              :         friend bool operator<( TestCaseInfo const& lhs,
    7256              :                                TestCaseInfo const& rhs );
    7257              : 
    7258              : 
    7259              :         std::string tagsAsString() const;
    7260              : 
    7261              :         std::string name;
    7262              :         StringRef className;
    7263              :     private:
    7264              :         std::string backingTags;
    7265              :         // Internally we copy tags to the backing storage and then add
    7266              :         // refs to this storage to the tags vector.
    7267              :         void internalAppendTag(StringRef tagString);
    7268              :     public:
    7269              :         std::vector<Tag> tags;
    7270              :         SourceLineInfo lineInfo;
    7271              :         TestCaseProperties properties = TestCaseProperties::None;
    7272              :     };
    7273              : 
    7274              :     /**
    7275              :      * Wrapper over the test case information and the test case invoker
    7276              :      *
    7277              :      * Does not own either, and is specifically made to be cheap
    7278              :      * to copy around.
    7279              :      */
    7280              :     class TestCaseHandle {
    7281              :         TestCaseInfo* m_info;
    7282              :         ITestInvoker* m_invoker;
    7283              :     public:
    7284          118 :         constexpr TestCaseHandle(TestCaseInfo* info, ITestInvoker* invoker) :
    7285          118 :             m_info(info), m_invoker(invoker) {}
    7286              : 
    7287          118 :         void prepareTestCase() const {
    7288          118 :             m_invoker->prepareTestCase();
    7289          118 :         }
    7290              : 
    7291          118 :         void tearDownTestCase() const {
    7292          118 :             m_invoker->tearDownTestCase();
    7293          118 :         }
    7294              : 
    7295          168 :         void invoke() const {
    7296          168 :             m_invoker->invoke();
    7297          168 :         }
    7298              : 
    7299          640 :         constexpr TestCaseInfo const& getTestCaseInfo() const {
    7300          640 :             return *m_info;
    7301              :         }
    7302              :     };
    7303              : 
    7304              :     Detail::unique_ptr<TestCaseInfo>
    7305              :     makeTestCaseInfo( StringRef className,
    7306              :                       NameAndTags const& nameAndTags,
    7307              :                       SourceLineInfo const& lineInfo );
    7308              : }
    7309              : 
    7310              : #ifdef __clang__
    7311              : #pragma clang diagnostic pop
    7312              : #endif
    7313              : 
    7314              : #endif // CATCH_TEST_CASE_INFO_HPP_INCLUDED

    7341              :

    7345              : namespace Catch {
    7346              :     using exceptionTranslateFunction = std::string(*)();
    7347              : 
    7348              :     class IExceptionTranslator;
    7349              :     using ExceptionTranslators = std::vector<Detail::unique_ptr<IExceptionTranslator const>>;
    7350              : 
    7351              :     class IExceptionTranslator {
    7352              :     public:
    7353              :         virtual ~IExceptionTranslator(); // = default
    7354              :         virtual std::string translate( ExceptionTranslators::const_iterator it, ExceptionTranslators::const_iterator itEnd ) const = 0;
    7355              :     };
    7356              : 
    7357              :     class IExceptionTranslatorRegistry {
    7358              :     public:
    7359              :         virtual ~IExceptionTranslatorRegistry(); // = default
    7360              :         virtual std::string translateActiveException() const = 0;
    7361              :     };
    7362              : 
    7363              : } // namespace Catch
    7364              : 
    7365              : #endif // CATCH_INTERFACES_EXCEPTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    7366              : 
    7367              : #include <exception>
    7368              : 
    7369              : namespace Catch {
    7370              :     namespace Detail {
    7371              :         void registerTranslatorImpl(
    7372              :             Detail::unique_ptr<IExceptionTranslator>&& translator );
    7373              :     }
    7374              : 
    7375              :     class ExceptionTranslatorRegistrar {
    7376              :         template<typename T>
    7377              :         class ExceptionTranslator : public IExceptionTranslator {
    7378              :         public:
    7379              : 
    7380              :             constexpr ExceptionTranslator( std::string(*translateFunction)( T const& ) )
    7381              :             : m_translateFunction( translateFunction )
    7382              :             {}
    7383              : 
    7384              :             std::string translate( ExceptionTranslators::const_iterator it, ExceptionTranslators::const_iterator itEnd ) const override {
    7385              : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
    7386              :                 try {
    7387              :                     if( it == itEnd )
    7388              :                         std::rethrow_exception(std::current_exception());
    7389              :                     else
    7390              :                         return (*it)->translate( it+1, itEnd );
    7391              :                 }
    7392              :                 catch( T const& ex ) {
    7393              :                     return m_translateFunction( ex );
    7394              :                 }
    7395              : #else
    7396              :                 return "You should never get here!";
    7397              : #endif
    7398              :             }
    7399              : 
    7400              :         protected:
    7401              :             std::string(*m_translateFunction)( T const& );
    7402              :         };
    7403              : 
    7404              :     public:
    7405              :         template<typename T>
    7406              :         ExceptionTranslatorRegistrar( std::string(*translateFunction)( T const& ) ) {
    7407              :             Detail::registerTranslatorImpl(
    7408              :                 Detail::make_unique<ExceptionTranslator<T>>(
    7409              :                     translateFunction ) );
    7410              :         }
    7411              :     };
    7412              : 
    7413              : } // namespace Catch
    7414              : 
    7415              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    7416              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TRANSLATE_EXCEPTION2( translatorName, signature ) \
    7417              :     static std::string translatorName( signature ); \
    7418              :     CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    7419              :     CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS \
    7420              :     namespace{ const Catch::ExceptionTranslatorRegistrar INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( catch_internal_ExceptionRegistrar )( &translatorName ); } \
    7421              :     CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
    7422              :     static std::string translatorName( signature )
    7423              : 
    7424              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TRANSLATE_EXCEPTION( signature ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TRANSLATE_EXCEPTION2( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( catch_internal_ExceptionTranslator ), signature )
    7425              : 
    7426              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
    7427              :     #define INTERNAL_CATCH_TRANSLATE_EXCEPTION_NO_REG( translatorName, signature) \
    7428              :             static std::string translatorName( signature )
    7429              : #endif
    7430              : 
    7431              : 
    7432              : // This macro is always prefixed
    7433              : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
    7434              : #define CATCH_TRANSLATE_EXCEPTION( signature ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TRANSLATE_EXCEPTION( signature )
    7435              : #else
    7436              : #define CATCH_TRANSLATE_EXCEPTION( signature ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TRANSLATE_EXCEPTION_NO_REG( INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( catch_internal_ExceptionTranslator ), signature )
    7437              : #endif
    7438              : 
    7439              :

    7449              : 
    7450              :     // Versioning information
    7451              :     struct Version {
    7452              :         Version( Version const& ) = delete;
    7453              :         Version& operator=( Version const& ) = delete;
    7454              :         Version(    unsigned int _majorVersion,
    7455              :                     unsigned int _minorVersion,
    7456              :                     unsigned int _patchNumber,
    7457              :                     char const * const _branchName,
    7458              :                     unsigned int _buildNumber );
    7459              : 
    7460              :         unsigned int const majorVersion;
    7461              :         unsigned int const minorVersion;
    7462              :         unsigned int const patchNumber;
    7463              : 
    7464              :         // buildNumber is only used if branchName is not null
    7465              :         char const * const branchName;
    7466              :         unsigned int const buildNumber;
    7467              : 
    7468              :         friend std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, Version const& version );
    7469              :     };
    7470              : 
    7471              :     Version const& libraryVersion();

    7480              : #define CATCH_VERSION_MAJOR 3
    7481              : #define CATCH_VERSION_MINOR 11
    7482              : #define CATCH_VERSION_PATCH 0
    7483              :

    7485              : 
    7486              : 
    7487              : /** \file
    7488              :  * This is a convenience header for Catch2's Generator support. It includes
    7489              :  * **all** of Catch2 headers related to generators.
    7490              :  *
    7491              :  * Generally the Catch2 users should use specific includes they need,
    7492              :  * but this header can be used instead for ease-of-experimentation, or
    7493              :  * just plain convenience, at the cost of (significantly) increased
    7494              :  * compilation times.
    7495              :  *
    7496              :  * When a new header is added to either the `generators` folder,
    7497              :  * or to the corresponding internal subfolder, it should be added here.
    7498              :  */
    7499              : 
    7500              : #ifndef CATCH_GENERATORS_ALL_HPP_INCLUDED
    7501              : #define CATCH_GENERATORS_ALL_HPP_INCLUDED
    7502              : 
    7503              : 
    7504              : 
    7505              : #ifndef CATCH_GENERATOR_EXCEPTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    7506              : #define CATCH_GENERATOR_EXCEPTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    7507              : 
    7508              : #include <exception>
    7509              : 
    7510              : namespace Catch {
    7511              : 
    7512              :     // Exception type to be thrown when a Generator runs into an error,
    7513              :     // e.g. it cannot initialize the first return value based on
    7514              :     // runtime information
    7515              :     class GeneratorException : public std::exception {
    7516              :         const char* const m_msg = "";
    7517              : 
    7518              :     public:
    7519            0 :         GeneratorException(const char* msg):
    7520            0 :             m_msg(msg)
    7521            0 :         {}
    7522              : 
    7523              :         const char* what() const noexcept final;
    7524              :     };
    7525              : 
    7526              : } // end namespace Catch
    7527              : 
    7528              : #endif // CATCH_GENERATOR_EXCEPTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    7529              : 
    7530              : 
    7531              : #ifndef CATCH_GENERATORS_HPP_INCLUDED
    7532              : #define CATCH_GENERATORS_HPP_INCLUDED
    7533              : 
    7534              : 
    7535              : 
    7536              : #ifndef CATCH_INTERFACES_GENERATORTRACKER_HPP_INCLUDED
    7537              : #define CATCH_INTERFACES_GENERATORTRACKER_HPP_INCLUDED
    7538              : 
    7539              : 
    7540              : #include <string>
    7541              : 
    7542              : namespace Catch {
    7543              : 
    7544              :     namespace Generators {
    7545              :         class GeneratorUntypedBase {
    7546              :             // Caches result from `toStringImpl`, assume that when it is an
    7547              :             // empty string, the cache is invalidated.
    7548              :             mutable std::string m_stringReprCache;
    7549              : 
    7550              :             // Counts based on `next` returning true
    7551              :             std::size_t m_currentElementIndex = 0;
    7552              : 
    7553              :             /**
    7554              :              * Attempts to move the generator to the next element
    7555              :              *
    7556              :              * Returns true iff the move succeeded (and a valid element
    7557              :              * can be retrieved).
    7558              :              */
    7559              :             virtual bool next() = 0;
    7560              : 
    7561              :             //! Customization point for `currentElementAsString`
    7562              :             virtual std::string stringifyImpl() const = 0;
    7563              : 
    7564              :         public:
    7565            0 :             GeneratorUntypedBase() = default;
    7566              :             // Generation of copy ops is deprecated (and Clang will complain)
    7567              :             // if there is a user destructor defined
    7568              :             GeneratorUntypedBase(GeneratorUntypedBase const&) = default;
    7569              :             GeneratorUntypedBase& operator=(GeneratorUntypedBase const&) = default;
    7570              : 
    7571              :             virtual ~GeneratorUntypedBase(); // = default;
    7572              : 
    7573              :             /**
    7574              :              * Attempts to move the generator to the next element
    7575              :              *
    7576              :              * Serves as a non-virtual interface to `next`, so that the
    7577              :              * top level interface can provide sanity checking and shared
    7578              :              * features.
    7579              :              *
    7580              :              * As with `next`, returns true iff the move succeeded and
    7581              :              * the generator has new valid element to provide.
    7582              :              */
    7583              :             bool countedNext();
    7584              : 
    7585              :             std::size_t currentElementIndex() const { return m_currentElementIndex; }
    7586              : 
    7587              :             /**
    7588              :              * Returns generator's current element as user-friendly string.
    7589              :              *
    7590              :              * By default returns string equivalent to calling
    7591              :              * `Catch::Detail::stringify` on the current element, but generators
    7592              :              * can customize their implementation as needed.
    7593              :              *
    7594              :              * Not thread-safe due to internal caching.
    7595              :              *
    7596              :              * The returned ref is valid only until the generator instance
    7597              :              * is destructed, or it moves onto the next element, whichever
    7598              :              * comes first.
    7599              :              */
    7600              :             StringRef currentElementAsString() const;
    7601              :         };
    7602              :         using GeneratorBasePtr = Catch::Detail::unique_ptr<GeneratorUntypedBase>;
    7603              : 
    7604              :     } // namespace Generators
    7605              : 
    7606              :     class IGeneratorTracker {
    7607              :     public:
    7608              :         virtual ~IGeneratorTracker(); // = default;
    7609              :         virtual auto hasGenerator() const -> bool = 0;
    7610              :         virtual auto getGenerator() const -> Generators::GeneratorBasePtr const& = 0;
    7611              :         virtual void setGenerator( Generators::GeneratorBasePtr&& generator ) = 0;
    7612              :     };
    7613              : 
    7614              : } // namespace Catch
    7615              : 
    7616              : #endif // CATCH_INTERFACES_GENERATORTRACKER_HPP_INCLUDED
    7617              : 
    7618              : #include <vector>
    7619              : #include <tuple>
    7620              : 
    7621              : namespace Catch {
    7622              : 
    7623              : namespace Generators {
    7624              : 
    7625              : namespace Detail {
    7626              : 
    7627              :     //! Throws GeneratorException with the provided message
    7628              :     [[noreturn]]
    7629              :     void throw_generator_exception(char const * msg);
    7630              : 
    7631              : } // end namespace detail
    7632              : 
    7633              :     template<typename T>
    7634              :     class IGenerator : public GeneratorUntypedBase {
    7635            0 :         std::string stringifyImpl() const override {
    7636            0 :             return ::Catch::Detail::stringify( get() );
    7637              :         }
    7638              : 
    7639              :     public:
    7640              :         // Returns the current element of the generator
    7641              :         //
    7642              :         // \Precondition The generator is either freshly constructed,
    7643              :         // or the last call to `next()` returned true
    7644              :         virtual T const& get() const = 0;
    7645              :         using type = T;
    7646              :     };
    7647              : 
    7648              :     template <typename T>
    7649              :     using GeneratorPtr = Catch::Detail::unique_ptr<IGenerator<T>>;
    7650              : 
    7651              :     template <typename T>
    7652              :     class GeneratorWrapper final {
    7653              :         GeneratorPtr<T> m_generator;
    7654              :     public:
    7655              :         //! Takes ownership of the passed pointer.
    7656              :         GeneratorWrapper(IGenerator<T>* generator):
    7657              :             m_generator(generator) {}
    7658              :         GeneratorWrapper(GeneratorPtr<T> generator):
    7659              :             m_generator(CATCH_MOVE(generator)) {}
    7660              : 
    7661              :         T const& get() const {
    7662              :             return m_generator->get();
    7663              :         }
    7664              :         bool next() {
    7665              :             return m_generator->countedNext();
    7666              :         }
    7667              :     };
    7668              : 
    7669              : 
    7670              :     template<typename T>
    7671              :     class SingleValueGenerator final : public IGenerator<T> {
    7672              :         T m_value;
    7673              :     public:
    7674              :         SingleValueGenerator(T const& value) :
    7675              :             m_value(value)
    7676              :         {}
    7677              :         SingleValueGenerator(T&& value):
    7678              :             m_value(CATCH_MOVE(value))
    7679              :         {}
    7680              : 
    7681              :         T const& get() const override {
    7682              :             return m_value;
    7683              :         }
    7684              :         bool next() override {
    7685              :             return false;
    7686              :         }
    7687              :     };
    7688              : 
    7689              :     template<typename T>
    7690              :     class FixedValuesGenerator final : public IGenerator<T> {
    7691              :         static_assert(!std::is_same<T, bool>::value,
    7692              :             "FixedValuesGenerator does not support bools because of std::vector<bool>"
    7693              :             "specialization, use SingleValue Generator instead.");
    7694              :         std::vector<T> m_values;
    7695              :         size_t m_idx = 0;
    7696              :     public:
    7697              :         FixedValuesGenerator( std::initializer_list<T> values ) : m_values( values ) {}
    7698              : 
    7699              :         T const& get() const override {
    7700              :             return m_values[m_idx];
    7701              :         }
    7702              :         bool next() override {
    7703              :             ++m_idx;
    7704              :             return m_idx < m_values.size();
    7705              :         }
    7706              :     };
    7707              : 
    7708              :     template <typename T, typename DecayedT = std::decay_t<T>>
    7709              :     GeneratorWrapper<DecayedT> value( T&& value ) {
    7710              :         return GeneratorWrapper<DecayedT>(
    7711              :             Catch::Detail::make_unique<SingleValueGenerator<DecayedT>>(
    7712              :                 CATCH_FORWARD( value ) ) );
    7713              :     }
    7714              :     template <typename T>
    7715              :     GeneratorWrapper<T> values(std::initializer_list<T> values) {
    7716              :         return GeneratorWrapper<T>(Catch::Detail::make_unique<FixedValuesGenerator<T>>(values));
    7717              :     }
    7718              : 
    7719              :     template<typename T>
    7720              :     class Generators : public IGenerator<T> {
    7721              :         std::vector<GeneratorWrapper<T>> m_generators;
    7722              :         size_t m_current = 0;
    7723              : 
    7724              :         void add_generator( GeneratorWrapper<T>&& generator ) {
    7725              :             m_generators.emplace_back( CATCH_MOVE( generator ) );
    7726              :         }
    7727              :         void add_generator( T const& val ) {
    7728              :             m_generators.emplace_back( value( val ) );
    7729              :         }
    7730              :         void add_generator( T&& val ) {
    7731              :             m_generators.emplace_back( value( CATCH_MOVE( val ) ) );
    7732              :         }
    7733              :         template <typename U>
    7734              :         std::enable_if_t<!std::is_same<std::decay_t<U>, T>::value>
    7735              :         add_generator( U&& val ) {
    7736              :             add_generator( T( CATCH_FORWARD( val ) ) );
    7737              :         }
    7738              : 
    7739              :         template <typename U> void add_generators( U&& valueOrGenerator ) {
    7740              :             add_generator( CATCH_FORWARD( valueOrGenerator ) );
    7741              :         }
    7742              : 
    7743              :         template <typename U, typename... Gs>
    7744              :         void add_generators( U&& valueOrGenerator, Gs&&... moreGenerators ) {
    7745              :             add_generator( CATCH_FORWARD( valueOrGenerator ) );
    7746              :             add_generators( CATCH_FORWARD( moreGenerators )... );
    7747              :         }
    7748              : 
    7749              :     public:
    7750              :         template <typename... Gs>
    7751              :         Generators(Gs &&... moreGenerators) {
    7752              :             m_generators.reserve(sizeof...(Gs));
    7753              :             add_generators(CATCH_FORWARD(moreGenerators)...);
    7754              :         }
    7755              : 
    7756              :         T const& get() const override {
    7757              :             return m_generators[m_current].get();
    7758              :         }
    7759              : 
    7760              :         bool next() override {
    7761              :             if (m_current >= m_generators.size()) {
    7762              :                 return false;
    7763              :             }
    7764              :             const bool current_status = m_generators[m_current].next();
    7765              :             if (!current_status) {
    7766              :                 ++m_current;
    7767              :             }
    7768              :             return m_current < m_generators.size();
    7769              :         }
    7770              :     };
    7771              : 
    7772              : 
    7773              :     template <typename... Ts>
    7774              :     GeneratorWrapper<std::tuple<std::decay_t<Ts>...>>
    7775              :     table( std::initializer_list<std::tuple<std::decay_t<Ts>...>> tuples ) {
    7776              :         return values<std::tuple<Ts...>>( tuples );
    7777              :     }
    7778              : 
    7779              :     // Tag type to signal that a generator sequence should convert arguments to a specific type
    7780              :     template <typename T>
    7781              :     struct as {};
    7782              : 
    7783              :     template<typename T, typename... Gs>
    7784              :     auto makeGenerators( GeneratorWrapper<T>&& generator, Gs &&... moreGenerators ) -> Generators<T> {
    7785              :         return Generators<T>(CATCH_MOVE(generator), CATCH_FORWARD(moreGenerators)...);
    7786              :     }
    7787              :     template<typename T>
    7788              :     auto makeGenerators( GeneratorWrapper<T>&& generator ) -> Generators<T> {
    7789              :         return Generators<T>(CATCH_MOVE(generator));
    7790              :     }
    7791              :     template<typename T, typename... Gs>
    7792              :     auto makeGenerators( T&& val, Gs &&... moreGenerators ) -> Generators<std::decay_t<T>> {
    7793              :         return makeGenerators( value( CATCH_FORWARD( val ) ), CATCH_FORWARD( moreGenerators )... );
    7794              :     }
    7795              :     template<typename T, typename U, typename... Gs>
    7796              :     auto makeGenerators( as<T>, U&& val, Gs &&... moreGenerators ) -> Generators<T> {
    7797              :         return makeGenerators( value( T( CATCH_FORWARD( val ) ) ), CATCH_FORWARD( moreGenerators )... );
    7798              :     }
    7799              : 
    7800              :     IGeneratorTracker* acquireGeneratorTracker( StringRef generatorName,
    7801              :                                                 SourceLineInfo const& lineInfo );
    7802              :     IGeneratorTracker* createGeneratorTracker( StringRef generatorName,
    7803              :                                                SourceLineInfo lineInfo,
    7804              :                                                GeneratorBasePtr&& generator );
    7805              : 
    7806              :     template<typename L>
    7807              :     auto generate( StringRef generatorName, SourceLineInfo const& lineInfo, L const& generatorExpression ) -> typename decltype(generatorExpression())::type {
    7808              :         using UnderlyingType = typename decltype(generatorExpression())::type;
    7809              : 
    7810              :         IGeneratorTracker* tracker = acquireGeneratorTracker( generatorName, lineInfo );
    7811              :         // Creation of tracker is delayed after generator creation, so
    7812              :         // that constructing generator can fail without breaking everything.
    7813              :         if (!tracker) {
    7814              :             tracker = createGeneratorTracker(
    7815              :                 generatorName,
    7816              :                 lineInfo,
    7817              :                 Catch::Detail::make_unique<Generators<UnderlyingType>>(
    7818              :                     generatorExpression() ) );
    7819              :         }
    7820              : 
    7821              :         auto const& generator = static_cast<IGenerator<UnderlyingType> const&>( *tracker->getGenerator() );
    7822              :         return generator.get();
    7823              :     }
    7824              : 
    7825              : } // namespace Generators
    7826              : } // namespace Catch
    7827              : 
    7828              : #define CATCH_INTERNAL_GENERATOR_STRINGIZE_IMPL( ... ) #__VA_ARGS__##_catch_sr
    7829              : #define CATCH_INTERNAL_GENERATOR_STRINGIZE(...) CATCH_INTERNAL_GENERATOR_STRINGIZE_IMPL(__VA_ARGS__)
    7830              : 
    7831              : #define GENERATE( ... ) \
    7832              :     Catch::Generators::generate( CATCH_INTERNAL_GENERATOR_STRINGIZE(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME(generator)), \
    7833              :                                  CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, \
    7834              :                                  [ ]{ using namespace Catch::Generators; return makeGenerators( __VA_ARGS__ ); } ) //NOLINT(google-build-using-namespace)
    7835              : #define GENERATE_COPY( ... ) \
    7836              :     Catch::Generators::generate( CATCH_INTERNAL_GENERATOR_STRINGIZE(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME(generator)), \
    7837              :                                  CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, \
    7838              :                                  [=]{ using namespace Catch::Generators; return makeGenerators( __VA_ARGS__ ); } ) //NOLINT(google-build-using-namespace)
    7839              : #define GENERATE_REF( ... ) \
    7840              :     Catch::Generators::generate( CATCH_INTERNAL_GENERATOR_STRINGIZE(INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME(generator)), \
    7841              :                                  CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, \
    7842              :                                  [&]{ using namespace Catch::Generators; return makeGenerators( __VA_ARGS__ ); } ) //NOLINT(google-build-using-namespace)
    7843              : 
    7844              : #endif // CATCH_GENERATORS_HPP_INCLUDED
    7845              : 
    7846              : 
    7847              : #ifndef CATCH_GENERATORS_ADAPTERS_HPP_INCLUDED
    7848              : #define CATCH_GENERATORS_ADAPTERS_HPP_INCLUDED
    7849              : 
    7850              : 
    7851              : #include <cassert>
    7852              : 
    7853              : namespace Catch {
    7854              : namespace Generators {
    7855              : 
    7856              :     template <typename T>
    7857              :     class TakeGenerator final : public IGenerator<T> {
    7858              :         GeneratorWrapper<T> m_generator;
    7859              :         size_t m_returned = 0;
    7860              :         size_t m_target;
    7861              :     public:
    7862              :         TakeGenerator(size_t target, GeneratorWrapper<T>&& generator):
    7863              :             m_generator(CATCH_MOVE(generator)),
    7864              :             m_target(target)
    7865              :         {
    7866              :             assert(target != 0 && "Empty generators are not allowed");
    7867              :         }
    7868              :         T const& get() const override {
    7869              :             return m_generator.get();
    7870              :         }
    7871              :         bool next() override {
    7872              :             ++m_returned;
    7873              :             if (m_returned >= m_target) {
    7874              :                 return false;
    7875              :             }
    7876              : 
    7877              :             const auto success = m_generator.next();
    7878              :             // If the underlying generator does not contain enough values
    7879              :             // then we cut short as well
    7880              :             if (!success) {
    7881              :                 m_returned = m_target;
    7882              :             }
    7883              :             return success;
    7884              :         }
    7885              :     };
    7886              : 
    7887              :     template <typename T>
    7888              :     GeneratorWrapper<T> take(size_t target, GeneratorWrapper<T>&& generator) {
    7889              :         return GeneratorWrapper<T>(Catch::Detail::make_unique<TakeGenerator<T>>(target, CATCH_MOVE(generator)));
    7890              :     }
    7891              : 
    7892              : 
    7893              :     template <typename T, typename Predicate>
    7894              :     class FilterGenerator final : public IGenerator<T> {
    7895              :         GeneratorWrapper<T> m_generator;
    7896              :         Predicate m_predicate;
    7897              :         static_assert(!std::is_reference<Predicate>::value, "This would most likely result in a dangling reference");
    7898              :     public:
    7899              :         template <typename P>
    7900              :         FilterGenerator(P&& pred, GeneratorWrapper<T>&& generator):
    7901              :             m_generator(CATCH_MOVE(generator)),
    7902              :             m_predicate(CATCH_FORWARD(pred))
    7903              :         {
    7904              :             if (!m_predicate(m_generator.get())) {
    7905              :                 // It might happen that there are no values that pass the
    7906              :                 // filter. In that case we throw an exception.
    7907              :                 auto has_initial_value = next();
    7908              :                 if (!has_initial_value) {
    7909              :                     Detail::throw_generator_exception("No valid value found in filtered generator");
    7910              :                 }
    7911              :             }
    7912              :         }
    7913              : 
    7914              :         T const& get() const override {
    7915              :             return m_generator.get();
    7916              :         }
    7917              : 
    7918              :         bool next() override {
    7919              :             bool success = m_generator.next();
    7920              :             if (!success) {
    7921              :                 return false;
    7922              :             }
    7923              :             while (!m_predicate(m_generator.get()) && (success = m_generator.next()) == true);
    7924              :             return success;
    7925              :         }
    7926              :     };
    7927              : 
    7928              : 
    7929              :     template <typename T, typename Predicate>
    7930              :     GeneratorWrapper<T> filter(Predicate&& pred, GeneratorWrapper<T>&& generator) {
    7931              :         return GeneratorWrapper<T>(Catch::Detail::make_unique<FilterGenerator<T, typename std::remove_reference<Predicate>::type>>(CATCH_FORWARD(pred), CATCH_MOVE(generator)));
    7932              :     }
    7933              : 
    7934              :     template <typename T>
    7935              :     class RepeatGenerator final : public IGenerator<T> {
    7936              :         static_assert(!std::is_same<T, bool>::value,
    7937              :             "RepeatGenerator currently does not support bools"
    7938              :             "because of std::vector<bool> specialization");
    7939              :         GeneratorWrapper<T> m_generator;
    7940              :         mutable std::vector<T> m_returned;
    7941              :         size_t m_target_repeats;
    7942              :         size_t m_current_repeat = 0;
    7943              :         size_t m_repeat_index = 0;
    7944              :     public:
    7945              :         RepeatGenerator(size_t repeats, GeneratorWrapper<T>&& generator):
    7946              :             m_generator(CATCH_MOVE(generator)),
    7947              :             m_target_repeats(repeats)
    7948              :         {
    7949              :             assert(m_target_repeats > 0 && "Repeat generator must repeat at least once");
    7950              :         }
    7951              : 
    7952              :         T const& get() const override {
    7953              :             if (m_current_repeat == 0) {
    7954              :                 m_returned.push_back(m_generator.get());
    7955              :                 return m_returned.back();
    7956              :             }
    7957              :             return m_returned[m_repeat_index];
    7958              :         }
    7959              : 
    7960              :         bool next() override {
    7961              :             // There are 2 basic cases:
    7962              :             // 1) We are still reading the generator
    7963              :             // 2) We are reading our own cache
    7964              : 
    7965              :             // In the first case, we need to poke the underlying generator.
    7966              :             // If it happily moves, we are left in that state, otherwise it is time to start reading from our cache
    7967              :             if (m_current_repeat == 0) {
    7968              :                 const auto success = m_generator.next();
    7969              :                 if (!success) {
    7970              :                     ++m_current_repeat;
    7971              :                 }
    7972              :                 return m_current_repeat < m_target_repeats;
    7973              :             }
    7974              : 
    7975              :             // In the second case, we need to move indices forward and check that we haven't run up against the end
    7976              :             ++m_repeat_index;
    7977              :             if (m_repeat_index == m_returned.size()) {
    7978              :                 m_repeat_index = 0;
    7979              :                 ++m_current_repeat;
    7980              :             }
    7981              :             return m_current_repeat < m_target_repeats;
    7982              :         }
    7983              :     };
    7984              : 
    7985              :     template <typename T>
    7986              :     GeneratorWrapper<T> repeat(size_t repeats, GeneratorWrapper<T>&& generator) {
    7987              :         return GeneratorWrapper<T>(Catch::Detail::make_unique<RepeatGenerator<T>>(repeats, CATCH_MOVE(generator)));
    7988              :     }
    7989              : 
    7990              :     template <typename T, typename U, typename Func>
    7991              :     class MapGenerator final : public IGenerator<T> {
    7992              :         // TBD: provide static assert for mapping function, for friendly error message
    7993              :         GeneratorWrapper<U> m_generator;
    7994              :         Func m_function;
    7995              :         // To avoid returning dangling reference, we have to save the values
    7996              :         T m_cache;
    7997              :     public:
    7998              :         template <typename F2 = Func>
    7999              :         MapGenerator(F2&& function, GeneratorWrapper<U>&& generator) :
    8000              :             m_generator(CATCH_MOVE(generator)),
    8001              :             m_function(CATCH_FORWARD(function)),
    8002              :             m_cache(m_function(m_generator.get()))
    8003              :         {}
    8004              : 
    8005              :         T const& get() const override {
    8006              :             return m_cache;
    8007              :         }
    8008              :         bool next() override {
    8009              :             const auto success = m_generator.next();
    8010              :             if (success) {
    8011              :                 m_cache = m_function(m_generator.get());
    8012              :             }
    8013              :             return success;
    8014              :         }
    8015              :     };
    8016              : 
    8017              :     template <typename Func, typename U, typename T = FunctionReturnType<Func, U>>
    8018              :     GeneratorWrapper<T> map(Func&& function, GeneratorWrapper<U>&& generator) {
    8019              :         return GeneratorWrapper<T>(
    8020              :             Catch::Detail::make_unique<MapGenerator<T, U, Func>>(CATCH_FORWARD(function), CATCH_MOVE(generator))
    8021              :         );
    8022              :     }
    8023              : 
    8024              :     template <typename T, typename U, typename Func>
    8025              :     GeneratorWrapper<T> map(Func&& function, GeneratorWrapper<U>&& generator) {
    8026              :         return GeneratorWrapper<T>(
    8027              :             Catch::Detail::make_unique<MapGenerator<T, U, Func>>(CATCH_FORWARD(function), CATCH_MOVE(generator))
    8028              :         );
    8029              :     }
    8030              : 
    8031              :     template <typename T>
    8032              :     class ChunkGenerator final : public IGenerator<std::vector<T>> {
    8033              :         std::vector<T> m_chunk;
    8034              :         size_t m_chunk_size;
    8035              :         GeneratorWrapper<T> m_generator;
    8036              :         bool m_used_up = false;
    8037              :     public:
    8038              :         ChunkGenerator(size_t size, GeneratorWrapper<T> generator) :
    8039              :             m_chunk_size(size), m_generator(CATCH_MOVE(generator))
    8040              :         {
    8041              :             m_chunk.reserve(m_chunk_size);
    8042              :             if (m_chunk_size != 0) {
    8043              :                 m_chunk.push_back(m_generator.get());
    8044              :                 for (size_t i = 1; i < m_chunk_size; ++i) {
    8045              :                     if (!m_generator.next()) {
    8046              :                         Detail::throw_generator_exception("Not enough values to initialize the first chunk");
    8047              :                     }
    8048              :                     m_chunk.push_back(m_generator.get());
    8049              :                 }
    8050              :             }
    8051              :         }
    8052              :         std::vector<T> const& get() const override {
    8053              :             return m_chunk;
    8054              :         }
    8055              :         bool next() override {
    8056              :             m_chunk.clear();
    8057              :             for (size_t idx = 0; idx < m_chunk_size; ++idx) {
    8058              :                 if (!m_generator.next()) {
    8059              :                     return false;
    8060              :                 }
    8061              :                 m_chunk.push_back(m_generator.get());
    8062              :             }
    8063              :             return true;
    8064              :         }
    8065              :     };
    8066              : 
    8067              :     template <typename T>
    8068              :     GeneratorWrapper<std::vector<T>> chunk(size_t size, GeneratorWrapper<T>&& generator) {
    8069              :         return GeneratorWrapper<std::vector<T>>(
    8070              :             Catch::Detail::make_unique<ChunkGenerator<T>>(size, CATCH_MOVE(generator))
    8071              :         );
    8072              :     }
    8073              : 
    8074              : } // namespace Generators
    8075              : } // namespace Catch
    8076              : 
    8077              : 
    8078              : #endif // CATCH_GENERATORS_ADAPTERS_HPP_INCLUDED
    8079              : 
    8080              : 
    8081              : #ifndef CATCH_GENERATORS_RANDOM_HPP_INCLUDED
    8082              : #define CATCH_GENERATORS_RANDOM_HPP_INCLUDED
    8083              : 
    8084              : 
    8085              : 
    8086              : #ifndef CATCH_RANDOM_NUMBER_GENERATOR_HPP_INCLUDED
    8087              : #define CATCH_RANDOM_NUMBER_GENERATOR_HPP_INCLUDED
    8088              : 
    8089              : #include <cstdint>
    8090              : 
    8091              : namespace Catch {
    8092              : 
    8093              :     // This is a simple implementation of C++11 Uniform Random Number
    8094              :     // Generator. It does not provide all operators, because Catch2
    8095              :     // does not use it, but it should behave as expected inside stdlib's
    8096              :     // distributions.
    8097              :     // The implementation is based on the PCG family (http://pcg-random.org)
    8098              :     class SimplePcg32 {
    8099              :         using state_type = std::uint64_t;
    8100              :     public:
    8101              :         using result_type = std::uint32_t;
    8102            0 :         static constexpr result_type (min)() {
    8103            0 :             return 0;
    8104              :         }
    8105              :         static constexpr result_type (max)() {
