    8106              :             return static_cast<result_type>(-1);
    8107              :         }
    8108              : 
    8109              :         // Provide some default initial state for the default constructor
    8110            1 :         SimplePcg32():SimplePcg32(0xed743cc4U) {}
    8111              : 
    8112              :         explicit SimplePcg32(result_type seed_);
    8113              : 
    8114              :         void seed(result_type seed_);
    8115              :         void discard(uint64_t skip);
    8116              : 
    8117              :         result_type operator()();
    8118              : 
    8119              :     private:
    8120              :         friend bool operator==(SimplePcg32 const& lhs, SimplePcg32 const& rhs);
    8121              :         friend bool operator!=(SimplePcg32 const& lhs, SimplePcg32 const& rhs);
    8122              : 
    8123              :         // In theory we also need operator<< and operator>>
    8124              :         // In practice we do not use them, so we will skip them for now
    8125              : 
    8126              : 
    8127              :         std::uint64_t m_state;
    8128              :         // This part of the state determines which "stream" of the numbers
    8129              :         // is chosen -- we take it as a constant for Catch2, so we only
    8130              :         // need to deal with seeding the main state.
    8131              :         // Picked by reading 8 bytes from `/dev/random` :-)
    8132              :         static const std::uint64_t s_inc = (0x13ed0cc53f939476ULL << 1ULL) | 1ULL;
    8133              :     };
    8134              : 
    8135              : } // end namespace Catch
    8136              : 
    8137              : #endif // CATCH_RANDOM_NUMBER_GENERATOR_HPP_INCLUDED
    8138              : 
    8139              : 
    8140              : 
    8141              : #ifndef CATCH_UNIFORM_INTEGER_DISTRIBUTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    8142              : #define CATCH_UNIFORM_INTEGER_DISTRIBUTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    8143              : 
    8144              : 
    8145              : 
    8146              : 
    8147              : #ifndef CATCH_RANDOM_INTEGER_HELPERS_HPP_INCLUDED
    8148              : #define CATCH_RANDOM_INTEGER_HELPERS_HPP_INCLUDED
    8149              : 
    8150              : #include <climits>
    8151              : #include <cstddef>
    8152              : #include <cstdint>
    8153              : #include <type_traits>
    8154              : 
    8155              : // Note: We use the usual enable-disable-autodetect dance here even though
    8156              : //       we do not support these in CMake configuration options (yet?).
    8157              : //       It is highly unlikely that we will need to make these actually
    8158              : //       user-configurable, but this will make it simpler if weend up needing
    8159              : //       it, and it provides an escape hatch to the users who need it.
    8160              : #if defined( __SIZEOF_INT128__ )
    8161              : #    define CATCH_CONFIG_INTERNAL_UINT128
    8162              : // Unlike GCC, MSVC does not polyfill umul as mulh + mul pair on ARM machines.
    8163              : // Currently we do not bother doing this ourselves, but we could if it became
    8164              : // important for perf.
    8165              : #elif defined( _MSC_VER ) && defined( _M_X64 )
    8166              : #    define CATCH_CONFIG_INTERNAL_MSVC_UMUL128
    8167              : #endif
    8168              : 
    8169              : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_INTERNAL_UINT128 ) && \
    8170              :     !defined( CATCH_CONFIG_NO_UINT128 ) &&      \
    8171              :     !defined( CATCH_CONFIG_UINT128 )
    8172              : #define CATCH_CONFIG_UINT128
    8173              : #endif
    8174              : 
    8175              : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_INTERNAL_MSVC_UMUL128 ) && \
    8176              :     !defined( CATCH_CONFIG_NO_MSVC_UMUL128 ) &&      \
    8177              :     !defined( CATCH_CONFIG_MSVC_UMUL128 )
    8178              : #    define CATCH_CONFIG_MSVC_UMUL128
    8179              : #    include <intrin.h>
    8180              : #endif
    8181              : 
    8182              : 
    8183              : namespace Catch {
    8184              :     namespace Detail {
    8185              : 
    8186              :         template <std::size_t>
    8187              :         struct SizedUnsignedType;
    8188              : #define SizedUnsignedTypeHelper( TYPE )        \
    8189              :     template <>                                \
    8190              :     struct SizedUnsignedType<sizeof( TYPE )> { \
    8191              :         using type = TYPE;                     \
    8192              :     }
    8193              : 
    8194              :         SizedUnsignedTypeHelper( std::uint8_t );
    8195              :         SizedUnsignedTypeHelper( std::uint16_t );
    8196              :         SizedUnsignedTypeHelper( std::uint32_t );
    8197              :         SizedUnsignedTypeHelper( std::uint64_t );
    8198              : #undef SizedUnsignedTypeHelper
    8199              : 
    8200              :         template <std::size_t sz>
    8201              :         using SizedUnsignedType_t = typename SizedUnsignedType<sz>::type;
    8202              : 
    8203              :         template <typename T>
    8204              :         using DoubleWidthUnsignedType_t = SizedUnsignedType_t<2 * sizeof( T )>;
    8205              : 
    8206              :         template <typename T>
    8207              :         struct ExtendedMultResult {
    8208              :             T upper;
    8209              :             T lower;
    8210              :             constexpr bool operator==( ExtendedMultResult const& rhs ) const {
    8211              :                 return upper == rhs.upper && lower == rhs.lower;
    8212              :             }
    8213              :         };
    8214              : 
    8215              :         /**
    8216              :          * Returns 128 bit result of lhs * rhs using portable C++ code
    8217              :          *
    8218              :          * This implementation is almost twice as fast as naive long multiplication,
    8219              :          * and unlike intrinsic-based approach, it supports constexpr evaluation.
    8220              :          */
    8221              :         constexpr ExtendedMultResult<std::uint64_t>
    8222              :         extendedMultPortable(std::uint64_t lhs, std::uint64_t rhs) {
    8223              : #define CarryBits( x ) ( x >> 32 )
    8224              : #define Digits( x ) ( x & 0xFF'FF'FF'FF )
    8225              :             std::uint64_t lhs_low = Digits( lhs );
    8226              :             std::uint64_t rhs_low = Digits( rhs );
    8227              :             std::uint64_t low_low = ( lhs_low * rhs_low );
    8228              :             std::uint64_t high_high = CarryBits( lhs ) * CarryBits( rhs );
    8229              : 
    8230              :             // We add in carry bits from low-low already
    8231              :             std::uint64_t high_low =
    8232              :                 ( CarryBits( lhs ) * rhs_low ) + CarryBits( low_low );
    8233              :             // Note that we can add only low bits from high_low, to avoid
    8234              :             // overflow with large inputs
    8235              :             std::uint64_t low_high =
    8236              :                 ( lhs_low * CarryBits( rhs ) ) + Digits( high_low );
    8237              : 
    8238              :             return { high_high + CarryBits( high_low ) + CarryBits( low_high ),
    8239              :                      ( low_high << 32 ) | Digits( low_low ) };
    8240              : #undef CarryBits
    8241              : #undef Digits
    8242              :         }
    8243              : 
    8244              :         //! Returns 128 bit result of lhs * rhs
    8245              :         inline ExtendedMultResult<std::uint64_t>
    8246            0 :         extendedMult( std::uint64_t lhs, std::uint64_t rhs ) {
    8247              : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_UINT128 )
    8248            0 :             auto result = __uint128_t( lhs ) * __uint128_t( rhs );
    8249            0 :             return { static_cast<std::uint64_t>( result >> 64 ),
    8250            0 :                      static_cast<std::uint64_t>( result ) };
    8251              : #elif defined( CATCH_CONFIG_MSVC_UMUL128 )
    8252              :             std::uint64_t high;
    8253              :             std::uint64_t low = _umul128( lhs, rhs, &high );
    8254              :             return { high, low };
    8255              : #else
    8256              :             return extendedMultPortable( lhs, rhs );
    8257              : #endif
    8258              :         }
    8259              : 
    8260              : 
    8261              :         template <typename UInt>
    8262              :         constexpr ExtendedMultResult<UInt> extendedMult( UInt lhs, UInt rhs ) {
    8263              :             static_assert( std::is_unsigned<UInt>::value,
    8264              :                            "extendedMult can only handle unsigned integers" );
    8265              :             static_assert( sizeof( UInt ) < sizeof( std::uint64_t ),
    8266              :                            "Generic extendedMult can only handle types smaller "
    8267              :                            "than uint64_t" );
    8268              :             using WideType = DoubleWidthUnsignedType_t<UInt>;
    8269              : 
    8270              :             auto result = WideType( lhs ) * WideType( rhs );
    8271              :             return {
    8272              :                 static_cast<UInt>( result >> ( CHAR_BIT * sizeof( UInt ) ) ),
    8273              :                 static_cast<UInt>( result & UInt( -1 ) ) };
    8274              :         }
    8275              : 
    8276              : 
    8277              :         template <typename TargetType,
    8278              :                   typename Generator>
    8279              :             std::enable_if_t<sizeof(typename Generator::result_type) >= sizeof(TargetType),
    8280            1 :             TargetType> fillBitsFrom(Generator& gen) {
    8281              :             using gresult_type = typename Generator::result_type;
    8282              :             static_assert( std::is_unsigned<TargetType>::value, "Only unsigned integers are supported" );
    8283              :             static_assert( Generator::min() == 0 &&
    8284              :                            Generator::max() == static_cast<gresult_type>( -1 ),
    8285              :                            "Generator must be able to output all numbers in its result type (effectively it must be a random bit generator)" );
    8286              : 
    8287              :             // We want to return the top bits from a generator, as they are
    8288              :             // usually considered higher quality.
    8289            1 :             constexpr auto generated_bits = sizeof( gresult_type ) * CHAR_BIT;
    8290            1 :             constexpr auto return_bits = sizeof( TargetType ) * CHAR_BIT;
    8291              : 
    8292            1 :             return static_cast<TargetType>( gen() >>
    8293            1 :                                             ( generated_bits - return_bits) );
    8294              :         }
    8295              : 
    8296              :         template <typename TargetType,
    8297              :                   typename Generator>
    8298              :             std::enable_if_t<sizeof(typename Generator::result_type) < sizeof(TargetType),
    8299            0 :             TargetType> fillBitsFrom(Generator& gen) {
    8300              :             using gresult_type = typename Generator::result_type;
    8301              :             static_assert( std::is_unsigned<TargetType>::value,
    8302              :                            "Only unsigned integers are supported" );
    8303              :             static_assert( Generator::min() == 0 &&
    8304              :                            Generator::max() == static_cast<gresult_type>( -1 ),
    8305              :                            "Generator must be able to output all numbers in its result type (effectively it must be a random bit generator)" );
    8306              : 
    8307            0 :             constexpr auto generated_bits = sizeof( gresult_type ) * CHAR_BIT;
    8308            0 :             constexpr auto return_bits = sizeof( TargetType ) * CHAR_BIT;
    8309            0 :             std::size_t filled_bits = 0;
    8310            0 :             TargetType ret = 0;
    8311              :             do {
    8312            0 :                 ret <<= generated_bits;
    8313            0 :                 ret |= gen();
    8314            0 :                 filled_bits += generated_bits;
    8315            0 :             } while ( filled_bits < return_bits );
    8316              : 
    8317            0 :             return ret;
    8318              :         }
    8319              : 
    8320              :         /*
    8321              :          * Transposes numbers into unsigned type while keeping their ordering
    8322              :          *
    8323              :          * This means that signed types are changed so that the ordering is
    8324              :          * [INT_MIN, ..., -1, 0, ..., INT_MAX], rather than order we would
    8325              :          * get by simple casting ([0, ..., INT_MAX, INT_MIN, ..., -1])
    8326              :          */
    8327              :         template <typename OriginalType, typename UnsignedType>
    8328              :         constexpr
    8329              :         std::enable_if_t<std::is_signed<OriginalType>::value, UnsignedType>
    8330              :         transposeToNaturalOrder( UnsignedType in ) {
    8331              :             static_assert(
    8332              :                 sizeof( OriginalType ) == sizeof( UnsignedType ),
    8333              :                 "reordering requires the same sized types on both sides" );
    8334              :             static_assert( std::is_unsigned<UnsignedType>::value,
    8335              :                            "Input type must be unsigned" );
    8336              :             // Assuming 2s complement (standardized in current C++), the
    8337              :             // positive and negative numbers are already internally ordered,
    8338              :             // and their difference is in the top bit. Swapping it orders
    8339              :             // them the desired way.
    8340              :             constexpr auto highest_bit =
    8341              :                 UnsignedType( 1 ) << ( sizeof( UnsignedType ) * CHAR_BIT - 1 );
    8342              :             return static_cast<UnsignedType>( in ^ highest_bit );
    8343              :         }
    8344              : 
    8345              : 
    8346              : 
    8347              :         template <typename OriginalType,
    8348              :                   typename UnsignedType>
    8349              :         constexpr
    8350              :         std::enable_if_t<std::is_unsigned<OriginalType>::value, UnsignedType>
    8351            0 :             transposeToNaturalOrder(UnsignedType in) {
    8352              :             static_assert(
    8353              :                 sizeof( OriginalType ) == sizeof( UnsignedType ),
    8354              :                 "reordering requires the same sized types on both sides" );
    8355              :             static_assert( std::is_unsigned<UnsignedType>::value, "Input type must be unsigned" );
    8356              :             // No reordering is needed for unsigned -> unsigned
    8357            0 :             return in;
    8358              :         }
    8359              :     } // namespace Detail
    8360              : } // namespace Catch
    8361              : 
    8362              : #endif // CATCH_RANDOM_INTEGER_HELPERS_HPP_INCLUDED
    8363              : 
    8364              : namespace Catch {
    8365              : 
    8366              : /**
    8367              :  * Implementation of uniform distribution on integers.
    8368              :  *
    8369              :  * Unlike `std::uniform_int_distribution`, this implementation supports
    8370              :  * various 1 byte integral types, including bool (but you should not
    8371              :  * actually use it for bools).
    8372              :  *
    8373              :  * The underlying algorithm is based on the one described in "Fast Random
    8374              :  * Integer Generation in an Interval" by Daniel Lemire, but has been
    8375              :  * optimized under the assumption of reuse of the same distribution object.
    8376              :  */
    8377              : template <typename IntegerType>
    8378              : class uniform_integer_distribution {
    8379              :     static_assert(std::is_integral<IntegerType>::value, "...");
    8380              : 
    8381              :     using UnsignedIntegerType = Detail::SizedUnsignedType_t<sizeof(IntegerType)>;
    8382              : 
    8383              :     // Only the left bound is stored, and we store it converted to its
    8384              :     // unsigned image. This avoids having to do the conversions inside
    8385              :     // the operator(), at the cost of having to do the conversion in
    8386              :     // the a() getter. The right bound is only needed in the b() getter,
    8387              :     // so we recompute it there from other stored data.
    8388              :     UnsignedIntegerType m_a;
    8389              : 
    8390              :     // How many different values are there in [a, b]. a == b => 1, can be 0 for distribution over all values in the type.
    8391              :     UnsignedIntegerType m_ab_distance;
    8392              : 
    8393              :     // We hoisted this out of the main generation function. Technically,
    8394              :     // this means that using this distribution will be slower than Lemire's
    8395              :     // algorithm if this distribution instance will be used only few times,
    8396              :     // but it will be faster if it is used many times. Since Catch2 uses
    8397              :     // distributions only to implement random generators, we assume that each
    8398              :     // distribution will be reused many times and this is an optimization.
    8399              :     UnsignedIntegerType m_rejection_threshold = 0;
    8400              : 
    8401            0 :     static constexpr UnsignedIntegerType computeDistance(IntegerType a, IntegerType b) {
    8402              :         // This overflows and returns 0 if a == 0 and b == TYPE_MAX.
    8403              :         // We handle that later when generating the number.
    8404            0 :         return transposeTo(b) - transposeTo(a) + 1;
    8405              :     }
    8406              : 
    8407            0 :     static constexpr UnsignedIntegerType computeRejectionThreshold(UnsignedIntegerType ab_distance) {
    8408              :         // distance == 0 means that we will return all possible values from
    8409              :         // the type's range, and that we shouldn't reject anything.
    8410            0 :         if ( ab_distance == 0 ) { return 0; }
    8411            0 :         return ( ~ab_distance + 1 ) % ab_distance;
    8412              :     }
    8413              : 
    8414            0 :     static constexpr UnsignedIntegerType transposeTo(IntegerType in) {
    8415            0 :         return Detail::transposeToNaturalOrder<IntegerType>(
    8416            0 :             static_cast<UnsignedIntegerType>( in ) );
    8417              :     }
    8418            0 :     static constexpr IntegerType transposeBack(UnsignedIntegerType in) {
    8419              :         return static_cast<IntegerType>(
    8420            0 :             Detail::transposeToNaturalOrder<IntegerType>(in) );
    8421              :     }
    8422              : 
    8423              : public:
    8424              :     using result_type = IntegerType;
    8425              : 
    8426            0 :     constexpr uniform_integer_distribution( IntegerType a, IntegerType b ):
    8427            0 :         m_a( transposeTo(a) ),
    8428            0 :         m_ab_distance( computeDistance(a, b) ),
    8429            0 :         m_rejection_threshold( computeRejectionThreshold(m_ab_distance) ) {
    8430            0 :         assert( a <= b );
    8431            0 :     }
    8432              : 
    8433              :     template <typename Generator>
    8434            0 :     constexpr result_type operator()( Generator& g ) {
    8435              :         // All possible values of result_type are valid.
    8436            0 :         if ( m_ab_distance == 0 ) {
    8437            0 :             return transposeBack( Detail::fillBitsFrom<UnsignedIntegerType>( g ) );
    8438              :         }
    8439              : 
    8440            0 :         auto random_number = Detail::fillBitsFrom<UnsignedIntegerType>( g );
    8441            0 :         auto emul = Detail::extendedMult( random_number, m_ab_distance );
    8442              :         // Unlike Lemire's algorithm we skip the ab_distance check, since
    8443              :         // we precomputed the rejection threshold, which is always tighter.
    8444            0 :         while (emul.lower < m_rejection_threshold) {
    8445            0 :             random_number = Detail::fillBitsFrom<UnsignedIntegerType>( g );
    8446            0 :             emul = Detail::extendedMult( random_number, m_ab_distance );
    8447              :         }
    8448              : 
    8449            0 :         return transposeBack(m_a + emul.upper);
    8450              :     }
    8451              : 
    8452              :     constexpr result_type a() const { return transposeBack(m_a); }
    8453              :     constexpr result_type b() const { return transposeBack(m_ab_distance + m_a - 1); }
    8454              : };
    8455              : 
    8456              : } // end namespace Catch
    8457              : 
    8458              : #endif // CATCH_UNIFORM_INTEGER_DISTRIBUTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    8459              : 
    8460              : 
    8461              : 
    8462              : #ifndef CATCH_UNIFORM_FLOATING_POINT_DISTRIBUTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    8463              : #define CATCH_UNIFORM_FLOATING_POINT_DISTRIBUTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    8464              : 
    8465              : 
    8466              : 
    8467              : 
    8468              : #ifndef CATCH_RANDOM_FLOATING_POINT_HELPERS_HPP_INCLUDED
    8469              : #define CATCH_RANDOM_FLOATING_POINT_HELPERS_HPP_INCLUDED
    8470              : 
    8471              : 
    8472              : 
    8473              : #ifndef CATCH_POLYFILLS_HPP_INCLUDED
    8474              : #define CATCH_POLYFILLS_HPP_INCLUDED
    8475              : 
    8476              : namespace Catch {
    8477              : 
    8478              :     bool isnan(float f);
    8479              :     bool isnan(double d);
    8480              : 
    8481              :     float nextafter(float x, float y);
    8482              :     double nextafter(double x, double y);
    8483              : 
    8484              : }
    8485              : 
    8486              : #endif // CATCH_POLYFILLS_HPP_INCLUDED
    8487              : 
    8488              : #include <cassert>
    8489              : #include <cmath>
    8490              : #include <cstdint>
    8491              : #include <limits>
    8492              : #include <type_traits>
    8493              : 
    8494              : namespace Catch {
    8495              : 
    8496              :     namespace Detail {
    8497              :         /**
    8498              :          * Returns the largest magnitude of 1-ULP distance inside the [a, b] range.
    8499              :          *
    8500              :          * Assumes `a < b`.
    8501              :          */
    8502              :         template <typename FloatType>
    8503              :         FloatType gamma(FloatType a, FloatType b) {
    8504              :             static_assert( std::is_floating_point<FloatType>::value,
    8505              :                            "gamma returns the largest ULP magnitude within "
    8506              :                            "floating point range [a, b]. This only makes sense "
    8507              :                            "for floating point types" );
    8508              :             assert( a <= b );
    8509              : 
    8510              :             const auto gamma_up = Catch::nextafter( a, std::numeric_limits<FloatType>::infinity() ) - a;
    8511              :             const auto gamma_down = b - Catch::nextafter( b, -std::numeric_limits<FloatType>::infinity() );
    8512              : 
    8513              :             return gamma_up < gamma_down ? gamma_down : gamma_up;
    8514              :         }
    8515              : 
    8516              :         template <typename FloatingPoint>
    8517              :         struct DistanceTypePicker;
    8518              :         template <>
    8519              :         struct DistanceTypePicker<float> {
    8520              :             using type = std::uint32_t;
    8521              :         };
    8522              :         template <>
    8523              :         struct DistanceTypePicker<double> {
    8524              :             using type = std::uint64_t;
    8525              :         };
    8526              : 
    8527              :         template <typename T>
    8528              :         using DistanceType = typename DistanceTypePicker<T>::type;
    8529              : 
    8530              : #if defined( __GNUC__ ) || defined( __clang__ )
    8531              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic push
    8532              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal"
    8533              : #endif
    8534              :         /**
    8535              :          * Computes the number of equi-distant floats in [a, b]
    8536              :          *
    8537              :          * Since not every range can be split into equidistant floats
    8538              :          * exactly, we actually compute ceil(b/distance - a/distance),
    8539              :          * because in those cases we want to overcount.
    8540              :          *
    8541              :          * Uses modified Dekker's FastTwoSum algorithm to handle rounding.
    8542              :          */
    8543              :         template <typename FloatType>
    8544              :         DistanceType<FloatType>
    8545              :         count_equidistant_floats( FloatType a, FloatType b, FloatType distance ) {
    8546              :             assert( a <= b );
    8547              :             // We get distance as gamma for our uniform float distribution,
    8548              :             // so this will round perfectly.
    8549              :             const auto ag = a / distance;
    8550              :             const auto bg = b / distance;
    8551              : 
    8552              :             const auto s = bg - ag;
    8553              :             const auto err = ( std::fabs( a ) <= std::fabs( b ) )
    8554              :                                  ? -ag - ( s - bg )
    8555              :                                  : bg - ( s + ag );
    8556              :             const auto ceil_s = static_cast<DistanceType<FloatType>>( std::ceil( s ) );
    8557              : 
    8558              :             return ( ceil_s != s ) ? ceil_s : ceil_s + ( err > 0 );
    8559              :         }
    8560              : #if defined( __GNUC__ ) || defined( __clang__ )
    8561              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic pop
    8562              : #endif
    8563              : 
    8564              :     }
    8565              : 
    8566              : } // end namespace Catch
    8567              : 
    8568              : #endif // CATCH_RANDOM_FLOATING_POINT_HELPERS_HPP_INCLUDED
    8569              : 
    8570              : #include <cmath>
    8571              : #include <type_traits>
    8572              : 
    8573              : namespace Catch {
    8574              : 
    8575              :     namespace Detail {
    8576              : #if defined( __GNUC__ ) || defined( __clang__ )
    8577              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic push
    8578              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal"
    8579              : #endif
    8580              :         // The issue with overflow only happens with maximal ULP and HUGE
    8581              :         // distance, e.g. when generating numbers in [-inf, inf] for given
    8582              :         // type. So we only check for the largest possible ULP in the
    8583              :         // type, and return something that does not overflow to inf in 1 mult.
    8584              :         constexpr std::uint64_t calculate_max_steps_in_one_go(double gamma) {
    8585              :             if ( gamma == 1.99584030953472e+292 ) { return 9007199254740991; }
    8586              :             return static_cast<std::uint64_t>( -1 );
    8587              :         }
    8588              :         constexpr std::uint32_t calculate_max_steps_in_one_go(float gamma) {
    8589              :             if ( gamma == 2.028241e+31f ) { return 16777215; }
    8590              :             return static_cast<std::uint32_t>( -1 );
    8591              :         }
    8592              : #if defined( __GNUC__ ) || defined( __clang__ )
    8593              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic pop
    8594              : #endif
    8595              :     }
    8596              : 
    8597              : /**
    8598              :  * Implementation of uniform distribution on floating point numbers.
    8599              :  *
    8600              :  * Note that we support only `float` and `double` types, because these
    8601              :  * usually mean the same thing across different platform. `long double`
    8602              :  * varies wildly by platform and thus we cannot provide reproducible
    8603              :  * implementation. Also note that we don't implement all parts of
    8604              :  * distribution per standard: this distribution is not serializable, nor
    8605              :  * can the range be arbitrarily reset.
    8606              :  *
    8607              :  * The implementation also uses different approach than the one taken by
    8608              :  * `std::uniform_real_distribution`, where instead of generating a number
    8609              :  * between [0, 1) and then multiplying the range bounds with it, we first
    8610              :  * split the [a, b] range into a set of equidistributed floating point
    8611              :  * numbers, and then use uniform int distribution to pick which one to
    8612              :  * return.
    8613              :  *
    8614              :  * This has the advantage of guaranteeing uniformity (the multiplication
    8615              :  * method loses uniformity due to rounding when multiplying floats), except
    8616              :  * for small non-uniformity at one side of the interval, where we have
    8617              :  * to deal with the fact that not every interval is splittable into
    8618              :  * equidistributed floats.
    8619              :  *
    8620              :  * Based on "Drawing random floating-point numbers from an interval" by
    8621              :  * Frederic Goualard.
    8622              :  */
    8623              : template <typename FloatType>
    8624              : class uniform_floating_point_distribution {
    8625              :     static_assert(std::is_floating_point<FloatType>::value, "...");
    8626              :     static_assert(!std::is_same<FloatType, long double>::value,
    8627              :                   "We do not support long double due to inconsistent behaviour between platforms");
    8628              : 
    8629              :     using WidthType = Detail::DistanceType<FloatType>;
    8630              : 
    8631              :     FloatType m_a, m_b;
    8632              :     FloatType m_ulp_magnitude;
    8633              :     WidthType m_floats_in_range;
    8634              :     uniform_integer_distribution<WidthType> m_int_dist;
    8635              : 
    8636              :     // In specific cases, we can overflow into `inf` when computing the
    8637              :     // `steps * g` offset. To avoid this, we don't offset by more than this
    8638              :     // in one multiply + addition.
    8639              :     WidthType m_max_steps_in_one_go;
    8640              :     // We don't want to do the magnitude check every call to `operator()`
    8641              :     bool m_a_has_leq_magnitude;
    8642              : 
    8643              : public:
    8644              :     using result_type = FloatType;
    8645              : 
    8646              :     uniform_floating_point_distribution( FloatType a, FloatType b ):
    8647              :         m_a( a ),
    8648              :         m_b( b ),
    8649              :         m_ulp_magnitude( Detail::gamma( m_a, m_b ) ),
    8650              :         m_floats_in_range( Detail::count_equidistant_floats( m_a, m_b, m_ulp_magnitude ) ),
    8651              :         m_int_dist(0, m_floats_in_range),
    8652              :         m_max_steps_in_one_go( Detail::calculate_max_steps_in_one_go(m_ulp_magnitude)),
    8653              :         m_a_has_leq_magnitude(std::fabs(m_a) <= std::fabs(m_b))
    8654              :     {
    8655              :         assert( a <= b );
    8656              :     }
    8657              : 
    8658              :     template <typename Generator>
    8659              :     result_type operator()( Generator& g ) {
    8660              :         WidthType steps = m_int_dist( g );
    8661              :         if ( m_a_has_leq_magnitude ) {
    8662              :             if ( steps == m_floats_in_range ) { return m_a; }
    8663              :             auto b = m_b;
    8664              :             while (steps > m_max_steps_in_one_go) {
    8665              :                 b -= m_max_steps_in_one_go * m_ulp_magnitude;
    8666              :                 steps -= m_max_steps_in_one_go;
    8667              :             }
    8668              :             return b - steps * m_ulp_magnitude;
    8669              :         } else {
    8670              :             if ( steps == m_floats_in_range ) { return m_b; }
    8671              :             auto a = m_a;
    8672              :             while (steps > m_max_steps_in_one_go) {
    8673              :                 a += m_max_steps_in_one_go * m_ulp_magnitude;
    8674              :                 steps -= m_max_steps_in_one_go;
    8675              :             }
    8676              :             return a + steps * m_ulp_magnitude;
    8677              :         }
    8678              :     }
    8679              : 
    8680              :     result_type a() const { return m_a; }
    8681              :     result_type b() const { return m_b; }
    8682              : };
    8683              : 
    8684              : } // end namespace Catch
    8685              : 
    8686              : #endif // CATCH_UNIFORM_FLOATING_POINT_DISTRIBUTION_HPP_INCLUDED
    8687              : 
    8688              : namespace Catch {
    8689              : namespace Generators {
    8690              : namespace Detail {
    8691              :     // Returns a suitable seed for a random floating generator based off
    8692              :     // the primary internal rng. It does so by taking current value from
    8693              :     // the rng and returning it as the seed.
    8694              :     std::uint32_t getSeed();
    8695              : }
    8696              : 
    8697              : template <typename Float>
    8698              : class RandomFloatingGenerator final : public IGenerator<Float> {
    8699              :     Catch::SimplePcg32 m_rng;
    8700              :     Catch::uniform_floating_point_distribution<Float> m_dist;
    8701              :     Float m_current_number;
    8702              : public:
    8703              :     RandomFloatingGenerator( Float a, Float b, std::uint32_t seed ):
    8704              :         m_rng(seed),
    8705              :         m_dist(a, b) {
    8706              :         static_cast<void>(next());
    8707              :     }
    8708              : 
    8709              :     Float const& get() const override {
    8710              :         return m_current_number;
    8711              :     }
    8712              :     bool next() override {
    8713              :         m_current_number = m_dist(m_rng);
    8714              :         return true;
    8715              :     }
    8716              : };
    8717              : 
    8718              : template <>
    8719              : class RandomFloatingGenerator<long double> final : public IGenerator<long double> {
    8720              :     // We still rely on <random> for this specialization, but we don't
    8721              :     // want to drag it into the header.
    8722              :     struct PImpl;
    8723              :     Catch::Detail::unique_ptr<PImpl> m_pimpl;
    8724              :     long double m_current_number;
    8725              : 
    8726              : public:
    8727              :     RandomFloatingGenerator( long double a, long double b, std::uint32_t seed );
    8728              : 
    8729            0 :     long double const& get() const override { return m_current_number; }
    8730              :     bool next() override;
    8731              : 
    8732              :     ~RandomFloatingGenerator() override; // = default
    8733              : };
    8734              : 
    8735              : template <typename Integer>
    8736              : class RandomIntegerGenerator final : public IGenerator<Integer> {
    8737              :     Catch::SimplePcg32 m_rng;
    8738              :     Catch::uniform_integer_distribution<Integer> m_dist;
    8739              :     Integer m_current_number;
    8740              : public:
    8741              :     RandomIntegerGenerator( Integer a, Integer b, std::uint32_t seed ):
    8742              :         m_rng(seed),
    8743              :         m_dist(a, b) {
    8744              :         static_cast<void>(next());
    8745              :     }
    8746              : 
    8747              :     Integer const& get() const override {
    8748              :         return m_current_number;
    8749              :     }
    8750              :     bool next() override {
    8751              :         m_current_number = m_dist(m_rng);
    8752              :         return true;
    8753              :     }
    8754              : };
    8755              : 
    8756              : template <typename T>
    8757              : std::enable_if_t<std::is_integral<T>::value, GeneratorWrapper<T>>
    8758              : random(T a, T b) {
    8759              :     return GeneratorWrapper<T>(
    8760              :         Catch::Detail::make_unique<RandomIntegerGenerator<T>>(a, b, Detail::getSeed())
    8761              :     );
    8762              : }
    8763              : 
    8764              : template <typename T>
    8765              : std::enable_if_t<std::is_floating_point<T>::value,
    8766              : GeneratorWrapper<T>>
    8767              : random(T a, T b) {
    8768              :     return GeneratorWrapper<T>(
    8769              :         Catch::Detail::make_unique<RandomFloatingGenerator<T>>(a, b, Detail::getSeed())
    8770              :     );
    8771              : }
    8772              : 
    8773              : 
    8774              : } // namespace Generators
    8775              : } // namespace Catch
    8776              : 
    8777              : 
    8778              : #endif // CATCH_GENERATORS_RANDOM_HPP_INCLUDED
    8779              : 
    8780              : 
    8781              : #ifndef CATCH_GENERATORS_RANGE_HPP_INCLUDED
    8782              : #define CATCH_GENERATORS_RANGE_HPP_INCLUDED
    8783              : 
    8784              : 
    8785              : #include <iterator>
    8786              : #include <type_traits>
    8787              : 
    8788              : namespace Catch {
    8789              : namespace Generators {
    8790              : 
    8791              : 
    8792              : template <typename T>
    8793              : class RangeGenerator final : public IGenerator<T> {
    8794              :     T m_current;
    8795              :     T m_end;
    8796              :     T m_step;
    8797              :     bool m_positive;
    8798              : 
    8799              : public:
    8800              :     RangeGenerator(T const& start, T const& end, T const& step):
    8801              :         m_current(start),
    8802              :         m_end(end),
    8803              :         m_step(step),
    8804              :         m_positive(m_step > T(0))
    8805              :     {
    8806              :         assert(m_current != m_end && "Range start and end cannot be equal");
    8807              :         assert(m_step != T(0) && "Step size cannot be zero");
    8808              :         assert(((m_positive && m_current <= m_end) || (!m_positive && m_current >= m_end)) && "Step moves away from end");
    8809              :     }
    8810              : 
    8811              :     RangeGenerator(T const& start, T const& end):
    8812              :         RangeGenerator(start, end, (start < end) ? T(1) : T(-1))
    8813              :     {}
    8814              : 
    8815              :     T const& get() const override {
    8816              :         return m_current;
    8817              :     }
    8818              : 
    8819              :     bool next() override {
    8820              :         m_current += m_step;
    8821              :         return (m_positive) ? (m_current < m_end) : (m_current > m_end);
    8822              :     }
    8823              : };
    8824              : 
    8825              : template <typename T>
    8826              : GeneratorWrapper<T> range(T const& start, T const& end, T const& step) {
    8827              :     static_assert(std::is_arithmetic<T>::value && !std::is_same<T, bool>::value, "Type must be numeric");
    8828              :     return GeneratorWrapper<T>(Catch::Detail::make_unique<RangeGenerator<T>>(start, end, step));
    8829              : }
    8830              : 
    8831              : template <typename T>
    8832              : GeneratorWrapper<T> range(T const& start, T const& end) {
    8833              :     static_assert(std::is_integral<T>::value && !std::is_same<T, bool>::value, "Type must be an integer");
    8834              :     return GeneratorWrapper<T>(Catch::Detail::make_unique<RangeGenerator<T>>(start, end));
    8835              : }
    8836              : 
    8837              : 
    8838              : template <typename T>
    8839              : class IteratorGenerator final : public IGenerator<T> {
    8840              :     static_assert(!std::is_same<T, bool>::value,
    8841              :         "IteratorGenerator currently does not support bools"
    8842              :         "because of std::vector<bool> specialization");
    8843              : 
    8844              :     std::vector<T> m_elems;
    8845              :     size_t m_current = 0;
    8846              : public:
    8847              :     template <typename InputIterator, typename InputSentinel>
    8848              :     IteratorGenerator(InputIterator first, InputSentinel last):m_elems(first, last) {
    8849              :         if (m_elems.empty()) {
    8850              :             Detail::throw_generator_exception("IteratorGenerator received no valid values");
    8851              :         }
    8852              :     }
    8853              : 
    8854              :     T const& get() const override {
    8855              :         return m_elems[m_current];
    8856              :     }
    8857              : 
    8858              :     bool next() override {
    8859              :         ++m_current;
    8860              :         return m_current != m_elems.size();
    8861              :     }
    8862              : };
    8863              : 
    8864              : template <typename InputIterator,
    8865              :           typename InputSentinel,
    8866              :           typename ResultType = std::remove_const_t<typename std::iterator_traits<InputIterator>::value_type>>
    8867              : GeneratorWrapper<ResultType> from_range(InputIterator from, InputSentinel to) {
    8868              :     return GeneratorWrapper<ResultType>(Catch::Detail::make_unique<IteratorGenerator<ResultType>>(from, to));
    8869              : }
    8870              : 
    8871              : template <typename Container>
    8872              : auto from_range(Container const& cnt) {
    8873              :     using std::begin;
    8874              :     using std::end;
    8875              :     return from_range( begin( cnt ), end( cnt ) );
    8876              : }
    8877              : 
    8878              : 
    8879              : } // namespace Generators
    8880              : } // namespace Catch
    8881              : 
    8882              : 
    8883              : #endif // CATCH_GENERATORS_RANGE_HPP_INCLUDED
    8884              : 
    8885              : #endif // CATCH_GENERATORS_ALL_HPP_INCLUDED
    8886              : 
    8887              : 
    8888              : /** \file
    8889              :  * This is a convenience header for Catch2's interfaces. It includes
    8890              :  * **all** of Catch2 headers related to interfaces.
    8891              :  *
    8892              :  * Generally the Catch2 users should use specific includes they need,
    8893              :  * but this header can be used instead for ease-of-experimentation, or
    8894              :  * just plain convenience, at the cost of somewhat increased compilation
    8895              :  * times.
    8896              :  *
    8897              :  * When a new header is added to either the `interfaces` folder, or to
    8898              :  * the corresponding internal subfolder, it should be added here.
    8899              :  */
    8900              : 
    8901              : 
    8902              : #ifndef CATCH_INTERFACES_ALL_HPP_INCLUDED
    8903              : #define CATCH_INTERFACES_ALL_HPP_INCLUDED
    8904              : 
    8905              : 
    8906              : 
    8907              : #ifndef CATCH_INTERFACES_REPORTER_HPP_INCLUDED
    8908              : #define CATCH_INTERFACES_REPORTER_HPP_INCLUDED
    8909              : 
    8910              : 
    8911              : #include <map>
    8912              : #include <string>
    8913              : #include <vector>
    8914              : 
    8915              : namespace Catch {
    8916              : 
    8917              :     struct ReporterDescription;

    8921              :     class TestCaseHandle;
    8922              :     class IConfig;
    8923              :     class IStream;
    8924              :     enum class ColourMode : std::uint8_t;
    8925              : 
    8926              :     struct ReporterConfig {
    8927              :         ReporterConfig( IConfig const* _fullConfig,
    8928              :                         Detail::unique_ptr<IStream> _stream,
    8929              :                         ColourMode colourMode,
    8930              :                         std::map<std::string, std::string> customOptions );
    8931              : 
    8932              :         ReporterConfig( ReporterConfig&& ) = default;
    8933              :         ReporterConfig& operator=( ReporterConfig&& ) = default;
    8934              :         ~ReporterConfig(); // = default
    8935              : 
    8936              :         Detail::unique_ptr<IStream> takeStream() &&;
    8937              :         IConfig const* fullConfig() const;
    8938              :         ColourMode colourMode() const;
    8939              :         std::map<std::string, std::string> const& customOptions() const;
    8940              : 
    8941              :     private:
    8942              :         Detail::unique_ptr<IStream> m_stream;

    8944              :         ColourMode m_colourMode;
    8945              :         std::map<std::string, std::string> m_customOptions;
    8946              :     };
    8947              : 
    8948              :     struct AssertionStats {
    8949              :         AssertionStats( AssertionResult const& _assertionResult,
    8950              :                         std::vector<MessageInfo> const& _infoMessages,
    8951              :                         Totals const& _totals );
    8952              : 
    8953            0 :         AssertionStats( AssertionStats const& )              = default;
    8954              :         AssertionStats( AssertionStats && )                  = default;
    8955              :         AssertionStats& operator = ( AssertionStats const& ) = delete;
    8956              :         AssertionStats& operator = ( AssertionStats && )     = delete;
    8957              : 
    8958              :         AssertionResult assertionResult;
    8959              :         std::vector<MessageInfo> infoMessages;
    8960              :         Totals totals;
    8961              :     };
    8962              :

    8965              :                         Counts const& _assertions,

    8967              :                         bool _missingAssertions );

    8974              :

    8977              :                         Totals const& _totals,
    8978              :                         std::string&& _stdOut,
    8979              :                         std::string&& _stdErr,
    8980              :                         bool _aborting );

    8983              :         Totals totals;

    8988              : 
    8989              :     struct TestRunStats {
    8990              :         TestRunStats(   TestRunInfo const& _runInfo,
    8991              :                         Totals const& _totals,
    8992              :                         bool _aborting );
    8993              : 
    8994              :         TestRunInfo runInfo;
    8995              :         Totals totals;
    8996              :         bool aborting;
    8997              :     };
    8998              : 
    8999              :     //! By setting up its preferences, a reporter can modify Catch2's behaviour
    9000              :     //! in some regards, e.g. it can request Catch2 to capture writes to
    9001              :     //! stdout/stderr during test execution, and pass them to the reporter.
    9002              :     struct ReporterPreferences {
    9003              :         //! Catch2 should redirect writes to stdout and pass them to the
    9004              :         //! reporter
    9005              :         bool shouldRedirectStdOut = false;
    9006              :         //! Catch2 should call `Reporter::assertionEnded` even for passing
    9007              :         //! assertions
    9008              :         bool shouldReportAllAssertions = false;
    9009              :         //! Catch2 should call `Reporter::assertionStarting` for all assertions
    9010              :         // Defaults to true for backwards compatibility, but none of our current
    9011              :         // reporters actually want this, and it enables a fast path in assertion
    9012              :         // handling.
    9013              :         bool shouldReportAllAssertionStarts = true;
    9014              :     };
    9015              : 
    9016              :     /**
    9017              :      * The common base for all reporters and event listeners
    9018              :      *
    9019              :      * Implementing classes must also implement:
    9020              :      *
    9021              :      *     //! User-friendly description of the reporter/listener type
    9022              :      *     static std::string getDescription()
    9023              :      *
    9024              :      * Generally shouldn't be derived from by users of Catch2 directly,
    9025              :      * instead they should derive from one of the utility bases that
    9026              :      * derive from this class.
    9027              :      */
    9028              :     class IEventListener {
    9029              :     protected:
    9030              :         //! Derived classes can set up their preferences here
    9031              :         ReporterPreferences m_preferences;
    9032              :         //! The test run's config as filled in from CLI and defaults
    9033              :         IConfig const* m_config;
    9034              : 
    9035              :     public:
    9036            1 :         IEventListener( IConfig const* config ): m_config( config ) {}
    9037              : 
    9038              :         virtual ~IEventListener(); // = default;
    9039              : 
    9040              :         // Implementing class must also provide the following static methods:
    9041              :         // static std::string getDescription();
    9042              : 
    9043            3 :         ReporterPreferences const& getPreferences() const {
    9044            3 :             return m_preferences;
    9045              :         }
    9046              : 
    9047              :         //! Called when no test cases match provided test spec
    9048              :         virtual void noMatchingTestCases( StringRef unmatchedSpec ) = 0;
    9049              :         //! Called for all invalid test specs from the cli
    9050              :         virtual void reportInvalidTestSpec( StringRef invalidArgument ) = 0;
    9051              : 
    9052              :         /**
    9053              :          * Called once in a testing run before tests are started
    9054              :          *
    9055              :          * Not called if tests won't be run (e.g. only listing will happen)
    9056              :          */
    9057              :         virtual void testRunStarting( TestRunInfo const& testRunInfo ) = 0;
    9058              : 
    9059              :         //! Called _once_ for each TEST_CASE, no matter how many times it is entered
    9060              :         virtual void testCaseStarting( TestCaseInfo const& testInfo ) = 0;
    9061              :         //! Called _every time_ a TEST_CASE is entered, including repeats (due to sections)
    9062              :         virtual void testCasePartialStarting( TestCaseInfo const& testInfo, uint64_t partNumber ) = 0;
    9063              :         //! Called when a `SECTION` is being entered. Not called for skipped sections
    9064              :         virtual void sectionStarting( SectionInfo const& sectionInfo ) = 0;
    9065              : 
    9066              :         //! Called when user-code is being probed before the actual benchmark runs
    9067              :         virtual void benchmarkPreparing( StringRef benchmarkName ) = 0;
    9068              :         //! Called after probe but before the user-code is being benchmarked
    9069              :         virtual void benchmarkStarting( BenchmarkInfo const& benchmarkInfo ) = 0;
    9070              :         //! Called with the benchmark results if benchmark successfully finishes
    9071              :         virtual void benchmarkEnded( BenchmarkStats<> const& benchmarkStats ) = 0;
    9072              :         //! Called if running the benchmarks fails for any reason
    9073              :         virtual void benchmarkFailed( StringRef benchmarkName ) = 0;
    9074              : 
    9075              :         //! Called before assertion success/failure is evaluated
    9076              :         virtual void assertionStarting( AssertionInfo const& assertionInfo ) = 0;
    9077              : 
    9078              :         //! Called after assertion was fully evaluated
    9079              :         virtual void assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) = 0;
    9080              : 
    9081              :         //! Called after a `SECTION` has finished running
    9082              :         virtual void sectionEnded( SectionStats const& sectionStats ) = 0;
    9083              :         //! Called _every time_ a TEST_CASE is entered, including repeats (due to sections)
    9084              :         virtual void testCasePartialEnded(TestCaseStats const& testCaseStats, uint64_t partNumber ) = 0;
    9085              :         //! Called _once_ for each TEST_CASE, no matter how many times it is entered
    9086              :         virtual void testCaseEnded( TestCaseStats const& testCaseStats ) = 0;
    9087              :         /**
    9088              :          * Called once after all tests in a testing run are finished
    9089              :          *
    9090              :          * Not called if tests weren't run (e.g. only listings happened)
    9091              :          */
    9092              :         virtual void testRunEnded( TestRunStats const& testRunStats ) = 0;
    9093              : 
    9094              :         /**
    9095              :          * Called with test cases that are skipped due to the test run aborting.
    9096              :          * NOT called for test cases that are explicitly skipped using the `SKIP` macro.
    9097              :          *
    9098              :          * Deprecated - will be removed in the next major release.
    9099              :          */
    9100              :         virtual void skipTest( TestCaseInfo const& testInfo ) = 0;
    9101              : 
    9102              :         //! Called if a fatal error (signal/structured exception) occurred
    9103              :         virtual void fatalErrorEncountered( StringRef error ) = 0;
    9104              : 
    9105              :         //! Writes out information about provided reporters using reporter-specific format
    9106              :         virtual void listReporters(std::vector<ReporterDescription> const& descriptions) = 0;
    9107              :         //! Writes out the provided listeners descriptions using reporter-specific format
    9108              :         virtual void listListeners(std::vector<ListenerDescription> const& descriptions) = 0;
    9109              :         //! Writes out information about provided tests using reporter-specific format
    9110              :         virtual void listTests(std::vector<TestCaseHandle> const& tests) = 0;
    9111              :         //! Writes out information about the provided tags using reporter-specific format
    9112              :         virtual void listTags(std::vector<TagInfo> const& tags) = 0;
    9113              :     };
    9114              :     using IEventListenerPtr = Detail::unique_ptr<IEventListener>;
    9115              : 
    9116              : } // end namespace Catch
    9117              :

    9214              : namespace Catch {
    9215              :     namespace Detail {
    9216              :         //! Provides case-insensitive `op<` semantics when called
    9217              :         struct CaseInsensitiveLess {
    9218              :             bool operator()( StringRef lhs,
    9219              :                              StringRef rhs ) const;
    9220              :         };
    9221              : 
    9222              :         //! Provides case-insensitive `op==` semantics when called
    9223              :         struct CaseInsensitiveEqualTo {
    9224              :             bool operator()( StringRef lhs,
    9225              :                              StringRef rhs ) const;
    9226              :         };
    9227              : 
    9228              :     } // namespace Detail
    9229              : } // namespace Catch

    9232              : 
    9233              : 
    9234              : 
    9235              : /** \file
    9236              :  * Wrapper for ANDROID_LOGWRITE configuration option
    9237              :  *
    9238              :  * We want to default to enabling it when compiled for android, but
    9239              :  * users of the library should also be able to disable it if they want
    9240              :  * to.
    9241              :  */
    9242              : 
    9243              : #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_ANDROID_LOGWRITE_HPP_INCLUDED
    9244              : #define CATCH_CONFIG_ANDROID_LOGWRITE_HPP_INCLUDED
    9245              : 
    9246              : 
    9247              : #if defined(__ANDROID__)
    9248              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_ANDROID_LOGWRITE
    9249              : #endif
    9250              : 
    9251              : 
    9252              : #if defined( CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_ANDROID_LOGWRITE ) && \
    9253              :     !defined( CATCH_CONFIG_NO_ANDROID_LOGWRITE ) &&      \
    9254              :     !defined( CATCH_CONFIG_ANDROID_LOGWRITE )
    9255              : #    define CATCH_CONFIG_ANDROID_LOGWRITE
    9256              : #endif
    9257              : 
    9258              : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_ANDROID_LOGWRITE_HPP_INCLUDED
    9259              : 
    9260              : 
    9261              : 
    9262              : /** \file
    9263              :  * Wrapper for UNCAUGHT_EXCEPTIONS configuration option
    9264              :  *
    9265              :  * For some functionality, Catch2 requires to know whether there is
    9266              :  * an active exception. Because `std::uncaught_exception` is deprecated
    9267              :  * in C++17, we want to use `std::uncaught_exceptions` if possible.
    9268              :  */
    9269              : 
    9270              : #ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_UNCAUGHT_EXCEPTIONS_HPP_INCLUDED
    9271              : #define CATCH_CONFIG_UNCAUGHT_EXCEPTIONS_HPP_INCLUDED
    9272              : 
    9273              : 
    9274              : #if defined(_MSC_VER)
    9275              : #  if _MSC_VER >= 1900 // Visual Studio 2015 or newer
    9276              : #    define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP17_UNCAUGHT_EXCEPTIONS
    9277              : #  endif
    9278              : #endif
    9279              : 
    9280              : 
    9281              : #include <exception>
    9282              : 
    9283              : #if defined(__cpp_lib_uncaught_exceptions) \
    9284              :     && !defined(CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP17_UNCAUGHT_EXCEPTIONS)
    9285              : 
    9286              : #  define CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP17_UNCAUGHT_EXCEPTIONS
    9287              : #endif // __cpp_lib_uncaught_exceptions
    9288              : 
    9289              : 
    9290              : #if defined(CATCH_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP17_UNCAUGHT_EXCEPTIONS) \
    9291              :     && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_NO_CPP17_UNCAUGHT_EXCEPTIONS) \
    9292              :     && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_CPP17_UNCAUGHT_EXCEPTIONS)
    9293              : 
    9294              : #  define CATCH_CONFIG_CPP17_UNCAUGHT_EXCEPTIONS
    9295              : #endif
    9296              : 
    9297              : 
    9298              : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_UNCAUGHT_EXCEPTIONS_HPP_INCLUDED
    9299              : 
    9300              : 
    9301              : #ifndef CATCH_CONSOLE_COLOUR_HPP_INCLUDED
    9302              : #define CATCH_CONSOLE_COLOUR_HPP_INCLUDED
    9303              : 
    9304              : 
    9305              : #include <iosfwd>
    9306              : #include <cstdint>
    9307              : 
    9308              : namespace Catch {
    9309              : 
    9310              :     enum class ColourMode : std::uint8_t;
    9311              :     class IStream;
    9312              : 
    9313              :     struct Colour {
    9314              :         enum Code {
    9315              :             None = 0,
    9316              : 
    9317              :             White,
    9318              :             Red,
    9319              :             Green,
    9320              :             Blue,
    9321              :             Cyan,
    9322              :             Yellow,
    9323              :             Grey,
    9324              : 
    9325              :             Bright = 0x10,
    9326              : 
    9327              :             BrightRed = Bright | Red,
    9328              :             BrightGreen = Bright | Green,
    9329              :             LightGrey = Bright | Grey,
    9330              :             BrightWhite = Bright | White,
    9331              :             BrightYellow = Bright | Yellow,
    9332              : 
    9333              :             // By intention
    9334              :             FileName = LightGrey,
    9335              :             Warning = BrightYellow,
    9336              :             ResultError = BrightRed,
    9337              :             ResultSuccess = BrightGreen,
    9338              :             ResultExpectedFailure = Warning,
    9339              : 
    9340              :             Error = BrightRed,
    9341              :             Success = Green,
    9342              :             Skip = LightGrey,
    9343              : 
    9344              :             OriginalExpression = Cyan,
    9345              :             ReconstructedExpression = BrightYellow,
    9346              : 
    9347              :             SecondaryText = LightGrey,
    9348              :             Headers = White
    9349              :         };
    9350              :     };
    9351              : 
    9352              :     class ColourImpl {
    9353              :     protected:
    9354              :         //! The associated stream of this ColourImpl instance
    9355              :         IStream* m_stream;
    9356              :     public:
    9357            1 :         ColourImpl( IStream* stream ): m_stream( stream ) {}
    9358              : 
    9359              :         //! RAII wrapper around writing specific colour of text using specific
    9360              :         //! colour impl into a stream.
    9361              :         class ColourGuard {
    9362              :             ColourImpl const* m_colourImpl;
    9363              :             Colour::Code m_code;
    9364              :             bool m_engaged = false;
    9365              : 
    9366              :         public:
    9367              :             //! Does **not** engage the guard/start the colour
    9368              :             ColourGuard( Colour::Code code,
    9369              :                          ColourImpl const* colour );
    9370              : 
    9371              :             ColourGuard( ColourGuard const& rhs ) = delete;
    9372              :             ColourGuard& operator=( ColourGuard const& rhs ) = delete;
    9373              : 
    9374              :             ColourGuard( ColourGuard&& rhs ) noexcept;
    9375              :             ColourGuard& operator=( ColourGuard&& rhs ) noexcept;
    9376              : 
    9377              :             //! Removes colour _if_ the guard was engaged
    9378              :             ~ColourGuard();
    9379              : 
    9380              :             /**
    9381              :              * Explicitly engages colour for given stream.
    9382              :              *
    9383              :              * The API based on operator<< should be preferred.
    9384              :              */
    9385              :             ColourGuard& engage( std::ostream& stream ) &;
    9386              :             /**
    9387              :              * Explicitly engages colour for given stream.
    9388              :              *
    9389              :              * The API based on operator<< should be preferred.
    9390              :              */
    9391              :             ColourGuard&& engage( std::ostream& stream ) &&;
    9392              : 
    9393              :         private:
    9394              :             //! Engages the guard and starts using colour
    9395              :             friend std::ostream& operator<<( std::ostream& lhs,
    9396              :                                              ColourGuard& guard ) {
    9397              :                 guard.engageImpl( lhs );
    9398              :                 return lhs;
    9399              :             }
    9400              :             //! Engages the guard and starts using colour
    9401            5 :             friend std::ostream& operator<<( std::ostream& lhs,
    9402              :                                             ColourGuard&& guard) {
    9403            5 :                 guard.engageImpl( lhs );
    9404            5 :                 return lhs;
    9405              :             }
    9406              : 
    9407              :             void engageImpl( std::ostream& stream );
    9408              : 
    9409              :         };
    9410              : 
    9411              :         virtual ~ColourImpl(); // = default
    9412              :         /**
    9413              :          * Creates a guard object for given colour and this colour impl
    9414              :          *
    9415              :          * **Important:**
    9416              :          * the guard starts disengaged, and has to be engaged explicitly.
    9417              :          */
    9418              :         ColourGuard guardColour( Colour::Code colourCode );
    9419              : 
    9420              :     private:
    9421              :         virtual void use( Colour::Code colourCode ) const = 0;
    9422              :     };
    9423              : 
    9424              :     //! Provides ColourImpl based on global config and target compilation platform
    9425              :     Detail::unique_ptr<ColourImpl> makeColourImpl( ColourMode colourSelection,
    9426              :                                                    IStream* stream );
    9427              : 
    9428              :     //! Checks if specific colour impl has been compiled into the binary
    9429              :     bool isColourImplAvailable( ColourMode colourSelection );
    9430              : 
    9431              : } // end namespace Catch
    9432              : 
    9433              : #endif // CATCH_CONSOLE_COLOUR_HPP_INCLUDED

    9453              : #include <cstddef>
    9454              : #include <initializer_list>
    9455              : 
    9456              : // We want a simple polyfill over `std::empty`, `std::size` and so on
    9457              : // for C++14 or C++ libraries with incomplete support.
    9458              : // We also have to handle that MSVC std lib will happily provide these
    9459              : // under older standards.
    9460              : #if defined(CATCH_CPP17_OR_GREATER) || defined(_MSC_VER)
    9461              : 
    9462              : // We are already using this header either way, so there shouldn't
    9463              : // be much additional overhead in including it to get the feature
    9464              : // test macros
    9465              : #include <string>
    9466              : 
    9467              : #  if !defined(__cpp_lib_nonmember_container_access)
    9468              : #      define CATCH_CONFIG_POLYFILL_NONMEMBER_CONTAINER_ACCESS
    9469              : #  endif
    9470              : 
    9471              : #else
    9472              : #define CATCH_CONFIG_POLYFILL_NONMEMBER_CONTAINER_ACCESS
    9473              : #endif
    9474              : 
    9475              : 
    9476              : 
    9477              : namespace Catch {
    9478              : namespace Detail {
    9479              : 
    9480              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_POLYFILL_NONMEMBER_CONTAINER_ACCESS)
    9481              :     template <typename Container>
    9482              :     constexpr auto empty(Container const& cont) -> decltype(cont.empty()) {
    9483              :         return cont.empty();
    9484              :     }
    9485              :     template <typename T, std::size_t N>
    9486              :     constexpr bool empty(const T (&)[N]) noexcept {
    9487              :         // GCC < 7 does not support the const T(&)[] parameter syntax
    9488              :         // so we have to ignore the length explicitly
    9489              :         (void)N;
    9490              :         return false;
    9491              :     }
    9492              :     template <typename T>
    9493              :     constexpr bool empty(std::initializer_list<T> list) noexcept {
    9494              :         return list.size() > 0;
    9495              :     }
    9496              : 
    9497              : 
    9498              :     template <typename Container>
    9499              :     constexpr auto size(Container const& cont) -> decltype(cont.size()) {
    9500              :         return cont.size();
    9501              :     }
    9502              :     template <typename T, std::size_t N>
    9503              :     constexpr std::size_t size(const T(&)[N]) noexcept {
    9504              :         return N;
    9505              :     }
    9506              : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_POLYFILL_NONMEMBER_CONTAINER_ACCESS
    9507              : 
    9508              : } // end namespace Detail
    9509              : } // end namespace Catch

    9530              : 
    9531              : 
    9532              : namespace Catch {
    9533              :     bool isDebuggerActive();
    9534              : }
    9535              : 
    9536              : #if !defined( CATCH_TRAP ) && defined( __clang__ ) && defined( __has_builtin )
    9537              : #    if __has_builtin( __builtin_debugtrap )
    9538              : #        define CATCH_TRAP() __builtin_debugtrap()
    9539              : #    endif
    9540              : #endif
    9541              : 
    9542              : #if !defined( CATCH_TRAP ) && defined( _MSC_VER )
    9543              : #    define CATCH_TRAP() __debugbreak()
    9544              : #endif
    9545              : 
    9546              : #if !defined(CATCH_TRAP) // If we couldn't use compiler-specific impl from above, we get into platform-specific options
    9547              : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_MAC
    9548              : 
    9549              :     #if defined(__i386__) || defined(__x86_64__)
    9550              :         #define CATCH_TRAP() __asm__("int $3\n" : : ) /* NOLINT */
    9551              :     #elif defined(__aarch64__)
    9552              :         #define CATCH_TRAP() __asm__(".inst 0xd43e0000")
    9553              :     #elif defined(__POWERPC__)
    9554              :         #define CATCH_TRAP() __asm__("li r0, 20\nsc\nnop\nli r0, 37\nli r4, 2\nsc\nnop\n" \
    9555              :         : : : "memory","r0","r3","r4" ) /* NOLINT */
    9556              :     #endif
    9557              : 
    9558              : #elif defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_IPHONE)
    9559              : 
    9560              :     // use inline assembler
    9561              :     #if defined(__i386__) || defined(__x86_64__)
    9562              :         #define CATCH_TRAP()  __asm__("int $3")
    9563              :     #elif defined(__aarch64__)
    9564              :         #define CATCH_TRAP()  __asm__(".inst 0xd4200000")
    9565              :     #elif defined(__arm__) && !defined(__thumb__)
    9566              :         #define CATCH_TRAP()  __asm__(".inst 0xe7f001f0")
    9567              :     #elif defined(__arm__) &&  defined(__thumb__)
    9568              :         #define CATCH_TRAP()  __asm__(".inst 0xde01")
    9569              :     #endif
    9570              : 
    9571              : #elif defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_LINUX) || defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_QNX)
    9572              :     // If we can use inline assembler, do it because this allows us to break
    9573              :     // directly at the location of the failing check instead of breaking inside
    9574              :     // raise() called from it, i.e. one stack frame below.
    9575              :     #if defined(__GNUC__) && (defined(__i386) || defined(__x86_64))
    9576              :         #define CATCH_TRAP() asm volatile ("int $3") /* NOLINT */
    9577              :     #else // Fall back to the generic way.
    9578              :         #include <signal.h>
    9579              : 
    9580              :         #define CATCH_TRAP() raise(SIGTRAP)
    9581              :     #endif
    9582              : #elif defined(__MINGW32__)
    9583              :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) void __stdcall DebugBreak();
    9584              :     #define CATCH_TRAP() DebugBreak()
    9585              : #endif
    9586              : #endif // ^^ CATCH_TRAP is not defined yet, so we define it
    9587              : 
    9588              : 
    9589              : #if !defined(CATCH_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER)
    9590              :     #if defined(CATCH_TRAP)
    9591              :         #define CATCH_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() []{ if( Catch::isDebuggerActive() ) { CATCH_TRAP(); } }()
    9592              :     #else
    9593              :         #define CATCH_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() []{}()
    9594              :     #endif
    9595              : #endif
    9596              : 
    9597              : #endif // CATCH_DEBUGGER_HPP_INCLUDED
    9598              : 
    9599              : 
    9600              : #ifndef CATCH_ENFORCE_HPP_INCLUDED
    9601              : #define CATCH_ENFORCE_HPP_INCLUDED
    9602              :

    9604              : #include <exception> // for `std::exception` in no-exception configuration
    9605              :

    9607              : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
