    9609              :     [[noreturn]]
    9610            0 :     void throw_exception(Ex const& e) {
    9611            0 :         throw e;
    9612              :     }
    9613              : #else // ^^ Exceptions are enabled //  Exceptions are disabled vv
    9614              :     [[noreturn]]

    9616              : #endif
    9617              :

    9624              :

    9626              : 
    9627              : #define CATCH_MAKE_MSG(...) \
    9628              :     (Catch::ReusableStringStream() << __VA_ARGS__).str()
    9629              : 
    9630              : #define CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR(...) \
    9631              :     Catch::throw_logic_error(CATCH_MAKE_MSG( CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO << ": Internal Catch2 error: " << __VA_ARGS__))
    9632              : 
    9633              : #define CATCH_ERROR(...) \
    9634              :     Catch::throw_domain_error(CATCH_MAKE_MSG( __VA_ARGS__ ))
    9635              : 
    9636              : #define CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR(...) \
    9637              :     Catch::throw_runtime_error(CATCH_MAKE_MSG( __VA_ARGS__ ))
    9638              : 
    9639              : #define CATCH_ENFORCE( condition, ... ) \
    9640              :     do{ if( !(condition) ) CATCH_ERROR( __VA_ARGS__ ); } while(false)
    9641              :

    9674              : #ifndef CATCH_ERRNO_GUARD_HPP_INCLUDED
    9675              : #define CATCH_ERRNO_GUARD_HPP_INCLUDED
    9676              : 
    9677              : namespace Catch {
    9678              : 
    9679              :     //! Simple RAII class that stores the value of `errno`
    9680              :     //! at construction and restores it at destruction.
    9681              :     class ErrnoGuard {
    9682              :     public:
    9683              :         // Keep these outlined to avoid dragging in macros from <cerrno>
    9684              : 
    9685              :         ErrnoGuard();
    9686              :         ~ErrnoGuard();
    9687              :     private:
    9688              :         int m_oldErrno;
    9689              :     };
    9690              :

    9695              : 
    9696              : #ifndef CATCH_EXCEPTION_TRANSLATOR_REGISTRY_HPP_INCLUDED
    9697              : #define CATCH_EXCEPTION_TRANSLATOR_REGISTRY_HPP_INCLUDED
    9698              : 
    9699              : 
    9700              : #include <string>
    9701              : 
    9702              : namespace Catch {
    9703              : 
    9704              :     class ExceptionTranslatorRegistry : public IExceptionTranslatorRegistry {
    9705              :     public:
    9706              :         ~ExceptionTranslatorRegistry() override;
    9707              :         void registerTranslator( Detail::unique_ptr<IExceptionTranslator>&& translator );
    9708              :         std::string translateActiveException() const override;
    9709              : 
    9710              :     private:
    9711              :         ExceptionTranslators m_translators;
    9712              :     };
    9713              : }
    9714              : 
    9715              : #endif // CATCH_EXCEPTION_TRANSLATOR_REGISTRY_HPP_INCLUDED
    9716              : 
    9717              : 
    9718              : #ifndef CATCH_FATAL_CONDITION_HANDLER_HPP_INCLUDED
    9719              : #define CATCH_FATAL_CONDITION_HANDLER_HPP_INCLUDED
    9720              : 
    9721              : #include <cassert>
    9722              : 
    9723              : namespace Catch {
    9724              : 
    9725              :     /**
    9726              :      * Wrapper for platform-specific fatal error (signals/SEH) handlers
    9727              :      *
    9728              :      * Tries to be cooperative with other handlers, and not step over
    9729              :      * other handlers. This means that unknown structured exceptions
    9730              :      * are passed on, previous signal handlers are called, and so on.
    9731              :      *
    9732              :      * Can only be instantiated once, and assumes that once a signal
    9733              :      * is caught, the binary will end up terminating. Thus, there
    9734              :      */
    9735              :     class FatalConditionHandler {
    9736              :         bool m_started = false;
    9737              : 
    9738              :         // Install/disengage implementation for specific platform.
    9739              :         // Should be if-defed to work on current platform, can assume
    9740              :         // engage-disengage 1:1 pairing.
    9741              :         void engage_platform();
    9742              :         void disengage_platform() noexcept;
    9743              :     public:
    9744              :         // Should also have platform-specific implementations as needed
    9745              :         FatalConditionHandler();
    9746              :         ~FatalConditionHandler();
    9747              : 
    9748          168 :         void engage() {
    9749          168 :             assert(!m_started && "Handler cannot be installed twice.");
    9750          168 :             m_started = true;
    9751          168 :             engage_platform();
    9752          168 :         }
    9753              : 
    9754          168 :         void disengage() noexcept {
    9755          168 :             assert(m_started && "Handler cannot be uninstalled without being installed first");
    9756          168 :             m_started = false;
    9757          168 :             disengage_platform();
    9758          168 :         }
    9759              :     };
    9760              : 
    9761              :     //! Simple RAII guard for (dis)engaging the FatalConditionHandler
    9762              :     class FatalConditionHandlerGuard {
    9763              :         FatalConditionHandler* m_handler;
    9764              :     public:
    9765          168 :         FatalConditionHandlerGuard(FatalConditionHandler* handler):
    9766          168 :             m_handler(handler) {
    9767          168 :             m_handler->engage();
    9768          168 :         }
    9769          168 :         ~FatalConditionHandlerGuard() {
    9770          168 :             m_handler->disengage();
    9771          168 :         }
    9772              :     };
    9773              : 
    9774              : } // end namespace Catch
    9775              : 
    9776              : #endif // CATCH_FATAL_CONDITION_HANDLER_HPP_INCLUDED
    9777              : 
    9778              : 
    9779              : #ifndef CATCH_FLOATING_POINT_HELPERS_HPP_INCLUDED
    9780              : #define CATCH_FLOATING_POINT_HELPERS_HPP_INCLUDED
    9781              : 
    9782              : 
    9783              : #include <cassert>
    9784              : #include <cmath>
    9785              : #include <cstdint>
    9786              : #include <utility>
    9787              : #include <limits>
    9788              : 
    9789              : namespace Catch {
    9790              :     namespace Detail {
    9791              : 
    9792              :         uint32_t convertToBits(float f);
    9793              :         uint64_t convertToBits(double d);
    9794              : 
    9795              :         // Used when we know we want == comparison of two doubles
    9796              :         // to centralize warning suppression
    9797              :         bool directCompare( float lhs, float rhs );
    9798              :         bool directCompare( double lhs, double rhs );
    9799              : 
    9800              :     } // end namespace Detail
    9801              : 
    9802              : 
    9803              : 
    9804              : #if defined( __GNUC__ ) || defined( __clang__ )
    9805              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic push
    9806              :     // We do a bunch of direct compensations of floating point numbers,
    9807              :     // because we know what we are doing and actually do want the direct
    9808              :     // comparison behaviour.
    9809              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal"
    9810              : #endif
    9811              : 
    9812              :     /**
    9813              :      * Calculates the ULP distance between two floating point numbers
    9814              :      *
    9815              :      * The ULP distance of two floating point numbers is the count of
    9816              :      * valid floating point numbers representable between them.
    9817              :      *
    9818              :      * There are some exceptions between how this function counts the
    9819              :      * distance, and the interpretation of the standard as implemented.
    9820              :      * by e.g. `nextafter`. For this function it always holds that:
    9821              :      * * `(x == y) => ulpDistance(x, y) == 0` (so `ulpDistance(-0, 0) == 0`)
    9822              :      * * `ulpDistance(maxFinite, INF) == 1`
    9823              :      * * `ulpDistance(x, -x) == 2 * ulpDistance(x, 0)`
    9824              :      *
    9825              :      * \pre `!isnan( lhs )`
    9826              :      * \pre `!isnan( rhs )`
    9827              :      * \pre floating point numbers are represented in IEEE-754 format
    9828              :      */
    9829              :     template <typename FP>
    9830            0 :     uint64_t ulpDistance( FP lhs, FP rhs ) {
    9831              :         assert( std::numeric_limits<FP>::is_iec559 &&
    9832              :             "ulpDistance assumes IEEE-754 format for floating point types" );
    9833            0 :         assert( !Catch::isnan( lhs ) &&
    9834              :                 "Distance between NaN and number is not meaningful" );
    9835            0 :         assert( !Catch::isnan( rhs ) &&
    9836              :                 "Distance between NaN and number is not meaningful" );
    9837              : 
    9838              :         // We want X == Y to imply 0 ULP distance even if X and Y aren't
    9839              :         // bit-equal (-0 and 0), or X - Y != 0 (same sign infinities).
    9840            0 :         if ( lhs == rhs ) { return 0; }
    9841              : 
    9842              :         // We need a properly typed positive zero for type inference.
    9843              :         static constexpr FP positive_zero{};
    9844              : 
    9845              :         // We want to ensure that +/- 0 is always represented as positive zero
    9846            0 :         if ( lhs == positive_zero ) { lhs = positive_zero; }
    9847            0 :         if ( rhs == positive_zero ) { rhs = positive_zero; }
    9848              : 
    9849              :         // If arguments have different signs, we can handle them by summing
    9850              :         // how far are they from 0 each.
    9851            0 :         if ( std::signbit( lhs ) != std::signbit( rhs ) ) {
    9852            0 :             return ulpDistance( std::abs( lhs ), positive_zero ) +
    9853            0 :                    ulpDistance( std::abs( rhs ), positive_zero );
    9854              :         }
    9855              : 
    9856              :         // When both lhs and rhs are of the same sign, we can just
    9857              :         // read the numbers bitwise as integers, and then subtract them
    9858              :         // (assuming IEEE).
    9859            0 :         uint64_t lc = Detail::convertToBits( lhs );
    9860            0 :         uint64_t rc = Detail::convertToBits( rhs );
    9861              : 
    9862              :         // The ulp distance between two numbers is symmetric, so to avoid
    9863              :         // dealing with overflows we want the bigger converted number on the lhs
    9864            0 :         if ( lc < rc ) {
    9865            0 :             std::swap( lc, rc );
    9866              :         }
    9867              : 
    9868            0 :         return lc - rc;
    9869              :     }
    9870              : 
    9871              : #if defined( __GNUC__ ) || defined( __clang__ )
    9872              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic pop
    9873              : #endif
    9874              : 
    9875              : 
    9876              : } // end namespace Catch
    9877              : 
    9878              : #endif // CATCH_FLOATING_POINT_HELPERS_HPP_INCLUDED
    9879              : 
    9880              : 
    9881              : #ifndef CATCH_GETENV_HPP_INCLUDED
    9882              : #define CATCH_GETENV_HPP_INCLUDED
    9883              : 
    9884              : namespace Catch {
    9885              : namespace Detail {
    9886              : 
    9887              :     //! Wrapper over `std::getenv` that compiles on UWP (and always returns nullptr there)
    9888              :     char const* getEnv(char const* varName);
    9889              : 
    9890              : }
    9891              : }
    9892              : 
    9893              : #endif // CATCH_GETENV_HPP_INCLUDED
    9894              : 
    9895              : 
    9896              : #ifndef CATCH_IS_PERMUTATION_HPP_INCLUDED
    9897              : #define CATCH_IS_PERMUTATION_HPP_INCLUDED
    9898              : 
    9899              : #include <iterator>
    9900              : #include <type_traits>
    9901              : 
    9902              : namespace Catch {
    9903              :     namespace Detail {
    9904              : 
    9905              :         template <typename ForwardIter,
    9906              :                   typename Sentinel,
    9907              :                   typename T,
    9908              :                   typename Comparator>
    9909              :         constexpr
    9910              :         ForwardIter find_sentinel( ForwardIter start,
    9911              :                                    Sentinel sentinel,
    9912              :                                    T const& value,
    9913              :                                    Comparator cmp ) {
    9914              :             while ( start != sentinel ) {
    9915              :                 if ( cmp( *start, value ) ) { break; }
    9916              :                 ++start;
    9917              :             }
    9918              :             return start;
    9919              :         }
    9920              : 
    9921              :         template <typename ForwardIter,
    9922              :                   typename Sentinel,
    9923              :                   typename T,
    9924              :                   typename Comparator>
    9925              :         constexpr
    9926              :         std::ptrdiff_t count_sentinel( ForwardIter start,
    9927              :                                        Sentinel sentinel,
    9928              :                                        T const& value,
    9929              :                                        Comparator cmp ) {
    9930              :             std::ptrdiff_t count = 0;
    9931              :             while ( start != sentinel ) {
    9932              :                 if ( cmp( *start, value ) ) { ++count; }
    9933              :                 ++start;
    9934              :             }
    9935              :             return count;
    9936              :         }
    9937              : 
    9938              :         template <typename ForwardIter, typename Sentinel>
    9939              :         constexpr
    9940              :         std::enable_if_t<!std::is_same<ForwardIter, Sentinel>::value,
    9941              :                          std::ptrdiff_t>
    9942              :         sentinel_distance( ForwardIter iter, const Sentinel sentinel ) {
    9943              :             std::ptrdiff_t dist = 0;
    9944              :             while ( iter != sentinel ) {
    9945              :                 ++iter;
    9946              :                 ++dist;
    9947              :             }
    9948              :             return dist;
    9949              :         }
    9950              : 
    9951              :         template <typename ForwardIter>
    9952              :         constexpr std::ptrdiff_t sentinel_distance( ForwardIter first,
    9953              :                                                     ForwardIter last ) {
    9954              :             return std::distance( first, last );
    9955              :         }
    9956              : 
    9957              :         template <typename ForwardIter1,
    9958              :                   typename Sentinel1,
    9959              :                   typename ForwardIter2,
    9960              :                   typename Sentinel2,
    9961              :                   typename Comparator>
    9962              :         constexpr bool check_element_counts( ForwardIter1 first_1,
    9963              :                                              const Sentinel1 end_1,
    9964              :                                              ForwardIter2 first_2,
    9965              :                                              const Sentinel2 end_2,
    9966              :                                              Comparator cmp ) {
    9967              :             auto cursor = first_1;
    9968              :             while ( cursor != end_1 ) {
    9969              :                 if ( find_sentinel( first_1, cursor, *cursor, cmp ) ==
    9970              :                      cursor ) {
    9971              :                     // we haven't checked this element yet
    9972              :                     const auto count_in_range_2 =
    9973              :                         count_sentinel( first_2, end_2, *cursor, cmp );
    9974              :                     // Not a single instance in 2nd range, so it cannot be a
    9975              :                     // permutation of 1st range
    9976              :                     if ( count_in_range_2 == 0 ) { return false; }
    9977              : 
    9978              :                     const auto count_in_range_1 =
    9979              :                         count_sentinel( cursor, end_1, *cursor, cmp );
    9980              :                     if ( count_in_range_1 != count_in_range_2 ) {
    9981              :                         return false;
    9982              :                     }
    9983              :                 }
    9984              : 
    9985              :                 ++cursor;
    9986              :             }
    9987              : 
    9988              :             return true;
    9989              :         }
    9990              : 
    9991              :         template <typename ForwardIter1,
    9992              :                   typename Sentinel1,
    9993              :                   typename ForwardIter2,
    9994              :                   typename Sentinel2,
    9995              :                   typename Comparator>
    9996              :         constexpr bool is_permutation( ForwardIter1 first_1,
    9997              :                                        const Sentinel1 end_1,
    9998              :                                        ForwardIter2 first_2,
    9999              :                                        const Sentinel2 end_2,
   10000              :                                        Comparator cmp ) {
   10001              :             // TODO: no optimization for stronger iterators, because we would also have to constrain on sentinel vs not sentinel types
   10002              :             // TODO: Comparator has to be "both sides", e.g. a == b => b == a
   10003              :             // This skips shared prefix of the two ranges
   10004              :             while (first_1 != end_1 && first_2 != end_2 && cmp(*first_1, *first_2)) {
   10005              :                 ++first_1;
   10006              :                 ++first_2;
   10007              :             }
   10008              : 
   10009              :             // We need to handle case where at least one of the ranges has no more elements
   10010              :             if (first_1 == end_1 || first_2 == end_2) {
   10011              :                 return first_1 == end_1 && first_2 == end_2;
   10012              :             }
   10013              : 
   10014              :             // pair counting is n**2, so we pay linear walk to compare the sizes first
   10015              :             auto dist_1 = sentinel_distance( first_1, end_1 );
   10016              :             auto dist_2 = sentinel_distance( first_2, end_2 );
   10017              : 
   10018              :             if (dist_1 != dist_2) { return false; }
   10019              : 
   10020              :             // Since we do not try to handle stronger iterators pair (e.g.
   10021              :             // bidir) optimally, the only thing left to do is to check counts in
   10022              :             // the remaining ranges.
   10023              :             return check_element_counts( first_1, end_1, first_2, end_2, cmp );
   10024              :         }
   10025              : 
   10026              :     } // namespace Detail
   10027              : } // namespace Catch
   10028              : 
   10029              : #endif // CATCH_IS_PERMUTATION_HPP_INCLUDED
   10030              : 
   10031              :

   10039              : namespace Catch {
   10040              : 
   10041              :     class IStream {
   10042              :     public:
   10043              :         virtual ~IStream(); // = default
   10044              :         virtual std::ostream& stream() = 0;
   10045              :         /**
   10046              :          * Best guess on whether the instance is writing to a console (e.g. via stdout/stderr)
   10047              :          *
   10048              :          * This is useful for e.g. Win32 colour support, because the Win32
   10049              :          * API manipulates console directly, unlike POSIX escape codes,
   10050              :          * that can be written anywhere.
   10051              :          *
   10052              :          * Due to variety of ways to change where the stdout/stderr is
   10053              :          * _actually_ being written, users should always assume that
   10054              :          * the answer might be wrong.
   10055              :          */
   10056            0 :         virtual bool isConsole() const { return false; }
   10057              :     };
   10058              : 
   10059              :     /**
   10060              :      * Creates a stream wrapper that writes to specific file.
   10061              :      *
   10062              :      * Also recognizes 4 special filenames
   10063              :      * * `-` for stdout
   10064              :      * * `%stdout` for stdout
   10065              :      * * `%stderr` for stderr
   10066              :      * * `%debug` for platform specific debugging output
   10067              :      *
   10068              :      * \throws if passed an unrecognized %-prefixed stream
   10069              :      */
   10070              :     auto makeStream( std::string const& filename ) -> Detail::unique_ptr<IStream>;
   10071              :

   10096              :     public:

   10099              : 
   10100              :         JsonObjectWriter writeObject() &&;
   10101              :         JsonArrayWriter writeArray() &&;
   10102              : 
   10103              :         template <typename T>
   10104            0 :         void write( T const& value ) && {
   10105            0 :             writeImpl( value, !std::is_arithmetic<T>::value );
   10106            0 :         }
   10107              :         void write( StringRef value ) &&;
   10108              :         void write( bool value ) &&;
   10109              : 
   10110              :     private:
   10111              :         void writeImpl( StringRef value, bool quote );
   10112              : 
   10113              :         // Without this SFINAE, this overload is a better match
   10114              :         // for `std::string`, `char const*`, `char const[N]` args.
   10115              :         // While it would still work, it would cause code bloat
   10116              :         // and multiple iteration over the strings
   10117              :         template <typename T,
   10118              :                   typename = typename std::enable_if_t<
   10119              :                       !std::is_convertible<T, StringRef>::value>>
   10120            0 :         void writeImpl( T const& value, bool quote_value ) {
   10121            0 :             m_sstream << value;
   10122            0 :             writeImpl( m_sstream.str(), quote_value );
   10123            0 :         }
   10124              : 
   10125              :         std::ostream& m_os;
   10126              :         std::stringstream m_sstream;
   10127              :         std::uint64_t m_indent_level;
   10128              :     };
   10129              :

   10164            0 :             return writeImpl( value );
   10165              :         }
   10166              :

   10172            0 :             JsonUtils::appendCommaNewline(
   10173            0 :                 m_os, m_should_comma, m_indent_level + 1 );
   10174            0 :             JsonValueWriter{ m_os }.write( value );
   10175              : 
   10176            0 :             return *this;
   10177              :         }
   10178              : 
   10179              :         std::ostream& m_os;
   10180              :         std::uint64_t m_indent_level;
   10181              :         bool m_should_comma = false;
   10182              :         bool m_active = true;
   10183              :     };

   10250              :     class OutputRedirect {
   10251              :         bool m_redirectActive = false;
   10252              :         virtual void activateImpl() = 0;
   10253              :         virtual void deactivateImpl() = 0;
   10254              :     public:
   10255              :         enum Kind {
   10256              :             //! No redirect (noop implementation)
   10257              :             None,
   10258              :             //! Redirect std::cout/std::cerr/std::clog streams internally
   10259              :             Streams,
   10260              :             //! Redirect the stdout/stderr file descriptors into files
   10261              :             FileDescriptors,
   10262              :         };
   10263              : 
   10264              :         virtual ~OutputRedirect(); // = default;
   10265              : 
   10266              :         // TODO: Do we want to check that redirect is not active before retrieving the output?
   10267              :         virtual std::string getStdout() = 0;
   10268              :         virtual std::string getStderr() = 0;
   10269              :         virtual void clearBuffers() = 0;
   10270          310 :         bool isActive() const { return m_redirectActive; }
   10271          310 :         void activate() {
   10272          310 :             assert( !m_redirectActive && "redirect is already active" );
   10273          310 :             activateImpl();
   10274          310 :             m_redirectActive = true;
   10275          310 :         }
   10276          310 :         void deactivate() {
   10277          310 :             assert( m_redirectActive && "redirect is not active" );
   10278          310 :             deactivateImpl();
   10279          310 :             m_redirectActive = false;
   10280          310 :         }
   10281              :     };
   10282              : 
   10283              :     bool isRedirectAvailable( OutputRedirect::Kind kind);
   10284              :     Detail::unique_ptr<OutputRedirect> makeOutputRedirect( bool actual );
   10285              : 
   10286              :     class RedirectGuard {

   10392              : namespace Catch {
   10393              : namespace TestCaseTracking {
   10394              : 
   10395              :     struct NameAndLocation {
   10396              :         std::string name;
   10397              :         SourceLineInfo location;
   10398              : 
   10399              :         NameAndLocation( std::string&& _name, SourceLineInfo const& _location );
   10400            0 :         friend bool operator==(NameAndLocation const& lhs, NameAndLocation const& rhs) {
   10401              :             // This is a very cheap check that should have a very high hit rate.
   10402              :             // If we get to SourceLineInfo::operator==, we will redo it, but the
   10403              :             // cost of repeating is trivial at that point (we will be paying
   10404              :             // multiple strcmp/memcmps at that point).
   10405            0 :             if ( lhs.location.line != rhs.location.line ) { return false; }
   10406            0 :             return lhs.name == rhs.name && lhs.location == rhs.location;
   10407              :         }
   10408            0 :         friend bool operator!=(NameAndLocation const& lhs,
   10409              :                                NameAndLocation const& rhs) {
   10410            0 :             return !( lhs == rhs );
   10411              :         }
   10412              :     };
   10413              : 
   10414              :     /**
   10415              :      * This is a variant of `NameAndLocation` that does not own the name string
   10416              :      *
   10417              :      * This avoids extra allocations when trying to locate a tracker by its
   10418              :      * name and location, as long as we make sure that trackers only keep
   10419              :      * around the owning variant.
   10420              :      */
   10421              :     struct NameAndLocationRef {
   10422              :         StringRef name;
   10423              :         SourceLineInfo location;
   10424              : 
   10425          447 :         constexpr NameAndLocationRef( StringRef name_,
   10426          447 :                                       SourceLineInfo location_ ):
   10427          447 :             name( name_ ), location( location_ ) {}
   10428              : 
   10429          258 :         friend bool operator==( NameAndLocation const& lhs,
   10430              :                                 NameAndLocationRef const& rhs ) {
   10431              :             // This is a very cheap check that should have a very high hit rate.
   10432              :             // If we get to SourceLineInfo::operator==, we will redo it, but the
   10433              :             // cost of repeating is trivial at that point (we will be paying
   10434              :             // multiple strcmp/memcmps at that point).
   10435          258 :             if ( lhs.location.line != rhs.location.line ) { return false; }
   10436          516 :             return StringRef( lhs.name ) == rhs.name &&
   10437          516 :                    lhs.location == rhs.location;
   10438              :         }
   10439              :         friend bool operator==( NameAndLocationRef const& lhs,
   10440              :                                 NameAndLocation const& rhs ) {
   10441              :             return rhs == lhs;
   10442              :         }
   10443              :     };
   10444              : 
   10445              :     class ITracker;
   10446              : 
   10447              :     using ITrackerPtr = Catch::Detail::unique_ptr<ITracker>;
   10448              : 
   10449              :     class ITracker {
   10450              :         NameAndLocation m_nameAndLocation;
   10451              : 
   10452              :         using Children = std::vector<ITrackerPtr>;
   10453              : 
   10454              :     protected:
   10455              :         enum CycleState {
   10456              :             NotStarted,
   10457              :             Executing,
   10458              :             ExecutingChildren,
   10459              :             NeedsAnotherRun,
   10460              :             CompletedSuccessfully,
   10461              :             Failed
   10462              :         };
   10463              : 
   10464              :         ITracker* m_parent = nullptr;
   10465              :         Children m_children;
   10466              :         CycleState m_runState = NotStarted;
   10467              : 
   10468              :     public:
   10469          307 :         ITracker( NameAndLocation&& nameAndLoc, ITracker* parent ):
   10470          307 :             m_nameAndLocation( CATCH_MOVE(nameAndLoc) ),
   10471          307 :             m_parent( parent )
   10472          307 :         {}
   10473              : 
   10474              : 
   10475              :         // static queries
   10476         1076 :         NameAndLocation const& nameAndLocation() const {
   10477         1076 :             return m_nameAndLocation;
   10478              :         }
   10479            0 :         ITracker* parent() const {
   10480            0 :             return m_parent;
   10481              :         }

   10484              : 
   10485              : 
   10486              :         // dynamic queries
   10487              : 
   10488              :         //! Returns true if tracker run to completion (successfully or not)
   10489              :         virtual bool isComplete() const = 0;
   10490              :         //! Returns true if tracker run to completion successfully
   10491          168 :         bool isSuccessfullyCompleted() const {
   10492          168 :             return m_runState == CompletedSuccessfully;
   10493              :         }
   10494              :         //! Returns true if tracker has started but hasn't been completed
   10495              :         bool isOpen() const;

   10497              :         bool hasStarted() const;
   10498              : 
   10499              :         // actions

   10501              :         virtual void fail() = 0;

   10503              : 
   10504              :         //! Register a nested ITracker
   10505              :         void addChild( ITrackerPtr&& child );

   10507              :          * Returns ptr to specific child if register with this tracker.
   10508              :          *
   10509              :          * Returns nullptr if not found.
   10510              :          */

   10512              :         //! Have any children been added?
   10513            0 :         bool hasChildren() const {
   10514            0 :             return !m_children.empty();
   10515              :         }
   10516              : 
   10517              : 
   10518              :         //! Marks tracker as executing a child, doing se recursively up the tree
   10519              :         void openChild();
   10520              : 
   10521              :         /**
   10522              :          * Returns true if the instance is a section tracker
   10523              :          *
   10524              :          * Subclasses should override to true if they are, replaces RTTI
   10525              :          * for internal debug checks.
   10526              :          */

   10536              : 
   10537              :     class TrackerContext {
   10538              :

   10556          168 :         }
   10557              :         void completeCycle();
   10558              :

   10583              : 
   10584              :     class SectionTracker : public TrackerBase {
   10585              :         std::vector<StringRef> m_filters;
   10586              :         // Note that lifetime-wise we piggy back off the name stored in the `ITracker` parent`.
   10587              :         // Currently it allocates owns the name, so this is safe. If it is later refactored
   10588              :         // to not own the name, the name still has to outlive the `ITracker` parent, so
   10589              :         // this should still be safe.
   10590              :         StringRef m_trimmed_name;
   10591              :     public:
   10592              :         SectionTracker( NameAndLocation&& nameAndLocation, TrackerContext& ctx, ITracker* parent );
   10593              : 
   10594              :         bool isSectionTracker() const override;
   10595              : 
   10596              :         bool isComplete() const override;
   10597              : 
   10598              :         static SectionTracker& acquire( TrackerContext& ctx, NameAndLocationRef const& nameAndLocation );
   10599              : 
   10600              :         void tryOpen();
   10601              : 
   10602              :         void addInitialFilters( std::vector<std::string> const& filters );

   10605            0 :         std::vector<StringRef> const& getFilters() const { return m_filters; }

   10643              :       // vv Dummy implementations for single-thread performance

   10807              : #ifndef CATCH_SHARDING_HPP_INCLUDED
   10808              : #define CATCH_SHARDING_HPP_INCLUDED
   10809              : 
   10810              : #include <cassert>
   10811              : #include <algorithm>
   10812              : 
   10813              : namespace Catch {
   10814              : 
   10815              :     template<typename Container>
   10816            1 :     Container createShard(Container const& container, std::size_t const shardCount, std::size_t const shardIndex) {
   10817            1 :         assert(shardCount > shardIndex);
   10818              : 
   10819            1 :         if (shardCount == 1) {
   10820            1 :             return container;
   10821              :         }
   10822              : 
   10823            0 :         const std::size_t totalTestCount = container.size();
   10824              : 
   10825            0 :         const std::size_t shardSize = totalTestCount / shardCount;
   10826            0 :         const std::size_t leftoverTests = totalTestCount % shardCount;
   10827              : 
   10828            0 :         const std::size_t startIndex = shardIndex * shardSize + (std::min)(shardIndex, leftoverTests);
   10829            0 :         const std::size_t endIndex = (shardIndex + 1) * shardSize + (std::min)(shardIndex + 1, leftoverTests);
   10830              : 
   10831            0 :         auto startIterator = std::next(container.begin(), static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(startIndex));
   10832            0 :         auto endIterator = std::next(container.begin(), static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(endIndex));
   10833              : 
   10834            0 :         return Container(startIterator, endIterator);
   10835              :     }
   10836              : 
   10837              : }
   10838              : 
   10839              : #endif // CATCH_SHARDING_HPP_INCLUDED
   10840              : 
   10841              : 
   10842              : #ifndef CATCH_SINGLETONS_HPP_INCLUDED
   10843              : #define CATCH_SINGLETONS_HPP_INCLUDED
   10844              : 
   10845              : namespace Catch {
   10846              : 
   10847              :     struct ISingleton {
   10848              :         virtual ~ISingleton(); // = default
   10849              :     };
   10850              : 
   10851              : 
   10852              :     void addSingleton( ISingleton* singleton );
   10853              :     void cleanupSingletons();
   10854              : 
   10855              : 
   10856              :     template<typename SingletonImplT, typename InterfaceT = SingletonImplT, typename MutableInterfaceT = InterfaceT>
   10857              :     class Singleton : SingletonImplT, public ISingleton {
   10858              : 
   10859          125 :         static auto getInternal() -> Singleton* {
   10860              :             static Singleton* s_instance = nullptr;
   10861          125 :             if( !s_instance ) {
   10862            2 :                 s_instance = new Singleton;
   10863            2 :                 addSingleton( s_instance );
   10864              :             }
   10865          125 :             return s_instance;
   10866              :         }
   10867              : 
   10868              :     public:
   10869            5 :         static auto get() -> InterfaceT const& {
   10870            5 :             return *getInternal();
   10871              :         }
   10872          120 :         static auto getMutable() -> MutableInterfaceT& {
   10873          120 :             return *getInternal();
   10874              :         }
   10875              :     };
   10876              :

   10932              : namespace Catch {
   10933              : 
   10934              :     bool startsWith( std::string const& s, std::string const& prefix );
   10935              :     bool startsWith( StringRef s, char prefix );
   10936              :     bool endsWith( std::string const& s, std::string const& suffix );

   10940              :     std::string toLower( std::string const& s );

   10942              :     //! Returns a new string without whitespace at the start/end
   10943              :     std::string trim( std::string const& str );
   10944              :     //! Returns a substring of the original ref without whitespace. Beware lifetimes!
   10945              :     StringRef trim(StringRef ref);
   10946              : 
   10947              :     // !!! Be aware, returns refs into original string - make sure original string outlives them
   10948              :     std::vector<StringRef> splitStringRef( StringRef str, char delimiter );
   10949              :     bool replaceInPlace( std::string& str, std::string const& replaceThis, std::string const& withThis );
   10950              : 
   10951              :     /**
   10952              :      * Helper for streaming a "count [maybe-plural-of-label]" human-friendly string
   10953              :      *
   10954              :      * Usage example:
   10955              :      * ```cpp
   10956              :      * std::cout << "Found " << pluralise(count, "error") << '\n';
   10957              :      * ```
   10958              :      *
   10959              :      * **Important:** The provided string must outlive the instance
   10960              :      */
   10961              :     class pluralise {
   10962              :         std::uint64_t m_count;
   10963              :         StringRef m_label;
   10964              : 
   10965              :     public:
   10966            2 :         constexpr pluralise(std::uint64_t count, StringRef label):
   10967            2 :             m_count(count),
   10968            2 :             m_label(label)
   10969            2 :         {}
   10970              : 
   10971              :         friend std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, pluralise const& pluraliser );
   10972              :     };
   10973              : }
   10974              : 
   10975              : #endif // CATCH_STRING_MANIP_HPP_INCLUDED
   10976              :

   11154              : #ifndef CATCH_TEXTFLOW_HPP_INCLUDED
   11155              : #define CATCH_TEXTFLOW_HPP_INCLUDED

   11161              : 
   11162              : namespace Catch {
   11163              :     namespace TextFlow {
   11164              : 
   11165              :         class Columns;
   11166              : 
   11167              :         /**
   11168              :          * Abstraction for a string with ansi escape sequences that
   11169              :          * automatically skips over escapes when iterating. Only graphical
   11170              :          * escape sequences are considered.
   11171              :          *
   11172              :          * Internal representation:
   11173              :          * An escape sequence looks like \033[39;49m
   11174              :          * We need bidirectional iteration and the unbound length of escape
   11175              :          * sequences poses a problem for operator-- To make this work we'll
   11176              :          * replace the last `m` with a 0xff (this is a codepoint that won't have
   11177              :          * any utf-8 meaning).
   11178              :          */
   11179              :         class AnsiSkippingString {
   11180              :             std::string m_string;
   11181              :             std::size_t m_size = 0;
   11182              : 
   11183              :             // perform 0xff replacement and calculate m_size
   11184              :             void preprocessString();
   11185              : 
   11186              :         public:
   11187              :             class const_iterator;
   11188              :             using iterator = const_iterator;
   11189              :             // note: must be u-suffixed or this will cause a "truncation of
   11190              :             // constant value" warning on MSVC
   11191              :             static constexpr char sentinel = static_cast<char>( 0xffu );
   11192              : 
   11193              :             explicit AnsiSkippingString( std::string const& text );
   11194              :             explicit AnsiSkippingString( std::string&& text );
   11195              : 
   11196              :             const_iterator begin() const;
   11197              :             const_iterator end() const;
   11198              : 
   11199              :             size_t size() const { return m_size; }
   11200              : 
   11201              :             std::string substring( const_iterator begin,
   11202              :                                    const_iterator end ) const;
   11203              :         };
   11204              : 
   11205              :         class AnsiSkippingString::const_iterator {
   11206              :             friend AnsiSkippingString;
   11207              :             struct EndTag {};
   11208              : 
   11209              :             const std::string* m_string;
   11210              :             std::string::const_iterator m_it;
   11211              : 
   11212            0 :             explicit const_iterator( const std::string& string, EndTag ):
   11213            0 :                 m_string( &string ), m_it( string.end() ) {}
   11214              : 
   11215              :             void tryParseAnsiEscapes();
   11216              :             void advance();
   11217              :             void unadvance();
   11218              : 
   11219              :         public:
   11220              :             using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
   11221              :             using value_type = char;
   11222              :             using pointer = value_type*;
   11223              :             using reference = value_type&;
   11224              :             using iterator_category = std::bidirectional_iterator_tag;
   11225              : 
   11226            0 :             explicit const_iterator( const std::string& string ):
   11227            0 :                 m_string( &string ), m_it( string.begin() ) {
   11228            0 :                 tryParseAnsiEscapes();
   11229            0 :             }
   11230              : 
   11231            0 :             char operator*() const { return *m_it; }
   11232              : 
   11233            0 :             const_iterator& operator++() {
   11234            0 :                 advance();
   11235            0 :                 return *this;
   11236              :             }
   11237            0 :             const_iterator operator++( int ) {
   11238            0 :                 iterator prev( *this );
   11239            0 :                 operator++();
   11240            0 :                 return prev;
   11241              :             }
   11242            0 :             const_iterator& operator--() {
   11243            0 :                 unadvance();
   11244            0 :                 return *this;
   11245              :             }
   11246              :             const_iterator operator--( int ) {
   11247              :                 iterator prev( *this );
   11248              :                 operator--();
   11249              :                 return prev;
   11250              :             }
   11251              : 
   11252            0 :             bool operator==( const_iterator const& other ) const {
   11253            0 :                 return m_it == other.m_it;
   11254              :             }
   11255            0 :             bool operator!=( const_iterator const& other ) const {
   11256            0 :                 return !operator==( other );
   11257              :             }
   11258            0 :             bool operator<=( const_iterator const& other ) const {
   11259            0 :                 return m_it <= other.m_it;
   11260              :             }
   11261              : 
   11262            0 :             const_iterator oneBefore() const {
   11263            0 :                 auto it = *this;
   11264            0 :                 return --it;
   11265              :             }
   11266              :         };
   11267              : 
   11268              :         /**
   11269              :          * Represents a column of text with specific width and indentation
   11270              :          *
   11271              :          * When written out to a stream, it will perform linebreaking
   11272              :          * of the provided text so that the written lines fit within
   11273              :          * target width.
   11274              :          */
   11275              :         class Column {
   11276              :             // String to be written out
   11277              :             AnsiSkippingString m_string;
   11278              :             // Width of the column for linebreaking
   11279              :             size_t m_width = CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1;
   11280              :             // Indentation of other lines (including first if initial indent is
   11281              :             // unset)
   11282              :             size_t m_indent = 0;
   11283              :             // Indentation of the first line
   11284              :             size_t m_initialIndent = std::string::npos;
   11285              : 
   11286              :         public:
   11287              :             /**
   11288              :              * Iterates "lines" in `Column` and returns them
   11289              :              */
   11290              :             class const_iterator {
   11291              :                 friend Column;
   11292              :                 struct EndTag {};
   11293              : 
   11294              :                 Column const& m_column;
   11295              :                 // Where does the current line start?
   11296              :                 AnsiSkippingString::const_iterator m_lineStart;
   11297              :                 // How long should the current line be?
   11298              :                 AnsiSkippingString::const_iterator m_lineEnd;
   11299              :                 // How far have we checked the string to iterate?
   11300              :                 AnsiSkippingString::const_iterator m_parsedTo;
   11301              :                 // Should a '-' be appended to the line?
   11302              :                 bool m_addHyphen = false;
   11303              : 
   11304            0 :                 const_iterator( Column const& column, EndTag ):
   11305            0 :                     m_column( column ),
   11306            0 :                     m_lineStart( m_column.m_string.end() ),
   11307            0 :                     m_lineEnd( column.m_string.end() ),
   11308            0 :                     m_parsedTo( column.m_string.end() ) {}
   11309              : 
   11310              :                 // Calculates the length of the current line
   11311              :                 void calcLength();
   11312              : 
   11313              :                 // Returns current indentation width
   11314              :                 size_t indentSize() const;
   11315              : 
   11316              :                 // Creates an indented and (optionally) suffixed string from
   11317              :                 // current iterator position, indentation and length.
   11318              :                 std::string addIndentAndSuffix(
   11319              :                     AnsiSkippingString::const_iterator start,
   11320              :                     AnsiSkippingString::const_iterator end ) const;
   11321              : 
   11322              :             public:
   11323              :                 using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
   11324              :                 using value_type = std::string;
   11325              :                 using pointer = value_type*;
   11326              :                 using reference = value_type&;
   11327              :                 using iterator_category = std::forward_iterator_tag;
   11328              : 
   11329              :                 explicit const_iterator( Column const& column );
   11330              : 
   11331              :                 std::string operator*() const;
   11332              : 
   11333              :                 const_iterator& operator++();
   11334              :                 const_iterator operator++( int );
   11335              : 
   11336            0 :                 bool operator==( const_iterator const& other ) const {
   11337            0 :                     return m_lineStart == other.m_lineStart &&
   11338            0 :                            &m_column == &other.m_column;
   11339              :                 }
   11340            0 :                 bool operator!=( const_iterator const& other ) const {
   11341            0 :                     return !operator==( other );
   11342              :                 }
   11343              :             };
   11344              :             using iterator = const_iterator;
   11345              : 
   11346            0 :             explicit Column( std::string const& text ): m_string( text ) {}
   11347            0 :             explicit Column( std::string&& text ):
   11348            0 :                 m_string( CATCH_MOVE( text ) ) {}
   11349              : 
   11350            0 :             Column& width( size_t newWidth ) & {
   11351            0 :                 assert( newWidth > 0 );
   11352            0 :                 m_width = newWidth;
   11353            0 :                 return *this;
   11354              :             }
   11355            0 :             Column&& width( size_t newWidth ) && {
   11356            0 :                 assert( newWidth > 0 );
   11357            0 :                 m_width = newWidth;
   11358            0 :                 return CATCH_MOVE( *this );
   11359              :             }
   11360              :             Column& indent( size_t newIndent ) & {
   11361              :                 m_indent = newIndent;
   11362              :                 return *this;
   11363              :             }
   11364            0 :             Column&& indent( size_t newIndent ) && {
   11365            0 :                 m_indent = newIndent;
   11366            0 :                 return CATCH_MOVE( *this );
   11367              :             }
   11368              :             Column& initialIndent( size_t newIndent ) & {
   11369              :                 m_initialIndent = newIndent;

   11375              :             }
   11376              : 
   11377            0 :             size_t width() const { return m_width; }
   11378            0 :             const_iterator begin() const { return const_iterator( *this ); }
   11379            0 :             const_iterator end() const {
   11380            0 :                 return { *this, const_iterator::EndTag{} };
   11381              :             }
   11382              : 
   11383              :             friend std::ostream& operator<<( std::ostream& os,
   11384              :                                              Column const& col );
   11385              :

   11387              :             friend Columns operator+( Column&& lhs, Column&& rhs );
   11388              :         };
   11389              : 
   11390              :         //! Creates a column that serves as an empty space of specific width
   11391              :         Column Spacer( size_t spaceWidth );
   11392              : 
   11393              :         class Columns {
   11394              :             std::vector<Column> m_columns;
   11395              : 
   11396              :         public:
   11397              :             class iterator {
   11398              :                 friend Columns;

   11404              :

   11406              : 
   11407              :             public:
   11408              :                 using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
   11409              :                 using value_type = std::string;
   11410              :                 using pointer = value_type*;
   11411              :                 using reference = value_type&;
   11412              :                 using iterator_category = std::forward_iterator_tag;
   11413              : 
   11414              :                 explicit iterator( Columns const& columns );
   11415              : 
   11416              :                 auto operator==( iterator const& other ) const -> bool {
   11417              :                     return m_iterators == other.m_iterators;
   11418              :                 }
   11419            0 :                 auto operator!=( iterator const& other ) const -> bool {

   11445              : #ifndef CATCH_TO_STRING_HPP_INCLUDED

   11447              : 
   11448              : #include <string>
   11449              : 
   11450              : 
   11451              : namespace Catch {
   11452              :     template <typename T>
   11453              :     std::string to_string(T const& t) {
   11454              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_CPP11_TO_STRING)
   11455              :         return std::to_string(t);
   11456              : #else
   11457              :         ReusableStringStream rss;
   11458              :         rss << t;
   11459              :         return rss.str();
   11460              : #endif
   11461              :     }
   11462              : } // end namespace Catch

   11485              : namespace Catch {
   11486              :     enum class XmlFormatting : std::uint8_t {
   11487              :         None = 0x00,
   11488              :         Indent = 0x01,
   11489              :         Newline = 0x02,
   11490              :     };
   11491              : 
   11492            0 :     constexpr XmlFormatting operator|( XmlFormatting lhs, XmlFormatting rhs ) {
   11493              :         return static_cast<XmlFormatting>( static_cast<std::uint8_t>( lhs ) |
   11494            0 :                                            static_cast<std::uint8_t>( rhs ) );
   11495              :     }
   11496              : 
   11497            0 :     constexpr XmlFormatting operator&( XmlFormatting lhs, XmlFormatting rhs ) {
   11498              :         return static_cast<XmlFormatting>( static_cast<std::uint8_t>( lhs ) &
   11499            0 :                                            static_cast<std::uint8_t>( rhs ) );
   11500              :     }
   11501              : 
   11502              : 
   11503              :     /**
   11504              :      * Helper for XML-encoding text (escaping angle brackets, quotes, etc)
   11505              :      *
   11506              :      * Note: doesn't take ownership of passed strings, and thus the
   11507              :      *       encoded string must outlive the encoding instance.
   11508              :      */
   11509              :     class XmlEncode {
   11510              :     public:
   11511              :         enum ForWhat { ForTextNodes, ForAttributes };
   11512              : 
   11513            0 :         constexpr XmlEncode( StringRef str, ForWhat forWhat = ForTextNodes ):
   11514            0 :             m_str( str ), m_forWhat( forWhat ) {}
   11515              : 
   11516              : 
   11517              :         void encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const;
   11518              : 
   11519              :         friend std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, XmlEncode const& xmlEncode );
   11520              : 
   11521              :     private:
   11522              :         StringRef m_str;
   11523              :         ForWhat m_forWhat;
   11524              :     };
   11525              : 
   11526              :     class XmlWriter {
   11527              :     public:
   11528              : 
   11529              :         class ScopedElement {
   11530              :         public:
   11531              :             ScopedElement( XmlWriter* writer, XmlFormatting fmt );
   11532              : 
   11533              :             ScopedElement( ScopedElement&& other ) noexcept;
   11534              :             ScopedElement& operator=( ScopedElement&& other ) noexcept;
   11535              : 
   11536              :             ~ScopedElement();
   11537              : 
   11538              :             ScopedElement&
   11539              :             writeText( StringRef text,
   11540              :                        XmlFormatting fmt = XmlFormatting::Newline |
   11541              :                                            XmlFormatting::Indent );
   11542              : 
   11543              :             ScopedElement& writeAttribute( StringRef name,
   11544              :                                            StringRef attribute );
   11545              :             template <typename T,
   11546              :                       // Without this SFINAE, this overload is a better match
   11547              :                       // for `std::string`, `char const*`, `char const[N]` args.
   11548              :                       // While it would still work, it would cause code bloat
   11549              :                       // and multiple iteration over the strings
   11550              :                       typename = typename std::enable_if_t<
   11551              :                           !std::is_convertible<T, StringRef>::value>>
   11552            0 :             ScopedElement& writeAttribute( StringRef name,
   11553              :                                            T const& attribute ) {
   11554            0 :                 m_writer->writeAttribute( name, attribute );
   11555            0 :                 return *this;
   11556              :             }
   11557              : 
   11558              :         private:
   11559              :             XmlWriter* m_writer = nullptr;
   11560              :             XmlFormatting m_fmt;
   11561              :         };
   11562              : 
   11563              :         XmlWriter( std::ostream& os );
   11564              :         ~XmlWriter();
   11565              : 
   11566              :         XmlWriter( XmlWriter const& ) = delete;
   11567              :         XmlWriter& operator=( XmlWriter const& ) = delete;
   11568              : 
   11569              :         XmlWriter& startElement( std::string const& name, XmlFormatting fmt = XmlFormatting::Newline | XmlFormatting::Indent);
   11570              : 
   11571              :         ScopedElement scopedElement( std::string const& name, XmlFormatting fmt = XmlFormatting::Newline | XmlFormatting::Indent);
   11572              : 
   11573              :         XmlWriter& endElement(XmlFormatting fmt = XmlFormatting::Newline | XmlFormatting::Indent);
   11574              : 
   11575              :         //! The attribute content is XML-encoded
   11576              :         XmlWriter& writeAttribute( StringRef name, StringRef attribute );
   11577              : 
   11578              :         //! Writes the attribute as "true/false"
   11579              :         XmlWriter& writeAttribute( StringRef name, bool attribute );
   11580              : 
   11581              :         //! The attribute content is XML-encoded
   11582              :         XmlWriter& writeAttribute( StringRef name, char const* attribute );
   11583              : 
   11584              :         //! The attribute value must provide op<<(ostream&, T). The resulting
   11585              :         //! serialization is XML-encoded
   11586              :         template <typename T,
   11587              :                   // Without this SFINAE, this overload is a better match
   11588              :                   // for `std::string`, `char const*`, `char const[N]` args.
   11589              :                   // While it would still work, it would cause code bloat
   11590              :                   // and multiple iteration over the strings
   11591              :                   typename = typename std::enable_if_t<
   11592              :                       !std::is_convertible<T, StringRef>::value>>
   11593            0 :         XmlWriter& writeAttribute( StringRef name, T const& attribute ) {
   11594            0 :             ReusableStringStream rss;
   11595            0 :             rss << attribute;
   11596            0 :             return writeAttribute( name, rss.str() );
   11597            0 :         }
   11598              : 
   11599              :         //! Writes escaped `text` in a element
   11600              :         XmlWriter& writeText( StringRef text,
   11601              :                               XmlFormatting fmt = XmlFormatting::Newline |
   11602              :                                                   XmlFormatting::Indent );
   11603              : 
   11604              :         //! Writes XML comment as "<!-- text -->"
   11605              :         XmlWriter& writeComment( StringRef text,
   11606              :                                  XmlFormatting fmt = XmlFormatting::Newline |
   11607              :                                                      XmlFormatting::Indent );
   11608              : 
   11609              :         void writeStylesheetRef( StringRef url );
   11610              : 
   11611              :         void ensureTagClosed();
   11612              : 
   11613              :     private:
   11614              : 
   11615              :         void applyFormatting(XmlFormatting fmt);
   11616              : 
   11617              :         void writeDeclaration();
   11618              : 
   11619              :         void newlineIfNecessary();
   11620              : 
   11621              :         bool m_tagIsOpen = false;
   11622              :         bool m_needsNewline = false;
   11623              :         std::vector<std::string> m_tags;
   11624              :         std::string m_indent;
   11625              :         std::ostream& m_os;
   11626              :     };
   11627              : 
   11628              : }
   11629              : 
   11630              : #endif // CATCH_XMLWRITER_HPP_INCLUDED
   11631              : 
   11632              : 
   11633              : /** \file
   11634              :  * This is a convenience header for Catch2's Matcher support. It includes
   11635              :  * **all** of Catch2 headers related to matchers.
   11636              :  *
   11637              :  * Generally the Catch2 users should use specific includes they need,
   11638              :  * but this header can be used instead for ease-of-experimentation, or
   11639              :  * just plain convenience, at the cost of increased compilation times.
   11640              :  *
   11641              :  * When a new header is added to either the `matchers` folder, or to
   11642              :  * the corresponding internal subfolder, it should be added here.
   11643              :  */
   11644              : 
   11645              : #ifndef CATCH_MATCHERS_ALL_HPP_INCLUDED
   11646              : #define CATCH_MATCHERS_ALL_HPP_INCLUDED
   11647              : 
   11648              : 
   11649              : 
   11650              : #ifndef CATCH_MATCHERS_HPP_INCLUDED
   11651              : #define CATCH_MATCHERS_HPP_INCLUDED
   11652              : 
   11653              : 
   11654              : 
   11655              : #ifndef CATCH_MATCHERS_IMPL_HPP_INCLUDED
   11656              : #define CATCH_MATCHERS_IMPL_HPP_INCLUDED
   11657              : 
   11658              : 
   11659              : #include <string>
   11660              : 
   11661              : namespace Catch {
   11662              : 
   11663              : #ifdef __clang__
   11664              : #    pragma clang diagnostic push
   11665              : #    pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wsign-compare"
   11666              : #    pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wnon-virtual-dtor"
   11667              : #elif defined __GNUC__
   11668              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic push
   11669              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wsign-compare"
   11670              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wnon-virtual-dtor"
   11671              : #endif
   11672              : 
   11673              :     template<typename ArgT, typename MatcherT>
   11674              :     class MatchExpr : public ITransientExpression {
   11675              :         ArgT && m_arg;
   11676              :         MatcherT const& m_matcher;
   11677              :     public:
   11678            0 :         constexpr MatchExpr( ArgT && arg, MatcherT const& matcher )
   11679            0 :         :   ITransientExpression{ true, matcher.match( arg ) }, // not forwarding arg here on purpose
   11680            0 :             m_arg( CATCH_FORWARD(arg) ),
   11681            0 :             m_matcher( matcher )
   11682            0 :         {}
   11683              : 
   11684            0 :         void streamReconstructedExpression( std::ostream& os ) const override {
   11685            0 :             os << Catch::Detail::stringify( m_arg )
   11686              :                << ' '
   11687            0 :                << m_matcher.toString();
   11688            0 :         }
   11689              :     };
   11690              : 
   11691              : #ifdef __clang__
   11692              : #    pragma clang diagnostic pop
   11693              : #elif defined __GNUC__
   11694              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic pop
   11695              : #endif
   11696              : 
   11697              : 
   11698              :     namespace Matchers {
   11699              :         template <typename ArgT>
   11700              :         class MatcherBase;
   11701              :     }
   11702              : 
   11703              :     using StringMatcher = Matchers::MatcherBase<std::string>;
   11704              : 
   11705              :     void handleExceptionMatchExpr( AssertionHandler& handler, StringMatcher const& matcher );
   11706              : 
   11707              :     template<typename ArgT, typename MatcherT>
   11708              :     constexpr MatchExpr<ArgT, MatcherT>
   11709              :     makeMatchExpr( ArgT&& arg, MatcherT const& matcher ) {
   11710              :         return MatchExpr<ArgT, MatcherT>( CATCH_FORWARD(arg), matcher );
   11711              :     }
   11712              : 
   11713              : } // namespace Catch
   11714              : 
   11715              : 
   11716              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
   11717              : #define INTERNAL_CHECK_THAT( macroName, matcher, resultDisposition, arg ) \
   11718              :     do { \
   11719              :         Catch::AssertionHandler catchAssertionHandler( macroName##_catch_sr, CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, CATCH_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY(arg) ", " CATCH_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY(matcher), resultDisposition ); \
   11720              :         INTERNAL_CATCH_TRY { \
   11721              :             catchAssertionHandler.handleExpr( Catch::makeMatchExpr( arg, matcher ) ); \
   11722              :         } INTERNAL_CATCH_CATCH( catchAssertionHandler ) \
   11723              :         catchAssertionHandler.complete(); \
   11724              :     } while( false )
   11725              : 
   11726              : 
   11727              : ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
   11728              : #define INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_MATCHES( macroName, exceptionType, resultDisposition, matcher, ... ) \
   11729              :     do { \
   11730              :         Catch::AssertionHandler catchAssertionHandler( macroName##_catch_sr, CATCH_INTERNAL_LINEINFO, CATCH_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY(__VA_ARGS__) ", " CATCH_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY(exceptionType) ", " CATCH_INTERNAL_STRINGIFY(matcher), resultDisposition ); \
   11731              :         if( catchAssertionHandler.allowThrows() ) \
   11732              :             try { \
   11733              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
   11734              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_USELESS_CAST_WARNINGS \
   11735              :                 static_cast<void>(__VA_ARGS__ ); \
   11736              :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION \
   11737              :                 catchAssertionHandler.handleUnexpectedExceptionNotThrown(); \
   11738              :             } \
   11739              :             catch( exceptionType const& ex ) { \
   11740              :                 catchAssertionHandler.handleExpr( Catch::makeMatchExpr( ex, matcher ) ); \
   11741              :             } \
   11742              :             catch( ... ) { \
   11743              :                 catchAssertionHandler.handleUnexpectedInflightException(); \
   11744              :             } \
   11745              :         else \
   11746              :             catchAssertionHandler.handleThrowingCallSkipped(); \
   11747              :         catchAssertionHandler.complete(); \
   11748              :     } while( false )
   11749              : 
   11750              : 
   11751              : #endif // CATCH_MATCHERS_IMPL_HPP_INCLUDED
   11752              : 
   11753              : #include <string>
   11754              : #include <vector>
   11755              : 
   11756              : namespace Catch {
   11757              : namespace Matchers {
   11758              : 
   11759              :     class MatcherUntypedBase {
   11760              :     public:
   11761            0 :         MatcherUntypedBase() = default;
   11762              : 
   11763              :         MatcherUntypedBase(MatcherUntypedBase const&) = default;
   11764              :         MatcherUntypedBase(MatcherUntypedBase&&) = default;
   11765              : 
   11766              :         MatcherUntypedBase& operator = (MatcherUntypedBase const&) = delete;
   11767              :         MatcherUntypedBase& operator = (MatcherUntypedBase&&) = delete;
   11768              : 
   11769              :         std::string toString() const;
   11770              : 
   11771              :     protected:
   11772              :         virtual ~MatcherUntypedBase(); // = default;
   11773              :         virtual std::string describe() const = 0;
   11774              :         mutable std::string m_cachedToString;
   11775              :     };
   11776              : 
   11777              : 
   11778              :     template<typename T>
   11779              :     class MatcherBase : public MatcherUntypedBase {
   11780              :     public:
   11781              :         virtual bool match( T const& arg ) const = 0;
   11782              :     };
   11783              : 
   11784              :     namespace Detail {
   11785              : 
   11786              :         template<typename ArgT>
   11787              :         class MatchAllOf final : public MatcherBase<ArgT> {
   11788              :             std::vector<MatcherBase<ArgT> const*> m_matchers;
   11789              : 
   11790              :         public:
   11791              :             MatchAllOf() = default;
   11792              :             MatchAllOf(MatchAllOf const&) = delete;
   11793              :             MatchAllOf& operator=(MatchAllOf const&) = delete;
   11794              :             MatchAllOf(MatchAllOf&&) = default;
   11795              :             MatchAllOf& operator=(MatchAllOf&&) = default;
   11796              : 
   11797              : 
   11798              :             bool match( ArgT const& arg ) const override {
   11799              :                 for( auto matcher : m_matchers ) {
   11800              :                     if (!matcher->match(arg))
   11801              :                         return false;
   11802              :                 }
   11803              :                 return true;
   11804              :             }
   11805              :             std::string describe() const override {
   11806              :                 std::string description;
   11807              :                 description.reserve( 4 + m_matchers.size()*32 );
   11808              :                 description += "( ";
   11809              :                 bool first = true;
   11810              :                 for( auto matcher : m_matchers ) {
   11811              :                     if( first )
   11812              :                         first = false;
   11813              :                     else
   11814              :                         description += " and ";
   11815              :                     description += matcher->toString();
   11816              :                 }
   11817              :                 description += " )";
   11818              :                 return description;
   11819              :             }
   11820              : 
   11821              :             friend MatchAllOf operator&& (MatchAllOf&& lhs, MatcherBase<ArgT> const& rhs) {
   11822              :                 lhs.m_matchers.push_back(&rhs);
   11823              :                 return CATCH_MOVE(lhs);
   11824              :             }
   11825              :             friend MatchAllOf operator&& (MatcherBase<ArgT> const& lhs, MatchAllOf&& rhs) {
   11826              :                 rhs.m_matchers.insert(rhs.m_matchers.begin(), &lhs);
   11827              :                 return CATCH_MOVE(rhs);
   11828              :             }
   11829              :         };
   11830              :
