   11831              :         //! lvalue overload is intentionally deleted, users should
   11832              :         //! not be trying to compose stored composition matchers
   11833              :         template<typename ArgT>
   11834              :         MatchAllOf<ArgT> operator&& (MatchAllOf<ArgT> const& lhs, MatcherBase<ArgT> const& rhs) = delete;
   11835              :         //! lvalue overload is intentionally deleted, users should
   11836              :         //! not be trying to compose stored composition matchers
   11837              :         template<typename ArgT>
   11838              :         MatchAllOf<ArgT> operator&& (MatcherBase<ArgT> const& lhs, MatchAllOf<ArgT> const& rhs) = delete;
   11839              : 
   11840              :         template<typename ArgT>
   11841              :         class MatchAnyOf final : public MatcherBase<ArgT> {
   11842              :             std::vector<MatcherBase<ArgT> const*> m_matchers;
   11843              :         public:
   11844              :             MatchAnyOf() = default;
   11845              :             MatchAnyOf(MatchAnyOf const&) = delete;
   11846              :             MatchAnyOf& operator=(MatchAnyOf const&) = delete;
   11847              :             MatchAnyOf(MatchAnyOf&&) = default;
   11848              :             MatchAnyOf& operator=(MatchAnyOf&&) = default;
   11849              : 
   11850              :             bool match( ArgT const& arg ) const override {
   11851              :                 for( auto matcher : m_matchers ) {
   11852              :                     if (matcher->match(arg))
   11853              :                         return true;
   11854              :                 }
   11855              :                 return false;
   11856              :             }
   11857              :             std::string describe() const override {
   11858              :                 std::string description;
   11859              :                 description.reserve( 4 + m_matchers.size()*32 );
   11860              :                 description += "( ";
   11861              :                 bool first = true;
   11862              :                 for( auto matcher : m_matchers ) {
   11863              :                     if( first )
   11864              :                         first = false;
   11865              :                     else
   11866              :                         description += " or ";
   11867              :                     description += matcher->toString();
   11868              :                 }
   11869              :                 description += " )";
   11870              :                 return description;
   11871              :             }
   11872              : 
   11873              :             friend MatchAnyOf operator|| (MatchAnyOf&& lhs, MatcherBase<ArgT> const& rhs) {
   11874              :                 lhs.m_matchers.push_back(&rhs);
   11875              :                 return CATCH_MOVE(lhs);
   11876              :             }
   11877              :             friend MatchAnyOf operator|| (MatcherBase<ArgT> const& lhs, MatchAnyOf&& rhs) {
   11878              :                 rhs.m_matchers.insert(rhs.m_matchers.begin(), &lhs);
   11879              :                 return CATCH_MOVE(rhs);
   11880              :             }
   11881              :         };
   11882              : 
   11883              :         //! lvalue overload is intentionally deleted, users should
   11884              :         //! not be trying to compose stored composition matchers
   11885              :         template<typename ArgT>
   11886              :         MatchAnyOf<ArgT> operator|| (MatchAnyOf<ArgT> const& lhs, MatcherBase<ArgT> const& rhs) = delete;
   11887              :         //! lvalue overload is intentionally deleted, users should
   11888              :         //! not be trying to compose stored composition matchers
   11889              :         template<typename ArgT>
   11890              :         MatchAnyOf<ArgT> operator|| (MatcherBase<ArgT> const& lhs, MatchAnyOf<ArgT> const& rhs) = delete;
   11891              : 
   11892              :         template<typename ArgT>
   11893              :         class MatchNotOf final : public MatcherBase<ArgT> {
   11894              :             MatcherBase<ArgT> const& m_underlyingMatcher;
   11895              : 
   11896              :         public:
   11897              :             explicit MatchNotOf( MatcherBase<ArgT> const& underlyingMatcher ):
   11898              :                 m_underlyingMatcher( underlyingMatcher )
   11899              :             {}
   11900              : 
   11901              :             bool match( ArgT const& arg ) const override {
   11902              :                 return !m_underlyingMatcher.match( arg );
   11903              :             }
   11904              : 
   11905              :             std::string describe() const override {
   11906              :                 return "not " + m_underlyingMatcher.toString();
   11907              :             }
   11908              :         };
   11909              : 
   11910              :     } // namespace Detail
   11911              : 
   11912              :     template <typename T>
   11913              :     Detail::MatchAllOf<T> operator&& (MatcherBase<T> const& lhs, MatcherBase<T> const& rhs) {
   11914              :         return Detail::MatchAllOf<T>{} && lhs && rhs;
   11915              :     }
   11916              :     template <typename T>
   11917              :     Detail::MatchAnyOf<T> operator|| (MatcherBase<T> const& lhs, MatcherBase<T> const& rhs) {
   11918              :         return Detail::MatchAnyOf<T>{} || lhs || rhs;
   11919              :     }
   11920              : 
   11921              :     template <typename T>
   11922              :     Detail::MatchNotOf<T> operator! (MatcherBase<T> const& matcher) {
   11923              :         return Detail::MatchNotOf<T>{ matcher };
   11924              :     }
   11925              : 
   11926              : 
   11927              : } // namespace Matchers
   11928              : } // namespace Catch
   11929              : 
   11930              : 
   11931              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_ALL) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
   11932              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( expr, matcher ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_STR_MATCHES( "CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, matcher, expr )
   11933              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_MATCHES( expr, exceptionType, matcher ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_MATCHES( "CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_MATCHES", exceptionType, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, matcher, expr )
   11934              : 
   11935              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_THROWS_WITH( expr, matcher ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_STR_MATCHES( "CATCH_CHECK_THROWS_WITH", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, matcher, expr )
   11936              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_THROWS_MATCHES( expr, exceptionType, matcher ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_MATCHES( "CATCH_CHECK_THROWS_MATCHES", exceptionType, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, matcher, expr )
   11937              : 
   11938              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_THAT( arg, matcher ) INTERNAL_CHECK_THAT( "CATCH_CHECK_THAT", matcher, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, arg )
   11939              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THAT( arg, matcher ) INTERNAL_CHECK_THAT( "CATCH_REQUIRE_THAT", matcher, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, arg )
   11940              : 
   11941              : #elif defined(CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_ALL) && defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
   11942              : 
   11943              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( expr, matcher )                   (void)(0)
   11944              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_MATCHES( expr, exceptionType, matcher ) (void)(0)
   11945              : 
   11946              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_THROWS_WITH( expr, matcher )                     (void)(0)
   11947              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_THROWS_MATCHES( expr, exceptionType, matcher )   (void)(0)
   11948              : 
   11949              :   #define CATCH_CHECK_THAT( arg, matcher )                             (void)(0)
   11950              :   #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THAT( arg, matcher )                           (void)(0)
   11951              : 
   11952              : #elif !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_ALL) && !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
   11953              : 
   11954              :   #define REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( expr, matcher ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_STR_MATCHES( "REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, matcher, expr )
   11955              :   #define REQUIRE_THROWS_MATCHES( expr, exceptionType, matcher ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_MATCHES( "REQUIRE_THROWS_MATCHES", exceptionType, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, matcher, expr )
   11956              : 
   11957              :   #define CHECK_THROWS_WITH( expr, matcher ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_STR_MATCHES( "CHECK_THROWS_WITH", Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, matcher, expr )
   11958              :   #define CHECK_THROWS_MATCHES( expr, exceptionType, matcher ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_MATCHES( "CHECK_THROWS_MATCHES", exceptionType, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, matcher, expr )
   11959              : 
   11960              :   #define CHECK_THAT( arg, matcher ) INTERNAL_CHECK_THAT( "CHECK_THAT", matcher, Catch::ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure, arg )
   11961              :   #define REQUIRE_THAT( arg, matcher ) INTERNAL_CHECK_THAT( "REQUIRE_THAT", matcher, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, arg )
   11962              : 
   11963              : #elif !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_ALL) && defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
   11964              : 
   11965              :   #define REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH( expr, matcher )                   (void)(0)
   11966              :   #define REQUIRE_THROWS_MATCHES( expr, exceptionType, matcher ) (void)(0)
   11967              : 
   11968              :   #define CHECK_THROWS_WITH( expr, matcher )                     (void)(0)
   11969              :   #define CHECK_THROWS_MATCHES( expr, exceptionType, matcher )   (void)(0)
   11970              : 
   11971              :   #define CHECK_THAT( arg, matcher )                             (void)(0)
   11972              :   #define REQUIRE_THAT( arg, matcher )                           (void)(0)
   11973              : 
   11974              : #endif // end of user facing macro declarations
   11975              : 
   11976              : #endif // CATCH_MATCHERS_HPP_INCLUDED
   11977              : 
   11978              : 
   11979              : #ifndef CATCH_MATCHERS_CONTAINER_PROPERTIES_HPP_INCLUDED
   11980              : #define CATCH_MATCHERS_CONTAINER_PROPERTIES_HPP_INCLUDED
   11981              : 
   11982              : 
   11983              : 
   11984              : #ifndef CATCH_MATCHERS_TEMPLATED_HPP_INCLUDED
   11985              : #define CATCH_MATCHERS_TEMPLATED_HPP_INCLUDED
   11986              : 
   11987              : 
   11988              : #include <array>
   11989              : #include <algorithm>
   11990              : #include <string>
   11991              : #include <type_traits>
   11992              : 
   11993              : namespace Catch {
   11994              : namespace Matchers {
   11995              :     class MatcherGenericBase : public MatcherUntypedBase {
   11996              :     public:
   11997            0 :         MatcherGenericBase() = default;
   11998              :         ~MatcherGenericBase() override; // = default;
   11999              : 
   12000              :         MatcherGenericBase(MatcherGenericBase const&) = default;
   12001              :         MatcherGenericBase(MatcherGenericBase&&) = default;
   12002              : 
   12003              :         MatcherGenericBase& operator=(MatcherGenericBase const&) = delete;
   12004              :         MatcherGenericBase& operator=(MatcherGenericBase&&) = delete;
   12005              :     };
   12006              : 
   12007              : 
   12008              :     namespace Detail {
   12009              :         template<std::size_t N, std::size_t M>
   12010              :         std::array<void const*, N + M> array_cat(std::array<void const*, N> && lhs, std::array<void const*, M> && rhs) {
   12011              :             std::array<void const*, N + M> arr{};
   12012              :             std::copy_n(lhs.begin(), N, arr.begin());
   12013              :             std::copy_n(rhs.begin(), M, arr.begin() + N);
   12014              :             return arr;
   12015              :         }
   12016              : 
   12017              :         template<std::size_t N>
   12018              :         std::array<void const*, N+1> array_cat(std::array<void const*, N> && lhs, void const* rhs) {
   12019              :             std::array<void const*, N+1> arr{};
   12020              :             std::copy_n(lhs.begin(), N, arr.begin());
   12021              :             arr[N] = rhs;
   12022              :             return arr;
   12023              :         }
   12024              : 
   12025              :         template<std::size_t N>
   12026              :         std::array<void const*, N+1> array_cat(void const* lhs, std::array<void const*, N> && rhs) {
   12027              :             std::array<void const*, N + 1> arr{ {lhs} };
   12028              :             std::copy_n(rhs.begin(), N, arr.begin() + 1);
   12029              :             return arr;
   12030              :         }
   12031              : 
   12032              :         template<typename T>
   12033              :         static constexpr bool is_generic_matcher_v = std::is_base_of<
   12034              :             Catch::Matchers::MatcherGenericBase,
   12035              :             std::remove_cv_t<std::remove_reference_t<T>>
   12036              :         >::value;
   12037              : 
   12038              :         template<typename... Ts>
   12039              :         static constexpr bool are_generic_matchers_v = Catch::Detail::conjunction<std::integral_constant<bool,is_generic_matcher_v<Ts>>...>::value;
   12040              : 
   12041              :         template<typename T>
   12042              :         static constexpr bool is_matcher_v = std::is_base_of<
   12043              :             Catch::Matchers::MatcherUntypedBase,
   12044              :             std::remove_cv_t<std::remove_reference_t<T>>
   12045              :         >::value;
   12046              : 
   12047              : 
   12048              :         template<std::size_t N, typename Arg>
   12049              :         bool match_all_of(Arg&&, std::array<void const*, N> const&, std::index_sequence<>) {
   12050              :             return true;
   12051              :         }
   12052              : 
   12053              :         template<typename T, typename... MatcherTs, std::size_t N, typename Arg, std::size_t Idx, std::size_t... Indices>
   12054              :         bool match_all_of(Arg&& arg, std::array<void const*, N> const& matchers, std::index_sequence<Idx, Indices...>) {
   12055              :             return static_cast<T const*>(matchers[Idx])->match(arg) && match_all_of<MatcherTs...>(arg, matchers, std::index_sequence<Indices...>{});
   12056              :         }
   12057              : 
   12058              : 
   12059              :         template<std::size_t N, typename Arg>
   12060              :         bool match_any_of(Arg&&, std::array<void const*, N> const&, std::index_sequence<>) {
   12061              :             return false;
   12062              :         }
   12063              : 
   12064              :         template<typename T, typename... MatcherTs, std::size_t N, typename Arg, std::size_t Idx, std::size_t... Indices>
   12065              :         bool match_any_of(Arg&& arg, std::array<void const*, N> const& matchers, std::index_sequence<Idx, Indices...>) {
   12066              :             return static_cast<T const*>(matchers[Idx])->match(arg) || match_any_of<MatcherTs...>(arg, matchers, std::index_sequence<Indices...>{});
   12067              :         }
   12068              : 
   12069              :         std::string describe_multi_matcher(StringRef combine, std::string const* descriptions_begin, std::string const* descriptions_end);
   12070              : 
   12071              :         template<typename... MatcherTs, std::size_t... Idx>
   12072              :         std::string describe_multi_matcher(StringRef combine, std::array<void const*, sizeof...(MatcherTs)> const& matchers, std::index_sequence<Idx...>) {
   12073              :             std::array<std::string, sizeof...(MatcherTs)> descriptions {{
   12074              :                 static_cast<MatcherTs const*>(matchers[Idx])->toString()...
   12075              :             }};
   12076              : 
   12077              :             return describe_multi_matcher(combine, descriptions.data(), descriptions.data() + descriptions.size());
   12078              :         }
   12079              : 
   12080              : 
   12081              :         template<typename... MatcherTs>
   12082              :         class MatchAllOfGeneric final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12083              :         public:
   12084              :             MatchAllOfGeneric(MatchAllOfGeneric const&) = delete;
   12085              :             MatchAllOfGeneric& operator=(MatchAllOfGeneric const&) = delete;
   12086              :             MatchAllOfGeneric(MatchAllOfGeneric&&) = default;
   12087              :             MatchAllOfGeneric& operator=(MatchAllOfGeneric&&) = default;
   12088              : 
   12089              :             MatchAllOfGeneric(MatcherTs const&... matchers) : m_matchers{ {std::addressof(matchers)...} } {}
   12090              :             explicit MatchAllOfGeneric(std::array<void const*, sizeof...(MatcherTs)> matchers) : m_matchers{matchers} {}
   12091              : 
   12092              :             template<typename Arg>
   12093              :             bool match(Arg&& arg) const {
   12094              :                 return match_all_of<MatcherTs...>(arg, m_matchers, std::index_sequence_for<MatcherTs...>{});
   12095              :             }
   12096              : 
   12097              :             std::string describe() const override {
   12098              :                 return describe_multi_matcher<MatcherTs...>(" and "_sr, m_matchers, std::index_sequence_for<MatcherTs...>{});
   12099              :             }
   12100              : 
   12101              :             // Has to be public to enable the concatenating operators
   12102              :             // below, because they are not friend of the RHS, only LHS,
   12103              :             // and thus cannot access private fields of RHS
   12104              :             std::array<void const*, sizeof...( MatcherTs )> m_matchers;
   12105              : 
   12106              : 
   12107              :             //! Avoids type nesting for `GenericAllOf && GenericAllOf` case
   12108              :             template<typename... MatchersRHS>
   12109              :             friend
   12110              :             MatchAllOfGeneric<MatcherTs..., MatchersRHS...> operator && (
   12111              :                     MatchAllOfGeneric<MatcherTs...>&& lhs,
   12112              :                     MatchAllOfGeneric<MatchersRHS...>&& rhs) {
   12113              :                 return MatchAllOfGeneric<MatcherTs..., MatchersRHS...>{array_cat(CATCH_MOVE(lhs.m_matchers), CATCH_MOVE(rhs.m_matchers))};
   12114              :             }
   12115              : 
   12116              :             //! Avoids type nesting for `GenericAllOf && some matcher` case
   12117              :             template<typename MatcherRHS>
   12118              :             friend std::enable_if_t<is_matcher_v<MatcherRHS>,
   12119              :             MatchAllOfGeneric<MatcherTs..., MatcherRHS>> operator && (
   12120              :                     MatchAllOfGeneric<MatcherTs...>&& lhs,
   12121              :                     MatcherRHS const& rhs) {
   12122              :                 return MatchAllOfGeneric<MatcherTs..., MatcherRHS>{array_cat(CATCH_MOVE(lhs.m_matchers), static_cast<void const*>(&rhs))};
   12123              :             }
   12124              : 
   12125              :             //! Avoids type nesting for `some matcher && GenericAllOf` case
   12126              :             template<typename MatcherLHS>
   12127              :             friend std::enable_if_t<is_matcher_v<MatcherLHS>,
   12128              :             MatchAllOfGeneric<MatcherLHS, MatcherTs...>> operator && (
   12129              :                     MatcherLHS const& lhs,
   12130              :                     MatchAllOfGeneric<MatcherTs...>&& rhs) {
   12131              :                 return MatchAllOfGeneric<MatcherLHS, MatcherTs...>{array_cat(static_cast<void const*>(std::addressof(lhs)), CATCH_MOVE(rhs.m_matchers))};
   12132              :             }
   12133              :         };
   12134              : 
   12135              : 
   12136              :         template<typename... MatcherTs>
   12137              :         class MatchAnyOfGeneric final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12138              :         public:
   12139              :             MatchAnyOfGeneric(MatchAnyOfGeneric const&) = delete;
   12140              :             MatchAnyOfGeneric& operator=(MatchAnyOfGeneric const&) = delete;
   12141              :             MatchAnyOfGeneric(MatchAnyOfGeneric&&) = default;
   12142              :             MatchAnyOfGeneric& operator=(MatchAnyOfGeneric&&) = default;
   12143              : 
   12144              :             MatchAnyOfGeneric(MatcherTs const&... matchers) : m_matchers{ {std::addressof(matchers)...} } {}
   12145              :             explicit MatchAnyOfGeneric(std::array<void const*, sizeof...(MatcherTs)> matchers) : m_matchers{matchers} {}
   12146              : 
   12147              :             template<typename Arg>
   12148              :             bool match(Arg&& arg) const {
   12149              :                 return match_any_of<MatcherTs...>(arg, m_matchers, std::index_sequence_for<MatcherTs...>{});
   12150              :             }
   12151              : 
   12152              :             std::string describe() const override {
   12153              :                 return describe_multi_matcher<MatcherTs...>(" or "_sr, m_matchers, std::index_sequence_for<MatcherTs...>{});
   12154              :             }
   12155              : 
   12156              : 
   12157              :             // Has to be public to enable the concatenating operators
   12158              :             // below, because they are not friend of the RHS, only LHS,
   12159              :             // and thus cannot access private fields of RHS
   12160              :             std::array<void const*, sizeof...( MatcherTs )> m_matchers;
   12161              : 
   12162              :             //! Avoids type nesting for `GenericAnyOf || GenericAnyOf` case
   12163              :             template<typename... MatchersRHS>
   12164              :             friend MatchAnyOfGeneric<MatcherTs..., MatchersRHS...> operator || (
   12165              :                     MatchAnyOfGeneric<MatcherTs...>&& lhs,
   12166              :                     MatchAnyOfGeneric<MatchersRHS...>&& rhs) {
   12167              :                 return MatchAnyOfGeneric<MatcherTs..., MatchersRHS...>{array_cat(CATCH_MOVE(lhs.m_matchers), CATCH_MOVE(rhs.m_matchers))};
   12168              :             }
   12169              : 
   12170              :             //! Avoids type nesting for `GenericAnyOf || some matcher` case
   12171              :             template<typename MatcherRHS>
   12172              :             friend std::enable_if_t<is_matcher_v<MatcherRHS>,
   12173              :             MatchAnyOfGeneric<MatcherTs..., MatcherRHS>> operator || (
   12174              :                     MatchAnyOfGeneric<MatcherTs...>&& lhs,
   12175              :                     MatcherRHS const& rhs) {
   12176              :                 return MatchAnyOfGeneric<MatcherTs..., MatcherRHS>{array_cat(CATCH_MOVE(lhs.m_matchers), static_cast<void const*>(std::addressof(rhs)))};
   12177              :             }
   12178              : 
   12179              :             //! Avoids type nesting for `some matcher || GenericAnyOf` case
   12180              :             template<typename MatcherLHS>
   12181              :             friend std::enable_if_t<is_matcher_v<MatcherLHS>,
   12182              :             MatchAnyOfGeneric<MatcherLHS, MatcherTs...>> operator || (
   12183              :                 MatcherLHS const& lhs,
   12184              :                 MatchAnyOfGeneric<MatcherTs...>&& rhs) {
   12185              :                 return MatchAnyOfGeneric<MatcherLHS, MatcherTs...>{array_cat(static_cast<void const*>(std::addressof(lhs)), CATCH_MOVE(rhs.m_matchers))};
   12186              :             }
   12187              :         };
   12188              : 
   12189              : 
   12190              :         template<typename MatcherT>
   12191              :         class MatchNotOfGeneric final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12192              :             MatcherT const& m_matcher;
   12193              : 
   12194              :         public:
   12195              :             MatchNotOfGeneric(MatchNotOfGeneric const&) = delete;
   12196              :             MatchNotOfGeneric& operator=(MatchNotOfGeneric const&) = delete;
   12197              :             MatchNotOfGeneric(MatchNotOfGeneric&&) = default;
   12198              :             MatchNotOfGeneric& operator=(MatchNotOfGeneric&&) = default;
   12199              : 
   12200              :             explicit MatchNotOfGeneric(MatcherT const& matcher) : m_matcher{matcher} {}
   12201              : 
   12202              :             template<typename Arg>
   12203              :             bool match(Arg&& arg) const {
   12204              :                 return !m_matcher.match(arg);
   12205              :             }
   12206              : 
   12207              :             std::string describe() const override {
   12208              :                 return "not " + m_matcher.toString();
   12209              :             }
   12210              : 
   12211              :             //! Negating negation can just unwrap and return underlying matcher
   12212              :             friend MatcherT const& operator ! (MatchNotOfGeneric<MatcherT> const& matcher) {
   12213              :                 return matcher.m_matcher;
   12214              :             }
   12215              :         };
   12216              :     } // namespace Detail
   12217              : 
   12218              : 
   12219              :     // compose only generic matchers
   12220              :     template<typename MatcherLHS, typename MatcherRHS>
   12221              :     std::enable_if_t<Detail::are_generic_matchers_v<MatcherLHS, MatcherRHS>, Detail::MatchAllOfGeneric<MatcherLHS, MatcherRHS>>
   12222              :         operator && (MatcherLHS const& lhs, MatcherRHS const& rhs) {
   12223              :         return { lhs, rhs };
   12224              :     }
   12225              : 
   12226              :     template<typename MatcherLHS, typename MatcherRHS>
   12227              :     std::enable_if_t<Detail::are_generic_matchers_v<MatcherLHS, MatcherRHS>, Detail::MatchAnyOfGeneric<MatcherLHS, MatcherRHS>>
   12228              :         operator || (MatcherLHS const& lhs, MatcherRHS const& rhs) {
   12229              :         return { lhs, rhs };
   12230              :     }
   12231              : 
   12232              :     //! Wrap provided generic matcher in generic negator
   12233              :     template<typename MatcherT>
   12234              :     std::enable_if_t<Detail::is_generic_matcher_v<MatcherT>, Detail::MatchNotOfGeneric<MatcherT>>
   12235              :         operator ! (MatcherT const& matcher) {
   12236              :         return Detail::MatchNotOfGeneric<MatcherT>{matcher};
   12237              :     }
   12238              : 
   12239              : 
   12240              :     // compose mixed generic and non-generic matchers
   12241              :     template<typename MatcherLHS, typename ArgRHS>
   12242              :     std::enable_if_t<Detail::is_generic_matcher_v<MatcherLHS>, Detail::MatchAllOfGeneric<MatcherLHS, MatcherBase<ArgRHS>>>
   12243              :         operator && (MatcherLHS const& lhs, MatcherBase<ArgRHS> const& rhs) {
   12244              :         return { lhs, rhs };
   12245              :     }
   12246              : 
   12247              :     template<typename ArgLHS, typename MatcherRHS>
   12248              :     std::enable_if_t<Detail::is_generic_matcher_v<MatcherRHS>, Detail::MatchAllOfGeneric<MatcherBase<ArgLHS>, MatcherRHS>>
   12249              :         operator && (MatcherBase<ArgLHS> const& lhs, MatcherRHS const& rhs) {
   12250              :         return { lhs, rhs };
   12251              :     }
   12252              : 
   12253              :     template<typename MatcherLHS, typename ArgRHS>
   12254              :     std::enable_if_t<Detail::is_generic_matcher_v<MatcherLHS>, Detail::MatchAnyOfGeneric<MatcherLHS, MatcherBase<ArgRHS>>>
   12255              :         operator || (MatcherLHS const& lhs, MatcherBase<ArgRHS> const& rhs) {
   12256              :         return { lhs, rhs };
   12257              :     }
   12258              : 
   12259              :     template<typename ArgLHS, typename MatcherRHS>
   12260              :     std::enable_if_t<Detail::is_generic_matcher_v<MatcherRHS>, Detail::MatchAnyOfGeneric<MatcherBase<ArgLHS>, MatcherRHS>>
   12261              :         operator || (MatcherBase<ArgLHS> const& lhs, MatcherRHS const& rhs) {
   12262              :         return { lhs, rhs };
   12263              :     }
   12264              : 
   12265              : } // namespace Matchers
   12266              : } // namespace Catch
   12267              : 
   12268              : #endif // CATCH_MATCHERS_TEMPLATED_HPP_INCLUDED
   12269              : 
   12270              : namespace Catch {
   12271              :     namespace Matchers {
   12272              : 
   12273              :         class IsEmptyMatcher final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12274              :         public:
   12275              :             template <typename RangeLike>
   12276              :             bool match(RangeLike&& rng) const {
   12277              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_POLYFILL_NONMEMBER_CONTAINER_ACCESS)
   12278              :                 using Catch::Detail::empty;
   12279              : #else
   12280              :                 using std::empty;
   12281              : #endif
   12282              :                 return empty(rng);
   12283              :             }
   12284              : 
   12285              :             std::string describe() const override;
   12286              :         };
   12287              : 
   12288              :         class HasSizeMatcher final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12289              :             std::size_t m_target_size;
   12290              :         public:
   12291            0 :             explicit HasSizeMatcher(std::size_t target_size):
   12292            0 :                 m_target_size(target_size)
   12293            0 :             {}
   12294              : 
   12295              :             template <typename RangeLike>
   12296              :             bool match(RangeLike&& rng) const {
   12297              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_POLYFILL_NONMEMBER_CONTAINER_ACCESS)
   12298              :                 using Catch::Detail::size;
   12299              : #else
   12300              :                 using std::size;
   12301              : #endif
   12302              :                 return size(rng) == m_target_size;
   12303              :             }
   12304              : 
   12305              :             std::string describe() const override;
   12306              :         };
   12307              : 
   12308              :         template <typename Matcher>
   12309              :         class SizeMatchesMatcher final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12310              :             Matcher m_matcher;
   12311              :         public:
   12312              :             explicit SizeMatchesMatcher(Matcher m):
   12313              :                 m_matcher(CATCH_MOVE(m))
   12314              :             {}
   12315              : 
   12316              :             template <typename RangeLike>
   12317              :             bool match(RangeLike&& rng) const {
   12318              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_POLYFILL_NONMEMBER_CONTAINER_ACCESS)
   12319              :                 using Catch::Detail::size;
   12320              : #else
   12321              :                 using std::size;
   12322              : #endif
   12323              :                 return m_matcher.match(size(rng));
   12324              :             }
   12325              : 
   12326              :             std::string describe() const override {
   12327              :                 return "size matches " + m_matcher.describe();
   12328              :             }
   12329              :         };
   12330              : 
   12331              : 
   12332              :         //! Creates a matcher that accepts empty ranges/containers
   12333              :         IsEmptyMatcher IsEmpty();
   12334              :         //! Creates a matcher that accepts ranges/containers with specific size
   12335              :         HasSizeMatcher SizeIs(std::size_t sz);
   12336              :         template <typename Matcher>
   12337              :         std::enable_if_t<Detail::is_matcher_v<Matcher>,
   12338              :         SizeMatchesMatcher<Matcher>> SizeIs(Matcher&& m) {
   12339              :             return SizeMatchesMatcher<Matcher>{CATCH_FORWARD(m)};
   12340              :         }
   12341              : 
   12342              :     } // end namespace Matchers
   12343              : } // end namespace Catch
   12344              : 
   12345              : #endif // CATCH_MATCHERS_CONTAINER_PROPERTIES_HPP_INCLUDED
   12346              : 
   12347              : 
   12348              : #ifndef CATCH_MATCHERS_CONTAINS_HPP_INCLUDED
   12349              : #define CATCH_MATCHERS_CONTAINS_HPP_INCLUDED
   12350              : 
   12351              : 
   12352              : #include <functional>
   12353              : #include <type_traits>
   12354              : 
   12355              : namespace Catch {
   12356              :     namespace Matchers {
   12357              :         //! Matcher for checking that an element in range is equal to specific element
   12358              :         template <typename T, typename Equality>
   12359              :         class ContainsElementMatcher final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12360              :             T m_desired;
   12361              :             Equality m_eq;
   12362              :         public:
   12363              :             template <typename T2, typename Equality2>
   12364              :             ContainsElementMatcher(T2&& target, Equality2&& predicate):
   12365              :                 m_desired(CATCH_FORWARD(target)),
   12366              :                 m_eq(CATCH_FORWARD(predicate))
   12367              :             {}
   12368              : 
   12369              :             std::string describe() const override {
   12370              :                 return "contains element " + Catch::Detail::stringify(m_desired);
   12371              :             }
   12372              : 
   12373              :             template <typename RangeLike>
   12374              :             bool match( RangeLike&& rng ) const {
   12375              :                 for ( auto&& elem : rng ) {
   12376              :                     if ( m_eq( elem, m_desired ) ) { return true; }
   12377              :                 }
   12378              :                 return false;
   12379              :             }
   12380              :         };
   12381              : 
   12382              :         //! Meta-matcher for checking that an element in a range matches a specific matcher
   12383              :         template <typename Matcher>
   12384              :         class ContainsMatcherMatcher final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12385              :             Matcher m_matcher;
   12386              :         public:
   12387              :             // Note that we do a copy+move to avoid having to SFINAE this
   12388              :             // constructor (and also avoid some perfect forwarding failure
   12389              :             // cases)
   12390              :             ContainsMatcherMatcher(Matcher matcher):
   12391              :                 m_matcher(CATCH_MOVE(matcher))
   12392              :             {}
   12393              : 
   12394              :             template <typename RangeLike>
   12395              :             bool match(RangeLike&& rng) const {
   12396              :                 for (auto&& elem : rng) {
   12397              :                     if (m_matcher.match(elem)) {
   12398              :                         return true;
   12399              :                     }
   12400              :                 }
   12401              :                 return false;
   12402              :             }
   12403              : 
   12404              :             std::string describe() const override {
   12405              :                 return "contains element matching " + m_matcher.describe();
   12406              :             }
   12407              :         };
   12408              : 
   12409              :         /**
   12410              :          * Creates a matcher that checks whether a range contains a specific element.
   12411              :          *
   12412              :          * Uses `std::equal_to` to do the comparison
   12413              :          */
   12414              :         template <typename T>
   12415              :         std::enable_if_t<!Detail::is_matcher_v<T>,
   12416              :         ContainsElementMatcher<T, std::equal_to<>>> Contains(T&& elem) {
   12417              :             return { CATCH_FORWARD(elem), std::equal_to<>{} };
   12418              :         }
   12419              : 
   12420              :         //! Creates a matcher that checks whether a range contains element matching a matcher
   12421              :         template <typename Matcher>
   12422              :         std::enable_if_t<Detail::is_matcher_v<Matcher>,
   12423              :         ContainsMatcherMatcher<Matcher>> Contains(Matcher&& matcher) {
   12424              :             return { CATCH_FORWARD(matcher) };
   12425              :         }
   12426              : 
   12427              :         /**
   12428              :          * Creates a matcher that checks whether a range contains a specific element.
   12429              :          *
   12430              :          * Uses `eq` to do the comparisons, the element is provided on the rhs
   12431              :          */
   12432              :         template <typename T, typename Equality>
   12433              :         ContainsElementMatcher<T, Equality> Contains(T&& elem, Equality&& eq) {
   12434              :             return { CATCH_FORWARD(elem), CATCH_FORWARD(eq) };
   12435              :         }
   12436              : 
   12437              :     }
   12438              : }
   12439              : 
   12440              : #endif // CATCH_MATCHERS_CONTAINS_HPP_INCLUDED
   12441              : 
   12442              : 
   12443              : #ifndef CATCH_MATCHERS_EXCEPTION_HPP_INCLUDED
   12444              : #define CATCH_MATCHERS_EXCEPTION_HPP_INCLUDED
   12445              : 
   12446              : 
   12447              : namespace Catch {
   12448              : namespace Matchers {
   12449              : 
   12450              : class ExceptionMessageMatcher final : public MatcherBase<std::exception> {
   12451              :     std::string m_message;
   12452              : public:
   12453              : 
   12454            0 :     ExceptionMessageMatcher(std::string const& message):
   12455            0 :         m_message(message)
   12456            0 :     {}
   12457              : 
   12458              :     bool match(std::exception const& ex) const override;
   12459              : 
   12460              :     std::string describe() const override;
   12461              : };
   12462              : 
   12463              : //! Creates a matcher that checks whether a std derived exception has the provided message
   12464              : ExceptionMessageMatcher Message(std::string const& message);
   12465              : 
   12466              : template <typename StringMatcherType>
   12467              : class ExceptionMessageMatchesMatcher final
   12468              :     : public MatcherBase<std::exception> {
   12469              :     StringMatcherType m_matcher;
   12470              : 
   12471              : public:
   12472              :     ExceptionMessageMatchesMatcher( StringMatcherType matcher ):
   12473              :         m_matcher( CATCH_MOVE( matcher ) ) {}
   12474              : 
   12475              :     bool match( std::exception const& ex ) const override {
   12476              :         return m_matcher.match( ex.what() );
   12477              :     }
   12478              : 
   12479              :     std::string describe() const override {
   12480              :         return " matches \"" + m_matcher.describe() + '"';
   12481              :     }
   12482              : };
   12483              : 
   12484              : //! Creates a matcher that checks whether a message from an std derived
   12485              : //! exception matches a provided matcher
   12486              : template <typename StringMatcherType>
   12487              : ExceptionMessageMatchesMatcher<StringMatcherType>
   12488              : MessageMatches( StringMatcherType&& matcher ) {
   12489              :     return { CATCH_FORWARD( matcher ) };
   12490              : }
   12491              : 
   12492              : } // namespace Matchers
   12493              : } // namespace Catch
   12494              : 
   12495              : #endif // CATCH_MATCHERS_EXCEPTION_HPP_INCLUDED
   12496              : 
   12497              : 
   12498              : #ifndef CATCH_MATCHERS_FLOATING_POINT_HPP_INCLUDED
   12499              : #define CATCH_MATCHERS_FLOATING_POINT_HPP_INCLUDED
   12500              : 
   12501              : 
   12502              : namespace Catch {
   12503              : namespace Matchers {
   12504              : 
   12505              :     namespace Detail {
   12506              :         enum class FloatingPointKind : uint8_t;
   12507              :     }
   12508              : 
   12509              :     class  WithinAbsMatcher final : public MatcherBase<double> {
   12510              :     public:
   12511              :         WithinAbsMatcher(double target, double margin);
   12512              :         bool match(double const& matchee) const override;
   12513              :         std::string describe() const override;
   12514              :     private:
   12515              :         double m_target;
   12516              :         double m_margin;
   12517              :     };
   12518              : 
   12519              :     //! Creates a matcher that accepts numbers within certain range of target
   12520              :     WithinAbsMatcher WithinAbs( double target, double margin );
   12521              : 
   12522              : 
   12523              : 
   12524              :     class WithinUlpsMatcher final : public MatcherBase<double> {
   12525              :     public:
   12526              :         WithinUlpsMatcher( double target,
   12527              :                            uint64_t ulps,
   12528              :                            Detail::FloatingPointKind baseType );
   12529              :         bool match(double const& matchee) const override;
   12530              :         std::string describe() const override;
   12531              :     private:
   12532              :         double m_target;
   12533              :         uint64_t m_ulps;
   12534              :         Detail::FloatingPointKind m_type;
   12535              :     };
   12536              : 
   12537              :     //! Creates a matcher that accepts doubles within certain ULP range of target
   12538              :     WithinUlpsMatcher WithinULP(double target, uint64_t maxUlpDiff);
   12539              :     //! Creates a matcher that accepts floats within certain ULP range of target
   12540              :     WithinUlpsMatcher WithinULP(float target, uint64_t maxUlpDiff);
   12541              : 
   12542              : 
   12543              : 
   12544              :     // Given IEEE-754 format for floats and doubles, we can assume
   12545              :     // that float -> double promotion is lossless. Given this, we can
   12546              :     // assume that if we do the standard relative comparison of
   12547              :     // |lhs - rhs| <= epsilon * max(fabs(lhs), fabs(rhs)), then we get
   12548              :     // the same result if we do this for floats, as if we do this for
   12549              :     // doubles that were promoted from floats.
   12550              :     class WithinRelMatcher final : public MatcherBase<double> {
   12551              :     public:
   12552              :         WithinRelMatcher( double target, double epsilon );
   12553              :         bool match(double const& matchee) const override;
   12554              :         std::string describe() const override;
   12555              :     private:
   12556              :         double m_target;
   12557              :         double m_epsilon;
   12558              :     };
   12559              : 
   12560              :     //! Creates a matcher that accepts doubles within certain relative range of target
   12561              :     WithinRelMatcher WithinRel(double target, double eps);
   12562              :     //! Creates a matcher that accepts doubles within 100*DBL_EPS relative range of target
   12563              :     WithinRelMatcher WithinRel(double target);
   12564              :     //! Creates a matcher that accepts doubles within certain relative range of target
   12565              :     WithinRelMatcher WithinRel(float target, float eps);
   12566              :     //! Creates a matcher that accepts floats within 100*FLT_EPS relative range of target
   12567              :     WithinRelMatcher WithinRel(float target);
   12568              : 
   12569              : 
   12570              : 
   12571              :     class IsNaNMatcher final : public MatcherBase<double> {
   12572              :     public:
   12573            0 :         IsNaNMatcher() = default;
   12574              :         bool match( double const& matchee ) const override;
   12575              :         std::string describe() const override;
   12576              :     };
   12577              : 
   12578              :     IsNaNMatcher IsNaN();
   12579              : 
   12580              : } // namespace Matchers
   12581              : } // namespace Catch
   12582              : 
   12583              : #endif // CATCH_MATCHERS_FLOATING_POINT_HPP_INCLUDED
   12584              : 
   12585              : 
   12586              : #ifndef CATCH_MATCHERS_PREDICATE_HPP_INCLUDED
   12587              : #define CATCH_MATCHERS_PREDICATE_HPP_INCLUDED
   12588              : 
   12589              : 
   12590              : #include <string>
   12591              : 
   12592              : namespace Catch {
   12593              : namespace Matchers {
   12594              : 
   12595              : namespace Detail {
   12596              :     std::string finalizeDescription(const std::string& desc);
   12597              : } // namespace Detail
   12598              : 
   12599              : template <typename T, typename Predicate>
   12600              : class PredicateMatcher final : public MatcherBase<T> {
   12601              :     Predicate m_predicate;
   12602              :     std::string m_description;
   12603              : public:
   12604              : 
   12605              :     PredicateMatcher(Predicate&& elem, std::string const& descr)
   12606              :         :m_predicate(CATCH_FORWARD(elem)),
   12607              :         m_description(Detail::finalizeDescription(descr))
   12608              :     {}
   12609              : 
   12610              :     bool match( T const& item ) const override {
   12611              :         return m_predicate(item);
   12612              :     }
   12613              : 
   12614              :     std::string describe() const override {
   12615              :         return m_description;
   12616              :     }
   12617              : };
   12618              : 
   12619              :     /**
   12620              :      * Creates a matcher that calls delegates `match` to the provided predicate.
   12621              :      *
   12622              :      * The user has to explicitly specify the argument type to the matcher
   12623              :      */
   12624              :     template<typename T, typename Pred>
   12625              :     PredicateMatcher<T, Pred> Predicate(Pred&& predicate, std::string const& description = "") {
   12626              :         static_assert(is_callable<Pred(T)>::value, "Predicate not callable with argument T");
   12627              :         static_assert(std::is_same<bool, FunctionReturnType<Pred, T>>::value, "Predicate does not return bool");
   12628              :         return PredicateMatcher<T, Pred>(CATCH_FORWARD(predicate), description);
   12629              :     }
   12630              : 
   12631              : } // namespace Matchers
   12632              : } // namespace Catch
   12633              : 
   12634              : #endif // CATCH_MATCHERS_PREDICATE_HPP_INCLUDED
   12635              : 
   12636              : 
   12637              : #ifndef CATCH_MATCHERS_QUANTIFIERS_HPP_INCLUDED
   12638              : #define CATCH_MATCHERS_QUANTIFIERS_HPP_INCLUDED
   12639              : 
   12640              : 
   12641              : namespace Catch {
   12642              :     namespace Matchers {
   12643              :         // Matcher for checking that all elements in range matches a given matcher.
   12644              :         template <typename Matcher>
   12645              :         class AllMatchMatcher final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12646              :             Matcher m_matcher;
   12647              :         public:
   12648              :             AllMatchMatcher(Matcher matcher):
   12649              :                 m_matcher(CATCH_MOVE(matcher))
   12650              :             {}
   12651              : 
   12652              :             std::string describe() const override {
   12653              :                 return "all match " + m_matcher.describe();
   12654              :             }
   12655              : 
   12656              :             template <typename RangeLike>
   12657              :             bool match(RangeLike&& rng) const {
   12658              :                 for (auto&& elem : rng) {
   12659              :                     if (!m_matcher.match(elem)) {
   12660              :                         return false;
   12661              :                     }
   12662              :                 }
   12663              :                 return true;
   12664              :             }
   12665              :         };
   12666              : 
   12667              :         // Matcher for checking that no element in range matches a given matcher.
   12668              :         template <typename Matcher>
   12669              :         class NoneMatchMatcher final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12670              :             Matcher m_matcher;
   12671              :         public:
   12672              :             NoneMatchMatcher(Matcher matcher):
   12673              :                 m_matcher(CATCH_MOVE(matcher))
   12674              :             {}
   12675              : 
   12676              :             std::string describe() const override {
   12677              :                 return "none match " + m_matcher.describe();
   12678              :             }
   12679              : 
   12680              :             template <typename RangeLike>
   12681              :             bool match(RangeLike&& rng) const {
   12682              :                 for (auto&& elem : rng) {
   12683              :                     if (m_matcher.match(elem)) {
   12684              :                         return false;
   12685              :                     }
   12686              :                 }
   12687              :                 return true;
   12688              :             }
   12689              :         };
   12690              : 
   12691              :         // Matcher for checking that at least one element in range matches a given matcher.
   12692              :         template <typename Matcher>
   12693              :         class AnyMatchMatcher final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12694              :             Matcher m_matcher;
   12695              :         public:
   12696              :             AnyMatchMatcher(Matcher matcher):
   12697              :                 m_matcher(CATCH_MOVE(matcher))
   12698              :             {}
   12699              : 
   12700              :             std::string describe() const override {
   12701              :                 return "any match " + m_matcher.describe();
   12702              :             }
   12703              : 
   12704              :             template <typename RangeLike>
   12705              :             bool match(RangeLike&& rng) const {
   12706              :                 for (auto&& elem : rng) {
   12707              :                     if (m_matcher.match(elem)) {
   12708              :                         return true;
   12709              :                     }
   12710              :                 }
   12711              :                 return false;
   12712              :             }
   12713              :         };
   12714              : 
   12715              :         // Matcher for checking that all elements in range are true.
   12716              :         class AllTrueMatcher final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12717              :         public:
   12718              :             std::string describe() const override;
   12719              : 
   12720              :             template <typename RangeLike>
   12721              :             bool match(RangeLike&& rng) const {
   12722              :                 for (auto&& elem : rng) {
   12723              :                     if (!elem) {
   12724              :                         return false;
   12725              :                     }
   12726              :                 }
   12727              :                 return true;
   12728              :             }
   12729              :         };
   12730              : 
   12731              :         // Matcher for checking that no element in range is true.
   12732              :         class NoneTrueMatcher final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12733              :         public:
   12734              :             std::string describe() const override;
   12735              : 
   12736              :             template <typename RangeLike>
   12737              :             bool match(RangeLike&& rng) const {
   12738              :                 for (auto&& elem : rng) {
   12739              :                     if (elem) {
   12740              :                         return false;
   12741              :                     }
   12742              :                 }
   12743              :                 return true;
   12744              :             }
   12745              :         };
   12746              : 
   12747              :         // Matcher for checking that any element in range is true.
   12748              :         class AnyTrueMatcher final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12749              :         public:
   12750              :             std::string describe() const override;
   12751              : 
   12752              :             template <typename RangeLike>
   12753              :             bool match(RangeLike&& rng) const {
   12754              :                 for (auto&& elem : rng) {
   12755              :                     if (elem) {
   12756              :                         return true;
   12757              :                     }
   12758              :                 }
   12759              :                 return false;
   12760              :             }
   12761              :         };
   12762              : 
   12763              :         // Creates a matcher that checks whether all elements in a range match a matcher
   12764              :         template <typename Matcher>
   12765              :         AllMatchMatcher<Matcher> AllMatch(Matcher&& matcher) {
   12766              :             return { CATCH_FORWARD(matcher) };
   12767              :         }
   12768              : 
   12769              :         // Creates a matcher that checks whether no element in a range matches a matcher.
   12770              :         template <typename Matcher>
   12771              :         NoneMatchMatcher<Matcher> NoneMatch(Matcher&& matcher) {
   12772              :             return { CATCH_FORWARD(matcher) };
   12773              :         }
   12774              : 
   12775              :         // Creates a matcher that checks whether any element in a range matches a matcher.
   12776              :         template <typename Matcher>
   12777              :         AnyMatchMatcher<Matcher> AnyMatch(Matcher&& matcher) {
   12778              :             return { CATCH_FORWARD(matcher) };
   12779              :         }
   12780              : 
   12781              :         // Creates a matcher that checks whether all elements in a range are true
   12782              :         AllTrueMatcher AllTrue();
   12783              : 
   12784              :         // Creates a matcher that checks whether no element in a range is true
   12785              :         NoneTrueMatcher NoneTrue();
   12786              : 
   12787              :         // Creates a matcher that checks whether any element in a range is true
   12788              :         AnyTrueMatcher AnyTrue();
   12789              :     }
   12790              : }
   12791              : 
   12792              : #endif // CATCH_MATCHERS_QUANTIFIERS_HPP_INCLUDED
   12793              : 
   12794              : 
   12795              : #ifndef CATCH_MATCHERS_RANGE_EQUALS_HPP_INCLUDED
   12796              : #define CATCH_MATCHERS_RANGE_EQUALS_HPP_INCLUDED
   12797              : 
   12798              : 
   12799              : #include <functional>
   12800              : 
   12801              : namespace Catch {
   12802              :     namespace Matchers {
   12803              : 
   12804              :         /**
   12805              :          * Matcher for checking that an element contains the same
   12806              :          * elements in the same order
   12807              :          */
   12808              :         template <typename TargetRangeLike, typename Equality>
   12809              :         class RangeEqualsMatcher final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12810              :             TargetRangeLike m_desired;
   12811              :             Equality m_predicate;
   12812              : 
   12813              :         public:
   12814              :             template <typename TargetRangeLike2, typename Equality2>
   12815              :             constexpr
   12816              :             RangeEqualsMatcher( TargetRangeLike2&& range,
   12817              :                                 Equality2&& predicate ):
   12818              :                 m_desired( CATCH_FORWARD( range ) ),
   12819              :                 m_predicate( CATCH_FORWARD( predicate ) ) {}
   12820              : 
   12821              :             template <typename RangeLike>
   12822              :             constexpr
   12823              :             bool match( RangeLike&& rng ) const {
   12824              :                 auto rng_start = begin( rng );
   12825              :                 const auto rng_end = end( rng );
   12826              :                 auto target_start = begin( m_desired );
   12827              :                 const auto target_end = end( m_desired );
   12828              : 
   12829              :                 while (rng_start != rng_end && target_start != target_end) {
   12830              :                     if (!m_predicate(*rng_start, *target_start)) {
   12831              :                         return false;
   12832              :                     }
   12833              :                     ++rng_start;
   12834              :                     ++target_start;
   12835              :                 }
   12836              :                 return rng_start == rng_end && target_start == target_end;
   12837              :             }
   12838              : 
   12839              :             std::string describe() const override {
   12840              :                 return "elements are " + Catch::Detail::stringify( m_desired );
   12841              :             }
   12842              :         };
   12843              : 
   12844              :         /**
   12845              :          * Matcher for checking that an element contains the same
   12846              :          * elements (but not necessarily in the same order)
   12847              :          */
   12848              :         template <typename TargetRangeLike, typename Equality>
   12849              :         class UnorderedRangeEqualsMatcher final : public MatcherGenericBase {
   12850              :             TargetRangeLike m_desired;
   12851              :             Equality m_predicate;
   12852              : 
   12853              :         public:
   12854              :             template <typename TargetRangeLike2, typename Equality2>
   12855              :             constexpr
   12856              :             UnorderedRangeEqualsMatcher( TargetRangeLike2&& range,
   12857              :                                          Equality2&& predicate ):
   12858              :                 m_desired( CATCH_FORWARD( range ) ),
   12859              :                 m_predicate( CATCH_FORWARD( predicate ) ) {}
   12860              : 
   12861              :             template <typename RangeLike>
   12862              :             constexpr
   12863              :             bool match( RangeLike&& rng ) const {
   12864              :                 using std::begin;
   12865              :                 using std::end;
   12866              :                 return Catch::Detail::is_permutation( begin( m_desired ),
   12867              :                                                       end( m_desired ),
   12868              :                                                       begin( rng ),
   12869              :                                                       end( rng ),
   12870              :                                                       m_predicate );
   12871              :             }
   12872              : 
   12873              :             std::string describe() const override {
   12874              :                 return "unordered elements are " +
   12875              :                        ::Catch::Detail::stringify( m_desired );
   12876              :             }
   12877              :         };
   12878              : 
   12879              :         /**
   12880              :          * Creates a matcher that checks if all elements in a range are equal
   12881              :          * to all elements in another range.
   12882              :          *
   12883              :          * Uses the provided predicate `predicate` to do the comparisons
   12884              :          * (defaulting to `std::equal_to`)
   12885              :          */
   12886              :         template <typename RangeLike,
   12887              :                   typename Equality = decltype( std::equal_to<>{} )>
   12888              :         constexpr
   12889              :         RangeEqualsMatcher<RangeLike, Equality>
   12890              :         RangeEquals( RangeLike&& range,
   12891              :                      Equality&& predicate = std::equal_to<>{} ) {
   12892              :             return { CATCH_FORWARD( range ), CATCH_FORWARD( predicate ) };
   12893              :         }
   12894              : 
   12895              :         /**
   12896              :          * Creates a matcher that checks if all elements in a range are equal
   12897              :          * to all elements in an initializer list.
   12898              :          *
   12899              :          * Uses the provided predicate `predicate` to do the comparisons
   12900              :          * (defaulting to `std::equal_to`)
   12901              :          */
   12902              :         template <typename T,
   12903              :                   typename Equality = decltype( std::equal_to<>{} )>
   12904              :         constexpr
   12905              :         RangeEqualsMatcher<std::initializer_list<T>, Equality>
   12906              :         RangeEquals( std::initializer_list<T> range,
   12907              :                      Equality&& predicate = std::equal_to<>{} ) {
   12908              :             return { range, CATCH_FORWARD( predicate ) };
   12909              :         }
   12910              : 
   12911              :         /**
   12912              :          * Creates a matcher that checks if all elements in a range are equal
   12913              :          * to all elements in another range, in some permutation.
   12914              :          *
   12915              :          * Uses the provided predicate `predicate` to do the comparisons
   12916              :          * (defaulting to `std::equal_to`)
   12917              :          */
   12918              :         template <typename RangeLike,
   12919              :                   typename Equality = decltype( std::equal_to<>{} )>
   12920              :         constexpr
   12921              :         UnorderedRangeEqualsMatcher<RangeLike, Equality>
   12922              :         UnorderedRangeEquals( RangeLike&& range,
   12923              :                               Equality&& predicate = std::equal_to<>{} ) {
   12924              :             return { CATCH_FORWARD( range ), CATCH_FORWARD( predicate ) };
   12925              :         }
   12926              : 
   12927              :         /**
   12928              :          * Creates a matcher that checks if all elements in a range are equal
   12929              :          * to all elements in an initializer list, in some permutation.
   12930              :          *
   12931              :          * Uses the provided predicate `predicate` to do the comparisons
   12932              :          * (defaulting to `std::equal_to`)
   12933              :          */
   12934              :         template <typename T,
   12935              :                   typename Equality = decltype( std::equal_to<>{} )>
   12936              :         constexpr
   12937              :         UnorderedRangeEqualsMatcher<std::initializer_list<T>, Equality>
   12938              :         UnorderedRangeEquals( std::initializer_list<T> range,
   12939              :                               Equality&& predicate = std::equal_to<>{} ) {
   12940              :             return { range, CATCH_FORWARD( predicate ) };
   12941              :         }
   12942              :     } // namespace Matchers
   12943              : } // namespace Catch
   12944              : 
   12945              : #endif // CATCH_MATCHERS_RANGE_EQUALS_HPP_INCLUDED
   12946              : 
   12947              : 
   12948              : #ifndef CATCH_MATCHERS_STRING_HPP_INCLUDED
   12949              : #define CATCH_MATCHERS_STRING_HPP_INCLUDED
   12950              : 
   12951              : 
   12952              : #include <string>
   12953              : 
   12954              : namespace Catch {
   12955              : namespace Matchers {
   12956              : 
   12957              :     struct CasedString {
   12958              :         CasedString( std::string const& str, CaseSensitive caseSensitivity );
   12959              :         std::string adjustString( std::string const& str ) const;
   12960              :         StringRef caseSensitivitySuffix() const;
   12961              : 
   12962              :         CaseSensitive m_caseSensitivity;
   12963              :         std::string m_str;
   12964              :     };
   12965              : 
   12966              :     class StringMatcherBase : public MatcherBase<std::string> {
   12967              :     protected:
   12968              :         CasedString m_comparator;
   12969              :         StringRef m_operation;
   12970              : 
   12971              :     public:
   12972              :         StringMatcherBase( StringRef operation,
   12973              :                            CasedString const& comparator );
   12974              :         std::string describe() const override;
   12975              :     };
   12976              : 
   12977              :     class StringEqualsMatcher final : public StringMatcherBase {
   12978              :     public:
   12979              :         StringEqualsMatcher( CasedString const& comparator );
   12980              :         bool match( std::string const& source ) const override;
   12981              :     };
   12982              :     class StringContainsMatcher final : public StringMatcherBase {
   12983              :     public:
   12984              :         StringContainsMatcher( CasedString const& comparator );
   12985              :         bool match( std::string const& source ) const override;
   12986              :     };
   12987              :     class StartsWithMatcher final : public StringMatcherBase {
   12988              :     public:
   12989              :         StartsWithMatcher( CasedString const& comparator );
   12990              :         bool match( std::string const& source ) const override;
   12991              :     };
   12992              :     class EndsWithMatcher final : public StringMatcherBase {
   12993              :     public:
   12994              :         EndsWithMatcher( CasedString const& comparator );
   12995              :         bool match( std::string const& source ) const override;
   12996              :     };
   12997              : 
   12998              :     class RegexMatcher final : public MatcherBase<std::string> {
   12999              :         std::string m_regex;
   13000              :         CaseSensitive m_caseSensitivity;
   13001              : 
   13002              :     public:
   13003              :         RegexMatcher( std::string regex, CaseSensitive caseSensitivity );
   13004              :         bool match( std::string const& matchee ) const override;
   13005              :         std::string describe() const override;
   13006              :     };
   13007              : 
   13008              :     //! Creates matcher that accepts strings that are exactly equal to `str`
   13009              :     StringEqualsMatcher Equals( std::string const& str, CaseSensitive caseSensitivity = CaseSensitive::Yes );
   13010              :     //! Creates matcher that accepts strings that contain `str`
   13011              :     StringContainsMatcher ContainsSubstring( std::string const& str, CaseSensitive caseSensitivity = CaseSensitive::Yes );
   13012              :     //! Creates matcher that accepts strings that _end_ with `str`
   13013              :     EndsWithMatcher EndsWith( std::string const& str, CaseSensitive caseSensitivity = CaseSensitive::Yes );
   13014              :     //! Creates matcher that accepts strings that _start_ with `str`
   13015              :     StartsWithMatcher StartsWith( std::string const& str, CaseSensitive caseSensitivity = CaseSensitive::Yes );
   13016              :     //! Creates matcher that accepts strings matching `regex`
   13017              :     RegexMatcher Matches( std::string const& regex, CaseSensitive caseSensitivity = CaseSensitive::Yes );
   13018              : 
   13019              : } // namespace Matchers
   13020              : } // namespace Catch
   13021              : 
   13022              : #endif // CATCH_MATCHERS_STRING_HPP_INCLUDED
   13023              : 
   13024              : 
   13025              : #ifndef CATCH_MATCHERS_VECTOR_HPP_INCLUDED
   13026              : #define CATCH_MATCHERS_VECTOR_HPP_INCLUDED
   13027              : 
   13028              : 
   13029              : #include <algorithm>
   13030              : 
   13031              : namespace Catch {
   13032              : namespace Matchers {
   13033              : 
   13034              :     template<typename T, typename Alloc>
   13035              :     class VectorContainsElementMatcher final : public MatcherBase<std::vector<T, Alloc>> {
   13036              :         T const& m_comparator;
   13037              : 
   13038              :     public:
   13039              :         VectorContainsElementMatcher(T const& comparator):
   13040              :             m_comparator(comparator)
   13041              :         {}
   13042              : 
   13043              :         bool match(std::vector<T, Alloc> const& v) const override {
   13044              :             for (auto const& el : v) {
   13045              :                 if (el == m_comparator) {
   13046              :                     return true;
   13047              :                 }
   13048              :             }
   13049              :             return false;
   13050              :         }
   13051              : 
   13052              :         std::string describe() const override {
   13053              :             return "Contains: " + ::Catch::Detail::stringify( m_comparator );
   13054              :         }
   13055              :     };
   13056              : 
   13057              :     template<typename T, typename AllocComp, typename AllocMatch>
   13058              :     class ContainsMatcher final : public MatcherBase<std::vector<T, AllocMatch>> {
   13059              :         std::vector<T, AllocComp> const& m_comparator;
   13060              : 
   13061              :     public:
   13062              :         ContainsMatcher(std::vector<T, AllocComp> const& comparator):
   13063              :             m_comparator( comparator )
   13064              :         {}
   13065              : 
   13066              :         bool match(std::vector<T, AllocMatch> const& v) const override {
   13067              :             // !TBD: see note in EqualsMatcher
   13068              :             if (m_comparator.size() > v.size())
   13069              :                 return false;
   13070              :             for (auto const& comparator : m_comparator) {
   13071              :                 auto present = false;
   13072              :                 for (const auto& el : v) {
   13073              :                     if (el == comparator) {
   13074              :                         present = true;
   13075              :                         break;
   13076              :                     }
   13077              :                 }
   13078              :                 if (!present) {
   13079              :                     return false;
   13080              :                 }
   13081              :             }
   13082              :             return true;
   13083              :         }
   13084              :         std::string describe() const override {
   13085              :             return "Contains: " + ::Catch::Detail::stringify( m_comparator );
   13086              :         }
   13087              :     };
   13088              : 
   13089              :     template<typename T, typename AllocComp, typename AllocMatch>
   13090              :     class EqualsMatcher final : public MatcherBase<std::vector<T, AllocMatch>> {
   13091              :         std::vector<T, AllocComp> const& m_comparator;
   13092              : 
   13093              :     public:
   13094              :         EqualsMatcher(std::vector<T, AllocComp> const& comparator):
   13095              :             m_comparator( comparator )
   13096              :         {}
   13097              : 
   13098              :         bool match(std::vector<T, AllocMatch> const& v) const override {
   13099              :             // !TBD: This currently works if all elements can be compared using !=
   13100              :             // - a more general approach would be via a compare template that defaults
   13101              :             // to using !=. but could be specialised for, e.g. std::vector<T> etc
   13102              :             // - then just call that directly
   13103              :             if ( m_comparator.size() != v.size() ) { return false; }
   13104              :             for ( std::size_t i = 0; i < v.size(); ++i ) {
   13105              :                 if ( !( m_comparator[i] == v[i] ) ) { return false; }
   13106              :             }
   13107              :             return true;
   13108              :         }
   13109              :         std::string describe() const override {
   13110              :             return "Equals: " + ::Catch::Detail::stringify( m_comparator );
   13111              :         }
   13112              :     };
   13113              : 
   13114              :     template<typename T, typename AllocComp, typename AllocMatch>
