   13115              :     class ApproxMatcher final : public MatcherBase<std::vector<T, AllocMatch>> {
   13116              :         std::vector<T, AllocComp> const& m_comparator;
   13117              :         mutable Catch::Approx approx = Catch::Approx::custom();
   13118              : 
   13119              :     public:
   13120              :         ApproxMatcher(std::vector<T, AllocComp> const& comparator):
   13121              :             m_comparator( comparator )
   13122              :         {}
   13123              : 
   13124              :         bool match(std::vector<T, AllocMatch> const& v) const override {
   13125              :             if (m_comparator.size() != v.size())
   13126              :                 return false;
   13127              :             for (std::size_t i = 0; i < v.size(); ++i)
   13128              :                 if (m_comparator[i] != approx(v[i]))
   13129              :                     return false;
   13130              :             return true;
   13131              :         }
   13132              :         std::string describe() const override {
   13133              :             return "is approx: " + ::Catch::Detail::stringify( m_comparator );
   13134              :         }
   13135              :         template <typename = std::enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>>
   13136              :         ApproxMatcher& epsilon( T const& newEpsilon ) {
   13137              :             approx.epsilon(static_cast<double>(newEpsilon));
   13138              :             return *this;
   13139              :         }
   13140              :         template <typename = std::enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>>
   13141              :         ApproxMatcher& margin( T const& newMargin ) {
   13142              :             approx.margin(static_cast<double>(newMargin));
   13143              :             return *this;
   13144              :         }
   13145              :         template <typename = std::enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>>
   13146              :         ApproxMatcher& scale( T const& newScale ) {
   13147              :             approx.scale(static_cast<double>(newScale));
   13148              :             return *this;
   13149              :         }
   13150              :     };
   13151              : 
   13152              :     template<typename T, typename AllocComp, typename AllocMatch>
   13153              :     class UnorderedEqualsMatcher final : public MatcherBase<std::vector<T, AllocMatch>> {
   13154              :         std::vector<T, AllocComp> const& m_target;
   13155              : 
   13156              :     public:
   13157              :         UnorderedEqualsMatcher(std::vector<T, AllocComp> const& target):
   13158              :             m_target(target)
   13159              :         {}
   13160              :         bool match(std::vector<T, AllocMatch> const& vec) const override {
   13161              :             if (m_target.size() != vec.size()) {
   13162              :                 return false;
   13163              :             }
   13164              :             return std::is_permutation(m_target.begin(), m_target.end(), vec.begin());
   13165              :         }
   13166              : 
   13167              :         std::string describe() const override {
   13168              :             return "UnorderedEquals: " + ::Catch::Detail::stringify(m_target);
   13169              :         }
   13170              :     };
   13171              : 
   13172              : 
   13173              :     // The following functions create the actual matcher objects.
   13174              :     // This allows the types to be inferred
   13175              : 
   13176              :     //! Creates a matcher that matches vectors that contain all elements in `comparator`
   13177              :     template<typename T, typename AllocComp = std::allocator<T>, typename AllocMatch = AllocComp>
   13178              :     ContainsMatcher<T, AllocComp, AllocMatch> Contains( std::vector<T, AllocComp> const& comparator ) {
   13179              :         return ContainsMatcher<T, AllocComp, AllocMatch>(comparator);
   13180              :     }
   13181              : 
   13182              :     //! Creates a matcher that matches vectors that contain `comparator` as an element
   13183              :     template<typename T, typename Alloc = std::allocator<T>>
   13184              :     VectorContainsElementMatcher<T, Alloc> VectorContains( T const& comparator ) {
   13185              :         return VectorContainsElementMatcher<T, Alloc>(comparator);
   13186              :     }
   13187              : 
   13188              :     //! Creates a matcher that matches vectors that are exactly equal to `comparator`
   13189              :     template<typename T, typename AllocComp = std::allocator<T>, typename AllocMatch = AllocComp>
   13190              :     EqualsMatcher<T, AllocComp, AllocMatch> Equals( std::vector<T, AllocComp> const& comparator ) {
   13191              :         return EqualsMatcher<T, AllocComp, AllocMatch>(comparator);
   13192              :     }
   13193              : 
   13194              :     //! Creates a matcher that matches vectors that `comparator` as an element
   13195              :     template<typename T, typename AllocComp = std::allocator<T>, typename AllocMatch = AllocComp>
   13196              :     ApproxMatcher<T, AllocComp, AllocMatch> Approx( std::vector<T, AllocComp> const& comparator ) {
   13197              :         return ApproxMatcher<T, AllocComp, AllocMatch>(comparator);
   13198              :     }
   13199              : 
   13200              :     //! Creates a matcher that matches vectors that is equal to `target` modulo permutation
   13201              :     template<typename T, typename AllocComp = std::allocator<T>, typename AllocMatch = AllocComp>
   13202              :     UnorderedEqualsMatcher<T, AllocComp, AllocMatch> UnorderedEquals(std::vector<T, AllocComp> const& target) {
   13203              :         return UnorderedEqualsMatcher<T, AllocComp, AllocMatch>(target);
   13204              :     }
   13205              : 
   13206              : } // namespace Matchers
   13207              : } // namespace Catch
   13208              : 
   13209              : #endif // CATCH_MATCHERS_VECTOR_HPP_INCLUDED
   13210              : 
   13211              : #endif // CATCH_MATCHERS_ALL_HPP_INCLUDED
   13212              : 
   13213              : 
   13214              : /** \file
   13215              :  * This is a convenience header for Catch2's Reporter support. It includes
   13216              :  * **all** of Catch2 headers related to reporters, including all reporters.
   13217              :  *
   13218              :  * Generally the Catch2 users should use specific includes they need,
   13219              :  * but this header can be used instead for ease-of-experimentation, or
   13220              :  * just plain convenience, at the cost of (significantly) increased
   13221              :  * compilation times.
   13222              :  *
   13223              :  * When a new header (reporter) is added to either the `reporter` folder,
   13224              :  * or to the corresponding internal subfolder, it should be added here.
   13225              :  */
   13226              : 
   13227              : #ifndef CATCH_REPORTERS_ALL_HPP_INCLUDED
   13228              : #define CATCH_REPORTERS_ALL_HPP_INCLUDED
   13229              : 
   13230              : 
   13231              : 
   13232              : #ifndef CATCH_REPORTER_AUTOMAKE_HPP_INCLUDED
   13233              : #define CATCH_REPORTER_AUTOMAKE_HPP_INCLUDED
   13234              : 
   13235              : 
   13236              : 
   13237              : #ifndef CATCH_REPORTER_STREAMING_BASE_HPP_INCLUDED

   13239              : 
   13240              : 
   13241              : 
   13242              : #ifndef CATCH_REPORTER_COMMON_BASE_HPP_INCLUDED
   13243              : #define CATCH_REPORTER_COMMON_BASE_HPP_INCLUDED
   13244              : 
   13245              : 
   13246              : #include <map>
   13247              : #include <string>
   13248              : 
   13249              : namespace Catch {
   13250              :     class ColourImpl;
   13251              : 
   13252              :     /**
   13253              :      * This is the base class for all reporters.
   13254              :      *
   13255              :      * If are writing a reporter, you must derive from this type, or one
   13256              :      * of the helper reporter bases that are derived from this type.
   13257              :      *
   13258              :      * ReporterBase centralizes handling of various common tasks in reporters,
   13259              :      * like storing the right stream for the reporters to write to, and
   13260              :      * providing the default implementation of the different listing events.
   13261              :      */
   13262              :     class ReporterBase : public IEventListener {
   13263              :     protected:
   13264              :         //! The stream wrapper as passed to us by outside code
   13265              :         Detail::unique_ptr<IStream> m_wrapped_stream;
   13266              :         //! Cached output stream from `m_wrapped_stream` to reduce
   13267              :         //! number of indirect calls needed to write output.
   13268              :         std::ostream& m_stream;
   13269              :         //! Colour implementation this reporter was configured for
   13270              :         Detail::unique_ptr<ColourImpl> m_colour;
   13271              :         //! The custom reporter options user passed down to the reporter
   13272              :         std::map<std::string, std::string> m_customOptions;
   13273              : 
   13274              :     public:
   13275              :         ReporterBase( ReporterConfig&& config );
   13276              :         ~ReporterBase() override; // = default;
   13277              : 
   13278              :         /**
   13279              :          * Provides a simple default listing of reporters.
   13280              :          *
   13281              :          * Should look roughly like the reporter listing in v2 and earlier
   13282              :          * versions of Catch2.
   13283              :          */
   13284              :         void listReporters(
   13285              :             std::vector<ReporterDescription> const& descriptions ) override;
   13286              :         /**
   13287              :          * Provides a simple default listing of listeners
   13288              :          *
   13289              :          * Looks similarly to listing of reporters, but with listener type
   13290              :          * instead of reporter name.
   13291              :          */
   13292              :         void listListeners(
   13293              :             std::vector<ListenerDescription> const& descriptions ) override;
   13294              :         /**
   13295              :          * Provides a simple default listing of tests.
   13296              :          *
   13297              :          * Should look roughly like the test listing in v2 and earlier versions
   13298              :          * of Catch2. Especially supports low-verbosity listing that mimics the
   13299              :          * old `--list-test-names-only` output.
   13300              :          */
   13301              :         void listTests( std::vector<TestCaseHandle> const& tests ) override;
   13302              :         /**
   13303              :          * Provides a simple default listing of tags.
   13304              :          *
   13305              :          * Should look roughly like the tag listing in v2 and earlier versions
   13306              :          * of Catch2.
   13307              :          */
   13308              :         void listTags( std::vector<TagInfo> const& tags ) override;
   13309              :     };
   13310              : } // namespace Catch
   13311              : 
   13312              : #endif // CATCH_REPORTER_COMMON_BASE_HPP_INCLUDED
   13313              : 
   13314              : #include <vector>
   13315              : 
   13316              : namespace Catch {
   13317              : 
   13318              :     class StreamingReporterBase : public ReporterBase {
   13319              :     public:

   13321              :         //              doesn't implement backport of P0136
   13322            1 :         StreamingReporterBase(ReporterConfig&& _config):
   13323            1 :             ReporterBase(CATCH_MOVE(_config))
   13324            1 :         {}

   13337              :

   13339          118 :             currentTestCaseInfo = &_testInfo;
   13340          118 :         }
   13341          168 :         void testCasePartialStarting( TestCaseInfo const&, uint64_t ) override {}
   13342          239 :         void sectionStarting(SectionInfo const& _sectionInfo) override {
   13343          239 :             m_sectionStack.push_back(_sectionInfo);
   13344          239 :         }
   13345              :

   13347            0 :         void assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& ) override {}
   13348              : 
   13349          239 :         void sectionEnded(SectionStats const& /* _sectionStats */) override {
   13350          239 :             m_sectionStack.pop_back();
   13351          239 :         }
   13352          168 :         void testCasePartialEnded( TestCaseStats const&, uint64_t ) override {}
   13353          118 :         void testCaseEnded(TestCaseStats const& /* _testCaseStats */) override {
   13354          118 :             currentTestCaseInfo = nullptr;
   13355          118 :         }
   13356              :         void testRunEnded( TestRunStats const& /* _testRunStats */ ) override;
   13357              : 
   13358            0 :         void skipTest(TestCaseInfo const&) override {
   13359              :             // Don't do anything with this by default.
   13360              :             // It can optionally be overridden in the derived class.
   13361            0 :         }
   13362              : 
   13363              :     protected:
   13364              :         TestRunInfo currentTestRunInfo{ "test run has not started yet"_sr };
   13365              :         TestCaseInfo const* currentTestCaseInfo = nullptr;
   13366              : 
   13367              :         //! Stack of all _active_ sections in the _current_ test case
   13368              :         std::vector<SectionInfo> m_sectionStack;
   13369              :     };
   13370              : 
   13371              : } // end namespace Catch
   13372              :

   13385            0 :             m_preferences.shouldReportAllAssertionStarts = false;

   13497              : 
   13498              : #ifndef CATCH_REPORTER_CUMULATIVE_BASE_HPP_INCLUDED
   13499              : #define CATCH_REPORTER_CUMULATIVE_BASE_HPP_INCLUDED
   13500              : 
   13501              : 
   13502              : #include <string>
   13503              : #include <vector>
   13504              : 
   13505              : namespace Catch {
   13506              : 
   13507              :     namespace Detail {
   13508              : 
   13509              :         //! Represents either an assertion or a benchmark result to be handled by cumulative reporter later
   13510              :         class AssertionOrBenchmarkResult {
   13511              :             // This should really be a variant, but this is much faster
   13512              :             // to write and the data layout here is already terrible
   13513              :             // enough that we do not have to care about the object size.
   13514              :             Optional<AssertionStats> m_assertion;
   13515              :             Optional<BenchmarkStats<>> m_benchmark;
   13516              :         public:
   13517              :             AssertionOrBenchmarkResult(AssertionStats const& assertion);
   13518              :             AssertionOrBenchmarkResult(BenchmarkStats<> const& benchmark);
   13519              : 
   13520              :             bool isAssertion() const;
   13521              :             bool isBenchmark() const;
   13522              : 
   13523              :             AssertionStats const& asAssertion() const;
   13524              :             BenchmarkStats<> const& asBenchmark() const;
   13525              :         };
   13526              :     }
   13527              : 
   13528              :     /**
   13529              :      * Utility base for reporters that need to handle all results at once
   13530              :      *
   13531              :      * It stores tree of all test cases, sections and assertions, and after the
   13532              :      * test run is finished, calls into `testRunEndedCumulative` to pass the
   13533              :      * control to the deriving class.
   13534              :      *
   13535              :      * If you are deriving from this class and override any testing related
   13536              :      * member functions, you should first call into the base's implementation to
   13537              :      * avoid breaking the tree construction.
   13538              :      *
   13539              :      * Due to the way this base functions, it has to expand assertions up-front,
   13540              :      * even if they are later unused (e.g. because the deriving reporter does
   13541              :      * not report successful assertions, or because the deriving reporter does
   13542              :      * not use assertion expansion at all). Derived classes can use two
   13543              :      * customization points, `m_shouldStoreSuccesfulAssertions` and
   13544              :      * `m_shouldStoreFailedAssertions`, to disable the expansion and gain extra
   13545              :      * performance. **Accessing the assertion expansions if it wasn't stored is
   13546              :      * UB.**
   13547              :      */
   13548              :     class CumulativeReporterBase : public ReporterBase {
   13549              :     public:
   13550              :         template<typename T, typename ChildNodeT>
   13551              :         struct Node {
   13552            0 :             explicit Node( T const& _value ) : value( _value ) {}
   13553              : 
   13554              :             using ChildNodes = std::vector<Detail::unique_ptr<ChildNodeT>>;
   13555              :             T value;
   13556              :             ChildNodes children;
   13557              :         };
   13558              :         struct SectionNode {
   13559            0 :             explicit SectionNode(SectionStats const& _stats) : stats(_stats) {}
   13560              : 
   13561              :             bool operator == (SectionNode const& other) const {
   13562              :                 return stats.sectionInfo.lineInfo == other.stats.sectionInfo.lineInfo;
   13563              :             }
   13564              : 
   13565              :             bool hasAnyAssertions() const;
   13566              : 
   13567              :             SectionStats stats;
   13568              :             std::vector<Detail::unique_ptr<SectionNode>> childSections;
   13569              :             std::vector<Detail::AssertionOrBenchmarkResult> assertionsAndBenchmarks;
   13570              :             std::string stdOut;
   13571              :             std::string stdErr;
   13572              :         };
   13573              : 
   13574              : 
   13575              :         using TestCaseNode = Node<TestCaseStats, SectionNode>;
   13576              :         using TestRunNode = Node<TestRunStats, TestCaseNode>;
   13577              : 
   13578              :         // GCC5 compat: we cannot use inherited constructor, because it
   13579              :         //              doesn't implement backport of P0136
   13580            0 :         CumulativeReporterBase(ReporterConfig&& _config):
   13581            0 :             ReporterBase(CATCH_MOVE(_config))
   13582            0 :         {}
   13583              :         ~CumulativeReporterBase() override;
   13584              : 
   13585            0 :         void benchmarkPreparing( StringRef ) override {}
   13586            0 :         void benchmarkStarting( BenchmarkInfo const& ) override {}
   13587              :         void benchmarkEnded( BenchmarkStats<> const& benchmarkStats ) override;
   13588            0 :         void benchmarkFailed( StringRef ) override {}
   13589              : 
   13590            0 :         void noMatchingTestCases( StringRef ) override {}
   13591            0 :         void reportInvalidTestSpec( StringRef ) override {}
   13592            0 :         void fatalErrorEncountered( StringRef /*error*/ ) override {}
   13593              : 
   13594            0 :         void testRunStarting( TestRunInfo const& ) override {}
   13595              : 
   13596            0 :         void testCaseStarting( TestCaseInfo const& ) override {}
   13597            0 :         void testCasePartialStarting( TestCaseInfo const&, uint64_t ) override {}
   13598              :         void sectionStarting( SectionInfo const& sectionInfo ) override;
   13599              : 
   13600            0 :         void assertionStarting( AssertionInfo const& ) override {}
   13601              : 
   13602              :         void assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) override;
   13603              :         void sectionEnded( SectionStats const& sectionStats ) override;
   13604            0 :         void testCasePartialEnded( TestCaseStats const&, uint64_t ) override {}
   13605              :         void testCaseEnded( TestCaseStats const& testCaseStats ) override;
   13606              :         void testRunEnded( TestRunStats const& testRunStats ) override;
   13607              :         //! Customization point: called after last test finishes (testRunEnded has been handled)
   13608              :         virtual void testRunEndedCumulative() = 0;
   13609              : 
   13610            0 :         void skipTest(TestCaseInfo const&) override {}
   13611              : 
   13612              :     protected:
   13613              :         //! Should the cumulative base store the assertion expansion for successful assertions?
   13614              :         bool m_shouldStoreSuccesfulAssertions = true;
   13615              :         //! Should the cumulative base store the assertion expansion for failed assertions?
   13616              :         bool m_shouldStoreFailedAssertions = true;
   13617              : 
   13618              :         // We need lazy construction here. We should probably refactor it
   13619              :         // later, after the events are redone.
   13620              :         //! The root node of the test run tree.
   13621              :         Detail::unique_ptr<TestRunNode> m_testRun;
   13622              : 
   13623              :     private:
   13624              :         // Note: We rely on pointer identity being stable, which is why
   13625              :         //       we store pointers to the nodes rather than the values.
   13626              :         std::vector<Detail::unique_ptr<TestCaseNode>> m_testCases;
   13627              :         // Root section of the _current_ test case
   13628              :         Detail::unique_ptr<SectionNode> m_rootSection;
   13629              :         // Deepest section of the _current_ test case
   13630              :         SectionNode* m_deepestSection = nullptr;
   13631              :         // Stack of _active_ sections in the _current_ test case
   13632              :         std::vector<SectionNode*> m_sectionStack;
   13633              :     };
   13634              : 
   13635              : } // end namespace Catch
   13636              : 
   13637              : #endif // CATCH_REPORTER_CUMULATIVE_BASE_HPP_INCLUDED
   13638              : 
   13639              : 
   13640              : #ifndef CATCH_REPORTER_EVENT_LISTENER_HPP_INCLUDED
   13641              : #define CATCH_REPORTER_EVENT_LISTENER_HPP_INCLUDED
   13642              : 
   13643              : 
   13644              : namespace Catch {
   13645              : 
   13646              :     /**
   13647              :      * Base class to simplify implementing listeners.
   13648              :      *
   13649              :      * Provides empty default implementation for all IEventListener member
   13650              :      * functions, so that a listener implementation can pick which
   13651              :      * member functions it actually cares about.
   13652              :      */
   13653              :     class EventListenerBase : public IEventListener {
   13654              :     public:
   13655              :         using IEventListener::IEventListener;
   13656              : 
   13657              :         void reportInvalidTestSpec( StringRef unmatchedSpec ) override;
   13658              :         void fatalErrorEncountered( StringRef error ) override;
   13659              : 
   13660              :         void benchmarkPreparing( StringRef name ) override;
   13661              :         void benchmarkStarting( BenchmarkInfo const& benchmarkInfo ) override;
   13662              :         void benchmarkEnded( BenchmarkStats<> const& benchmarkStats ) override;
   13663              :         void benchmarkFailed( StringRef error ) override;
   13664              : 
   13665              :         void assertionStarting( AssertionInfo const& assertionInfo ) override;
   13666              :         void assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) override;
   13667              : 
   13668              :         void listReporters(
   13669              :             std::vector<ReporterDescription> const& descriptions ) override;
   13670              :         void listListeners(
   13671              :             std::vector<ListenerDescription> const& descriptions ) override;
   13672              :         void listTests( std::vector<TestCaseHandle> const& tests ) override;
   13673              :         void listTags( std::vector<TagInfo> const& tagInfos ) override;
   13674              : 
   13675              :         void noMatchingTestCases( StringRef unmatchedSpec ) override;
   13676              :         void testRunStarting( TestRunInfo const& testRunInfo ) override;
   13677              :         void testCaseStarting( TestCaseInfo const& testInfo ) override;
   13678              :         void testCasePartialStarting( TestCaseInfo const& testInfo,
   13679              :                                       uint64_t partNumber ) override;
   13680              :         void sectionStarting( SectionInfo const& sectionInfo ) override;
   13681              :         void sectionEnded( SectionStats const& sectionStats ) override;
   13682              :         void testCasePartialEnded( TestCaseStats const& testCaseStats,
   13683              :                                    uint64_t partNumber ) override;
   13684              :         void testCaseEnded( TestCaseStats const& testCaseStats ) override;
   13685              :         void testRunEnded( TestRunStats const& testRunStats ) override;
   13686              :         void skipTest( TestCaseInfo const& testInfo ) override;
   13687              :     };
   13688              : 
   13689              : } // end namespace Catch
   13690              : 
   13691              : #endif // CATCH_REPORTER_EVENT_LISTENER_HPP_INCLUDED
   13692              : 
   13693              : 
   13694              : #ifndef CATCH_REPORTER_HELPERS_HPP_INCLUDED
   13695              : #define CATCH_REPORTER_HELPERS_HPP_INCLUDED
   13696              : 
   13697              : #include <iosfwd>
   13698              : #include <string>
   13699              : #include <vector>
   13700              : 
   13701              : 
   13702              : namespace Catch {
   13703              : 
   13704              :     class IConfig;
   13705              :     class TestCaseHandle;
   13706              :     class ColourImpl;
   13707              : 
   13708              :     // Returns double formatted as %.3f (format expected on output)
   13709              :     std::string getFormattedDuration( double duration );
   13710              : 
   13711              :     //! Should the reporter show duration of test given current configuration?
   13712              :     bool shouldShowDuration( IConfig const& config, double duration );
   13713              : 
   13714              :     std::string serializeFilters( std::vector<std::string> const& filters );
   13715              : 
   13716              :     struct lineOfChars {
   13717              :         char c;
   13718            0 :         constexpr lineOfChars( char c_ ): c( c_ ) {}
   13719              : 
   13720              :         friend std::ostream& operator<<( std::ostream& out, lineOfChars value );
   13721              :     };
   13722              : 
   13723              :     /**
   13724              :      * Lists reporter descriptions to the provided stream in user-friendly
   13725              :      * format
   13726              :      *
   13727              :      * Used as the default listing implementation by the first party reporter
   13728              :      * bases. The output should be backwards compatible with the output of
   13729              :      * Catch2 v2 binaries.
   13730              :      */
   13731              :     void
   13732              :     defaultListReporters( std::ostream& out,
   13733              :                           std::vector<ReporterDescription> const& descriptions,
   13734              :                           Verbosity verbosity );
   13735              :

   13748              :      * Catch2 v2 binaries.
   13749              :      */
   13750              :     void defaultListTags( std::ostream& out, std::vector<TagInfo> const& tags, bool isFiltered );
   13751              : 
   13752              :     /**
   13753              :      * Lists test case information to the provided stream in user-friendly
   13754              :      * format
   13755              :      *
   13756              :      * Used as the default listing implementation by the first party reporter
   13757              :      * bases. The output is backwards compatible with the output of Catch2
   13758              :      * v2 binaries, and also supports the format specific to the old
   13759              :      * `--list-test-names-only` option, for people who used it in integrations.
   13760              :      */
   13761              :     void defaultListTests( std::ostream& out,
   13762              :                            ColourImpl* streamColour,
   13763              :                            std::vector<TestCaseHandle> const& tests,
   13764              :                            bool isFiltered,
   13765              :                            Verbosity verbosity );
   13766              :

   13771              :      */

   13773              :                       ColourImpl& streamColour,
   13774              :                       Totals const& totals );
   13775              :

   13788              : namespace Catch {
   13789              :     class JsonReporter : public StreamingReporterBase {
   13790              :     public:
   13791              :         JsonReporter( ReporterConfig&& config );
   13792              : 
   13793              :         ~JsonReporter() override;
   13794              : 
   13795              :         static std::string getDescription();
   13796              : 
   13797              :     public: // StreamingReporterBase
   13798              :         void testRunStarting( TestRunInfo const& runInfo ) override;
   13799              :         void testRunEnded( TestRunStats const& runStats ) override;
   13800              : 
   13801              :         void testCaseStarting( TestCaseInfo const& tcInfo ) override;
   13802              :         void testCaseEnded( TestCaseStats const& tcStats ) override;
   13803              : 
   13804              :         void testCasePartialStarting( TestCaseInfo const& tcInfo,
   13805              :                                       uint64_t index ) override;
   13806              :         void testCasePartialEnded( TestCaseStats const& tcStats,
   13807              :                                    uint64_t index ) override;
   13808              : 
   13809              :         void sectionStarting( SectionInfo const& sectionInfo ) override;
   13810              :         void sectionEnded( SectionStats const& sectionStats ) override;
   13811              : 
   13812              :         void assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) override;
   13813              : 
   13814              :         //void testRunEndedCumulative() override;

   13817              :         void benchmarkStarting( BenchmarkInfo const& ) override;
   13818              :         void benchmarkEnded( BenchmarkStats<> const& ) override;
   13819              :         void benchmarkFailed( StringRef error ) override;

   13822              :             std::vector<ReporterDescription> const& descriptions ) override;
   13823              :         void listListeners(
   13824              :             std::vector<ListenerDescription> const& descriptions ) override;

   13829              :         Timer m_testCaseTimer;

   13831              :             Object,
   13832              :             Array
   13833              :         };

   13850              :         // When m_writers is not empty and its top element is
   13851              :         // - Writer::Object, then m_objectWriters is not be empty
   13852              :         // - Writer::Array,  then m_arrayWriters shall not be empty
   13853              :         std::stack<JsonObjectWriter> m_objectWriters{};
   13854              :         std::stack<JsonArrayWriter> m_arrayWriters{};
   13855              :         std::stack<Writer> m_writers{};
   13856              : 
   13857              :         bool m_startedListing = false;
   13858              :

   13860              :         // std::size_t m_sectionStarted = 0;

   13919              : namespace Catch {
   13920              : 
   13921              :     class MultiReporter final : public IEventListener {
   13922              :         /*
   13923              :          * Stores all added reporters and listeners
   13924              :          *
   13925              :          * All Listeners are stored before all reporters, and individual
   13926              :          * listeners/reporters are stored in order of insertion.
   13927              :          */
   13928              :         std::vector<IEventListenerPtr> m_reporterLikes;
   13929              :         bool m_haveNoncapturingReporters = false;
   13930              : 
   13931              :         // Keep track of how many listeners we have already inserted,
   13932              :         // so that we can insert them into the main vector at the right place
   13933              :         size_t m_insertedListeners = 0;
   13934              : 
   13935              :         void updatePreferences(IEventListener const& reporterish);
   13936              : 
   13937              :     public:
   13938            0 :         MultiReporter( IConfig const* config ):
   13939            0 :             IEventListener( config ) {
   13940            0 :             m_preferences.shouldReportAllAssertionStarts = false;
   13941            0 :         }
   13942              : 
   13943              :         using IEventListener::IEventListener;

   13949              : 
   13950              :         void noMatchingTestCases( StringRef unmatchedSpec ) override;
   13951              :         void fatalErrorEncountered( StringRef error ) override;
   13952              :         void reportInvalidTestSpec( StringRef arg ) override;
   13953              : 
   13954              :         void benchmarkPreparing( StringRef name ) override;
   13955              :         void benchmarkStarting( BenchmarkInfo const& benchmarkInfo ) override;
   13956              :         void benchmarkEnded( BenchmarkStats<> const& benchmarkStats ) override;

   13984              : 
   13985              : 
   13986              : #ifndef CATCH_REPORTER_REGISTRARS_HPP_INCLUDED
   13987              : #define CATCH_REPORTER_REGISTRARS_HPP_INCLUDED
   13988              : 
   13989              : 
   13990              : #include <type_traits>
   13991              : 
   13992              : namespace Catch {
   13993              : 
   13994              :     namespace Detail {
   13995              : 
   13996              :         template <typename T, typename = void>
   13997              :         struct has_description : std::false_type {};
   13998              : 
   13999              :         template <typename T>
   14000              :         struct has_description<
   14001              :             T,
   14002              :             void_t<decltype( T::getDescription() )>>
   14003              :             : std::true_type {};
   14004              : 
   14005              :         //! Indirection for reporter registration, so that the error handling is
   14006              :         //! independent on the reporter's concrete type
   14007              :         void registerReporterImpl( std::string const& name,
   14008              :                                    IReporterFactoryPtr reporterPtr );
   14009              :         //! Actually registers the factory, independent on listener's concrete type
   14010              :         void registerListenerImpl( Detail::unique_ptr<EventListenerFactory> listenerFactory );
   14011              :     } // namespace Detail
   14012              : 
   14013              :     class IEventListener;
   14014              :     using IEventListenerPtr = Detail::unique_ptr<IEventListener>;
   14015              : 
   14016              :     template <typename T>
   14017              :     class ReporterFactory : public IReporterFactory {
   14018              : 
   14019            1 :         IEventListenerPtr create( ReporterConfig&& config ) const override {
   14020            1 :             return Detail::make_unique<T>( CATCH_MOVE(config) );
   14021              :         }
   14022              : 
   14023            0 :         std::string getDescription() const override {
   14024            0 :             return T::getDescription();
   14025              :         }
   14026              :     };
   14027              : 
   14028              : 
   14029              :     template<typename T>
   14030              :     class ReporterRegistrar {
   14031              :     public:
   14032              :         explicit ReporterRegistrar( std::string const& name ) {
   14033              :             registerReporterImpl( name,
   14034              :                                   Detail::make_unique<ReporterFactory<T>>() );
   14035              :         }
   14036              :     };
   14037              : 
   14038              :     template<typename T>
   14039              :     class ListenerRegistrar {
   14040              : 
   14041              :         class TypedListenerFactory : public EventListenerFactory {
   14042              :             StringRef m_listenerName;
   14043              : 
   14044              :             std::string getDescriptionImpl( std::true_type ) const {
   14045              :                 return T::getDescription();
   14046              :             }
   14047              : 
   14048              :             std::string getDescriptionImpl( std::false_type ) const {
   14049              :                 return "(No description provided)";
   14050              :             }
   14051              : 
   14052              :         public:
   14053              :             TypedListenerFactory( StringRef listenerName ):
   14054              :                 m_listenerName( listenerName ) {}
   14055              : 
   14056              :             IEventListenerPtr create( IConfig const* config ) const override {
   14057              :                 return Detail::make_unique<T>( config );
   14058              :             }
   14059              : 
   14060              :             StringRef getName() const override {
   14061              :                 return m_listenerName;
   14062              :             }
   14063              : 
   14064              :             std::string getDescription() const override {
   14065              :                 return getDescriptionImpl( Detail::has_description<T>{} );
   14066              :             }
   14067              :         };
   14068              : 
   14069              :     public:
   14070              :         ListenerRegistrar(StringRef listenerName) {
   14071              :             registerListenerImpl( Detail::make_unique<TypedListenerFactory>(listenerName) );
   14072              :         }
   14073              :     };
   14074              : }
   14075              : 
   14076              : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE)
   14077              : 
   14078              : #    define CATCH_REGISTER_REPORTER( name, reporterType )                  \
   14079              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION                          \
   14080              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS                           \
   14081              :         namespace {                                                        \
   14082              :             const Catch::ReporterRegistrar<reporterType>                   \
   14083              :                 INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( catch_internal_RegistrarFor )( \
   14084              :                     name );                                                \
   14085              :         }                                                                  \
   14086              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION
   14087              : 
   14088              : #    define CATCH_REGISTER_LISTENER( listenerType )                        \
   14089              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION                          \
   14090              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS                           \
   14091              :         namespace {                                                        \
   14092              :             const Catch::ListenerRegistrar<listenerType>                   \
   14093              :                 INTERNAL_CATCH_UNIQUE_NAME( catch_internal_RegistrarFor )( \
   14094              :                     #listenerType##_catch_sr );                            \
   14095              :         }                                                                  \
   14096              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION
   14097              : 
   14098              : #else // CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE
   14099              : 
   14100              : #define CATCH_REGISTER_REPORTER(name, reporterType)
   14101              : #define CATCH_REGISTER_LISTENER(listenerType)
   14102              : 
   14103              : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE
   14104              :
